module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BlockPublicAccess

-- | Provides information about the block public access settings for an S3
--   bucket. These settings can apply to a bucket at the account level or
--   bucket level. For detailed information about each setting, see
--   <a>Blocking public access to your Amazon S3 storage</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon Simple Storage Service User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBlockPublicAccess</a> smart constructor.
data BlockPublicAccess
BlockPublicAccess' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> BlockPublicAccess

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 ignores public ACLs for the bucket and
--   objects in the bucket.
[$sel:ignorePublicAcls:BlockPublicAccess'] :: BlockPublicAccess -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 blocks public access control lists (ACLs)
--   for the bucket and objects in the bucket.
[$sel:blockPublicAcls:BlockPublicAccess'] :: BlockPublicAccess -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 restricts public bucket policies for the
--   bucket.
[$sel:restrictPublicBuckets:BlockPublicAccess'] :: BlockPublicAccess -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 blocks public bucket policies for the
--   bucket.
[$sel:blockPublicPolicy:BlockPublicAccess'] :: BlockPublicAccess -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>BlockPublicAccess</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ignorePublicAcls:BlockPublicAccess'</a>,
--   <a>blockPublicAccess_ignorePublicAcls</a> - Specifies whether Amazon
--   S3 ignores public ACLs for the bucket and objects in the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockPublicAcls:BlockPublicAccess'</a>,
--   <a>blockPublicAccess_blockPublicAcls</a> - Specifies whether Amazon S3
--   blocks public access control lists (ACLs) for the bucket and objects
--   in the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:restrictPublicBuckets:BlockPublicAccess'</a>,
--   <a>blockPublicAccess_restrictPublicBuckets</a> - Specifies whether
--   Amazon S3 restricts public bucket policies for the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockPublicPolicy:BlockPublicAccess'</a>,
--   <a>blockPublicAccess_blockPublicPolicy</a> - Specifies whether Amazon
--   S3 blocks public bucket policies for the bucket.
newBlockPublicAccess :: BlockPublicAccess

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 ignores public ACLs for the bucket and
--   objects in the bucket.
blockPublicAccess_ignorePublicAcls :: Lens' BlockPublicAccess (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 blocks public access control lists (ACLs)
--   for the bucket and objects in the bucket.
blockPublicAccess_blockPublicAcls :: Lens' BlockPublicAccess (Maybe Bool)

--   bucket.

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketCountByEffectivePermission

-- | Provides information about the number of S3 buckets that are publicly
--   accessible based on a combination of permissions settings for each
--   bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucketCountByEffectivePermission</a> smart
--   constructor.
data BucketCountByEffectivePermission
BucketCountByEffectivePermission' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> BucketCountByEffectivePermission

-- | The total number of buckets that allow the general public to have read
--   or write access to the bucket.
[$sel:publiclyAccessible:BucketCountByEffectivePermission'] :: BucketCountByEffectivePermission -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total number of buckets that Amazon Macie wasn't able to evaluate
--   permissions settings for. Macie can't determine whether these buckets
--   are publicly accessible.
[$sel:unknown:BucketCountByEffectivePermission'] :: BucketCountByEffectivePermission -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total number of buckets that allow the general public to have read
--   access to the bucket.
[$sel:publiclyReadable:BucketCountByEffectivePermission'] :: BucketCountByEffectivePermission -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total number of buckets that allow the general public to have
--   write access to the bucket.
[$sel:publiclyWritable:BucketCountByEffectivePermission'] :: BucketCountByEffectivePermission -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>BucketCountByEffectivePermission</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>bucketCountByEffectivePermission_publiclyAccessible</a> - The total
--   number of buckets that allow the general public to have read or write
--   access to the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unknown:BucketCountByEffectivePermission'</a>,
--   <a>bucketCountByEffectivePermission_unknown</a> - The total number of
--   buckets that Amazon Macie wasn't able to evaluate permissions settings
--   for. Macie can't determine whether these buckets are publicly
--   accessible.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publiclyReadable:BucketCountByEffectivePermission'</a>,
--   <a>bucketCountByEffectivePermission_publiclyReadable</a> - The total
--   number of buckets that allow the general public to have read access to
--   the bucket.
--

--   <a>bucketCountByEffectivePermission_publiclyWritable</a> - The total
--   number of buckets that allow the general public to have write access
--   to the bucket.

--   or write access to the bucket.

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketCountByEncryptionType

-- | Provides information about the number of S3 buckets that use certain
--   types of server-side encryption by default or don't encrypt new
--   objects by default. For detailed information about these settings, see
--   <a>Setting default server-side encryption behavior for Amazon S3
--   buckets</a> in the <i>Amazon Simple Storage Service User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucketCountByEncryptionType</a> smart constructor.
data BucketCountByEncryptionType
BucketCountByEncryptionType' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> BucketCountByEncryptionType

-- | The total number of buckets that Amazon Macie doesn't have current
--   encryption metadata for. Macie can't provide current data about the
--   default encryption settings for these buckets.
[$sel:unknown:BucketCountByEncryptionType'] :: BucketCountByEncryptionType -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total number of buckets that use an Amazon S3 managed key to
--   encrypt new objects by default. These buckets use Amazon S3 managed
--   encryption (SSE-S3) by default.
[$sel:s3Managed:BucketCountByEncryptionType'] :: BucketCountByEncryptionType -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total number of buckets that don't encrypt new objects by default.
--   Default encryption is disabled for these buckets.
[$sel:unencrypted:BucketCountByEncryptionType'] :: BucketCountByEncryptionType -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total number of buckets that use an KMS key to encrypt new objects
--   by default, either an Amazon Web Services managed key or a customer
--   managed key. These buckets use KMS encryption (SSE-KMS) by default.
[$sel:kmsManaged:BucketCountByEncryptionType'] :: BucketCountByEncryptionType -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>BucketCountByEncryptionType</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:unknown:BucketCountByEncryptionType'</a>,
--   <a>bucketCountByEncryptionType_unknown</a> - The total number of
--   buckets that Amazon Macie doesn't have current encryption metadata
--   for. Macie can't provide current data about the default encryption
--   settings for these buckets.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Managed:BucketCountByEncryptionType'</a>,
--   <a>bucketCountByEncryptionType_s3Managed</a> - The total number of
--   buckets that use an Amazon S3 managed key to encrypt new objects by
--   default. These buckets use Amazon S3 managed encryption (SSE-S3) by
--   default.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unencrypted:BucketCountByEncryptionType'</a>,
--   <a>bucketCountByEncryptionType_unencrypted</a> - The total number of
--   buckets that don't encrypt new objects by default. Default encryption
--   is disabled for these buckets.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsManaged:BucketCountByEncryptionType'</a>,
--   <a>bucketCountByEncryptionType_kmsManaged</a> - The total number of
--   buckets that use an KMS key to encrypt new objects by default, either
--   an Amazon Web Services managed key or a customer managed key. These
--   buckets use KMS encryption (SSE-KMS) by default.
newBucketCountByEncryptionType :: BucketCountByEncryptionType

-- | The total number of buckets that Amazon Macie doesn't have current
--   encryption metadata for. Macie can't provide current data about the
--   default encryption settings for these buckets.
bucketCountByEncryptionType_unknown :: Lens' BucketCountByEncryptionType (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total number of buckets that use an Amazon S3 managed key to
--   encrypt new objects by default. These buckets use Amazon S3 managed
--   encryption (SSE-S3) by default.
bucketCountByEncryptionType_s3Managed :: Lens' BucketCountByEncryptionType (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total number of buckets that don't encrypt new objects by default.
--   Default encryption is disabled for these buckets.
bucketCountByEncryptionType_unencrypted :: Lens' BucketCountByEncryptionType (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total number of buckets that use an KMS key to encrypt new objects
--   by default, either an Amazon Web Services managed key or a customer
--   managed key. These buckets use KMS encryption (SSE-KMS) by default.
bucketCountByEncryptionType_kmsManaged :: Lens' BucketCountByEncryptionType (Maybe Integer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketCountByEncryptionType.BucketCountByEncryptionType
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketCountByEncryptionType.BucketCountByEncryptionType
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketCountByEncryptionType.BucketCountByEncryptionType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketCountByEncryptionType.BucketCountByEncryptionType

--   shared with other Amazon Web Services accounts.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucketCountBySharedAccessType</a> smart constructor.
data BucketCountBySharedAccessType

--   Services accounts.
[$sel:notShared:BucketCountBySharedAccessType'] :: BucketCountBySharedAccessType -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total number of buckets that are shared with an Amazon Web
--   Services account that's part of the same Amazon Macie organization.

--   Services account that isn't part of the same Amazon Macie
--   organization.

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads

-- | Provides information about the number of S3 buckets whose bucket
--   policies do or don't require server-side encryption of objects when
--   objects are uploaded to the buckets.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads</a>
--   smart constructor.
data BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads
BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads

-- | The total number of buckets whose bucket policies require server-side
--   encryption of new objects. PutObject requests for these buckets must
--   include the x-amz-server-side-encryption header and the value for that
--   header must be AES256 or aws:kms.
[$sel:deniesUnencryptedObjectUploads:BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads'] :: BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total number of buckets that Amazon Macie wasn't able to evaluate
--   server-side encryption requirements for. Macie can't determine whether
--   the bucket policies for these buckets require server-side encryption
--   of new objects.
[$sel:unknown:BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads'] :: BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total number of buckets that don't have a bucket policy or have a
--   bucket policy that doesn't require server-side encryption of new
--   objects. If a bucket policy exists, the policy doesn't require
--   PutObject requests to include the x-amz-server-side-encryption header
--   and it doesn't require the value for that header to be AES256 or
--   aws:kms.
[$sel:allowsUnencryptedObjectUploads:BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads'] :: BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of
--   <a>BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:deniesUnencryptedObjectUploads:BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads'</a>,
--   <a>bucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads_deniesUnencryptedObjectUploads</a>
--   - The total number of buckets whose bucket policies require
--   server-side encryption of new objects. PutObject requests for these
--   buckets must include the x-amz-server-side-encryption header and the
--   value for that header must be AES256 or aws:kms.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unknown:BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads'</a>,
--   <a>bucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads_unknown</a> - The
--   total number of buckets that Amazon Macie wasn't able to evaluate
--   server-side encryption requirements for. Macie can't determine whether
--   the bucket policies for these buckets require server-side encryption
--   of new objects.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowsUnencryptedObjectUploads:BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads'</a>,
--   <a>bucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads_allowsUnencryptedObjectUploads</a>
--   - The total number of buckets that don't have a bucket policy or have
--   a bucket policy that doesn't require server-side encryption of new
--   objects. If a bucket policy exists, the policy doesn't require
--   PutObject requests to include the x-amz-server-side-encryption header
--   and it doesn't require the value for that header to be AES256 or
--   aws:kms.
newBucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads :: BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads

-- | The total number of buckets whose bucket policies require server-side
--   encryption of new objects. PutObject requests for these buckets must
--   include the x-amz-server-side-encryption header and the value for that
--   header must be AES256 or aws:kms.
bucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads_deniesUnencryptedObjectUploads :: Lens' BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total number of buckets that Amazon Macie wasn't able to evaluate
--   server-side encryption requirements for. Macie can't determine whether
--   the bucket policies for these buckets require server-side encryption
--   of new objects.
bucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads_unknown :: Lens' BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total number of buckets that don't have a bucket policy or have a
--   bucket policy that doesn't require server-side encryption of new
--   objects. If a bucket policy exists, the policy doesn't require
--   PutObject requests to include the x-amz-server-side-encryption header
--   and it doesn't require the value for that header to be AES256 or
--   aws:kms.
bucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads_allowsUnencryptedObjectUploads :: Lens' BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads (Maybe Integer)

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties

-- | Specifies the operator to use in a property-based condition that
--   filters the results of a query for information about S3 buckets.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties</a> smart
--   constructor.
data BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties
BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties

-- | The value for the property matches (equals) the specified value. If
--   you specify multiple values, Amazon Macie uses OR logic to join the
--   values.
[$sel:eq:BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties'] :: BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The value for the property is less than or equal to the specified
--   value.
[$sel:lte:BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties'] :: BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties -> Maybe Integer

-- | The name of the bucket begins with the specified value.
[$sel:prefix:BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties'] :: BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties -> Maybe Text

-- | The value for the property is greater than the specified value.
[$sel:gt:BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties'] :: BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties -> Maybe Integer

-- | The value for the property doesn't match (doesn't equal) the specified
--   value. If you specify multiple values, Amazon Macie uses OR logic to
--   join the values.
[$sel:neq:BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties'] :: BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The value for the property is less than the specified value.
[$sel:lt:BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties'] :: BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties -> Maybe Integer

-- | The value for the property is greater than or equal to the specified
--   value.
[$sel:gte:BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties'] :: BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:eq:BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties'</a>,
--   <a>bucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties_eq</a> - The value for the
--   property matches (equals) the specified value. If you specify multiple
--   values, Amazon Macie uses OR logic to join the values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lte:BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties'</a>,
--   <a>bucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties_lte</a> - The value for the
--   property is less than or equal to the specified value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties'</a>,
--   <a>bucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties_prefix</a> - The name of the
--   bucket begins with the specified value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gt:BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties'</a>,
--   <a>bucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties_gt</a> - The value for the
--   property is greater than the specified value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:neq:BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties'</a>,
--   <a>bucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties_neq</a> - The value for the
--   property doesn't match (doesn't equal) the specified value. If you
--   specify multiple values, Amazon Macie uses OR logic to join the
--   values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lt:BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties'</a>,
--   <a>bucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties_lt</a> - The value for the
--   property is less than the specified value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gte:BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties'</a>,
--   <a>bucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties_gte</a> - The value for the
--   property is greater than or equal to the specified value.
newBucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties :: BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties

-- | The value for the property matches (equals) the specified value. If
--   you specify multiple values, Amazon Macie uses OR logic to join the
--   values.
bucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties_eq :: Lens' BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties (Maybe [Text])

-- | The value for the property is less than or equal to the specified
--   value.
bucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties_lte :: Lens' BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties (Maybe Integer)

-- | The name of the bucket begins with the specified value.
bucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties_prefix :: Lens' BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties (Maybe Text)

-- | The value for the property is greater than the specified value.
bucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties_gt :: Lens' BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties (Maybe Integer)

-- | The value for the property doesn't match (doesn't equal) the specified
--   value. If you specify multiple values, Amazon Macie uses OR logic to
--   join the values.
bucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties_neq :: Lens' BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties (Maybe [Text])

-- | The value for the property is less than the specified value.
bucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties_lt :: Lens' BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties (Maybe Integer)

-- | The value for the property is greater than or equal to the specified
--   value.
bucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties_gte :: Lens' BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties (Maybe Integer)

instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties.BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketMetadataErrorCode

-- | The error code for an error that prevented Amazon Macie from
--   retrieving and processing information about an S3 bucket and the
--   bucket's objects.
newtype BucketMetadataErrorCode
BucketMetadataErrorCode' :: Text -> BucketMetadataErrorCode
[fromBucketMetadataErrorCode] :: BucketMetadataErrorCode -> Text
pattern BucketMetadataErrorCode_ACCESS_DENIED :: BucketMetadataErrorCode

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketPolicy

-- | Provides information about the permissions settings of the bucket
--   policy for an S3 bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucketPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data BucketPolicy
BucketPolicy' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> BucketPolicy

-- | Specifies whether the bucket policy allows the general public to have
--   write access to the bucket.
[$sel:allowsPublicWriteAccess:BucketPolicy'] :: BucketPolicy -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether the bucket policy allows the general public to have
--   read access to the bucket.
[$sel:allowsPublicReadAccess:BucketPolicy'] :: BucketPolicy -> Maybe Bool

--   omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   bucket policy allows the general public to have write access to the
--   bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowsPublicReadAccess:BucketPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>bucketPolicy_allowsPublicReadAccess</a> - Specifies whether the
--   bucket policy allows the general public to have read access to the
--   bucket.
newBucketPolicy :: BucketPolicy

-- | Specifies whether the bucket policy allows the general public to have
--   write access to the bucket.
bucketPolicy_allowsPublicWriteAccess :: Lens' BucketPolicy (Maybe Bool)

--   read access to the bucket.

--   an S3 bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucketLevelPermissions</a> smart constructor.
data BucketLevelPermissions
BucketLevelPermissions' :: Maybe AccessControlList -> Maybe BlockPublicAccess -> Maybe BucketPolicy -> BucketLevelPermissions

-- | The permissions settings of the access control list (ACL) for the
--   bucket. This value is null if an ACL hasn't been defined for the
--   bucket.
[$sel:accessControlList:BucketLevelPermissions'] :: BucketLevelPermissions -> Maybe AccessControlList

-- | The block public access settings for the bucket.
[$sel:blockPublicAccess:BucketLevelPermissions'] :: BucketLevelPermissions -> Maybe BlockPublicAccess

--   value is null if a bucket policy hasn't been defined for the bucket.

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Cell

-- | Specifies the location of an occurrence of sensitive data in a
--   Microsoft Excel workbook, CSV file, or TSV file.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCell</a> smart constructor.
data Cell
Cell' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Cell

-- | The row number of the row that contains the sensitive data.
[$sel:row:Cell'] :: Cell -> Maybe Integer

-- | The location of the cell, as an absolute cell reference, that contains
--   the sensitive data, for example Sheet2!C5 for cell C5 on Sheet2 in a
--   Microsoft Excel workbook. This value is null for CSV and TSV files.
[$sel:cellReference:Cell'] :: Cell -> Maybe Text

-- | The column number of the column that contains the sensitive data. For
--   a Microsoft Excel workbook, this value correlates to the alphabetical
--   character(s) for a column identifier, for example: 1 for column A, 2
--   for column B, and so on.
[$sel:column:Cell'] :: Cell -> Maybe Integer

-- | The name of the column that contains the sensitive data, if available.
[$sel:columnName:Cell'] :: Cell -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Cell</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:row:Cell'</a>, <a>cell_row</a> - The row number of the row
--   that contains the sensitive data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cellReference:Cell'</a>, <a>cell_cellReference</a> - The
--   location of the cell, as an absolute cell reference, that contains the
--   sensitive data, for example Sheet2!C5 for cell C5 on Sheet2 in a
--   Microsoft Excel workbook. This value is null for CSV and TSV files.
--   
--   <a>$sel:column:Cell'</a>, <a>cell_column</a> - The column number of
--   the column that contains the sensitive data. For a Microsoft Excel
--   workbook, this value correlates to the alphabetical character(s) for a
--   column identifier, for example: 1 for column A, 2 for column B, and so
--   on.
--   
--   <a>$sel:columnName:Cell'</a>, <a>cell_columnName</a> - The name of the
--   column that contains the sensitive data, if available.
newCell :: Cell

-- | The row number of the row that contains the sensitive data.
cell_row :: Lens' Cell (Maybe Integer)

-- | The location of the cell, as an absolute cell reference, that contains
--   the sensitive data, for example Sheet2!C5 for cell C5 on Sheet2 in a
--   Microsoft Excel workbook. This value is null for CSV and TSV files.
cell_cellReference :: Lens' Cell (Maybe Text)

-- | The column number of the column that contains the sensitive data. For
--   a Microsoft Excel workbook, this value correlates to the alphabetical
--   character(s) for a column identifier, for example: 1 for column A, 2
--   for column B, and so on.
cell_column :: Lens' Cell (Maybe Integer)

-- | The name of the column that contains the sensitive data, if available.
cell_columnName :: Lens' Cell (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Cell.Cell
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Cell.Cell
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Cell.Cell

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ClassificationResultStatus

-- | Provides information about the status of a sensitive data finding.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClassificationResultStatus</a> smart constructor.
data ClassificationResultStatus
ClassificationResultStatus' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ClassificationResultStatus

-- | A brief description of the status of the finding. Amazon Macie uses
--   this value to notify you of any errors, warnings, or considerations
--   that might impact your analysis of the finding.
[$sel:reason:ClassificationResultStatus'] :: ClassificationResultStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The status of the finding. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>COMPLETE - Amazon Macie successfully completed its analysis of the
--   S3 object that the finding applies to.</li>
--   <li>PARTIAL - Macie analyzed only a subset of the data in the S3
--   object that the finding applies to. For example, the object is an
--   archive file that contains files in an unsupported format.</li>
--   <li>SKIPPED - Macie wasn't able to analyze the S3 object that the
--   finding applies to. For example, the object is a file in an
--   unsupported format.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:code:ClassificationResultStatus'] :: ClassificationResultStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ClassificationResultStatus</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:reason:ClassificationResultStatus'</a>,
--   <a>classificationResultStatus_reason</a> - A brief description of the
--   status of the finding. Amazon Macie uses this value to notify you of
--   any errors, warnings, or considerations that might impact your
--   analysis of the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:code:ClassificationResultStatus'</a>,
--   <a>classificationResultStatus_code</a> - The status of the finding.
--   Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>COMPLETE - Amazon Macie successfully completed its analysis of the
--   S3 object that the finding applies to.</li>
--   <li>PARTIAL - Macie analyzed only a subset of the data in the S3
--   object that the finding applies to. For example, the object is an
--   archive file that contains files in an unsupported format.</li>
--   <li>SKIPPED - Macie wasn't able to analyze the S3 object that the
--   finding applies to. For example, the object is a file in an
--   unsupported format.</li>
--   </ul>
newClassificationResultStatus :: ClassificationResultStatus

-- | A brief description of the status of the finding. Amazon Macie uses
--   this value to notify you of any errors, warnings, or considerations
--   that might impact your analysis of the finding.
classificationResultStatus_reason :: Lens' ClassificationResultStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the finding. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>COMPLETE - Amazon Macie successfully completed its analysis of the
--   S3 object that the finding applies to.</li>
--   <li>PARTIAL - Macie analyzed only a subset of the data in the S3
--   object that the finding applies to. For example, the object is an
--   archive file that contains files in an unsupported format.</li>
--   <li>SKIPPED - Macie wasn't able to analyze the S3 object that the
--   finding applies to. For example, the object is a file in an
--   unsupported format.</li>
--   </ul>
classificationResultStatus_code :: Lens' ClassificationResultStatus (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ClassificationResultStatus.ClassificationResultStatus
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ClassificationResultStatus.ClassificationResultStatus
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ClassificationResultStatus.ClassificationResultStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ClassificationResultStatus.ClassificationResultStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ClassificationResultStatus.ClassificationResultStatus

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CriterionAdditionalProperties

-- | Specifies the operator to use in a property-based condition that
--   filters the results of a query for findings. For detailed information
--   and examples of each operator, see <a>Fundamentals of filtering
--   findings</a> in the <i>Amazon Macie User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCriterionAdditionalProperties</a> smart constructor.
data CriterionAdditionalProperties
CriterionAdditionalProperties' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> CriterionAdditionalProperties

-- | The value for the property matches (equals) the specified value. If
--   you specify multiple values, Macie uses OR logic to join the values.
[$sel:eq:CriterionAdditionalProperties'] :: CriterionAdditionalProperties -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The value for the property is less than or equal to the specified
--   value.
[$sel:lte:CriterionAdditionalProperties'] :: CriterionAdditionalProperties -> Maybe Integer

-- | The value for the property is greater than the specified value.
[$sel:gt:CriterionAdditionalProperties'] :: CriterionAdditionalProperties -> Maybe Integer

-- | The value for the property exclusively matches (equals an exact match
--   for) all the specified values. If you specify multiple values, Amazon
--   Macie uses AND logic to join the values.
--   
--   You can use this operator with the following properties:
--   customDataIdentifiers.detections.arn,
--   customDataIdentifiers.detections.name,
--   resourcesAffected.s3Bucket.tags.key,
--   resourcesAffected.s3Bucket.tags.value,
--   resourcesAffected.s3Object.tags.key,
--   resourcesAffected.s3Object.tags.value, sensitiveData.category, and
--   sensitiveData.detections.type.
[$sel:eqExactMatch:CriterionAdditionalProperties'] :: CriterionAdditionalProperties -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The value for the property doesn't match (doesn't equal) the specified
--   value. If you specify multiple values, Macie uses OR logic to join the
--   values.
[$sel:neq:CriterionAdditionalProperties'] :: CriterionAdditionalProperties -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The value for the property is less than the specified value.
[$sel:lt:CriterionAdditionalProperties'] :: CriterionAdditionalProperties -> Maybe Integer

-- | The value for the property is greater than or equal to the specified
--   value.
[$sel:gte:CriterionAdditionalProperties'] :: CriterionAdditionalProperties -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>CriterionAdditionalProperties</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:eq:CriterionAdditionalProperties'</a>,
--   <a>criterionAdditionalProperties_eq</a> - The value for the property
--   matches (equals) the specified value. If you specify multiple values,
--   Macie uses OR logic to join the values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lte:CriterionAdditionalProperties'</a>,
--   <a>criterionAdditionalProperties_lte</a> - The value for the property
--   is less than or equal to the specified value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gt:CriterionAdditionalProperties'</a>,
--   <a>criterionAdditionalProperties_gt</a> - The value for the property
--   is greater than the specified value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eqExactMatch:CriterionAdditionalProperties'</a>,
--   <a>criterionAdditionalProperties_eqExactMatch</a> - The value for the
--   property exclusively matches (equals an exact match for) all the
--   specified values. If you specify multiple values, Amazon Macie uses
--   AND logic to join the values.
--   
--   You can use this operator with the following properties:
--   customDataIdentifiers.detections.arn,
--   customDataIdentifiers.detections.name,
--   resourcesAffected.s3Bucket.tags.key,
--   resourcesAffected.s3Bucket.tags.value,
--   resourcesAffected.s3Object.tags.key,
--   resourcesAffected.s3Object.tags.value, sensitiveData.category, and
--   sensitiveData.detections.type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:neq:CriterionAdditionalProperties'</a>,
--   <a>criterionAdditionalProperties_neq</a> - The value for the property
--   doesn't match (doesn't equal) the specified value. If you specify
--   multiple values, Macie uses OR logic to join the values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lt:CriterionAdditionalProperties'</a>,
--   <a>criterionAdditionalProperties_lt</a> - The value for the property
--   is less than the specified value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gte:CriterionAdditionalProperties'</a>,
--   <a>criterionAdditionalProperties_gte</a> - The value for the property
--   is greater than or equal to the specified value.

--   you specify multiple values, Macie uses OR logic to join the values.

-- | The value for the property is greater than the specified value.

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CustomDataIdentifierSummary

-- | Provides information about a custom data identifier.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCustomDataIdentifierSummary</a> smart constructor.
data CustomDataIdentifierSummary
CustomDataIdentifierSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CustomDataIdentifierSummary

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom data identifier.
[$sel:arn:CustomDataIdentifierSummary'] :: CustomDataIdentifierSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the
--   custom data identifier was created.
[$sel:createdAt:CustomDataIdentifierSummary'] :: CustomDataIdentifierSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The custom name of the custom data identifier.
[$sel:name:CustomDataIdentifierSummary'] :: CustomDataIdentifierSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the custom data identifier.
[$sel:id:CustomDataIdentifierSummary'] :: CustomDataIdentifierSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The custom description of the custom data identifier.
[$sel:description:CustomDataIdentifierSummary'] :: CustomDataIdentifierSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CustomDataIdentifierSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:CustomDataIdentifierSummary'</a>,
--   <a>customDataIdentifierSummary_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the custom data identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:CustomDataIdentifierSummary'</a>,
--   <a>customDataIdentifierSummary_createdAt</a> - The date and time, in
--   UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the custom data identifier was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CustomDataIdentifierSummary'</a>,
--   <a>customDataIdentifierSummary_name</a> - The custom name of the
--   custom data identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:CustomDataIdentifierSummary'</a>,
--   <a>customDataIdentifierSummary_id</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   custom data identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:CustomDataIdentifierSummary'</a>,
--   <a>customDataIdentifierSummary_description</a> - The custom
--   description of the custom data identifier.
newCustomDataIdentifierSummary :: CustomDataIdentifierSummary

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom data identifier.
customDataIdentifierSummary_arn :: Lens' CustomDataIdentifierSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the
--   custom data identifier was created.
customDataIdentifierSummary_createdAt :: Lens' CustomDataIdentifierSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The custom name of the custom data identifier.
customDataIdentifierSummary_name :: Lens' CustomDataIdentifierSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the custom data identifier.
customDataIdentifierSummary_id :: Lens' CustomDataIdentifierSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The custom description of the custom data identifier.
customDataIdentifierSummary_description :: Lens' CustomDataIdentifierSummary (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CustomDataIdentifierSummary.CustomDataIdentifierSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CustomDataIdentifierSummary.CustomDataIdentifierSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CustomDataIdentifierSummary.CustomDataIdentifierSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CustomDataIdentifierSummary.CustomDataIdentifierSummary

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketPublicAccess

-- | Provides information about the permissions settings that determine
--   whether an S3 bucket is publicly accessible.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucketPublicAccess</a> smart constructor.
data BucketPublicAccess
BucketPublicAccess' :: Maybe BucketPermissionConfiguration -> Maybe EffectivePermission -> BucketPublicAccess

-- | The account-level and bucket-level permissions settings for the
--   bucket.
[$sel:permissionConfiguration:BucketPublicAccess'] :: BucketPublicAccess -> Maybe BucketPermissionConfiguration

-- | Specifies whether the bucket is publicly accessible due to the
--   combination of permissions settings that apply to the bucket. Possible
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>NOT_PUBLIC - The bucket isn't publicly accessible.</li>
--   <li>PUBLIC - The bucket is publicly accessible.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie can't determine whether the bucket is
--   publicly accessible.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:effectivePermission:BucketPublicAccess'] :: BucketPublicAccess -> Maybe EffectivePermission

-- | Create a value of <a>BucketPublicAccess</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionConfiguration:BucketPublicAccess'</a>,
--   <a>bucketPublicAccess_permissionConfiguration</a> - The account-level
--   and bucket-level permissions settings for the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:effectivePermission:BucketPublicAccess'</a>,
--   <a>bucketPublicAccess_effectivePermission</a> - Specifies whether the
--   bucket is publicly accessible due to the combination of permissions
--   settings that apply to the bucket. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>NOT_PUBLIC - The bucket isn't publicly accessible.</li>
--   <li>PUBLIC - The bucket is publicly accessible.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie can't determine whether the bucket is
--   publicly accessible.</li>
--   </ul>
newBucketPublicAccess :: BucketPublicAccess

-- | The account-level and bucket-level permissions settings for the
--   bucket.
bucketPublicAccess_permissionConfiguration :: Lens' BucketPublicAccess (Maybe BucketPermissionConfiguration)

-- | Specifies whether the bucket is publicly accessible due to the
--   combination of permissions settings that apply to the bucket. Possible
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>NOT_PUBLIC - The bucket isn't publicly accessible.</li>
--   <li>PUBLIC - The bucket is publicly accessible.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie can't determine whether the bucket is
--   publicly accessible.</li>
--   </ul>
bucketPublicAccess_effectivePermission :: Lens' BucketPublicAccess (Maybe EffectivePermission)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketPublicAccess.BucketPublicAccess
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketPublicAccess.BucketPublicAccess
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketPublicAccess.BucketPublicAccess
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketPublicAccess.BucketPublicAccess
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketPublicAccess.BucketPublicAccess
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketPublicAccess.BucketPublicAccess
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketPublicAccess.BucketPublicAccess

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FindingAction

-- | Provides information about an action that occurred for a resource and
--   produced a policy finding.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFindingAction</a> smart constructor.
data FindingAction
FindingAction' :: Maybe ApiCallDetails -> Maybe FindingActionType -> FindingAction

-- | The invocation details of the API operation that an entity invoked for
--   the affected resource, if the value for the actionType property is
--   AWS_API_CALL.
[$sel:apiCallDetails:FindingAction'] :: FindingAction -> Maybe ApiCallDetails

-- | The type of action that occurred for the affected resource. This value
--   is typically AWS_API_CALL, which indicates that an entity invoked an
--   API operation for the resource.
[$sel:actionType:FindingAction'] :: FindingAction -> Maybe FindingActionType

-- | Create a value of <a>FindingAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:apiCallDetails:FindingAction'</a>,
--   <a>findingAction_apiCallDetails</a> - The invocation details of the
--   API operation that an entity invoked for the affected resource, if the
--   value for the actionType property is AWS_API_CALL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:actionType:FindingAction'</a>, <a>findingAction_actionType</a>
--   - The type of action that occurred for the affected resource. This
--   value is typically AWS_API_CALL, which indicates that an entity
--   invoked an API operation for the resource.
newFindingAction :: FindingAction

-- | The invocation details of the API operation that an entity invoked for
--   the affected resource, if the value for the actionType property is
--   AWS_API_CALL.
findingAction_apiCallDetails :: Lens' FindingAction (Maybe ApiCallDetails)

-- | The type of action that occurred for the affected resource. This value
--   is typically AWS_API_CALL, which indicates that an entity invoked an
--   API operation for the resource.
findingAction_actionType :: Lens' FindingAction (Maybe FindingActionType)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FindingAction.FindingAction
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FindingAction.FindingAction
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FindingAction.FindingAction
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FindingAction.FindingAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FindingAction.FindingAction
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FindingAction.FindingAction
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FindingAction.FindingAction

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FindingPublishingFrequency

-- | The frequency with which Amazon Macie publishes updates to policy
--   findings for an account. This includes publishing updates to Security
--   Hub and Amazon EventBridge (formerly called Amazon CloudWatch Events).
--   For more information, see <a>Monitoring and processing findings</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon Macie User Guide</i>. Valid values are:
newtype FindingPublishingFrequency
FindingPublishingFrequency' :: Text -> FindingPublishingFrequency
[fromFindingPublishingFrequency] :: FindingPublishingFrequency -> Text
pattern FindingPublishingFrequency_FIFTEEN_MINUTES :: FindingPublishingFrequency
pattern FindingPublishingFrequency_ONE_HOUR :: FindingPublishingFrequency
pattern FindingPublishingFrequency_SIX_HOURS :: FindingPublishingFrequency
instance Amazonka.Data.XML.ToXML Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FindingPublishingFrequency.FindingPublishingFrequency

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FindingsFilterListItem

-- | Provides information about a findings filter.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFindingsFilterListItem</a> smart constructor.
data FindingsFilterListItem
FindingsFilterListItem' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe FindingsFilterAction -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> FindingsFilterListItem

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the filter.
[$sel:arn:FindingsFilterListItem'] :: FindingsFilterListItem -> Maybe Text

-- | The action that's performed on findings that meet the filter criteria.
--   Possible values are: ARCHIVE, suppress (automatically archive) the
--   findings; and, NOOP, don't perform any action on the findings.
[$sel:action:FindingsFilterListItem'] :: FindingsFilterListItem -> Maybe FindingsFilterAction

-- | The custom name of the filter.
[$sel:name:FindingsFilterListItem'] :: FindingsFilterListItem -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the filter.
[$sel:id:FindingsFilterListItem'] :: FindingsFilterListItem -> Maybe Text

-- | A map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags (keys and values)
--   that are associated with the filter.
[$sel:tags:FindingsFilterListItem'] :: FindingsFilterListItem -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>FindingsFilterListItem</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:FindingsFilterListItem'</a>,
--   <a>findingsFilterListItem_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:FindingsFilterListItem'</a>,
--   <a>findingsFilterListItem_action</a> - The action that's performed on
--   findings that meet the filter criteria. Possible values are: ARCHIVE,
--   suppress (automatically archive) the findings; and, NOOP, don't
--   perform any action on the findings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:FindingsFilterListItem'</a>,
--   <a>findingsFilterListItem_name</a> - The custom name of the filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:FindingsFilterListItem'</a>,
--   <a>findingsFilterListItem_id</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:FindingsFilterListItem'</a>,
--   <a>findingsFilterListItem_tags</a> - A map of key-value pairs that
--   identifies the tags (keys and values) that are associated with the
--   filter.
newFindingsFilterListItem :: FindingsFilterListItem

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the filter.
findingsFilterListItem_arn :: Lens' FindingsFilterListItem (Maybe Text)

-- | The action that's performed on findings that meet the filter criteria.
--   Possible values are: ARCHIVE, suppress (automatically archive) the
--   findings; and, NOOP, don't perform any action on the findings.
findingsFilterListItem_action :: Lens' FindingsFilterListItem (Maybe FindingsFilterAction)

-- | The custom name of the filter.
findingsFilterListItem_name :: Lens' FindingsFilterListItem (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the filter.
findingsFilterListItem_id :: Lens' FindingsFilterListItem (Maybe Text)

-- | A map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags (keys and values)
--   that are associated with the filter.
findingsFilterListItem_tags :: Lens' FindingsFilterListItem (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FindingsFilterListItem.FindingsFilterListItem
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FindingsFilterListItem.FindingsFilterListItem
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FindingsFilterListItem.FindingsFilterListItem
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FindingsFilterListItem.FindingsFilterListItem
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FindingsFilterListItem.FindingsFilterListItem

--   specified by the groupBy property in the query request.

--   number of findings in the group of query results.

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.IamUser

-- | Provides information about an Identity and Access Management (IAM)
--   user who performed an action on an affected resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIamUser</a> smart constructor.
data IamUser
IamUser' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> IamUser

-- | The unique identifier for the IAM user who performed the action.
[$sel:principalId:IamUser'] :: IamUser -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the principal that performed the
--   action. The last section of the ARN contains the name of the user who
--   performed the action.
[$sel:arn:IamUser'] :: IamUser -> Maybe Text

-- | The user name of the IAM user who performed the action.
[$sel:userName:IamUser'] :: IamUser -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that's
--   associated with the IAM user who performed the action.
[$sel:accountId:IamUser'] :: IamUser -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>IamUser</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:principalId:IamUser'</a>, <a>iamUser_principalId</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the IAM user who performed the action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:IamUser'</a>, <a>iamUser_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the principal that performed the action. The last
--   section of the ARN contains the name of the user who performed the
--   action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userName:IamUser'</a>, <a>iamUser_userName</a> - The user name
--   of the IAM user who performed the action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:IamUser'</a>, <a>iamUser_accountId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that's associated with
--   the IAM user who performed the action.
newIamUser :: IamUser

-- | The unique identifier for the IAM user who performed the action.
iamUser_principalId :: Lens' IamUser (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the principal that performed the
--   action. The last section of the ARN contains the name of the user who
--   performed the action.
iamUser_arn :: Lens' IamUser (Maybe Text)

-- | The user name of the IAM user who performed the action.
iamUser_userName :: Lens' IamUser (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that's
--   associated with the IAM user who performed the action.
iamUser_accountId :: Lens' IamUser (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.IamUser.IamUser
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.IamUser.IamUser
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.IamUser.IamUser
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.IamUser.IamUser

--   longitude coordinate of the location, rounded to four decimal places.

--   places.

instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.IpGeoLocation.IpGeoLocation
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.IpGeoLocation.IpGeoLocation


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.IpOwner

-- | Provides information about the registered owner of an IP address.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIpOwner</a> smart constructor.
data IpOwner
IpOwner' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> IpOwner

-- | The name of the organization that owned the IP address.
[$sel:org:IpOwner'] :: IpOwner -> Maybe Text

-- | The organization identifier that's associated with the autonomous
--   system number (ASN) for the autonomous system that included the IP
--   address.
[$sel:asnOrg:IpOwner'] :: IpOwner -> Maybe Text

-- | The autonomous system number (ASN) for the autonomous system that
--   included the IP address.
[$sel:asn:IpOwner'] :: IpOwner -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the internet service provider (ISP) that owned the IP
--   address.
[$sel:isp:IpOwner'] :: IpOwner -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>IpOwner</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:org:IpOwner'</a>, <a>ipOwner_org</a> - The name of the
--   organization that owned the IP address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:asnOrg:IpOwner'</a>, <a>ipOwner_asnOrg</a> - The organization
--   identifier that's associated with the autonomous system number (ASN)
--   for the autonomous system that included the IP address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:asn:IpOwner'</a>, <a>ipOwner_asn</a> - The autonomous system
--   number (ASN) for the autonomous system that included the IP address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isp:IpOwner'</a>, <a>ipOwner_isp</a> - The name of the
--   internet service provider (ISP) that owned the IP address.
newIpOwner :: IpOwner

-- | The name of the organization that owned the IP address.
ipOwner_org :: Lens' IpOwner (Maybe Text)

-- | The organization identifier that's associated with the autonomous
--   system number (ASN) for the autonomous system that included the IP
--   address.
ipOwner_asnOrg :: Lens' IpOwner (Maybe Text)

-- | The autonomous system number (ASN) for the autonomous system that
--   included the IP address.
ipOwner_asn :: Lens' IpOwner (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the internet service provider (ISP) that owned the IP
--   address.
ipOwner_isp :: Lens' IpOwner (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.IpOwner.IpOwner
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.IpOwner.IpOwner
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.IpOwner.IpOwner
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.IpOwner.IpOwner
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.IpOwner.IpOwner
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.IpOwner.IpOwner
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.IpOwner.IpOwner


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.IpAddressDetails

-- | Provides information about the IP address of the device that an entity
--   used to perform an action on an affected resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIpAddressDetails</a> smart constructor.
data IpAddressDetails
IpAddressDetails' :: Maybe IpCity -> Maybe IpGeoLocation -> Maybe Text -> Maybe IpOwner -> Maybe IpCountry -> IpAddressDetails

-- | The city that the IP address originated from.
[$sel:ipCity:IpAddressDetails'] :: IpAddressDetails -> Maybe IpCity

-- | The geographic coordinates of the location that the IP address
--   originated from.
[$sel:ipGeoLocation:IpAddressDetails'] :: IpAddressDetails -> Maybe IpGeoLocation

-- | The Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) address of the device.
[$sel:ipAddressV4:IpAddressDetails'] :: IpAddressDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The registered owner of the IP address.
[$sel:ipOwner:IpAddressDetails'] :: IpAddressDetails -> Maybe IpOwner

-- | The country that the IP address originated from.
[$sel:ipCountry:IpAddressDetails'] :: IpAddressDetails -> Maybe IpCountry

-- | Create a value of <a>IpAddressDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipCity:IpAddressDetails'</a>, <a>ipAddressDetails_ipCity</a> -
--   The city that the IP address originated from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipGeoLocation:IpAddressDetails'</a>,
--   <a>ipAddressDetails_ipGeoLocation</a> - The geographic coordinates of
--   the location that the IP address originated from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipAddressV4:IpAddressDetails'</a>,
--   <a>ipAddressDetails_ipAddressV4</a> - The Internet Protocol version 4
--   (IPv4) address of the device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipOwner:IpAddressDetails'</a>, <a>ipAddressDetails_ipOwner</a>
--   - The registered owner of the IP address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipCountry:IpAddressDetails'</a>,
--   <a>ipAddressDetails_ipCountry</a> - The country that the IP address
--   originated from.
newIpAddressDetails :: IpAddressDetails

-- | The city that the IP address originated from.
ipAddressDetails_ipCity :: Lens' IpAddressDetails (Maybe IpCity)

-- | The geographic coordinates of the location that the IP address
--   originated from.
ipAddressDetails_ipGeoLocation :: Lens' IpAddressDetails (Maybe IpGeoLocation)

-- | The Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) address of the device.
ipAddressDetails_ipAddressV4 :: Lens' IpAddressDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The registered owner of the IP address.
ipAddressDetails_ipOwner :: Lens' IpAddressDetails (Maybe IpOwner)

-- | The country that the IP address originated from.
ipAddressDetails_ipCountry :: Lens' IpAddressDetails (Maybe IpCountry)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.IpAddressDetails.IpAddressDetails
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.IpAddressDetails.IpAddressDetails
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.IpAddressDetails.IpAddressDetails
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.IpAddressDetails.IpAddressDetails

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.IpAddressDetails.IpAddressDetails

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobDetails

-- | Specifies whether any one-time or recurring classification jobs are
--   configured to analyze data in an S3 bucket, and, if so, the details of
--   the job that ran most recently.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobDetails</a> smart constructor.
data JobDetails
JobDetails' :: Maybe IsMonitoredByJob -> Maybe IsDefinedInJob -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> JobDetails

-- | Specifies whether any recurring jobs are configured to analyze data in
--   the bucket. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>TRUE - The bucket is explicitly included in the bucket definition
--   (S3BucketDefinitionForJob) for one or more recurring jobs or the
--   bucket matches the bucket criteria (S3BucketCriteriaForJob) for one or
--   more recurring jobs. At least one of those jobs has a status other
--   than CANCELLED.</li>
--   <li>FALSE - The bucket isn't explicitly included in the bucket
--   definition (S3BucketDefinitionForJob) for any recurring jobs, the
--   bucket doesn't match the bucket criteria (S3BucketCriteriaForJob) for
--   any recurring jobs, or all the recurring jobs that are configured to
--   analyze data in the bucket have a status of CANCELLED.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - An exception occurred when Amazon Macie attempted to
--   retrieve job data for the bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:isMonitoredByJob:JobDetails'] :: JobDetails -> Maybe IsMonitoredByJob

-- | Specifies whether any one-time or recurring jobs are configured to
--   analyze data in the bucket. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>TRUE - The bucket is explicitly included in the bucket definition
--   (S3BucketDefinitionForJob) for one or more jobs and at least one of
--   those jobs has a status other than CANCELLED. Or the bucket matched
--   the bucket criteria (S3BucketCriteriaForJob) for at least one job that
--   previously ran.</li>
--   <li>FALSE - The bucket isn't explicitly included in the bucket
--   definition (S3BucketDefinitionForJob) for any jobs, all the jobs that
--   explicitly include the bucket in their bucket definitions have a
--   status of CANCELLED, or the bucket didn't match the bucket criteria
--   (S3BucketCriteriaForJob) for any jobs that previously ran.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - An exception occurred when Amazon Macie attempted to
--   retrieve job data for the bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:isDefinedInJob:JobDetails'] :: JobDetails -> Maybe IsDefinedInJob

-- | The unique identifier for the job that ran most recently and is
--   configured to analyze data in the bucket, either the latest run of a
--   recurring job or the only run of a one-time job.
--   
--   This value is typically null if the value for the isDefinedInJob
--   property is FALSE or UNKNOWN.
[$sel:lastJobId:JobDetails'] :: JobDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the job
--   (lastJobId) started. If the job is a recurring job, this value
--   indicates when the most recent run started.
--   
--   This value is typically null if the value for the isDefinedInJob
--   property is FALSE or UNKNOWN.
[$sel:lastJobRunTime:JobDetails'] :: JobDetails -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>JobDetails</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:isMonitoredByJob:JobDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobDetails_isMonitoredByJob</a> - Specifies whether any recurring
--   jobs are configured to analyze data in the bucket. Possible values
--   are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>TRUE - The bucket is explicitly included in the bucket definition
--   (S3BucketDefinitionForJob) for one or more recurring jobs or the
--   bucket matches the bucket criteria (S3BucketCriteriaForJob) for one or
--   more recurring jobs. At least one of those jobs has a status other
--   than CANCELLED.</li>
--   <li>FALSE - The bucket isn't explicitly included in the bucket
--   definition (S3BucketDefinitionForJob) for any recurring jobs, the
--   bucket doesn't match the bucket criteria (S3BucketCriteriaForJob) for
--   any recurring jobs, or all the recurring jobs that are configured to
--   analyze data in the bucket have a status of CANCELLED.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - An exception occurred when Amazon Macie attempted to
--   retrieve job data for the bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:isDefinedInJob:JobDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobDetails_isDefinedInJob</a> - Specifies whether any one-time or
--   recurring jobs are configured to analyze data in the bucket. Possible
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>TRUE - The bucket is explicitly included in the bucket definition
--   (S3BucketDefinitionForJob) for one or more jobs and at least one of
--   those jobs has a status other than CANCELLED. Or the bucket matched
--   the bucket criteria (S3BucketCriteriaForJob) for at least one job that
--   previously ran.</li>
--   <li>FALSE - The bucket isn't explicitly included in the bucket
--   definition (S3BucketDefinitionForJob) for any jobs, all the jobs that
--   explicitly include the bucket in their bucket definitions have a
--   status of CANCELLED, or the bucket didn't match the bucket criteria
--   (S3BucketCriteriaForJob) for any jobs that previously ran.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - An exception occurred when Amazon Macie attempted to
--   retrieve job data for the bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastJobId:JobDetails'</a>, <a>jobDetails_lastJobId</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the job that ran most recently and is configured
--   to analyze data in the bucket, either the latest run of a recurring
--   job or the only run of a one-time job.
--   
--   This value is typically null if the value for the isDefinedInJob
--   property is FALSE or UNKNOWN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastJobRunTime:JobDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobDetails_lastJobRunTime</a> - The date and time, in UTC and
--   extended ISO 8601 format, when the job (lastJobId) started. If the job
--   is a recurring job, this value indicates when the most recent run
--   started.
--   
--   This value is typically null if the value for the isDefinedInJob
--   property is FALSE or UNKNOWN.
newJobDetails :: JobDetails

-- | Specifies whether any recurring jobs are configured to analyze data in
--   the bucket. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>TRUE - The bucket is explicitly included in the bucket definition
--   (S3BucketDefinitionForJob) for one or more recurring jobs or the
--   bucket matches the bucket criteria (S3BucketCriteriaForJob) for one or
--   more recurring jobs. At least one of those jobs has a status other
--   than CANCELLED.</li>
--   <li>FALSE - The bucket isn't explicitly included in the bucket
--   definition (S3BucketDefinitionForJob) for any recurring jobs, the
--   bucket doesn't match the bucket criteria (S3BucketCriteriaForJob) for
--   any recurring jobs, or all the recurring jobs that are configured to
--   analyze data in the bucket have a status of CANCELLED.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - An exception occurred when Amazon Macie attempted to
--   retrieve job data for the bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
jobDetails_isMonitoredByJob :: Lens' JobDetails (Maybe IsMonitoredByJob)

-- | Specifies whether any one-time or recurring jobs are configured to
--   analyze data in the bucket. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>TRUE - The bucket is explicitly included in the bucket definition
--   (S3BucketDefinitionForJob) for one or more jobs and at least one of
--   those jobs has a status other than CANCELLED. Or the bucket matched
--   the bucket criteria (S3BucketCriteriaForJob) for at least one job that
--   previously ran.</li>
--   <li>FALSE - The bucket isn't explicitly included in the bucket
--   definition (S3BucketDefinitionForJob) for any jobs, all the jobs that
--   explicitly include the bucket in their bucket definitions have a
--   status of CANCELLED, or the bucket didn't match the bucket criteria
--   (S3BucketCriteriaForJob) for any jobs that previously ran.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - An exception occurred when Amazon Macie attempted to
--   retrieve job data for the bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
jobDetails_isDefinedInJob :: Lens' JobDetails (Maybe IsDefinedInJob)

-- | The unique identifier for the job that ran most recently and is
--   configured to analyze data in the bucket, either the latest run of a
--   recurring job or the only run of a one-time job.
--   
--   This value is typically null if the value for the isDefinedInJob
--   property is FALSE or UNKNOWN.
jobDetails_lastJobId :: Lens' JobDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the job
--   (lastJobId) started. If the job is a recurring job, this value
--   indicates when the most recent run started.
--   
--   This value is typically null if the value for the isDefinedInJob
--   property is FALSE or UNKNOWN.
jobDetails_lastJobRunTime :: Lens' JobDetails (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobDetails.JobDetails
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobDetails.JobDetails
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobDetails.JobDetails
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobDetails.JobDetails
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobDetails.JobDetails
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobDetails.JobDetails
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobDetails.JobDetails

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.KeyValuePair

-- | Provides information about the tags that are associated with an S3
--   bucket or object. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an
--   associated tag value.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKeyValuePair</a> smart constructor.
data KeyValuePair
KeyValuePair' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> KeyValuePair

-- | One part of a key-value pair that comprises a tag. A tag value acts as
--   a descriptor for a tag key. A tag value can be an empty string.
[$sel:value:KeyValuePair'] :: KeyValuePair -> Maybe Text

-- | One part of a key-value pair that comprises a tag. A tag key is a
--   general label that acts as a category for more specific tag values.
[$sel:key:KeyValuePair'] :: KeyValuePair -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>KeyValuePair</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:KeyValuePair'</a>, <a>keyValuePair_value</a> - One part
--   of a key-value pair that comprises a tag. A tag value acts as a
--   descriptor for a tag key. A tag value can be an empty string.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:KeyValuePair'</a>, <a>keyValuePair_key</a> - One part of a
--   key-value pair that comprises a tag. A tag key is a general label that
--   acts as a category for more specific tag values.
newKeyValuePair :: KeyValuePair

-- | One part of a key-value pair that comprises a tag. A tag value acts as
--   a descriptor for a tag key. A tag value can be an empty string.
keyValuePair_value :: Lens' KeyValuePair (Maybe Text)

-- | One part of a key-value pair that comprises a tag. A tag key is a
--   general label that acts as a category for more specific tag values.
keyValuePair_key :: Lens' KeyValuePair (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.KeyValuePair.KeyValuePair
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.KeyValuePair.KeyValuePair
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.KeyValuePair.KeyValuePair
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.KeyValuePair.KeyValuePair
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.KeyValuePair.KeyValuePair
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.KeyValuePair.KeyValuePair
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.KeyValuePair.KeyValuePair

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.LastRunErrorStatus

-- | Specifies whether any account- or bucket-level access errors occurred
--   when a classification job ran. For information about using logging
--   data to investigate these errors, see <a>Monitoring sensitive data
--   discovery jobs</a> in the <i>Amazon Macie User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLastRunErrorStatus</a> smart constructor.
data LastRunErrorStatus
LastRunErrorStatus' :: Maybe LastRunErrorStatusCode -> LastRunErrorStatus

-- | Specifies whether any account- or bucket-level access errors occurred
--   when the job ran. For a recurring job, this value indicates the error
--   status of the job's most recent run. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ERROR - One or more errors occurred. Amazon Macie didn't process
--   all the data specified for the job.</li>
--   <li>NONE - No errors occurred. Macie processed all the data specified
--   for the job.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:code:LastRunErrorStatus'] :: LastRunErrorStatus -> Maybe LastRunErrorStatusCode

-- | Create a value of <a>LastRunErrorStatus</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:code:LastRunErrorStatus'</a>, <a>lastRunErrorStatus_code</a> -
--   Specifies whether any account- or bucket-level access errors occurred
--   when the job ran. For a recurring job, this value indicates the error
--   status of the job's most recent run. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ERROR - One or more errors occurred. Amazon Macie didn't process
--   all the data specified for the job.</li>
--   <li>NONE - No errors occurred. Macie processed all the data specified
--   for the job.</li>
--   </ul>
newLastRunErrorStatus :: LastRunErrorStatus

-- | Specifies whether any account- or bucket-level access errors occurred
--   when the job ran. For a recurring job, this value indicates the error
--   status of the job's most recent run. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ERROR - One or more errors occurred. Amazon Macie didn't process
--   all the data specified for the job.</li>
--   <li>NONE - No errors occurred. Macie processed all the data specified
--   for the job.</li>
--   </ul>
lastRunErrorStatus_code :: Lens' LastRunErrorStatus (Maybe LastRunErrorStatusCode)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.LastRunErrorStatus.LastRunErrorStatus
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.LastRunErrorStatus.LastRunErrorStatus
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.LastRunErrorStatus.LastRunErrorStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.LastRunErrorStatus.LastRunErrorStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.LastRunErrorStatus.LastRunErrorStatus
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.LastRunErrorStatus.LastRunErrorStatus
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.LastRunErrorStatus.LastRunErrorStatus

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ListJobsFilterTerm

-- | Specifies a condition that filters the results of a request for
--   information about classification jobs. Each condition consists of a
--   property, an operator, and one or more values.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListJobsFilterTerm</a> smart constructor.
data ListJobsFilterTerm
ListJobsFilterTerm' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe ListJobsFilterKey -> Maybe JobComparator -> ListJobsFilterTerm

-- | An array that lists one or more values to use to filter the results.
[$sel:values:ListJobsFilterTerm'] :: ListJobsFilterTerm -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The property to use to filter the results.
[$sel:key:ListJobsFilterTerm'] :: ListJobsFilterTerm -> Maybe ListJobsFilterKey

-- | The operator to use to filter the results.
[$sel:comparator:ListJobsFilterTerm'] :: ListJobsFilterTerm -> Maybe JobComparator

-- | Create a value of <a>ListJobsFilterTerm</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:ListJobsFilterTerm'</a>,
--   <a>listJobsFilterTerm_values</a> - An array that lists one or more
--   values to use to filter the results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:ListJobsFilterTerm'</a>, <a>listJobsFilterTerm_key</a> -
--   The property to use to filter the results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comparator:ListJobsFilterTerm'</a>,
--   <a>listJobsFilterTerm_comparator</a> - The operator to use to filter
--   the results.
newListJobsFilterTerm :: ListJobsFilterTerm

-- | An array that lists one or more values to use to filter the results.
listJobsFilterTerm_values :: Lens' ListJobsFilterTerm (Maybe [Text])

-- | The property to use to filter the results.
listJobsFilterTerm_key :: Lens' ListJobsFilterTerm (Maybe ListJobsFilterKey)

-- | The operator to use to filter the results.
listJobsFilterTerm_comparator :: Lens' ListJobsFilterTerm (Maybe JobComparator)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ListJobsFilterTerm.ListJobsFilterTerm
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ListJobsFilterTerm.ListJobsFilterTerm
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ListJobsFilterTerm.ListJobsFilterTerm
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ListJobsFilterTerm.ListJobsFilterTerm

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ListJobsFilterCriteria

-- | Specifies criteria for filtering the results of a request for
--   information about classification jobs.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListJobsFilterCriteria</a> smart constructor.
data ListJobsFilterCriteria
ListJobsFilterCriteria' :: Maybe [ListJobsFilterTerm] -> Maybe [ListJobsFilterTerm] -> ListJobsFilterCriteria

-- | An array of objects, one for each condition that determines which jobs
--   to include in the results.

-- | An array of objects, one for each condition that determines which jobs
--   to exclude from the results.

--   each condition that determines which jobs to include in the results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:excludes:ListJobsFilterCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>listJobsFilterCriteria_excludes</a> - An array of objects, one for
--   each condition that determines which jobs to exclude from the results.
newListJobsFilterCriteria :: ListJobsFilterCriteria

-- | An array of objects, one for each condition that determines which jobs
--   to include in the results.
listJobsFilterCriteria_includes :: Lens' ListJobsFilterCriteria (Maybe [ListJobsFilterTerm])

-- | An array of objects, one for each condition that determines which jobs
--   to exclude from the results.
listJobsFilterCriteria_excludes :: Lens' ListJobsFilterCriteria (Maybe [ListJobsFilterTerm])
