module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.MonthlySchedule

-- | Specifies a monthly recurrence pattern for running a classification
--   job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMonthlySchedule</a> smart constructor.
data MonthlySchedule
MonthlySchedule' :: Maybe Int -> MonthlySchedule

-- | The numeric day of the month when Amazon Macie runs the job. This
--   value can be an integer from 1 through 31.
--   
--   If this value exceeds the number of days in a certain month, Macie
--   doesn't run the job that month. Macie runs the job only during months
--   that have the specified day. For example, if this value is 31 and a
--   month has only 30 days, Macie doesn't run the job that month. To run
--   the job every month, specify a value that's less than 29.
[$sel:dayOfMonth:MonthlySchedule'] :: MonthlySchedule -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>MonthlySchedule</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dayOfMonth:MonthlySchedule'</a>,
--   <a>monthlySchedule_dayOfMonth</a> - The numeric day of the month when
--   Amazon Macie runs the job. This value can be an integer from 1 through
--   31.
--   
--   If this value exceeds the number of days in a certain month, Macie
--   doesn't run the job that month. Macie runs the job only during months
--   that have the specified day. For example, if this value is 31 and a
--   month has only 30 days, Macie doesn't run the job that month. To run
--   the job every month, specify a value that's less than 29.
newMonthlySchedule :: MonthlySchedule

-- | The numeric day of the month when Amazon Macie runs the job. This
--   value can be an integer from 1 through 31.
--   
--   If this value exceeds the number of days in a certain month, Macie
--   doesn't run the job that month. Macie runs the job only during months
--   that have the specified day. For example, if this value is 31 and a
--   month has only 30 days, Macie doesn't run the job that month. To run
--   the job every month, specify a value that's less than 29.
monthlySchedule_dayOfMonth :: Lens' MonthlySchedule (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.MonthlySchedule.MonthlySchedule
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.MonthlySchedule.MonthlySchedule
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.MonthlySchedule.MonthlySchedule
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.MonthlySchedule.MonthlySchedule
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.MonthlySchedule.MonthlySchedule
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.MonthlySchedule.MonthlySchedule
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.MonthlySchedule.MonthlySchedule
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.MonthlySchedule.MonthlySchedule


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ObjectCountByEncryptionType

-- | Provides information about the number of objects that are in an S3
--   bucket and use certain types of server-side encryption, use
--   client-side encryption, or aren't encrypted.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newObjectCountByEncryptionType</a> smart constructor.
data ObjectCountByEncryptionType
ObjectCountByEncryptionType' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> ObjectCountByEncryptionType

-- | The total number of objects that Amazon Macie doesn't have current
--   encryption metadata for. Macie can't provide current data about the
--   encryption settings for these objects.
[$sel:unknown:ObjectCountByEncryptionType'] :: ObjectCountByEncryptionType -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total number of objects that are encrypted with an Amazon S3
--   managed key. The objects use Amazon S3 managed encryption (SSE-S3).
[$sel:s3Managed:ObjectCountByEncryptionType'] :: ObjectCountByEncryptionType -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total number of objects that aren't encrypted or use client-side
--   encryption.
[$sel:unencrypted:ObjectCountByEncryptionType'] :: ObjectCountByEncryptionType -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total number of objects that are encrypted with an KMS key, either
--   an Amazon Web Services managed key or a customer managed key. The
--   objects use KMS encryption (SSE-KMS).
[$sel:kmsManaged:ObjectCountByEncryptionType'] :: ObjectCountByEncryptionType -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total number of objects that are encrypted with a
--   customer-provided key. The objects use customer-provided server-side
--   encryption (SSE-C).
[$sel:customerManaged:ObjectCountByEncryptionType'] :: ObjectCountByEncryptionType -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>ObjectCountByEncryptionType</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:unknown:ObjectCountByEncryptionType'</a>,
--   <a>objectCountByEncryptionType_unknown</a> - The total number of
--   objects that Amazon Macie doesn't have current encryption metadata
--   for. Macie can't provide current data about the encryption settings
--   for these objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Managed:ObjectCountByEncryptionType'</a>,
--   <a>objectCountByEncryptionType_s3Managed</a> - The total number of
--   objects that are encrypted with an Amazon S3 managed key. The objects
--   use Amazon S3 managed encryption (SSE-S3).
--   
--   <a>$sel:unencrypted:ObjectCountByEncryptionType'</a>,
--   <a>objectCountByEncryptionType_unencrypted</a> - The total number of
--   objects that aren't encrypted or use client-side encryption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsManaged:ObjectCountByEncryptionType'</a>,
--   <a>objectCountByEncryptionType_kmsManaged</a> - The total number of
--   objects that are encrypted with an KMS key, either an Amazon Web
--   Services managed key or a customer managed key. The objects use KMS
--   encryption (SSE-KMS).
--   
--   <a>$sel:customerManaged:ObjectCountByEncryptionType'</a>,
--   <a>objectCountByEncryptionType_customerManaged</a> - The total number
--   of objects that are encrypted with a customer-provided key. The
--   objects use customer-provided server-side encryption (SSE-C).
newObjectCountByEncryptionType :: ObjectCountByEncryptionType

-- | The total number of objects that Amazon Macie doesn't have current
--   encryption metadata for. Macie can't provide current data about the
--   encryption settings for these objects.
objectCountByEncryptionType_unknown :: Lens' ObjectCountByEncryptionType (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total number of objects that are encrypted with an Amazon S3
--   managed key. The objects use Amazon S3 managed encryption (SSE-S3).
objectCountByEncryptionType_s3Managed :: Lens' ObjectCountByEncryptionType (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total number of objects that aren't encrypted or use client-side
--   encryption.
objectCountByEncryptionType_unencrypted :: Lens' ObjectCountByEncryptionType (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total number of objects that are encrypted with an KMS key, either
--   an Amazon Web Services managed key or a customer managed key. The
--   objects use KMS encryption (SSE-KMS).
objectCountByEncryptionType_kmsManaged :: Lens' ObjectCountByEncryptionType (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total number of objects that are encrypted with a
--   customer-provided key. The objects use customer-provided server-side
--   encryption (SSE-C).
objectCountByEncryptionType_customerManaged :: Lens' ObjectCountByEncryptionType (Maybe Integer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ObjectCountByEncryptionType.ObjectCountByEncryptionType
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ObjectCountByEncryptionType.ObjectCountByEncryptionType
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ObjectCountByEncryptionType.ObjectCountByEncryptionType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ObjectCountByEncryptionType.ObjectCountByEncryptionType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ObjectCountByEncryptionType.ObjectCountByEncryptionType
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ObjectCountByEncryptionType.ObjectCountByEncryptionType
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ObjectCountByEncryptionType.ObjectCountByEncryptionType


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ObjectLevelStatistics

-- | Provides information about the total storage size (in bytes) or number
--   of objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze in one or more S3 buckets.
--   In a BucketMetadata or MatchingBucket object, this data is for a
--   specific bucket. In a GetBucketStatisticsResponse object, this data is
--   aggregated for the buckets in the query results. If versioning is
--   enabled for a bucket, total storage size values are based on the size
--   of the latest version of each applicable object in the bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newObjectLevelStatistics</a> smart constructor.
data ObjectLevelStatistics
ObjectLevelStatistics' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> ObjectLevelStatistics

-- | The total storage size (in bytes) or number of objects that Amazon
--   Macie can't analyze because the objects don't have a file name
--   extension for a supported file or storage format.
[$sel:fileType:ObjectLevelStatistics'] :: ObjectLevelStatistics -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total storage size (in bytes) or number of objects that Amazon
--   Macie can't analyze because the objects use an unsupported storage
--   class.
[$sel:storageClass:ObjectLevelStatistics'] :: ObjectLevelStatistics -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total storage size (in bytes) or number of objects that Amazon
--   Macie can't analyze because the objects use an unsupported storage
--   class or don't have a file name extension for a supported file or
--   storage format.
[$sel:total:ObjectLevelStatistics'] :: ObjectLevelStatistics -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>ObjectLevelStatistics</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileType:ObjectLevelStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>objectLevelStatistics_fileType</a> - The total storage size (in
--   bytes) or number of objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze because
--   the objects don't have a file name extension for a supported file or
--   storage format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageClass:ObjectLevelStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>objectLevelStatistics_storageClass</a> - The total storage size (in
--   bytes) or number of objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze because
--   the objects use an unsupported storage class.
--   
--   <a>$sel:total:ObjectLevelStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>objectLevelStatistics_total</a> - The total storage size (in bytes)
--   or number of objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze because the
--   objects use an unsupported storage class or don't have a file name
--   extension for a supported file or storage format.
newObjectLevelStatistics :: ObjectLevelStatistics

-- | The total storage size (in bytes) or number of objects that Amazon
--   Macie can't analyze because the objects don't have a file name
--   extension for a supported file or storage format.
objectLevelStatistics_fileType :: Lens' ObjectLevelStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total storage size (in bytes) or number of objects that Amazon
--   Macie can't analyze because the objects use an unsupported storage
--   class.
objectLevelStatistics_storageClass :: Lens' ObjectLevelStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total storage size (in bytes) or number of objects that Amazon
--   Macie can't analyze because the objects use an unsupported storage
--   class or don't have a file name extension for a supported file or
--   storage format.
objectLevelStatistics_total :: Lens' ObjectLevelStatistics (Maybe Integer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ObjectLevelStatistics.ObjectLevelStatistics
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ObjectLevelStatistics.ObjectLevelStatistics
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ObjectLevelStatistics.ObjectLevelStatistics
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ObjectLevelStatistics.ObjectLevelStatistics
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ObjectLevelStatistics.ObjectLevelStatistics
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ObjectLevelStatistics.ObjectLevelStatistics
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ObjectLevelStatistics.ObjectLevelStatistics


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.MatchingBucket

-- | Provides statistical data and other information about an S3 bucket
--   that Amazon Macie monitors and analyzes for your account. If an error
--   occurs when Macie attempts to retrieve and process information about
--   the bucket or the bucket's objects, the value for most of these
--   properties is null. Exceptions are accountId and bucketName. To
--   identify the cause of the error, refer to the errorCode and
--   errorMessage values.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMatchingBucket</a> smart constructor.
data MatchingBucket
MatchingBucket' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe ObjectCountByEncryptionType -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ObjectLevelStatistics -> Maybe ObjectLevelStatistics -> Maybe BucketMetadataErrorCode -> Maybe JobDetails -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> MatchingBucket

-- | The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that are compressed
--   (.gz, .gzip, .zip) files in the bucket.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Amazon Macie calculates this
--   value based on the size of the latest version of each applicable
--   object in the bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of
--   all versions of each applicable object in the bucket.
[$sel:sizeInBytesCompressed:MatchingBucket'] :: MatchingBucket -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total number of objects that are in the bucket, grouped by
--   server-side encryption type. This includes a grouping that reports the
--   total number of objects that aren't encrypted or use client-side
--   encryption.
[$sel:objectCountByEncryptionType:MatchingBucket'] :: MatchingBucket -> Maybe ObjectCountByEncryptionType

-- | The total storage size, in bytes, of the bucket.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Amazon Macie calculates this
--   value based on the size of the latest version of each object in the
--   bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all versions of
--   each object in the bucket.
[$sel:sizeInBytes:MatchingBucket'] :: MatchingBucket -> Maybe Integer

-- | The name of the bucket.
[$sel:bucketName:MatchingBucket'] :: MatchingBucket -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of objects that Amazon Macie can analyze in the
--   bucket. These objects use a supported storage class and have a file
--   name extension for a supported file or storage format.
[$sel:classifiableObjectCount:MatchingBucket'] :: MatchingBucket -> Maybe Integer

-- | The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns
--   the bucket.
[$sel:accountId:MatchingBucket'] :: MatchingBucket -> Maybe Text

-- | The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that Amazon Macie
--   can't analyze in the bucket. These objects don't use a supported
--   storage class or don't have a file name extension for a supported file
--   or storage format.
[$sel:unclassifiableObjectSizeInBytes:MatchingBucket'] :: MatchingBucket -> Maybe ObjectLevelStatistics

-- | The total number of objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze in the
--   bucket. These objects don't use a supported storage class or don't
--   have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.
[$sel:unclassifiableObjectCount:MatchingBucket'] :: MatchingBucket -> Maybe ObjectLevelStatistics

-- | Specifies the error code for an error that prevented Amazon Macie from
--   retrieving and processing information about the bucket and the
--   bucket's objects. If this value is ACCESS_DENIED, Macie doesn't have
--   permission to retrieve the information. For example, the bucket has a
--   restrictive bucket policy and Amazon S3 denied the request. If this
--   value is null, Macie was able to retrieve and process the information.
[$sel:errorCode:MatchingBucket'] :: MatchingBucket -> Maybe BucketMetadataErrorCode

-- | Specifies whether any one-time or recurring classification jobs are
--   configured to analyze objects in the bucket, and, if so, the details
--   of the job that ran most recently.
[$sel:jobDetails:MatchingBucket'] :: MatchingBucket -> Maybe JobDetails

-- | A brief description of the error (errorCode) that prevented Amazon
--   Macie from retrieving and processing information about the bucket and
--   the bucket's objects. This value is null if Macie was able to retrieve
--   and process the information.
[$sel:errorMessage:MatchingBucket'] :: MatchingBucket -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of objects in the bucket.
[$sel:objectCount:MatchingBucket'] :: MatchingBucket -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that Amazon Macie can
--   analyze in the bucket. These objects use a supported storage class and
--   have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Macie calculates this value
--   based on the size of the latest version of each applicable object in
--   the bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all
--   versions of each applicable object in the bucket.
[$sel:classifiableSizeInBytes:MatchingBucket'] :: MatchingBucket -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>MatchingBucket</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInBytesCompressed:MatchingBucket'</a>,
--   <a>matchingBucket_sizeInBytesCompressed</a> - The total storage size,
--   in bytes, of the objects that are compressed (.gz, .gzip, .zip) files
--   in the bucket.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Amazon Macie calculates this
--   value based on the size of the latest version of each applicable
--   object in the bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of
--   all versions of each applicable object in the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectCountByEncryptionType:MatchingBucket'</a>,
--   <a>matchingBucket_objectCountByEncryptionType</a> - The total number
--   of objects that are in the bucket, grouped by server-side encryption
--   type. This includes a grouping that reports the total number of
--   objects that aren't encrypted or use client-side encryption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInBytes:MatchingBucket'</a>,
--   <a>matchingBucket_sizeInBytes</a> - The total storage size, in bytes,
--   of the bucket.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Amazon Macie calculates this
--   value based on the size of the latest version of each object in the
--   bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all versions of
--   each object in the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:MatchingBucket'</a>,
--   <a>matchingBucket_bucketName</a> - The name of the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:classifiableObjectCount:MatchingBucket'</a>,
--   <a>matchingBucket_classifiableObjectCount</a> - The total number of
--   objects that Amazon Macie can analyze in the bucket. These objects use
--   a supported storage class and have a file name extension for a
--   supported file or storage format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:MatchingBucket'</a>, <a>matchingBucket_accountId</a>
--   - The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns
--   the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unclassifiableObjectSizeInBytes:MatchingBucket'</a>,
--   <a>matchingBucket_unclassifiableObjectSizeInBytes</a> - The total
--   storage size, in bytes, of the objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze
--   in the bucket. These objects don't use a supported storage class or
--   don't have a file name extension for a supported file or storage
--   format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unclassifiableObjectCount:MatchingBucket'</a>,
--   <a>matchingBucket_unclassifiableObjectCount</a> - The total number of
--   objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze in the bucket. These objects
--   don't use a supported storage class or don't have a file name
--   extension for a supported file or storage format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorCode:MatchingBucket'</a>, <a>matchingBucket_errorCode</a>
--   - Specifies the error code for an error that prevented Amazon Macie
--   from retrieving and processing information about the bucket and the
--   bucket's objects. If this value is ACCESS_DENIED, Macie doesn't have
--   permission to retrieve the information. For example, the bucket has a
--   restrictive bucket policy and Amazon S3 denied the request. If this
--   value is null, Macie was able to retrieve and process the information.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobDetails:MatchingBucket'</a>,
--   <a>matchingBucket_jobDetails</a> - Specifies whether any one-time or
--   recurring classification jobs are configured to analyze objects in the
--   bucket, and, if so, the details of the job that ran most recently.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorMessage:MatchingBucket'</a>,
--   <a>matchingBucket_errorMessage</a> - A brief description of the error
--   (errorCode) that prevented Amazon Macie from retrieving and processing
--   information about the bucket and the bucket's objects. This value is
--   null if Macie was able to retrieve and process the information.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectCount:MatchingBucket'</a>,
--   <a>matchingBucket_objectCount</a> - The total number of objects in the
--   bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:classifiableSizeInBytes:MatchingBucket'</a>,
--   <a>matchingBucket_classifiableSizeInBytes</a> - The total storage
--   size, in bytes, of the objects that Amazon Macie can analyze in the
--   bucket. These objects use a supported storage class and have a file
--   name extension for a supported file or storage format.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Macie calculates this value
--   based on the size of the latest version of each applicable object in
--   the bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all
--   versions of each applicable object in the bucket.
newMatchingBucket :: MatchingBucket

-- | The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that are compressed
--   (.gz, .gzip, .zip) files in the bucket.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Amazon Macie calculates this
--   value based on the size of the latest version of each applicable
--   object in the bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of
--   all versions of each applicable object in the bucket.
matchingBucket_sizeInBytesCompressed :: Lens' MatchingBucket (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total number of objects that are in the bucket, grouped by
--   server-side encryption type. This includes a grouping that reports the
--   total number of objects that aren't encrypted or use client-side
--   encryption.
matchingBucket_objectCountByEncryptionType :: Lens' MatchingBucket (Maybe ObjectCountByEncryptionType)

-- | The total storage size, in bytes, of the bucket.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Amazon Macie calculates this
--   value based on the size of the latest version of each object in the
--   bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all versions of
--   each object in the bucket.
matchingBucket_sizeInBytes :: Lens' MatchingBucket (Maybe Integer)

-- | The name of the bucket.
matchingBucket_bucketName :: Lens' MatchingBucket (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of objects that Amazon Macie can analyze in the
--   bucket. These objects use a supported storage class and have a file
--   name extension for a supported file or storage format.
matchingBucket_classifiableObjectCount :: Lens' MatchingBucket (Maybe Integer)

-- | The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns
--   the bucket.
matchingBucket_accountId :: Lens' MatchingBucket (Maybe Text)

-- | The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that Amazon Macie
--   can't analyze in the bucket. These objects don't use a supported
--   storage class or don't have a file name extension for a supported file
--   or storage format.
matchingBucket_unclassifiableObjectSizeInBytes :: Lens' MatchingBucket (Maybe ObjectLevelStatistics)

-- | The total number of objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze in the
--   bucket. These objects don't use a supported storage class or don't
--   have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.
matchingBucket_unclassifiableObjectCount :: Lens' MatchingBucket (Maybe ObjectLevelStatistics)

-- | Specifies the error code for an error that prevented Amazon Macie from
--   retrieving and processing information about the bucket and the
--   bucket's objects. If this value is ACCESS_DENIED, Macie doesn't have
--   permission to retrieve the information. For example, the bucket has a
--   restrictive bucket policy and Amazon S3 denied the request. If this
--   value is null, Macie was able to retrieve and process the information.
matchingBucket_errorCode :: Lens' MatchingBucket (Maybe BucketMetadataErrorCode)

-- | Specifies whether any one-time or recurring classification jobs are
--   configured to analyze objects in the bucket, and, if so, the details
--   of the job that ran most recently.
matchingBucket_jobDetails :: Lens' MatchingBucket (Maybe JobDetails)

-- | A brief description of the error (errorCode) that prevented Amazon
--   Macie from retrieving and processing information about the bucket and
--   the bucket's objects. This value is null if Macie was able to retrieve
--   and process the information.
matchingBucket_errorMessage :: Lens' MatchingBucket (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of objects in the bucket.
matchingBucket_objectCount :: Lens' MatchingBucket (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that Amazon Macie can
--   analyze in the bucket. These objects use a supported storage class and
--   have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Macie calculates this value
--   based on the size of the latest version of each applicable object in
--   the bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all
--   versions of each applicable object in the bucket.
matchingBucket_classifiableSizeInBytes :: Lens' MatchingBucket (Maybe Integer)

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ListJobsSortCriteria

-- | Specifies criteria for sorting the results of a request for
--   information about classification jobs.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListJobsSortCriteria</a> smart constructor.
data ListJobsSortCriteria
ListJobsSortCriteria' :: Maybe OrderBy -> Maybe ListJobsSortAttributeName -> ListJobsSortCriteria

-- | The sort order to apply to the results, based on the value for the
--   property specified by the attributeName property. Valid values are:
--   ASC, sort the results in ascending order; and, DESC, sort the results
--   in descending order.
[$sel:orderBy:ListJobsSortCriteria'] :: ListJobsSortCriteria -> Maybe OrderBy

-- | The property to sort the results by.
[$sel:attributeName:ListJobsSortCriteria'] :: ListJobsSortCriteria -> Maybe ListJobsSortAttributeName

-- | Create a value of <a>ListJobsSortCriteria</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:orderBy:ListJobsSortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>listJobsSortCriteria_orderBy</a> - The sort order to apply to the
--   results, based on the value for the property specified by the
--   attributeName property. Valid values are: ASC, sort the results in
--   ascending order; and, DESC, sort the results in descending order.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeName:ListJobsSortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>listJobsSortCriteria_attributeName</a> - The property to sort the
--   results by.
newListJobsSortCriteria :: ListJobsSortCriteria

-- | The sort order to apply to the results, based on the value for the
--   property specified by the attributeName property. Valid values are:
--   ASC, sort the results in ascending order; and, DESC, sort the results
--   in descending order.
listJobsSortCriteria_orderBy :: Lens' ListJobsSortCriteria (Maybe OrderBy)

listJobsSortCriteria_attributeName :: Lens' ListJobsSortCriteria (Maybe ListJobsSortAttributeName)

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FindingStatisticsSortCriteria

-- | Specifies criteria for sorting the results of a query that retrieves
--   aggregated statistical data about findings.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFindingStatisticsSortCriteria</a> smart constructor.
data FindingStatisticsSortCriteria
FindingStatisticsSortCriteria' :: Maybe OrderBy -> Maybe FindingStatisticsSortAttributeName -> FindingStatisticsSortCriteria

-- | The sort order to apply to the results, based on the value for the
--   property specified by the attributeName property. Valid values are:
--   ASC, sort the results in ascending order; and, DESC, sort the results
--   in descending order.
[$sel:orderBy:FindingStatisticsSortCriteria'] :: FindingStatisticsSortCriteria -> Maybe OrderBy

-- | The grouping to sort the results by. Valid values are: count, sort the
--   results by the number of findings in each group of results; and,
--   groupKey, sort the results by the name of each group of results.
[$sel:attributeName:FindingStatisticsSortCriteria'] :: FindingStatisticsSortCriteria -> Maybe FindingStatisticsSortAttributeName

--   optional fields omitted.

--   attributeName property. Valid values are: ASC, sort the results in
--   ascending order; and, DESC, sort the results in descending order.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeName:FindingStatisticsSortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>findingStatisticsSortCriteria_attributeName</a> - The grouping to
--   sort the results by. Valid values are: count, sort the results by the
--   number of findings in each group of results; and, groupKey, sort the
--   results by the name of each group of results.
newFindingStatisticsSortCriteria :: FindingStatisticsSortCriteria

-- | The sort order to apply to the results, based on the value for the
--   property specified by the attributeName property. Valid values are:
--   ASC, sort the results in ascending order; and, DESC, sort the results
--   in descending order.
findingStatisticsSortCriteria_orderBy :: Lens' FindingStatisticsSortCriteria (Maybe OrderBy)

-- | The grouping to sort the results by. Valid values are: count, sort the
--   results by the number of findings in each group of results; and,
--   groupKey, sort the results by the name of each group of results.
findingStatisticsSortCriteria_attributeName :: Lens' FindingStatisticsSortCriteria (Maybe FindingStatisticsSortAttributeName)

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketSortCriteria

-- | Specifies criteria for sorting the results of a query for information
--   about S3 buckets.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucketSortCriteria</a> smart constructor.
data BucketSortCriteria

--   by the attributeName property. Valid values are: ASC, sort the results
--   in ascending order; and, DESC, sort the results in descending order.
[$sel:orderBy:BucketSortCriteria'] :: BucketSortCriteria -> Maybe OrderBy

-- | The name of the bucket property to sort the results by. This value can
--   be one of the following properties that Amazon Macie defines as bucket
--   metadata: accountId, bucketName, classifiableObjectCount,
--   classifiableSizeInBytes, objectCount, or sizeInBytes.

--   results, based on the value specified by the attributeName property.
--   Valid values are: ASC, sort the results in ascending order; and, DESC,
--   sort the results in descending order.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeName:BucketSortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>bucketSortCriteria_attributeName</a> - The name of the bucket
--   property to sort the results by. This value can be one of the
--   following properties that Amazon Macie defines as bucket metadata:
--   accountId, bucketName, classifiableObjectCount,
--   classifiableSizeInBytes, objectCount, or sizeInBytes.
newBucketSortCriteria :: BucketSortCriteria

-- | The sort order to apply to the results, based on the value specified
--   by the attributeName property. Valid values are: ASC, sort the results
--   in ascending order; and, DESC, sort the results in descending order.

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Range

-- | Specifies the location of an occurrence of sensitive data in a
--   non-binary text file, such as an HTML, TXT, or XML file.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRange</a> smart constructor.
data Range
Range' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Range

-- | The number of lines from the beginning of the file to the beginning of
--   the sensitive data.
[$sel:start:Range'] :: Range -> Maybe Integer

-- | The number of lines from the beginning of the file to the end of the
--   sensitive data.
[$sel:end:Range'] :: Range -> Maybe Integer

-- | The number of characters, with spaces and starting from 1, from the
--   beginning of the first line that contains the sensitive data (start)
--   to the beginning of the sensitive data.
[$sel:startColumn:Range'] :: Range -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>Range</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:start:Range'</a>, <a>range_start</a> - The number of lines
--   from the beginning of the file to the beginning of the sensitive data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:end:Range'</a>, <a>range_end</a> - The number of lines from
--   the beginning of the file to the end of the sensitive data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startColumn:Range'</a>, <a>range_startColumn</a> - The number
--   of characters, with spaces and starting from 1, from the beginning of
--   the first line that contains the sensitive data (start) to the
--   beginning of the sensitive data.
newRange :: Range

-- | The number of lines from the beginning of the file to the beginning of
--   the sensitive data.
range_start :: Lens' Range (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of lines from the beginning of the file to the end of the
--   sensitive data.
range_end :: Lens' Range (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of characters, with spaces and starting from 1, from the
--   beginning of the first line that contains the sensitive data (start)
--   to the beginning of the sensitive data.
range_startColumn :: Lens' Range (Maybe Integer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Range.Range
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Range.Range
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Range.Range
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Range.Range
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Range.Range
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Range.Range
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Range.Range


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Page

-- | Specifies the location of an occurrence of sensitive data in an Adobe
--   Portable Document Format file.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPage</a> smart constructor.
data Page
Page' :: Maybe Range -> Maybe Range -> Maybe Integer -> Page

-- | Reserved for future use.
[$sel:offsetRange:Page'] :: Page -> Maybe Range

-- | Reserved for future use.
[$sel:lineRange:Page'] :: Page -> Maybe Range

-- | The page number of the page that contains the sensitive data.
[$sel:pageNumber:Page'] :: Page -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>Page</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:offsetRange:Page'</a>, <a>page_offsetRange</a> - Reserved for
--   future use.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lineRange:Page'</a>, <a>page_lineRange</a> - Reserved for
--   future use.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageNumber:Page'</a>, <a>page_pageNumber</a> - The page number
--   of the page that contains the sensitive data.
newPage :: Page

-- | Reserved for future use.
page_offsetRange :: Lens' Page (Maybe Range)

-- | Reserved for future use.
page_lineRange :: Lens' Page (Maybe Range)

-- | The page number of the page that contains the sensitive data.
page_pageNumber :: Lens' Page (Maybe Integer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Page.Page
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Page.Page
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Page.Page
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Page.Page
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Page.Page
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Page.Page
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Page.Page


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Record

-- | Specifies the location of an occurrence of sensitive data in an Apache
--   Avro object container, Apache Parquet file, JSON file, or JSON Lines
--   file.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecord</a> smart constructor.
data Record
Record' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Record

-- | The path, as a JSONPath expression, to the sensitive data. For an Avro
--   object container or Parquet file, this is the path to the field in the
--   record (recordIndex) that contains the data. For a JSON or JSON Lines
--   file, this is the path to the field or array that contains the data.
--   If the data is a value in an array, the path also indicates which
--   value contains the data.
--   
--   If Amazon Macie detects sensitive data in the name of any element in
--   the path, Macie omits this field. If the name of an element exceeds 20
--   characters, Macie truncates the name by removing characters from the
--   beginning of the name. If the resulting full path exceeds 250
--   characters, Macie also truncates the path, starting with the first
--   element in the path, until the path contains 250 or fewer characters.
[$sel:jsonPath:Record'] :: Record -> Maybe Text

-- | For an Avro object container or Parquet file, the record index,
--   starting from 0, for the record that contains the sensitive data. For
--   a JSON Lines file, the line index, starting from 0, for the line that
--   contains the sensitive data. This value is always 0 for JSON files.
[$sel:recordIndex:Record'] :: Record -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>Record</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:jsonPath:Record'</a>, <a>record_jsonPath</a> - The path, as a
--   JSONPath expression, to the sensitive data. For an Avro object
--   container or Parquet file, this is the path to the field in the record
--   (recordIndex) that contains the data. For a JSON or JSON Lines file,
--   this is the path to the field or array that contains the data. If the
--   data is a value in an array, the path also indicates which value
--   contains the data.
--   
--   If Amazon Macie detects sensitive data in the name of any element in
--   the path, Macie omits this field. If the name of an element exceeds 20
--   characters, Macie truncates the name by removing characters from the
--   beginning of the name. If the resulting full path exceeds 250
--   characters, Macie also truncates the path, starting with the first
--   element in the path, until the path contains 250 or fewer characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recordIndex:Record'</a>, <a>record_recordIndex</a> - For an
--   Avro object container or Parquet file, the record index, starting from
--   0, for the record that contains the sensitive data. For a JSON Lines
--   file, the line index, starting from 0, for the line that contains the
--   sensitive data. This value is always 0 for JSON files.
newRecord :: Record

-- | The path, as a JSONPath expression, to the sensitive data. For an Avro
--   object container or Parquet file, this is the path to the field in the
--   record (recordIndex) that contains the data. For a JSON or JSON Lines
--   file, this is the path to the field or array that contains the data.
--   If the data is a value in an array, the path also indicates which
--   value contains the data.
--   
--   If Amazon Macie detects sensitive data in the name of any element in
--   the path, Macie omits this field. If the name of an element exceeds 20
--   characters, Macie truncates the name by removing characters from the
--   beginning of the name. If the resulting full path exceeds 250
--   characters, Macie also truncates the path, starting with the first
--   element in the path, until the path contains 250 or fewer characters.
record_jsonPath :: Lens' Record (Maybe Text)

-- | For an Avro object container or Parquet file, the record index,
--   starting from 0, for the record that contains the sensitive data. For
--   a JSON Lines file, the line index, starting from 0, for the line that
--   contains the sensitive data. This value is always 0 for JSON files.
record_recordIndex :: Lens' Record (Maybe Integer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Record.Record
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Record.Record
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Record.Record
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Record.Record
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Record.Record
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Record.Record
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Record.Record


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Occurrences

-- | Specifies the location of 1-15 occurrences of sensitive data that was
--   detected by a managed data identifier or a custom data identifier and
--   produced a sensitive data finding.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOccurrences</a> smart constructor.
data Occurrences
Occurrences' :: Maybe [Range] -> Maybe [Cell] -> Maybe [Page] -> Maybe [Record] -> Maybe [Range] -> Occurrences

-- | An array of objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in a
--   non-binary text file, such as an HTML, TXT, or XML file. Each Range
--   object specifies a line or inclusive range of lines that contains the
--   sensitive data, and the position of the data on the specified line or
--   lines.
--   
--   This value is often null for file types that are supported by Cell,
--   Page, or Record objects. Exceptions are the location of sensitive data
--   in: unstructured sections of an otherwise structured file, such as a
--   comment in a file; a malformed file that Amazon Macie analyzes as
--   plain text; and, a CSV or TSV file that has any column names that
--   contain sensitive data.
[$sel:lineRanges:Occurrences'] :: Occurrences -> Maybe [Range]

-- | An array of objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in a
--   Microsoft Excel workbook, CSV file, or TSV file. This value is null
--   for all other types of files.
--   
--   Each Cell object specifies a cell or field that contains the sensitive
--   data.
[$sel:cells:Occurrences'] :: Occurrences -> Maybe [Cell]

-- | An array of objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in an
--   Adobe Portable Document Format file. This value is null for all other
--   types of files.
--   
--   Each Page object specifies a page that contains the sensitive data.
[$sel:pages:Occurrences'] :: Occurrences -> Maybe [Page]

-- | An array of objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in an
--   Apache Avro object container, Apache Parquet file, JSON file, or JSON
--   Lines file. This value is null for all other types of files.
--   
--   For an Avro object container or Parquet file, each Record object
--   specifies a record index and the path to a field in a record that
--   contains the sensitive data. For a JSON or JSON Lines file, each
--   Record object specifies the path to a field or array that contains the
--   sensitive data. For a JSON Lines file, it also specifies the index of
--   the line that contains the data.
[$sel:records:Occurrences'] :: Occurrences -> Maybe [Record]

-- | Reserved for future use.
[$sel:offsetRanges:Occurrences'] :: Occurrences -> Maybe [Range]

-- | Create a value of <a>Occurrences</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lineRanges:Occurrences'</a>, <a>occurrences_lineRanges</a> -
--   An array of objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in a
--   non-binary text file, such as an HTML, TXT, or XML file. Each Range
--   object specifies a line or inclusive range of lines that contains the
--   sensitive data, and the position of the data on the specified line or
--   lines.
--   
--   This value is often null for file types that are supported by Cell,
--   Page, or Record objects. Exceptions are the location of sensitive data
--   in: unstructured sections of an otherwise structured file, such as a
--   comment in a file; a malformed file that Amazon Macie analyzes as
--   plain text; and, a CSV or TSV file that has any column names that
--   contain sensitive data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cells:Occurrences'</a>, <a>occurrences_cells</a> - An array of
--   objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in a Microsoft
--   Excel workbook, CSV file, or TSV file. This value is null for all
--   other types of files.
--   
--   Each Cell object specifies a cell or field that contains the sensitive
--   data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pages:Occurrences'</a>, <a>occurrences_pages</a> - An array of
--   objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in an Adobe
--   Portable Document Format file. This value is null for all other types
--   of files.
--   
--   Each Page object specifies a page that contains the sensitive data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:records:Occurrences'</a>, <a>occurrences_records</a> - An
--   array of objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in an
--   Apache Avro object container, Apache Parquet file, JSON file, or JSON
--   Lines file. This value is null for all other types of files.
--   
--   For an Avro object container or Parquet file, each Record object
--   specifies a record index and the path to a field in a record that
--   contains the sensitive data. For a JSON or JSON Lines file, each
--   Record object specifies the path to a field or array that contains the
--   sensitive data. For a JSON Lines file, it also specifies the index of
--   the line that contains the data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:offsetRanges:Occurrences'</a>, <a>occurrences_offsetRanges</a>
--   - Reserved for future use.
newOccurrences :: Occurrences

-- | An array of objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in a
--   non-binary text file, such as an HTML, TXT, or XML file. Each Range
--   object specifies a line or inclusive range of lines that contains the
--   sensitive data, and the position of the data on the specified line or
--   lines.
--   
--   This value is often null for file types that are supported by Cell,
--   Page, or Record objects. Exceptions are the location of sensitive data
--   in: unstructured sections of an otherwise structured file, such as a
--   comment in a file; a malformed file that Amazon Macie analyzes as
--   plain text; and, a CSV or TSV file that has any column names that
--   contain sensitive data.
occurrences_lineRanges :: Lens' Occurrences (Maybe [Range])

-- | An array of objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in a
--   Microsoft Excel workbook, CSV file, or TSV file. This value is null
--   for all other types of files.
--   
--   Each Cell object specifies a cell or field that contains the sensitive
--   data.
occurrences_cells :: Lens' Occurrences (Maybe [Cell])

-- | An array of objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in an
--   Adobe Portable Document Format file. This value is null for all other
--   types of files.
--   
--   Each Page object specifies a page that contains the sensitive data.
occurrences_pages :: Lens' Occurrences (Maybe [Page])

-- | An array of objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in an
--   Apache Avro object container, Apache Parquet file, JSON file, or JSON
--   Lines file. This value is null for all other types of files.
--   
--   For an Avro object container or Parquet file, each Record object
--   specifies a record index and the path to a field in a record that
--   contains the sensitive data. For a JSON or JSON Lines file, each
--   Record object specifies the path to a field or array that contains the
--   sensitive data. For a JSON Lines file, it also specifies the index of
--   the line that contains the data.
occurrences_records :: Lens' Occurrences (Maybe [Record])

-- | Reserved for future use.
occurrences_offsetRanges :: Lens' Occurrences (Maybe [Range])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Occurrences.Occurrences
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Occurrences.Occurrences
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Occurrences.Occurrences
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Occurrences.Occurrences
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Occurrences.Occurrences
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Occurrences.Occurrences
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Occurrences.Occurrences


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.DefaultDetection

-- | Provides information about a type of sensitive data that was detected
--   by a managed data identifier and produced a sensitive data finding.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDefaultDetection</a> smart constructor.
data DefaultDetection
DefaultDetection' :: Maybe Occurrences -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> DefaultDetection

-- | The location of 1-15 occurrences of the sensitive data that was
--   detected. A finding includes location data for a maximum of 15
--   occurrences of sensitive data.
[$sel:occurrences:DefaultDetection'] :: DefaultDetection -> Maybe Occurrences

-- | The total number of occurrences of the type of sensitive data that was
--   detected.
[$sel:count:DefaultDetection'] :: DefaultDetection -> Maybe Integer

-- | The type of sensitive data that was detected. For example,
--   AWS_CREDENTIALS, PHONE_NUMBER, or ADDRESS.
[$sel:type':DefaultDetection'] :: DefaultDetection -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DefaultDetection</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:occurrences:DefaultDetection'</a>,
--   <a>defaultDetection_occurrences</a> - The location of 1-15 occurrences
--   of the sensitive data that was detected. A finding includes location
--   data for a maximum of 15 occurrences of sensitive data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:count:DefaultDetection'</a>, <a>defaultDetection_count</a> -
--   The total number of occurrences of the type of sensitive data that was
--   detected.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':DefaultDetection'</a>, <a>defaultDetection_type</a> -
--   The type of sensitive data that was detected. For example,
--   AWS_CREDENTIALS, PHONE_NUMBER, or ADDRESS.
newDefaultDetection :: DefaultDetection

-- | The location of 1-15 occurrences of the sensitive data that was
--   detected. A finding includes location data for a maximum of 15
--   occurrences of sensitive data.
defaultDetection_occurrences :: Lens' DefaultDetection (Maybe Occurrences)

-- | The total number of occurrences of the type of sensitive data that was
--   detected.
defaultDetection_count :: Lens' DefaultDetection (Maybe Integer)

-- | The type of sensitive data that was detected. For example,
--   AWS_CREDENTIALS, PHONE_NUMBER, or ADDRESS.
defaultDetection_type :: Lens' DefaultDetection (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.DefaultDetection.DefaultDetection
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.DefaultDetection.DefaultDetection
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.DefaultDetection.DefaultDetection
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.DefaultDetection.DefaultDetection
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.DefaultDetection.DefaultDetection
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.DefaultDetection.DefaultDetection
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.DefaultDetection.DefaultDetection


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CustomDetection

-- | Provides information about a custom data identifier that produced a
--   sensitive data finding, and the sensitive data that it detected for
--   the finding.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCustomDetection</a> smart constructor.
data CustomDetection
CustomDetection' :: Maybe Occurrences -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> CustomDetection

-- | The location of 1-15 occurrences of the sensitive data that the custom
--   data identifier detected. A finding includes location data for a
--   maximum of 15 occurrences of sensitive data.
[$sel:occurrences:CustomDetection'] :: CustomDetection -> Maybe Occurrences

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom data identifier.
[$sel:arn:CustomDetection'] :: CustomDetection -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of occurrences of the sensitive data that the custom
--   data identifier detected.
[$sel:count:CustomDetection'] :: CustomDetection -> Maybe Integer

-- | The name of the custom data identifier.
[$sel:name:CustomDetection'] :: CustomDetection -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CustomDetection</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:occurrences:CustomDetection'</a>,
--   <a>customDetection_occurrences</a> - The location of 1-15 occurrences
--   of the sensitive data that the custom data identifier detected. A
--   finding includes location data for a maximum of 15 occurrences of
--   sensitive data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:CustomDetection'</a>, <a>customDetection_arn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom data identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:count:CustomDetection'</a>, <a>customDetection_count</a> - The
--   total number of occurrences of the sensitive data that the custom data
--   identifier detected.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CustomDetection'</a>, <a>customDetection_name</a> - The
--   name of the custom data identifier.
newCustomDetection :: CustomDetection

-- | The location of 1-15 occurrences of the sensitive data that the custom
--   data identifier detected. A finding includes location data for a
--   maximum of 15 occurrences of sensitive data.
customDetection_occurrences :: Lens' CustomDetection (Maybe Occurrences)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom data identifier.
customDetection_arn :: Lens' CustomDetection (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of occurrences of the sensitive data that the custom
--   data identifier detected.
customDetection_count :: Lens' CustomDetection (Maybe Integer)

-- | The name of the custom data identifier.
customDetection_name :: Lens' CustomDetection (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CustomDetection.CustomDetection
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CustomDetection.CustomDetection
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CustomDetection.CustomDetection
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CustomDetection.CustomDetection
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CustomDetection.CustomDetection
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CustomDetection.CustomDetection
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CustomDetection.CustomDetection


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CustomDataIdentifiers

-- | Provides information about custom data identifiers that produced a
--   sensitive data finding, and the number of occurrences of the data that
--   they detected for the finding.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCustomDataIdentifiers</a> smart constructor.
data CustomDataIdentifiers
CustomDataIdentifiers' :: Maybe [CustomDetection] -> Maybe Integer -> CustomDataIdentifiers

-- | The custom data identifiers that detected the data, and the number of
--   occurrences of the data that each identifier detected.
[$sel:detections:CustomDataIdentifiers'] :: CustomDataIdentifiers -> Maybe [CustomDetection]

-- | The total number of occurrences of the data that was detected by the
--   custom data identifiers and produced the finding.
[$sel:totalCount:CustomDataIdentifiers'] :: CustomDataIdentifiers -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>CustomDataIdentifiers</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:detections:CustomDataIdentifiers'</a>,
--   <a>customDataIdentifiers_detections</a> - The custom data identifiers
--   that detected the data, and the number of occurrences of the data that
--   each identifier detected.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalCount:CustomDataIdentifiers'</a>,
--   <a>customDataIdentifiers_totalCount</a> - The total number of
--   occurrences of the data that was detected by the custom data
--   identifiers and produced the finding.
newCustomDataIdentifiers :: CustomDataIdentifiers

-- | The custom data identifiers that detected the data, and the number of
--   occurrences of the data that each identifier detected.
customDataIdentifiers_detections :: Lens' CustomDataIdentifiers (Maybe [CustomDetection])

-- | The total number of occurrences of the data that was detected by the
--   custom data identifiers and produced the finding.
customDataIdentifiers_totalCount :: Lens' CustomDataIdentifiers (Maybe Integer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CustomDataIdentifiers.CustomDataIdentifiers
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CustomDataIdentifiers.CustomDataIdentifiers
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CustomDataIdentifiers.CustomDataIdentifiers

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CustomDataIdentifiers.CustomDataIdentifiers


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.RelationshipStatus

-- | The current status of the relationship between an account and an
--   associated Amazon Macie administrator account (<i>inviter
--   account</i>). Possible values are:
newtype RelationshipStatus
RelationshipStatus' :: Text -> RelationshipStatus
[fromRelationshipStatus] :: RelationshipStatus -> Text
pattern RelationshipStatus_AccountSuspended :: RelationshipStatus
pattern RelationshipStatus_Created :: RelationshipStatus
pattern RelationshipStatus_EmailVerificationFailed :: RelationshipStatus
pattern RelationshipStatus_EmailVerificationInProgress :: RelationshipStatus
pattern RelationshipStatus_Enabled :: RelationshipStatus
pattern RelationshipStatus_Invited :: RelationshipStatus
pattern RelationshipStatus_Paused :: RelationshipStatus
pattern RelationshipStatus_RegionDisabled :: RelationshipStatus
pattern RelationshipStatus_Removed :: RelationshipStatus
pattern RelationshipStatus_Resigned :: RelationshipStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.XML.ToXML Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.RelationshipStatus.RelationshipStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.XML.FromXML Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.RelationshipStatus.RelationshipStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.RelationshipStatus.RelationshipStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.RelationshipStatus.RelationshipStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.RelationshipStatus.RelationshipStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.RelationshipStatus.RelationshipStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.Query.ToQuery Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.RelationshipStatus.RelationshipStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.Headers.ToHeader Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.RelationshipStatus.RelationshipStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.Log.ToLog Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.RelationshipStatus.RelationshipStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.RelationshipStatus.RelationshipStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.Text.ToText Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.RelationshipStatus.RelationshipStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.Text.FromText Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.RelationshipStatus.RelationshipStatus
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.RelationshipStatus.RelationshipStatus
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.RelationshipStatus.RelationshipStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.RelationshipStatus.RelationshipStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.RelationshipStatus.RelationshipStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.RelationshipStatus.RelationshipStatus
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.RelationshipStatus.RelationshipStatus
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.RelationshipStatus.RelationshipStatus


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Member

-- | Provides information about an account that's associated with an Amazon
--   Macie administrator account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMember</a> smart constructor.
data Member
Member' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RelationshipStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Member

-- | The email address for the account.
[$sel:email:Member'] :: Member -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID for the administrator account.
[$sel:administratorAccountId:Member'] :: Member -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the account.
[$sel:arn:Member'] :: Member -> Maybe Text

-- | The current status of the relationship between the account and the
--   administrator account.
[$sel:relationshipStatus:Member'] :: Member -> Maybe RelationshipStatus

-- | (Deprecated) The Amazon Web Services account ID for the administrator
--   account. This property has been replaced by the administratorAccountId
--   property and is retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:masterAccountId:Member'] :: Member -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when an Amazon
--   Macie membership invitation was last sent to the account. This value
--   is null if a Macie invitation hasn't been sent to the account.
[$sel:invitedAt:Member'] :: Member -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID for the account.
[$sel:accountId:Member'] :: Member -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, of the most
--   recent change to the status of the relationship between the account
--   and the administrator account.
[$sel:updatedAt:Member'] :: Member -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags (keys and values)
--   that are associated with the account in Amazon Macie.
[$sel:tags:Member'] :: Member -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>Member</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:email:Member'</a>, <a>member_email</a> - The email address for
--   the account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:administratorAccountId:Member'</a>,
--   <a>member_administratorAccountId</a> - The Amazon Web Services account
--   ID for the administrator account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Member'</a>, <a>member_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:relationshipStatus:Member'</a>,
--   <a>member_relationshipStatus</a> - The current status of the
--   relationship between the account and the administrator account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:masterAccountId:Member'</a>, <a>member_masterAccountId</a> -
--   (Deprecated) The Amazon Web Services account ID for the administrator
--   account. This property has been replaced by the administratorAccountId
--   property and is retained only for backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:invitedAt:Member'</a>, <a>member_invitedAt</a> - The date and
--   time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when an Amazon Macie
--   membership invitation was last sent to the account. This value is null
--   if a Macie invitation hasn't been sent to the account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:Member'</a>, <a>member_accountId</a> - The Amazon
--   Web Services account ID for the account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:updatedAt:Member'</a>, <a>member_updatedAt</a> - The date and
--   time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, of the most recent change
--   to the status of the relationship between the account and the
--   administrator account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Member'</a>, <a>member_tags</a> - A map of key-value
--   pairs that identifies the tags (keys and values) that are associated
--   with the account in Amazon Macie.
newMember :: Member

-- | The email address for the account.
member_email :: Lens' Member (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID for the administrator account.
member_administratorAccountId :: Lens' Member (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the account.
member_arn :: Lens' Member (Maybe Text)

-- | The current status of the relationship between the account and the
--   administrator account.
member_relationshipStatus :: Lens' Member (Maybe RelationshipStatus)

-- | (Deprecated) The Amazon Web Services account ID for the administrator
--   account. This property has been replaced by the administratorAccountId
--   property and is retained only for backward compatibility.
member_masterAccountId :: Lens' Member (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when an Amazon
--   Macie membership invitation was last sent to the account. This value
--   is null if a Macie invitation hasn't been sent to the account.
member_invitedAt :: Lens' Member (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID for the account.
member_accountId :: Lens' Member (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, of the most
--   recent change to the status of the relationship between the account
--   and the administrator account.
member_updatedAt :: Lens' Member (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags (keys and values)
--   that are associated with the account in Amazon Macie.
member_tags :: Lens' Member (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Member.Member
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Member.Member
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Member.Member
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Member.Member
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Member.Member
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Member.Member
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Member.Member


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Invitation

-- | Provides information about an Amazon Macie membership invitation that
--   was received by an account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInvitation</a> smart constructor.
data Invitation
Invitation' :: Maybe RelationshipStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Invitation

-- | The status of the relationship between the account that sent the
--   invitation (<i>inviter account</i>) and the account that received the
--   invitation (<i>invitee account</i>).
[$sel:relationshipStatus:Invitation'] :: Invitation -> Maybe RelationshipStatus

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the
--   invitation was sent.
[$sel:invitedAt:Invitation'] :: Invitation -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The unique identifier for the invitation. Amazon Macie uses this
--   identifier to validate the inviter account with the invitee account.
[$sel:invitationId:Invitation'] :: Invitation -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID for the account that sent the
--   invitation.
[$sel:accountId:Invitation'] :: Invitation -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Invitation</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:relationshipStatus:Invitation'</a>,
--   <a>invitation_relationshipStatus</a> - The status of the relationship
--   between the account that sent the invitation (<i>inviter account</i>)
--   and the account that received the invitation (<i>invitee account</i>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:invitedAt:Invitation'</a>, <a>invitation_invitedAt</a> - The
--   date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the
--   invitation was sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:invitationId:Invitation'</a>, <a>invitation_invitationId</a> -
--   The unique identifier for the invitation. Amazon Macie uses this
--   identifier to validate the inviter account with the invitee account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:Invitation'</a>, <a>invitation_accountId</a> - The
--   Amazon Web Services account ID for the account that sent the
--   invitation.
newInvitation :: Invitation

-- | The status of the relationship between the account that sent the
--   invitation (<i>inviter account</i>) and the account that received the
--   invitation (<i>invitee account</i>).
invitation_relationshipStatus :: Lens' Invitation (Maybe RelationshipStatus)

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the
--   invitation was sent.
invitation_invitedAt :: Lens' Invitation (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The unique identifier for the invitation. Amazon Macie uses this
--   identifier to validate the inviter account with the invitee account.
invitation_invitationId :: Lens' Invitation (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID for the account that sent the
--   invitation.
invitation_accountId :: Lens' Invitation (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Invitation.Invitation
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Invitation.Invitation
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Invitation.Invitation
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Invitation.Invitation
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Invitation.Invitation
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Invitation.Invitation
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Invitation.Invitation


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ReplicationDetails

-- | Provides information about settings that define whether one or more
--   objects in an S3 bucket are replicated to S3 buckets for other Amazon
--   Web Services accounts and, if so, which accounts.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReplicationDetails</a> smart constructor.
data ReplicationDetails
ReplicationDetails' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Bool -> ReplicationDetails

-- | Specifies whether the bucket is configured to replicate one or more
--   objects to any destination.
[$sel:replicated:ReplicationDetails'] :: ReplicationDetails -> Maybe Bool

-- | An array of Amazon Web Services account IDs, one for each Amazon Web
--   Services account that the bucket is configured to replicate one or
--   more objects to.
[$sel:replicationAccounts:ReplicationDetails'] :: ReplicationDetails -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Specifies whether the bucket is configured to replicate one or more
--   objects to an Amazon Web Services account that isn't part of the same
--   Amazon Macie organization.
[$sel:replicatedExternally:ReplicationDetails'] :: ReplicationDetails -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>ReplicationDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicated:ReplicationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>replicationDetails_replicated</a> - Specifies whether the bucket is
--   configured to replicate one or more objects to any destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationAccounts:ReplicationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>replicationDetails_replicationAccounts</a> - An array of Amazon Web
--   Services account IDs, one for each Amazon Web Services account that
--   the bucket is configured to replicate one or more objects to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicatedExternally:ReplicationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>replicationDetails_replicatedExternally</a> - Specifies whether the
--   bucket is configured to replicate one or more objects to an Amazon Web
--   Services account that isn't part of the same Amazon Macie
--   organization.
newReplicationDetails :: ReplicationDetails

-- | Specifies whether the bucket is configured to replicate one or more
--   objects to any destination.
replicationDetails_replicated :: Lens' ReplicationDetails (Maybe Bool)

-- | An array of Amazon Web Services account IDs, one for each Amazon Web
--   Services account that the bucket is configured to replicate one or
--   more objects to.
replicationDetails_replicationAccounts :: Lens' ReplicationDetails (Maybe [Text])

-- | Specifies whether the bucket is configured to replicate one or more
--   objects to an Amazon Web Services account that isn't part of the same
--   Amazon Macie organization.
replicationDetails_replicatedExternally :: Lens' ReplicationDetails (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ReplicationDetails.ReplicationDetails
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ReplicationDetails.ReplicationDetails
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ReplicationDetails.ReplicationDetails
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ReplicationDetails.ReplicationDetails
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ReplicationDetails.ReplicationDetails
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ReplicationDetails.ReplicationDetails
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ReplicationDetails.ReplicationDetails

--   names of the buckets.

--

--

--   that owns the bucket.

instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3BucketOwner.S3BucketOwner
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3BucketOwner.S3BucketOwner

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3BucketOwner.S3BucketOwner


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3Destination

-- | Specifies an S3 bucket to store data classification results in, and
--   the encryption settings to use when storing results in that bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3Destination</a> smart constructor.
data S3Destination
S3Destination' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> S3Destination

-- | The path prefix to use in the path to the location in the bucket. This
--   prefix specifies where to store classification results in the bucket.
[$sel:keyPrefix:S3Destination'] :: S3Destination -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the bucket.
[$sel:bucketName:S3Destination'] :: S3Destination -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the KMS key to use for encryption of
--   the results. This must be the ARN of an existing, symmetric, customer
--   managed KMS key that's in the same Amazon Web Services Region as the
--   bucket.
[$sel:kmsKeyArn:S3Destination'] :: S3Destination -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>S3Destination</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyPrefix:S3Destination'</a>, <a>s3Destination_keyPrefix</a> -
--   The path prefix to use in the path to the location in the bucket. This
--   prefix specifies where to store classification results in the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:S3Destination'</a>, <a>s3Destination_bucketName</a>
--   - The name of the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyArn:S3Destination'</a>, <a>s3Destination_kmsKeyArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the KMS key to use for encryption of
--   the results. This must be the ARN of an existing, symmetric, customer
--   managed KMS key that's in the same Amazon Web Services Region as the
--   bucket.
newS3Destination :: Text -> Text -> S3Destination

-- | The path prefix to use in the path to the location in the bucket. This
--   prefix specifies where to store classification results in the bucket.
s3Destination_keyPrefix :: Lens' S3Destination (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the bucket.
s3Destination_bucketName :: Lens' S3Destination Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the KMS key to use for encryption of
--   the results. This must be the ARN of an existing, symmetric, customer
--   managed KMS key that's in the same Amazon Web Services Region as the
--   bucket.
s3Destination_kmsKeyArn :: Lens' S3Destination Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3Destination.S3Destination
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3Destination.S3Destination
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3Destination.S3Destination
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3Destination.S3Destination
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3Destination.S3Destination
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3Destination.S3Destination
