module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion

-- | Specifies a property-based filter condition that determines which
--   Amazon Web Services resources are included or excluded from the query
--   results.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSearchResourcesSimpleCriterion</a> smart
--   constructor.
data SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion
SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe SearchResourcesSimpleCriterionKey -> Maybe SearchResourcesComparator -> SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion

-- | An array that lists one or more values to use in the condition. If you
--   specify multiple values, Amazon Macie uses OR logic to join the
--   values. Valid values for each supported property (key) are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_ID - A string that represents the unique identifier for
--   the Amazon Web Services account that owns the resource.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_EFFECTIVE_PERMISSION - A string that represents an
--   enumerated value that Macie defines for the
--   <a>BucketPublicAccess.effectivePermission</a> property of an S3
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_NAME - A string that represents the name of an S3
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_SHARED_ACCESS - A string that represents an enumerated
--   value that Macie defines for the <a>BucketMetadata.sharedAccess</a>
--   property of an S3 bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Values are case sensitive. Also, Macie doesn't support use of partial
--   values or wildcard characters in values.
[$sel:values:SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion'] :: SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The property to use in the condition.
[$sel:key:SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion'] :: SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion -> Maybe SearchResourcesSimpleCriterionKey

-- | The operator to use in the condition. Valid values are EQ (equals) and
--   NE (not equals).
[$sel:comparator:SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion'] :: SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion -> Maybe SearchResourcesComparator

-- | Create a value of <a>SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion'</a>,
--   <a>searchResourcesSimpleCriterion_values</a> - An array that lists one
--   or more values to use in the condition. If you specify multiple
--   values, Amazon Macie uses OR logic to join the values. Valid values
--   for each supported property (key) are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_ID - A string that represents the unique identifier for
--   the Amazon Web Services account that owns the resource.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_EFFECTIVE_PERMISSION - A string that represents an
--   enumerated value that Macie defines for the
--   <a>BucketPublicAccess.effectivePermission</a> property of an S3
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_NAME - A string that represents the name of an S3
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_SHARED_ACCESS - A string that represents an enumerated
--   value that Macie defines for the <a>BucketMetadata.sharedAccess</a>
--   property of an S3 bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Values are case sensitive. Also, Macie doesn't support use of partial
--   values or wildcard characters in values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion'</a>,
--   <a>searchResourcesSimpleCriterion_key</a> - The property to use in the
--   condition.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comparator:SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion'</a>,
--   <a>searchResourcesSimpleCriterion_comparator</a> - The operator to use
--   in the condition. Valid values are EQ (equals) and NE (not equals).
newSearchResourcesSimpleCriterion :: SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion

-- | An array that lists one or more values to use in the condition. If you
--   specify multiple values, Amazon Macie uses OR logic to join the
--   values. Valid values for each supported property (key) are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_ID - A string that represents the unique identifier for
--   the Amazon Web Services account that owns the resource.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_EFFECTIVE_PERMISSION - A string that represents an
--   enumerated value that Macie defines for the
--   <a>BucketPublicAccess.effectivePermission</a> property of an S3
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_NAME - A string that represents the name of an S3
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_SHARED_ACCESS - A string that represents an enumerated
--   value that Macie defines for the <a>BucketMetadata.sharedAccess</a>
--   property of an S3 bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Values are case sensitive. Also, Macie doesn't support use of partial
--   values or wildcard characters in values.
searchResourcesSimpleCriterion_values :: Lens' SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion (Maybe [Text])

-- | The property to use in the condition.
searchResourcesSimpleCriterion_key :: Lens' SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion (Maybe SearchResourcesSimpleCriterionKey)

-- | The operator to use in the condition. Valid values are EQ (equals) and
--   NE (not equals).
searchResourcesSimpleCriterion_comparator :: Lens' SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion (Maybe SearchResourcesComparator)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion.SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion.SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion.SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion.SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion.SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SearchResourcesSortCriteria

-- | Specifies criteria for sorting the results of a query for information
--   about Amazon Web Services resources that Amazon Macie monitors and
--   analyzes.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSearchResourcesSortCriteria</a> smart constructor.
data SearchResourcesSortCriteria

-- | The sort order to apply to the results, based on the value for the
--   property specified by the attributeName property. Valid values are:
--   ASC, sort the results in ascending order; and, DESC, sort the results
--   in descending order.
[$sel:orderBy:SearchResourcesSortCriteria'] :: SearchResourcesSortCriteria -> Maybe OrderBy

-- | Create a value of <a>SearchResourcesSortCriteria</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   to the results, based on the value for the property specified by the
--   attributeName property. Valid values are: ASC, sort the results in
--   ascending order; and, DESC, sort the results in descending order.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeName:SearchResourcesSortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>searchResourcesSortCriteria_attributeName</a> - The property to
--   sort the results by.
newSearchResourcesSortCriteria :: SearchResourcesSortCriteria

-- | The sort order to apply to the results, based on the value for the
--   property specified by the attributeName property. Valid values are:
--   ASC, sort the results in ascending order; and, DESC, sort the results
--   in descending order.

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SearchResourcesTagCriterionPair

--   to use in a tag-based filter condition for a query. Tag keys and
--   values are case sensitive. Also, Amazon Macie doesn't support use of
--   partial values or wildcard characters in tag-based filter conditions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSearchResourcesTagCriterionPair</a> smart
--   constructor.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   the condition.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:SearchResourcesTagCriterionPair'</a>,
--   <a>searchResourcesTagCriterionPair_key</a> - The value for the tag key
--   to use in the condition.

-- | The value for the tag key to use in the condition.

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SearchResourcesCriteria

--   resources from the results.

--   or more values for including or excluding resources from the results.

--   condition that defines a property, operator, and one or more values
--   for including or excluding resources from the results.

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SearchResourcesCriteriaBlock

-- | Specifies property- and tag-based conditions that define filter
--   criteria for including or excluding Amazon Web Services resources from
--   the query results.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSearchResourcesCriteriaBlock</a> smart constructor.
data SearchResourcesCriteriaBlock
SearchResourcesCriteriaBlock' :: Maybe [SearchResourcesCriteria] -> SearchResourcesCriteriaBlock

-- | An array of objects, one for each property- or tag-based condition
--   that includes or excludes resources from the query results. If you
--   specify more than one condition, Amazon Macie uses AND logic to join
--   the conditions.
[$sel:and:SearchResourcesCriteriaBlock'] :: SearchResourcesCriteriaBlock -> Maybe [SearchResourcesCriteria]

-- | Create a value of <a>SearchResourcesCriteriaBlock</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   each property- or tag-based condition that includes or excludes
--   resources from the query results. If you specify more than one
--   condition, Amazon Macie uses AND logic to join the conditions.
newSearchResourcesCriteriaBlock :: SearchResourcesCriteriaBlock

-- | An array of objects, one for each property- or tag-based condition
--   that includes or excludes resources from the query results. If you
--   specify more than one condition, Amazon Macie uses AND logic to join
--   the conditions.
searchResourcesCriteriaBlock_and :: Lens' SearchResourcesCriteriaBlock (Maybe [SearchResourcesCriteria])

instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SearchResourcesCriteriaBlock.SearchResourcesCriteriaBlock

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SearchResourcesBucketCriteria

-- | Specifies property- and tag-based conditions that define filter
--   criteria for including or excluding S3 buckets from the query results.
--   Exclude conditions take precedence over include conditions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSearchResourcesBucketCriteria</a> smart constructor.
data SearchResourcesBucketCriteria
SearchResourcesBucketCriteria' :: Maybe SearchResourcesCriteriaBlock -> Maybe SearchResourcesCriteriaBlock -> SearchResourcesBucketCriteria

--   include in the results.

--   exclude from the results.

--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>searchResourcesBucketCriteria_includes</a> - The property- and
--   tag-based conditions that determine which buckets to include in the
--   results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:excludes:SearchResourcesBucketCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>searchResourcesBucketCriteria_excludes</a> - The property- and
--   tag-based conditions that determine which buckets to exclude from the
--   results.
newSearchResourcesBucketCriteria :: SearchResourcesBucketCriteria

-- | The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which buckets to
--   include in the results.
searchResourcesBucketCriteria_includes :: Lens' SearchResourcesBucketCriteria (Maybe SearchResourcesCriteriaBlock)

-- | The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which buckets to
--   exclude from the results.
searchResourcesBucketCriteria_excludes :: Lens' SearchResourcesBucketCriteria (Maybe SearchResourcesCriteriaBlock)

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SecurityHubConfiguration

-- | Specifies configuration settings that determine which findings are
--   published to Security Hub automatically. For information about how
--   Macie publishes findings to Security Hub, see <a>Amazon Macie
--   integration with Security Hub</a> in the <i>Amazon Macie User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSecurityHubConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data SecurityHubConfiguration
SecurityHubConfiguration' :: Bool -> Bool -> SecurityHubConfiguration

-- | Specifies whether to publish policy findings to Security Hub. If you
--   set this value to true, Amazon Macie automatically publishes all new
--   and updated policy findings that weren't suppressed by a findings
--   filter. The default value is true.
[$sel:publishPolicyFindings:SecurityHubConfiguration'] :: SecurityHubConfiguration -> Bool

-- | Specifies whether to publish sensitive data findings to Security Hub.
--   If you set this value to true, Amazon Macie automatically publishes
--   all sensitive data findings that weren't suppressed by a findings
--   filter. The default value is false.
[$sel:publishClassificationFindings:SecurityHubConfiguration'] :: SecurityHubConfiguration -> Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>SecurityHubConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:publishPolicyFindings:SecurityHubConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>securityHubConfiguration_publishPolicyFindings</a> - Specifies
--   whether to publish policy findings to Security Hub. If you set this
--   value to true, Amazon Macie automatically publishes all new and
--   updated policy findings that weren't suppressed by a findings filter.
--   The default value is true.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publishClassificationFindings:SecurityHubConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>securityHubConfiguration_publishClassificationFindings</a> -
--   Specifies whether to publish sensitive data findings to Security Hub.
--   If you set this value to true, Amazon Macie automatically publishes
--   all sensitive data findings that weren't suppressed by a findings
--   filter. The default value is false.
newSecurityHubConfiguration :: Bool -> Bool -> SecurityHubConfiguration

-- | Specifies whether to publish policy findings to Security Hub. If you
--   set this value to true, Amazon Macie automatically publishes all new
--   and updated policy findings that weren't suppressed by a findings
--   filter. The default value is true.
securityHubConfiguration_publishPolicyFindings :: Lens' SecurityHubConfiguration Bool

-- | Specifies whether to publish sensitive data findings to Security Hub.
--   If you set this value to true, Amazon Macie automatically publishes
--   all sensitive data findings that weren't suppressed by a findings
--   filter. The default value is false.
securityHubConfiguration_publishClassificationFindings :: Lens' SecurityHubConfiguration Bool
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SecurityHubConfiguration.SecurityHubConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SecurityHubConfiguration.SecurityHubConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SecurityHubConfiguration.SecurityHubConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SecurityHubConfiguration.SecurityHubConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SecurityHubConfiguration.SecurityHubConfiguration

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SensitiveDataItem

-- | Provides information about the category, types, and occurrences of
--   sensitive data that produced a sensitive data finding.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSensitiveDataItem</a> smart constructor.
data SensitiveDataItem
SensitiveDataItem' :: Maybe [DefaultDetection] -> Maybe SensitiveDataItemCategory -> Maybe Integer -> SensitiveDataItem

-- | An array of objects, one for each type of sensitive data that was
--   detected. Each object reports the number of occurrences of a specific
--   type of sensitive data that was detected, and the location of up to 15
--   of those occurrences.
[$sel:detections:SensitiveDataItem'] :: SensitiveDataItem -> Maybe [DefaultDetection]

-- | The category of sensitive data that was detected. For example:
--   CREDENTIALS, for credentials data such as private keys or Amazon Web
--   Services secret keys; FINANCIAL_INFORMATION, for financial data such
--   as credit card numbers; or, PERSONAL_INFORMATION, for personal health
--   information, such as health insurance identification numbers, or
--   personally identifiable information, such as passport numbers.
[$sel:category:SensitiveDataItem'] :: SensitiveDataItem -> Maybe SensitiveDataItemCategory

-- | The total number of occurrences of the sensitive data that was
--   detected.
[$sel:totalCount:SensitiveDataItem'] :: SensitiveDataItem -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>SensitiveDataItem</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:detections:SensitiveDataItem'</a>,
--   <a>sensitiveDataItem_detections</a> - An array of objects, one for
--   each type of sensitive data that was detected. Each object reports the
--   number of occurrences of a specific type of sensitive data that was
--   detected, and the location of up to 15 of those occurrences.
--   
--   <a>$sel:category:SensitiveDataItem'</a>,
--   <a>sensitiveDataItem_category</a> - The category of sensitive data
--   that was detected. For example: CREDENTIALS, for credentials data such
--   as private keys or Amazon Web Services secret keys;
--   FINANCIAL_INFORMATION, for financial data such as credit card numbers;
--   or, PERSONAL_INFORMATION, for personal health information, such as
--   health insurance identification numbers, or personally identifiable
--   information, such as passport numbers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalCount:SensitiveDataItem'</a>,
--   <a>sensitiveDataItem_totalCount</a> - The total number of occurrences
--   of the sensitive data that was detected.
newSensitiveDataItem :: SensitiveDataItem

-- | An array of objects, one for each type of sensitive data that was
--   detected. Each object reports the number of occurrences of a specific
--   type of sensitive data that was detected, and the location of up to 15
--   of those occurrences.
sensitiveDataItem_detections :: Lens' SensitiveDataItem (Maybe [DefaultDetection])

-- | The category of sensitive data that was detected. For example:
--   CREDENTIALS, for credentials data such as private keys or Amazon Web
--   Services secret keys; FINANCIAL_INFORMATION, for financial data such
--   as credit card numbers; or, PERSONAL_INFORMATION, for personal health
--   information, such as health insurance identification numbers, or
--   personally identifiable information, such as passport numbers.
sensitiveDataItem_category :: Lens' SensitiveDataItem (Maybe SensitiveDataItemCategory)

-- | The total number of occurrences of the sensitive data that was
--   detected.
sensitiveDataItem_totalCount :: Lens' SensitiveDataItem (Maybe Integer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SensitiveDataItem.SensitiveDataItem
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SensitiveDataItem.SensitiveDataItem
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SensitiveDataItem.SensitiveDataItem
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SensitiveDataItem.SensitiveDataItem
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SensitiveDataItem.SensitiveDataItem
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SensitiveDataItem.SensitiveDataItem
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SensitiveDataItem.SensitiveDataItem


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ClassificationResult

-- | Provides the details of a sensitive data finding, including the types,
--   number of occurrences, and locations of the sensitive data that was
--   detected.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClassificationResult</a> smart constructor.
data ClassificationResult
ClassificationResult' :: Maybe [SensitiveDataItem] -> Maybe ClassificationResultStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe CustomDataIdentifiers -> ClassificationResult

-- | The category, types, and number of occurrences of the sensitive data
--   that produced the finding.
[$sel:sensitiveData:ClassificationResult'] :: ClassificationResult -> Maybe [SensitiveDataItem]

-- | The status of the finding.
[$sel:status:ClassificationResult'] :: ClassificationResult -> Maybe ClassificationResultStatus

-- | The type of content, as a MIME type, that the finding applies to. For
--   example, application/gzip, for a GNU Gzip compressed archive file, or
--   application/pdf, for an Adobe Portable Document Format file.
[$sel:mimeType:ClassificationResult'] :: ClassificationResult -> Maybe Text

-- | The total size, in bytes, of the data that the finding applies to.
[$sel:sizeClassified:ClassificationResult'] :: ClassificationResult -> Maybe Integer

-- | Specifies whether Amazon Macie detected additional occurrences of
--   sensitive data in the S3 object. A finding includes location data for
--   a maximum of 15 occurrences of sensitive data.
--   
--   This value can help you determine whether to investigate additional
--   occurrences of sensitive data in an object. You can do this by
--   referring to the corresponding sensitive data discovery result for the
--   finding (ClassificationDetails.detailedResultsLocation).
[$sel:additionalOccurrences:ClassificationResult'] :: ClassificationResult -> Maybe Bool

-- | The custom data identifiers that detected the sensitive data and the
--   number of occurrences of the data that they detected.
[$sel:customDataIdentifiers:ClassificationResult'] :: ClassificationResult -> Maybe CustomDataIdentifiers

-- | Create a value of <a>ClassificationResult</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sensitiveData:ClassificationResult'</a>,
--   <a>classificationResult_sensitiveData</a> - The category, types, and
--   number of occurrences of the sensitive data that produced the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ClassificationResult'</a>,
--   <a>classificationResult_status</a> - The status of the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mimeType:ClassificationResult'</a>,
--   <a>classificationResult_mimeType</a> - The type of content, as a MIME
--   type, that the finding applies to. For example, application/gzip, for
--   a GNU Gzip compressed archive file, or application/pdf, for an Adobe
--   Portable Document Format file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeClassified:ClassificationResult'</a>,
--   <a>classificationResult_sizeClassified</a> - The total size, in bytes,
--   of the data that the finding applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalOccurrences:ClassificationResult'</a>,
--   <a>classificationResult_additionalOccurrences</a> - Specifies whether
--   Amazon Macie detected additional occurrences of sensitive data in the
--   S3 object. A finding includes location data for a maximum of 15
--   occurrences of sensitive data.
--   
--   This value can help you determine whether to investigate additional
--   occurrences of sensitive data in an object. You can do this by
--   referring to the corresponding sensitive data discovery result for the
--   finding (ClassificationDetails.detailedResultsLocation).
--   
--   <a>$sel:customDataIdentifiers:ClassificationResult'</a>,
--   <a>classificationResult_customDataIdentifiers</a> - The custom data
--   identifiers that detected the sensitive data and the number of
--   occurrences of the data that they detected.
newClassificationResult :: ClassificationResult

-- | The category, types, and number of occurrences of the sensitive data
--   that produced the finding.
classificationResult_sensitiveData :: Lens' ClassificationResult (Maybe [SensitiveDataItem])

-- | The status of the finding.
classificationResult_status :: Lens' ClassificationResult (Maybe ClassificationResultStatus)

-- | The type of content, as a MIME type, that the finding applies to. For
--   example, application/gzip, for a GNU Gzip compressed archive file, or
--   application/pdf, for an Adobe Portable Document Format file.
classificationResult_mimeType :: Lens' ClassificationResult (Maybe Text)

-- | The total size, in bytes, of the data that the finding applies to.
classificationResult_sizeClassified :: Lens' ClassificationResult (Maybe Integer)

-- | Specifies whether Amazon Macie detected additional occurrences of
--   sensitive data in the S3 object. A finding includes location data for
--   a maximum of 15 occurrences of sensitive data.
--   
--   This value can help you determine whether to investigate additional
--   occurrences of sensitive data in an object. You can do this by
--   referring to the corresponding sensitive data discovery result for the
--   finding (ClassificationDetails.detailedResultsLocation).
classificationResult_additionalOccurrences :: Lens' ClassificationResult (Maybe Bool)

-- | The custom data identifiers that detected the sensitive data and the
--   number of occurrences of the data that they detected.
classificationResult_customDataIdentifiers :: Lens' ClassificationResult (Maybe CustomDataIdentifiers)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ClassificationResult.ClassificationResult
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ClassificationResult.ClassificationResult
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ClassificationResult.ClassificationResult
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ClassificationResult.ClassificationResult
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ClassificationResult.ClassificationResult
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ClassificationResult.ClassificationResult
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ClassificationResult.ClassificationResult


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ClassificationDetails

-- | Provides information about a sensitive data finding, including the
--   classification job that produced the finding.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClassificationDetails</a> smart constructor.
data ClassificationDetails
ClassificationDetails' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ClassificationResult -> ClassificationDetails

-- | The path to the folder or file (in Amazon S3) that contains the
--   corresponding sensitive data discovery result for the finding. If a
--   finding applies to a large archive or compressed file, this value is
--   the path to a folder. Otherwise, this value is the path to a file.
[$sel:detailedResultsLocation:ClassificationDetails'] :: ClassificationDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the classification job that produced the
--   finding.
[$sel:jobId:ClassificationDetails'] :: ClassificationDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the classification job that produced
--   the finding.
[$sel:jobArn:ClassificationDetails'] :: ClassificationDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The status and other details of the finding.
[$sel:result:ClassificationDetails'] :: ClassificationDetails -> Maybe ClassificationResult

-- | Create a value of <a>ClassificationDetails</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:detailedResultsLocation:ClassificationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>classificationDetails_detailedResultsLocation</a> - The path to the
--   folder or file (in Amazon S3) that contains the corresponding
--   sensitive data discovery result for the finding. If a finding applies
--   to a large archive or compressed file, this value is the path to a
--   folder. Otherwise, this value is the path to a file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:ClassificationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>classificationDetails_jobId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   classification job that produced the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobArn:ClassificationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>classificationDetails_jobArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the classification job that produced the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:result:ClassificationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>classificationDetails_result</a> - The status and other details of
--   the finding.
newClassificationDetails :: ClassificationDetails

-- | The path to the folder or file (in Amazon S3) that contains the
--   corresponding sensitive data discovery result for the finding. If a
--   finding applies to a large archive or compressed file, this value is
--   the path to a folder. Otherwise, this value is the path to a file.
classificationDetails_detailedResultsLocation :: Lens' ClassificationDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the classification job that produced the
--   finding.
classificationDetails_jobId :: Lens' ClassificationDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the classification job that produced
--   the finding.
classificationDetails_jobArn :: Lens' ClassificationDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The status and other details of the finding.
classificationDetails_result :: Lens' ClassificationDetails (Maybe ClassificationResult)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ClassificationDetails.ClassificationDetails
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ClassificationDetails.ClassificationDetails
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ClassificationDetails.ClassificationDetails
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ClassificationDetails.ClassificationDetails

instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ClassificationDetails.ClassificationDetails
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ClassificationDetails.ClassificationDetails


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ManagedDataIdentifierSummary

-- | Provides information about a managed data identifier. For additional
--   information, see <a>Using managed data identifiers</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon Macie User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newManagedDataIdentifierSummary</a> smart constructor.
data ManagedDataIdentifierSummary
ManagedDataIdentifierSummary' :: Maybe SensitiveDataItemCategory -> Maybe Text -> ManagedDataIdentifierSummary

-- | The category of sensitive data that the managed data identifier
--   detects: CREDENTIALS, for credentials data such as private keys or
--   Amazon Web Services secret keys; FINANCIAL_INFORMATION, for financial
--   data such as credit card numbers; or, PERSONAL_INFORMATION, for
--   personal health information, such as health insurance identification
--   numbers, or personally identifiable information, such as passport
--   numbers.
[$sel:category:ManagedDataIdentifierSummary'] :: ManagedDataIdentifierSummary -> Maybe SensitiveDataItemCategory

-- | The unique identifier for the managed data identifier. This is a
--   string that describes the type of sensitive data that the managed data
--   identifier detects. For example: OPENSSH_PRIVATE_KEY for OpenSSH
--   private keys, CREDIT_CARD_NUMBER for credit card numbers, or
--   USA_PASSPORT_NUMBER for US passport numbers.
[$sel:id:ManagedDataIdentifierSummary'] :: ManagedDataIdentifierSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ManagedDataIdentifierSummary</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:category:ManagedDataIdentifierSummary'</a>,
--   <a>managedDataIdentifierSummary_category</a> - The category of
--   sensitive data that the managed data identifier detects: CREDENTIALS,
--   for credentials data such as private keys or Amazon Web Services
--   secret keys; FINANCIAL_INFORMATION, for financial data such as credit
--   card numbers; or, PERSONAL_INFORMATION, for personal health
--   information, such as health insurance identification numbers, or
--   personally identifiable information, such as passport numbers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ManagedDataIdentifierSummary'</a>,
--   <a>managedDataIdentifierSummary_id</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   managed data identifier. This is a string that describes the type of
--   sensitive data that the managed data identifier detects. For example:
--   OPENSSH_PRIVATE_KEY for OpenSSH private keys, CREDIT_CARD_NUMBER for
--   credit card numbers, or USA_PASSPORT_NUMBER for US passport numbers.
newManagedDataIdentifierSummary :: ManagedDataIdentifierSummary

-- | The category of sensitive data that the managed data identifier
--   detects: CREDENTIALS, for credentials data such as private keys or
--   Amazon Web Services secret keys; FINANCIAL_INFORMATION, for financial
--   data such as credit card numbers; or, PERSONAL_INFORMATION, for
--   personal health information, such as health insurance identification
--   numbers, or personally identifiable information, such as passport
--   numbers.
managedDataIdentifierSummary_category :: Lens' ManagedDataIdentifierSummary (Maybe SensitiveDataItemCategory)

-- | The unique identifier for the managed data identifier. This is a
--   string that describes the type of sensitive data that the managed data
--   identifier detects. For example: OPENSSH_PRIVATE_KEY for OpenSSH
--   private keys, CREDIT_CARD_NUMBER for credit card numbers, or
--   USA_PASSPORT_NUMBER for US passport numbers.
managedDataIdentifierSummary_id :: Lens' ManagedDataIdentifierSummary (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ManagedDataIdentifierSummary.ManagedDataIdentifierSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ManagedDataIdentifierSummary.ManagedDataIdentifierSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ManagedDataIdentifierSummary.ManagedDataIdentifierSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ManagedDataIdentifierSummary.ManagedDataIdentifierSummary

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ServerSideEncryption

-- | Provides information about the server-side encryption settings for an
--   S3 bucket or S3 object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newServerSideEncryption</a> smart constructor.
data ServerSideEncryption
ServerSideEncryption' :: Maybe EncryptionType -> Maybe Text -> ServerSideEncryption

-- | The server-side encryption algorithm that's used when storing data in
--   the bucket or object. If default encryption is disabled for the bucket
--   or the object isn't encrypted using server-side encryption, this value
--   is NONE.
[$sel:encryptionType:ServerSideEncryption'] :: ServerSideEncryption -> Maybe EncryptionType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or unique identifier (key ID) for the
--   KMS key that's used to encrypt data in the bucket or the object. This
--   value is null if an KMS key isn't used to encrypt the data.
[$sel:kmsMasterKeyId:ServerSideEncryption'] :: ServerSideEncryption -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ServerSideEncryption</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionType:ServerSideEncryption'</a>,
--   <a>serverSideEncryption_encryptionType</a> - The server-side
--   encryption algorithm that's used when storing data in the bucket or
--   object. If default encryption is disabled for the bucket or the object
--   isn't encrypted using server-side encryption, this value is NONE.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsMasterKeyId:ServerSideEncryption'</a>,
--   <a>serverSideEncryption_kmsMasterKeyId</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) or unique identifier (key ID) for the KMS key that's used to
--   encrypt data in the bucket or the object. This value is null if an KMS
--   key isn't used to encrypt the data.
newServerSideEncryption :: ServerSideEncryption

-- | The server-side encryption algorithm that's used when storing data in
--   the bucket or object. If default encryption is disabled for the bucket
--   or the object isn't encrypted using server-side encryption, this value
--   is NONE.
serverSideEncryption_encryptionType :: Lens' ServerSideEncryption (Maybe EncryptionType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or unique identifier (key ID) for the
--   KMS key that's used to encrypt data in the bucket or the object. This
--   value is null if an KMS key isn't used to encrypt the data.
serverSideEncryption_kmsMasterKeyId :: Lens' ServerSideEncryption (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ServerSideEncryption.ServerSideEncryption
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ServerSideEncryption.ServerSideEncryption
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.ServerSideEncryption.ServerSideEncryption

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3Bucket

-- | Provides information about the S3 bucket that a finding applies to.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3Bucket</a> smart constructor.
data S3Bucket
S3Bucket' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe S3BucketOwner -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ServerSideEncryption -> Maybe AllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads -> Maybe BucketPublicAccess -> Maybe [KeyValuePair] -> S3Bucket

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket.
[$sel:arn:S3Bucket'] :: S3Bucket -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the
--   bucket was created.
[$sel:createdAt:S3Bucket'] :: S3Bucket -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The display name and canonical user ID for the Amazon Web Services
--   account that owns the bucket.
[$sel:owner:S3Bucket'] :: S3Bucket -> Maybe S3BucketOwner

-- | The name of the bucket.
[$sel:name:S3Bucket'] :: S3Bucket -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of server-side encryption that's used by default to encrypt
--   objects in the bucket.
[$sel:defaultServerSideEncryption:S3Bucket'] :: S3Bucket -> Maybe ServerSideEncryption

-- | Specifies whether the bucket policy for the bucket requires
--   server-side encryption of objects when objects are uploaded to the
--   bucket. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>FALSE - The bucket policy requires server-side encryption of new
--   objects. PutObject requests must include the
--   x-amz-server-side-encryption header and the value for that header must
--   be AES256 or aws:kms.</li>
--   <li>TRUE - The bucket doesn't have a bucket policy or it has a bucket
--   policy that doesn't require server-side encryption of new objects. If
--   a bucket policy exists, it doesn't require PutObject requests to
--   include the x-amz-server-side-encryption header and it doesn't require
--   the value for that header to be AES256 or aws:kms.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie can't determine whether the bucket policy
--   requires server-side encryption of objects.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:allowsUnencryptedObjectUploads:S3Bucket'] :: S3Bucket -> Maybe AllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads

-- | The permissions settings that determine whether the bucket is publicly
--   accessible.
[$sel:publicAccess:S3Bucket'] :: S3Bucket -> Maybe BucketPublicAccess

-- | The tags that are associated with the bucket.
[$sel:tags:S3Bucket'] :: S3Bucket -> Maybe [KeyValuePair]

-- | Create a value of <a>S3Bucket</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:S3Bucket'</a>, <a>s3Bucket_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:S3Bucket'</a>, <a>s3Bucket_createdAt</a> - The date
--   and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the bucket was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:owner:S3Bucket'</a>, <a>s3Bucket_owner</a> - The display name
--   and canonical user ID for the Amazon Web Services account that owns
--   the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:S3Bucket'</a>, <a>s3Bucket_name</a> - The name of the
--   bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultServerSideEncryption:S3Bucket'</a>,
--   <a>s3Bucket_defaultServerSideEncryption</a> - The type of server-side
--   encryption that's used by default to encrypt objects in the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowsUnencryptedObjectUploads:S3Bucket'</a>,
--   <a>s3Bucket_allowsUnencryptedObjectUploads</a> - Specifies whether the
--   bucket policy for the bucket requires server-side encryption of
--   objects when objects are uploaded to the bucket. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>FALSE - The bucket policy requires server-side encryption of new
--   objects. PutObject requests must include the
--   x-amz-server-side-encryption header and the value for that header must
--   be AES256 or aws:kms.</li>
--   <li>TRUE - The bucket doesn't have a bucket policy or it has a bucket
--   policy that doesn't require server-side encryption of new objects. If
--   a bucket policy exists, it doesn't require PutObject requests to
--   include the x-amz-server-side-encryption header and it doesn't require
--   the value for that header to be AES256 or aws:kms.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie can't determine whether the bucket policy
--   requires server-side encryption of objects.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicAccess:S3Bucket'</a>, <a>s3Bucket_publicAccess</a> - The
--   permissions settings that determine whether the bucket is publicly
--   accessible.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:S3Bucket'</a>, <a>s3Bucket_tags</a> - The tags that are
--   associated with the bucket.
newS3Bucket :: S3Bucket

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket.
s3Bucket_arn :: Lens' S3Bucket (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the
--   bucket was created.
s3Bucket_createdAt :: Lens' S3Bucket (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The display name and canonical user ID for the Amazon Web Services
--   account that owns the bucket.
s3Bucket_owner :: Lens' S3Bucket (Maybe S3BucketOwner)

-- | The name of the bucket.
s3Bucket_name :: Lens' S3Bucket (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of server-side encryption that's used by default to encrypt
--   objects in the bucket.
s3Bucket_defaultServerSideEncryption :: Lens' S3Bucket (Maybe ServerSideEncryption)

-- | Specifies whether the bucket policy for the bucket requires
--   server-side encryption of objects when objects are uploaded to the
--   bucket. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>FALSE - The bucket policy requires server-side encryption of new
--   objects. PutObject requests must include the
--   x-amz-server-side-encryption header and the value for that header must
--   be AES256 or aws:kms.</li>
--   <li>TRUE - The bucket doesn't have a bucket policy or it has a bucket
--   policy that doesn't require server-side encryption of new objects. If
--   a bucket policy exists, it doesn't require PutObject requests to
--   include the x-amz-server-side-encryption header and it doesn't require
--   the value for that header to be AES256 or aws:kms.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie can't determine whether the bucket policy
--   requires server-side encryption of objects.</li>
--   </ul>
s3Bucket_allowsUnencryptedObjectUploads :: Lens' S3Bucket (Maybe AllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads)

-- | The permissions settings that determine whether the bucket is publicly
--   accessible.
s3Bucket_publicAccess :: Lens' S3Bucket (Maybe BucketPublicAccess)

-- | The tags that are associated with the bucket.
s3Bucket_tags :: Lens' S3Bucket (Maybe [KeyValuePair])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3Bucket.S3Bucket
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3Bucket.S3Bucket
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3Bucket.S3Bucket
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3Bucket.S3Bucket
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3Bucket.S3Bucket

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3Bucket.S3Bucket

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSessionContextAttributes</a> smart constructor.

--   were issued.
[$sel:creationDate:SessionContextAttributes'] :: SessionContextAttributes -> Maybe POSIX

--   multi-factor authentication (MFA) device.

--   the credentials were authenticated with a multi-factor authentication

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SessionIssuer

-- | Provides information about the source and type of temporary security
--   credentials that were issued to an entity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSessionIssuer</a> smart constructor.
data SessionIssuer
SessionIssuer' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> SessionIssuer

-- | The unique identifier for the entity that was used to get the
--   credentials.
[$sel:principalId:SessionIssuer'] :: SessionIssuer -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source account, IAM user, or
--   role that was used to get the credentials.
[$sel:arn:SessionIssuer'] :: SessionIssuer -> Maybe Text

-- | The name or alias of the user or role that issued the session. This
--   value is null if the credentials were obtained from a root account
--   that doesn't have an alias.
[$sel:userName:SessionIssuer'] :: SessionIssuer -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns
--   the entity that was used to get the credentials.
[$sel:accountId:SessionIssuer'] :: SessionIssuer -> Maybe Text

-- | The source of the temporary security credentials, such as Root,
--   IAMUser, or Role.
[$sel:type':SessionIssuer'] :: SessionIssuer -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SessionIssuer</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:principalId:SessionIssuer'</a>,
--   <a>sessionIssuer_principalId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   entity that was used to get the credentials.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:SessionIssuer'</a>, <a>sessionIssuer_arn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the source account, IAM user, or role that was
--   used to get the credentials.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userName:SessionIssuer'</a>, <a>sessionIssuer_userName</a> -
--   The name or alias of the user or role that issued the session. This
--   value is null if the credentials were obtained from a root account
--   that doesn't have an alias.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:SessionIssuer'</a>, <a>sessionIssuer_accountId</a> -
--   The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns
--   the entity that was used to get the credentials.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':SessionIssuer'</a>, <a>sessionIssuer_type</a> - The
--   source of the temporary security credentials, such as Root, IAMUser,
--   or Role.
newSessionIssuer :: SessionIssuer

-- | The unique identifier for the entity that was used to get the
--   credentials.
sessionIssuer_principalId :: Lens' SessionIssuer (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source account, IAM user, or
--   role that was used to get the credentials.
sessionIssuer_arn :: Lens' SessionIssuer (Maybe Text)

-- | The name or alias of the user or role that issued the session. This
--   value is null if the credentials were obtained from a root account
--   that doesn't have an alias.
sessionIssuer_userName :: Lens' SessionIssuer (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns
--   the entity that was used to get the credentials.
sessionIssuer_accountId :: Lens' SessionIssuer (Maybe Text)

-- | The source of the temporary security credentials, such as Root,
--   IAMUser, or Role.
sessionIssuer_type :: Lens' SessionIssuer (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SessionIssuer.SessionIssuer
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SessionIssuer.SessionIssuer

--   authenticated with a multi-factor authentication (MFA) device.

--   <a>sessionContext_sessionIssuer</a> - The source and type of
--   credentials that were issued to the entity.

--   credentials were authenticated with a multi-factor authentication

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FederatedUser

-- | Provides information about an identity that performed an action on an
--   affected resource by using temporary security credentials. The
--   credentials were obtained using the GetFederationToken operation of
--   the Security Token Service (STS) API.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFederatedUser</a> smart constructor.
data FederatedUser
FederatedUser' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SessionContext -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> FederatedUser

-- | The unique identifier for the entity that was used to get the
--   credentials.
[$sel:principalId:FederatedUser'] :: FederatedUser -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the entity that was used to get the
--   credentials.
[$sel:arn:FederatedUser'] :: FederatedUser -> Maybe Text

-- | The details of the session that was created for the credentials,
--   including the entity that issued the session.
[$sel:sessionContext:FederatedUser'] :: FederatedUser -> Maybe SessionContext

-- | The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns
--   the entity that was used to get the credentials.
[$sel:accountId:FederatedUser'] :: FederatedUser -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services access key ID that identifies the credentials.
[$sel:accessKeyId:FederatedUser'] :: FederatedUser -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>FederatedUser</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:principalId:FederatedUser'</a>,
--   <a>federatedUser_principalId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   entity that was used to get the credentials.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:FederatedUser'</a>, <a>federatedUser_arn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the entity that was used to get the
--   credentials.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sessionContext:FederatedUser'</a>,
--   <a>federatedUser_sessionContext</a> - The details of the session that
--   was created for the credentials, including the entity that issued the
--   session.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:FederatedUser'</a>, <a>federatedUser_accountId</a> -
--   The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns
--   the entity that was used to get the credentials.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessKeyId:FederatedUser'</a>,
--   <a>federatedUser_accessKeyId</a> - The Amazon Web Services access key
--   ID that identifies the credentials.
newFederatedUser :: FederatedUser

-- | The unique identifier for the entity that was used to get the
--   credentials.
federatedUser_principalId :: Lens' FederatedUser (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the entity that was used to get the
--   credentials.
federatedUser_arn :: Lens' FederatedUser (Maybe Text)

-- | The details of the session that was created for the credentials,
--   including the entity that issued the session.
federatedUser_sessionContext :: Lens' FederatedUser (Maybe SessionContext)

-- | The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns
--   the entity that was used to get the credentials.
federatedUser_accountId :: Lens' FederatedUser (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services access key ID that identifies the credentials.
federatedUser_accessKeyId :: Lens' FederatedUser (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FederatedUser.FederatedUser
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FederatedUser.FederatedUser
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FederatedUser.FederatedUser
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FederatedUser.FederatedUser
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FederatedUser.FederatedUser
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FederatedUser.FederatedUser
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FederatedUser.FederatedUser


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.AssumedRole

-- | Provides information about an identity that performed an action on an
--   affected resource by using temporary security credentials. The
--   credentials were obtained using the AssumeRole operation of the
--   Security Token Service (STS) API.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssumedRole</a> smart constructor.
data AssumedRole
AssumedRole' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SessionContext -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> AssumedRole

-- | The unique identifier for the entity that was used to get the
--   credentials.
[$sel:principalId:AssumedRole'] :: AssumedRole -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the entity that was used to get the
--   credentials.

-- | The details of the session that was created for the credentials,
--   including the entity that issued the session.
[$sel:sessionContext:AssumedRole'] :: AssumedRole -> Maybe SessionContext

-- | The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns
--   the entity that was used to get the credentials.
[$sel:accountId:AssumedRole'] :: AssumedRole -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services access key ID that identifies the credentials.
[$sel:accessKeyId:AssumedRole'] :: AssumedRole -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AssumedRole</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:principalId:AssumedRole'</a>, <a>assumedRole_principalId</a> -
--   The unique identifier for the entity that was used to get the
--   credentials.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:AssumedRole'</a>, <a>assumedRole_arn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the entity that was used to get the
--   credentials.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sessionContext:AssumedRole'</a>,
--   <a>assumedRole_sessionContext</a> - The details of the session that
--   was created for the credentials, including the entity that issued the
--   session.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:AssumedRole'</a>, <a>assumedRole_accountId</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns the
--   entity that was used to get the credentials.
--

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Severity

-- | Provides the numerical and qualitative representations of a finding's
--   severity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSeverity</a> smart constructor.
data Severity
Severity' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe SeverityDescription -> Severity

-- | The numerical representation of the finding's severity, ranging from 1
--   (least severe) to 3 (most severe).
[$sel:score:Severity'] :: Severity -> Maybe Integer

-- | The qualitative representation of the finding's severity, ranging from
--   Low (least severe) to High (most severe).
[$sel:description:Severity'] :: Severity -> Maybe SeverityDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>Severity</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:score:Severity'</a>, <a>severity_score</a> - The numerical
--   representation of the finding's severity, ranging from 1 (least
--   severe) to 3 (most severe).
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Severity'</a>, <a>severity_description</a> - The
--   qualitative representation of the finding's severity, ranging from Low
--   (least severe) to High (most severe).
newSeverity :: Severity

-- | The numerical representation of the finding's severity, ranging from 1
--   (least severe) to 3 (most severe).
severity_score :: Lens' Severity (Maybe Integer)

-- | The qualitative representation of the finding's severity, ranging from
--   Low (least severe) to High (most severe).
severity_description :: Lens' Severity (Maybe SeverityDescription)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Severity.Severity
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Severity.Severity

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SimpleCriterionForJob

-- | Specifies a property-based condition that determines whether an S3
--   bucket is included or excluded from a classification job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSimpleCriterionForJob</a> smart constructor.
data SimpleCriterionForJob
SimpleCriterionForJob' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe SimpleCriterionKeyForJob -> Maybe JobComparator -> SimpleCriterionForJob

-- | An array that lists one or more values to use in the condition. If you
--   specify multiple values, Amazon Macie uses OR logic to join the
--   values. Valid values for each supported property (key) are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_ID - A string that represents the unique identifier for
--   the Amazon Web Services account that owns the bucket.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_EFFECTIVE_PERMISSION - A string that represents an
--   enumerated value that Macie defines for the
--   <a>BucketPublicAccess.effectivePermission</a> property of a
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_NAME - A string that represents the name of a
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_SHARED_ACCESS - A string that represents an enumerated
--   value that Macie defines for the <a>BucketMetadata.sharedAccess</a>
--   property of a bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Values are case sensitive. Also, Macie doesn't support use of partial
--   values or wildcard characters in these values.
[$sel:values:SimpleCriterionForJob'] :: SimpleCriterionForJob -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The property to use in the condition.
[$sel:key:SimpleCriterionForJob'] :: SimpleCriterionForJob -> Maybe SimpleCriterionKeyForJob

-- | The operator to use in the condition. Valid values are EQ (equals) and
--   NE (not equals).
[$sel:comparator:SimpleCriterionForJob'] :: SimpleCriterionForJob -> Maybe JobComparator

-- | Create a value of <a>SimpleCriterionForJob</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:SimpleCriterionForJob'</a>,
--   <a>simpleCriterionForJob_values</a> - An array that lists one or more
--   values to use in the condition. If you specify multiple values, Amazon
--   Macie uses OR logic to join the values. Valid values for each
--   supported property (key) are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_ID - A string that represents the unique identifier for
--   the Amazon Web Services account that owns the bucket.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_EFFECTIVE_PERMISSION - A string that represents an
--   enumerated value that Macie defines for the
--   <a>BucketPublicAccess.effectivePermission</a> property of a
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_NAME - A string that represents the name of a
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_SHARED_ACCESS - A string that represents an enumerated
--   value that Macie defines for the <a>BucketMetadata.sharedAccess</a>
--   property of a bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Values are case sensitive. Also, Macie doesn't support use of partial
--   values or wildcard characters in these values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:SimpleCriterionForJob'</a>,
--   <a>simpleCriterionForJob_key</a> - The property to use in the
--   condition.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comparator:SimpleCriterionForJob'</a>,
--   <a>simpleCriterionForJob_comparator</a> - The operator to use in the
--   condition. Valid values are EQ (equals) and NE (not equals).
newSimpleCriterionForJob :: SimpleCriterionForJob

-- | An array that lists one or more values to use in the condition. If you
--   specify multiple values, Amazon Macie uses OR logic to join the
--   values. Valid values for each supported property (key) are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_ID - A string that represents the unique identifier for
--   the Amazon Web Services account that owns the bucket.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_EFFECTIVE_PERMISSION - A string that represents an
--   enumerated value that Macie defines for the
--   <a>BucketPublicAccess.effectivePermission</a> property of a
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_NAME - A string that represents the name of a
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_SHARED_ACCESS - A string that represents an enumerated
--   value that Macie defines for the <a>BucketMetadata.sharedAccess</a>
--   property of a bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Values are case sensitive. Also, Macie doesn't support use of partial
--   values or wildcard characters in these values.
simpleCriterionForJob_values :: Lens' SimpleCriterionForJob (Maybe [Text])

-- | The property to use in the condition.
simpleCriterionForJob_key :: Lens' SimpleCriterionForJob (Maybe SimpleCriterionKeyForJob)

-- | The operator to use in the condition. Valid values are EQ (equals) and
--   NE (not equals).
simpleCriterionForJob_comparator :: Lens' SimpleCriterionForJob (Maybe JobComparator)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SimpleCriterionForJob.SimpleCriterionForJob
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SimpleCriterionForJob.SimpleCriterionForJob
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SimpleCriterionForJob.SimpleCriterionForJob
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SimpleCriterionForJob.SimpleCriterionForJob
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SimpleCriterionForJob.SimpleCriterionForJob
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SimpleCriterionForJob.SimpleCriterionForJob
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SimpleCriterionForJob.SimpleCriterionForJob
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SimpleCriterionForJob.SimpleCriterionForJob


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SimpleScopeTerm

-- | Specifies a property-based condition that determines whether an S3
--   object is included or excluded from a classification job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSimpleScopeTerm</a> smart constructor.
data SimpleScopeTerm
SimpleScopeTerm' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe ScopeFilterKey -> Maybe JobComparator -> SimpleScopeTerm

-- | An array that lists the values to use in the condition. If the value
--   for the key property is OBJECT_EXTENSION or OBJECT_KEY, this array can
--   specify multiple values and Amazon Macie uses OR logic to join the
--   values. Otherwise, this array can specify only one value.
--   
--   Valid values for each supported property (key) are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OBJECT_EXTENSION - A string that represents the file name
--   extension of an object. For example: docx or pdf</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_KEY - A string that represents the key prefix (folder name
--   or path) of an object. For example: logs or awslogs/eventlogs. This
--   value applies a condition to objects whose keys (names) begin with the
--   specified value.</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_LAST_MODIFIED_DATE - The date and time (in UTC and extended
--   ISO 8601 format) when an object was created or last changed, whichever
--   is latest. For example: 2020-09-28T14:31:13Z</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_SIZE - An integer that represents the storage size (in
--   bytes) of an object.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Macie doesn't support use of wildcard characters in these values.
--   Also, string values are case sensitive.
[$sel:values:SimpleScopeTerm'] :: SimpleScopeTerm -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The object property to use in the condition.
[$sel:key:SimpleScopeTerm'] :: SimpleScopeTerm -> Maybe ScopeFilterKey

-- | The operator to use in the condition. Valid values for each supported
--   property (key) are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OBJECT_EXTENSION - EQ (equals) or NE (not equals)</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_KEY - STARTS_WITH</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_LAST_MODIFIED_DATE - Any operator except CONTAINS</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_SIZE - Any operator except CONTAINS</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:comparator:SimpleScopeTerm'] :: SimpleScopeTerm -> Maybe JobComparator

-- | Create a value of <a>SimpleScopeTerm</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:SimpleScopeTerm'</a>, <a>simpleScopeTerm_values</a> -
--   An array that lists the values to use in the condition. If the value
--   for the key property is OBJECT_EXTENSION or OBJECT_KEY, this array can
--   specify multiple values and Amazon Macie uses OR logic to join the
--   values. Otherwise, this array can specify only one value.
--   
--   Valid values for each supported property (key) are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OBJECT_EXTENSION - A string that represents the file name
--   extension of an object. For example: docx or pdf</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_KEY - A string that represents the key prefix (folder name
--   or path) of an object. For example: logs or awslogs/eventlogs. This
--   value applies a condition to objects whose keys (names) begin with the
--   specified value.</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_LAST_MODIFIED_DATE - The date and time (in UTC and extended
--   ISO 8601 format) when an object was created or last changed, whichever
--   is latest. For example: 2020-09-28T14:31:13Z</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_SIZE - An integer that represents the storage size (in
--   bytes) of an object.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Macie doesn't support use of wildcard characters in these values.
--   Also, string values are case sensitive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:SimpleScopeTerm'</a>, <a>simpleScopeTerm_key</a> - The
--   object property to use in the condition.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comparator:SimpleScopeTerm'</a>,
--   <a>simpleScopeTerm_comparator</a> - The operator to use in the
--   condition. Valid values for each supported property (key) are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OBJECT_EXTENSION - EQ (equals) or NE (not equals)</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_KEY - STARTS_WITH</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_LAST_MODIFIED_DATE - Any operator except CONTAINS</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_SIZE - Any operator except CONTAINS</li>
--   </ul>
newSimpleScopeTerm :: SimpleScopeTerm

-- | An array that lists the values to use in the condition. If the value
--   for the key property is OBJECT_EXTENSION or OBJECT_KEY, this array can
--   specify multiple values and Amazon Macie uses OR logic to join the
--   values. Otherwise, this array can specify only one value.
--   
--   Valid values for each supported property (key) are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OBJECT_EXTENSION - A string that represents the file name
--   extension of an object. For example: docx or pdf</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_KEY - A string that represents the key prefix (folder name
--   or path) of an object. For example: logs or awslogs/eventlogs. This
--   value applies a condition to objects whose keys (names) begin with the
--   specified value.</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_LAST_MODIFIED_DATE - The date and time (in UTC and extended
--   ISO 8601 format) when an object was created or last changed, whichever
--   is latest. For example: 2020-09-28T14:31:13Z</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_SIZE - An integer that represents the storage size (in
--   bytes) of an object.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Macie doesn't support use of wildcard characters in these values.
--   Also, string values are case sensitive.
simpleScopeTerm_values :: Lens' SimpleScopeTerm (Maybe [Text])

-- | The object property to use in the condition.
simpleScopeTerm_key :: Lens' SimpleScopeTerm (Maybe ScopeFilterKey)

-- | The operator to use in the condition. Valid values for each supported
--   property (key) are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OBJECT_EXTENSION - EQ (equals) or NE (not equals)</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_KEY - STARTS_WITH</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_LAST_MODIFIED_DATE - Any operator except CONTAINS</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_SIZE - Any operator except CONTAINS</li>
--   </ul>
simpleScopeTerm_comparator :: Lens' SimpleScopeTerm (Maybe JobComparator)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SimpleScopeTerm.SimpleScopeTerm
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SimpleScopeTerm.SimpleScopeTerm
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SimpleScopeTerm.SimpleScopeTerm
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SimpleScopeTerm.SimpleScopeTerm
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SimpleScopeTerm.SimpleScopeTerm
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SimpleScopeTerm.SimpleScopeTerm
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SimpleScopeTerm.SimpleScopeTerm
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SimpleScopeTerm.SimpleScopeTerm


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SortCriteria

-- | Specifies criteria for sorting the results of a request for findings.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSortCriteria</a> smart constructor.
data SortCriteria
SortCriteria' :: Maybe OrderBy -> Maybe Text -> SortCriteria

-- | The sort order to apply to the results, based on the value for the
--   property specified by the attributeName property. Valid values are:
--   ASC, sort the results in ascending order; and, DESC, sort the results
--   in descending order.
[$sel:orderBy:SortCriteria'] :: SortCriteria -> Maybe OrderBy

-- | The name of the property to sort the results by. This value can be the
--   name of any property that Amazon Macie defines for a finding.
[$sel:attributeName:SortCriteria'] :: SortCriteria -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SortCriteria</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:orderBy:SortCriteria'</a>, <a>sortCriteria_orderBy</a> - The
--   sort order to apply to the results, based on the value for the
--   property specified by the attributeName property. Valid values are:
--   ASC, sort the results in ascending order; and, DESC, sort the results
--   in descending order.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeName:SortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>sortCriteria_attributeName</a> - The name of the property to sort
--   the results by. This value can be the name of any property that Amazon
--   Macie defines for a finding.
newSortCriteria :: SortCriteria

-- | The sort order to apply to the results, based on the value for the
--   property specified by the attributeName property. Valid values are:
--   ASC, sort the results in ascending order; and, DESC, sort the results
--   in descending order.
sortCriteria_orderBy :: Lens' SortCriteria (Maybe OrderBy)

-- | The name of the property to sort the results by. This value can be the
--   name of any property that Amazon Macie defines for a finding.
sortCriteria_attributeName :: Lens' SortCriteria (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SortCriteria.SortCriteria
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SortCriteria.SortCriteria
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SortCriteria.SortCriteria
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SortCriteria.SortCriteria
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SortCriteria.SortCriteria
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SortCriteria.SortCriteria
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.SortCriteria.SortCriteria


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Statistics

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStatistics</a> smart constructor.
data Statistics

-- | The approximate number of objects that the job has yet to process
--   during its current run.
[$sel:approximateNumberOfObjectsToProcess:Statistics'] :: Statistics -> Maybe Double

-- | The number of times that the job has run.
[$sel:numberOfRuns:Statistics'] :: Statistics -> Maybe Double

--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:approximateNumberOfObjectsToProcess:Statistics'</a>,
--   <a>statistics_approximateNumberOfObjectsToProcess</a> - The
--   approximate number of objects that the job has yet to process during
--   its current run.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfRuns:Statistics'</a>, <a>statistics_numberOfRuns</a> -
--   The number of times that the job has run.
newStatistics :: Statistics

-- | The approximate number of objects that the job has yet to process
--   during its current run.
statistics_approximateNumberOfObjectsToProcess :: Lens' Statistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The number of times that the job has run.
statistics_numberOfRuns :: Lens' Statistics (Maybe Double)

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3Object

-- | Provides information about the S3 object that a finding applies to.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3Object</a> smart constructor.
data S3Object
S3Object' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StorageClass -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ServerSideEncryption -> Maybe [KeyValuePair] -> S3Object

-- | The entity tag (ETag) that identifies the affected version of the
--   object. If the object was overwritten or changed after Amazon Macie
--   produced the finding, this value might be different from the current
--   ETag for the object.
[$sel:eTag:S3Object'] :: S3Object -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier for the affected version of the object.
[$sel:versionId:S3Object'] :: S3Object -> Maybe Text

-- | The path to the object, including the full key (name).
[$sel:path:S3Object'] :: S3Object -> Maybe Text

-- | The total storage size, in bytes, of the object.
[$sel:size:S3Object'] :: S3Object -> Maybe Integer

-- | The file name extension of the object. If the object doesn't have a
--   file name extension, this value is "".
[$sel:extension:S3Object'] :: S3Object -> Maybe Text

-- | The full key (name) that's assigned to the object.
[$sel:key:S3Object'] :: S3Object -> Maybe Text

-- | The storage class of the object.
[$sel:storageClass:S3Object'] :: S3Object -> Maybe StorageClass

-- | Specifies whether the object is publicly accessible due to the
--   combination of permissions settings that apply to the object.
[$sel:publicAccess:S3Object'] :: S3Object -> Maybe Bool

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the
--   object was last modified.
[$sel:lastModified:S3Object'] :: S3Object -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket that contains the object.
[$sel:bucketArn:S3Object'] :: S3Object -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of server-side encryption that's used to encrypt the object.
[$sel:serverSideEncryption:S3Object'] :: S3Object -> Maybe ServerSideEncryption

-- | The tags that are associated with the object.
[$sel:tags:S3Object'] :: S3Object -> Maybe [KeyValuePair]

-- | Create a value of <a>S3Object</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:eTag:S3Object'</a>, <a>s3Object_eTag</a> - The entity tag
--   (ETag) that identifies the affected version of the object. If the
--   object was overwritten or changed after Amazon Macie produced the
--   finding, this value might be different from the current ETag for the
--   object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionId:S3Object'</a>, <a>s3Object_versionId</a> - The
--   identifier for the affected version of the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:path:S3Object'</a>, <a>s3Object_path</a> - The path to the
--   object, including the full key (name).
--   
--   <a>$sel:size:S3Object'</a>, <a>s3Object_size</a> - The total storage
--   size, in bytes, of the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:extension:S3Object'</a>, <a>s3Object_extension</a> - The file
--   name extension of the object. If the object doesn't have a file name
--   extension, this value is "".
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:S3Object'</a>, <a>s3Object_key</a> - The full key (name)
--   that's assigned to the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageClass:S3Object'</a>, <a>s3Object_storageClass</a> - The
--   storage class of the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicAccess:S3Object'</a>, <a>s3Object_publicAccess</a> -
--   Specifies whether the object is publicly accessible due to the
--   combination of permissions settings that apply to the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModified:S3Object'</a>, <a>s3Object_lastModified</a> - The
--   date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the object
--   was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketArn:S3Object'</a>, <a>s3Object_bucketArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket that contains the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverSideEncryption:S3Object'</a>,
--   <a>s3Object_serverSideEncryption</a> - The type of server-side
--   encryption that's used to encrypt the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:S3Object'</a>, <a>s3Object_tags</a> - The tags that are
--   associated with the object.
newS3Object :: S3Object

-- | The entity tag (ETag) that identifies the affected version of the
--   object. If the object was overwritten or changed after Amazon Macie
--   produced the finding, this value might be different from the current
--   ETag for the object.
s3Object_eTag :: Lens' S3Object (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier for the affected version of the object.
s3Object_versionId :: Lens' S3Object (Maybe Text)

-- | The path to the object, including the full key (name).
s3Object_path :: Lens' S3Object (Maybe Text)

-- | The total storage size, in bytes, of the object.
s3Object_size :: Lens' S3Object (Maybe Integer)

-- | The file name extension of the object. If the object doesn't have a
--   file name extension, this value is "".
s3Object_extension :: Lens' S3Object (Maybe Text)

-- | The full key (name) that's assigned to the object.
s3Object_key :: Lens' S3Object (Maybe Text)

-- | The storage class of the object.
s3Object_storageClass :: Lens' S3Object (Maybe StorageClass)

-- | Specifies whether the object is publicly accessible due to the
--   combination of permissions settings that apply to the object.
s3Object_publicAccess :: Lens' S3Object (Maybe Bool)

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the
--   object was last modified.
s3Object_lastModified :: Lens' S3Object (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket that contains the object.
s3Object_bucketArn :: Lens' S3Object (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of server-side encryption that's used to encrypt the object.
s3Object_serverSideEncryption :: Lens' S3Object (Maybe ServerSideEncryption)

-- | The tags that are associated with the object.
s3Object_tags :: Lens' S3Object (Maybe [KeyValuePair])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3Object.S3Object
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3Object.S3Object
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3Object.S3Object
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3Object.S3Object
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3Object.S3Object
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3Object.S3Object
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3Object.S3Object
