module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagCriterionPairForJob

-- | Specifies a tag key, a tag value, or a tag key and value (as a pair)
--   to use in a tag-based condition that determines whether an S3 bucket
--   is included or excluded from a classification job. Tag keys and values
--   are case sensitive. Also, Amazon Macie doesn't support use of partial
--   values or wildcard characters in tag-based conditions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTagCriterionPairForJob</a> smart constructor.
data TagCriterionPairForJob
TagCriterionPairForJob' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> TagCriterionPairForJob

-- | The tag value to use in the condition.
[$sel:value:TagCriterionPairForJob'] :: TagCriterionPairForJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The value for the tag key to use in the condition.
[$sel:key:TagCriterionPairForJob'] :: TagCriterionPairForJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TagCriterionPairForJob</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:TagCriterionPairForJob'</a>,
--   <a>tagCriterionPairForJob_value</a> - The tag value to use in the
--   condition.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:TagCriterionPairForJob'</a>,
--   <a>tagCriterionPairForJob_key</a> - The value for the tag key to use
--   in the condition.
newTagCriterionPairForJob :: TagCriterionPairForJob

-- | The tag value to use in the condition.
tagCriterionPairForJob_value :: Lens' TagCriterionPairForJob (Maybe Text)

-- | The value for the tag key to use in the condition.
tagCriterionPairForJob_key :: Lens' TagCriterionPairForJob (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagCriterionPairForJob.TagCriterionPairForJob
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagCriterionPairForJob.TagCriterionPairForJob
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagCriterionPairForJob.TagCriterionPairForJob
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagCriterionPairForJob.TagCriterionPairForJob
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagCriterionPairForJob.TagCriterionPairForJob
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagCriterionPairForJob.TagCriterionPairForJob
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagCriterionPairForJob.TagCriterionPairForJob
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagCriterionPairForJob.TagCriterionPairForJob


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagCriterionForJob

-- | Specifies a tag-based condition that determines whether an S3 bucket
--   is included or excluded from a classification job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTagCriterionForJob</a> smart constructor.
data TagCriterionForJob
TagCriterionForJob' :: Maybe [TagCriterionPairForJob] -> Maybe JobComparator -> TagCriterionForJob

-- | The tag keys, tag values, or tag key and value pairs to use in the
--   condition.
[$sel:tagValues:TagCriterionForJob'] :: TagCriterionForJob -> Maybe [TagCriterionPairForJob]

-- | The operator to use in the condition. Valid values are EQ (equals) and
--   NE (not equals).
[$sel:comparator:TagCriterionForJob'] :: TagCriterionForJob -> Maybe JobComparator

-- | Create a value of <a>TagCriterionForJob</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagValues:TagCriterionForJob'</a>,
--   <a>tagCriterionForJob_tagValues</a> - The tag keys, tag values, or tag
--   key and value pairs to use in the condition.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comparator:TagCriterionForJob'</a>,
--   <a>tagCriterionForJob_comparator</a> - The operator to use in the
--   condition. Valid values are EQ (equals) and NE (not equals).
newTagCriterionForJob :: TagCriterionForJob

-- | The tag keys, tag values, or tag key and value pairs to use in the
--   condition.
tagCriterionForJob_tagValues :: Lens' TagCriterionForJob (Maybe [TagCriterionPairForJob])

-- | The operator to use in the condition. Valid values are EQ (equals) and
--   NE (not equals).
tagCriterionForJob_comparator :: Lens' TagCriterionForJob (Maybe JobComparator)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagCriterionForJob.TagCriterionForJob
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagCriterionForJob.TagCriterionForJob
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagCriterionForJob.TagCriterionForJob
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagCriterionForJob.TagCriterionForJob
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagCriterionForJob.TagCriterionForJob

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagCriterionForJob.TagCriterionForJob
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagCriterionForJob.TagCriterionForJob


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CriteriaForJob

-- | Specifies a property- or tag-based condition that defines criteria for
--   including or excluding S3 buckets from a classification job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCriteriaForJob</a> smart constructor.
data CriteriaForJob
CriteriaForJob' :: Maybe TagCriterionForJob -> Maybe SimpleCriterionForJob -> CriteriaForJob

-- | A tag-based condition that defines an operator and tag keys, tag
--   values, or tag key and value pairs for including or excluding buckets
--   from the job.
[$sel:tagCriterion:CriteriaForJob'] :: CriteriaForJob -> Maybe TagCriterionForJob

-- | A property-based condition that defines a property, operator, and one
--   or more values for including or excluding buckets from the job.
[$sel:simpleCriterion:CriteriaForJob'] :: CriteriaForJob -> Maybe SimpleCriterionForJob

-- | Create a value of <a>CriteriaForJob</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagCriterion:CriteriaForJob'</a>,
--   <a>criteriaForJob_tagCriterion</a> - A tag-based condition that
--   defines an operator and tag keys, tag values, or tag key and value
--   pairs for including or excluding buckets from the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:simpleCriterion:CriteriaForJob'</a>,
--   <a>criteriaForJob_simpleCriterion</a> - A property-based condition
--   that defines a property, operator, and one or more values for
--   including or excluding buckets from the job.
newCriteriaForJob :: CriteriaForJob

-- | A tag-based condition that defines an operator and tag keys, tag
--   values, or tag key and value pairs for including or excluding buckets
--   from the job.
criteriaForJob_tagCriterion :: Lens' CriteriaForJob (Maybe TagCriterionForJob)

-- | A property-based condition that defines a property, operator, and one
--   or more values for including or excluding buckets from the job.
criteriaForJob_simpleCriterion :: Lens' CriteriaForJob (Maybe SimpleCriterionForJob)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CriteriaForJob.CriteriaForJob
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CriteriaForJob.CriteriaForJob
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CriteriaForJob.CriteriaForJob
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CriteriaForJob.CriteriaForJob
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CriteriaForJob.CriteriaForJob
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CriteriaForJob.CriteriaForJob
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CriteriaForJob.CriteriaForJob
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CriteriaForJob.CriteriaForJob


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CriteriaBlockForJob

-- | Specifies one or more property- and tag-based conditions that define
--   criteria for including or excluding S3 buckets from a classification
--   job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCriteriaBlockForJob</a> smart constructor.
data CriteriaBlockForJob
CriteriaBlockForJob' :: Maybe [CriteriaForJob] -> CriteriaBlockForJob

-- | An array of conditions, one for each condition that determines which
--   buckets to include or exclude from the job. If you specify more than
--   one condition, Amazon Macie uses AND logic to join the conditions.
[$sel:and:CriteriaBlockForJob'] :: CriteriaBlockForJob -> Maybe [CriteriaForJob]

-- | Create a value of <a>CriteriaBlockForJob</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:and:CriteriaBlockForJob'</a>, <a>criteriaBlockForJob_and</a> -
--   An array of conditions, one for each condition that determines which
--   buckets to include or exclude from the job. If you specify more than
--   one condition, Amazon Macie uses AND logic to join the conditions.
newCriteriaBlockForJob :: CriteriaBlockForJob

-- | An array of conditions, one for each condition that determines which
--   buckets to include or exclude from the job. If you specify more than
--   one condition, Amazon Macie uses AND logic to join the conditions.
criteriaBlockForJob_and :: Lens' CriteriaBlockForJob (Maybe [CriteriaForJob])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CriteriaBlockForJob.CriteriaBlockForJob
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CriteriaBlockForJob.CriteriaBlockForJob
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CriteriaBlockForJob.CriteriaBlockForJob
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CriteriaBlockForJob.CriteriaBlockForJob
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CriteriaBlockForJob.CriteriaBlockForJob
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CriteriaBlockForJob.CriteriaBlockForJob
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CriteriaBlockForJob.CriteriaBlockForJob
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.CriteriaBlockForJob.CriteriaBlockForJob


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3BucketCriteriaForJob

-- | Specifies property- and tag-based conditions that define criteria for
--   including or excluding S3 buckets from a classification job. Exclude
--   conditions take precedence over include conditions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3BucketCriteriaForJob</a> smart constructor.
data S3BucketCriteriaForJob
S3BucketCriteriaForJob' :: Maybe CriteriaBlockForJob -> Maybe CriteriaBlockForJob -> S3BucketCriteriaForJob

-- | The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which buckets to
--   include in the job.
[$sel:includes:S3BucketCriteriaForJob'] :: S3BucketCriteriaForJob -> Maybe CriteriaBlockForJob

-- | The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which buckets to
--   exclude from the job.
[$sel:excludes:S3BucketCriteriaForJob'] :: S3BucketCriteriaForJob -> Maybe CriteriaBlockForJob

-- | Create a value of <a>S3BucketCriteriaForJob</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:includes:S3BucketCriteriaForJob'</a>,
--   <a>s3BucketCriteriaForJob_includes</a> - The property- and tag-based
--   conditions that determine which buckets to include in the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:excludes:S3BucketCriteriaForJob'</a>,
--   <a>s3BucketCriteriaForJob_excludes</a> - The property- and tag-based
--   conditions that determine which buckets to exclude from the job.
newS3BucketCriteriaForJob :: S3BucketCriteriaForJob

-- | The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which buckets to
--   include in the job.
s3BucketCriteriaForJob_includes :: Lens' S3BucketCriteriaForJob (Maybe CriteriaBlockForJob)

-- | The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which buckets to
--   exclude from the job.
s3BucketCriteriaForJob_excludes :: Lens' S3BucketCriteriaForJob (Maybe CriteriaBlockForJob)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3BucketCriteriaForJob.S3BucketCriteriaForJob
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3BucketCriteriaForJob.S3BucketCriteriaForJob
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3BucketCriteriaForJob.S3BucketCriteriaForJob
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3BucketCriteriaForJob.S3BucketCriteriaForJob
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3BucketCriteriaForJob.S3BucketCriteriaForJob

pattern TagTarget_S3_OBJECT :: TagTarget

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagValuePair

-- | Specifies a tag key or tag key and value pair to use in a tag-based
--   condition that determines whether an S3 object is included or excluded
--   from a classification job. Tag keys and values are case sensitive.
--   Also, Amazon Macie doesn't support use of partial values or wildcard
--   characters in tag-based conditions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTagValuePair</a> smart constructor.
data TagValuePair
TagValuePair' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> TagValuePair

-- | The tag value, associated with the specified tag key (key), to use in
--   the condition. To specify only a tag key for a condition, specify the
--   tag key for the key property and set this value to an empty string.
[$sel:value:TagValuePair'] :: TagValuePair -> Maybe Text

-- | The value for the tag key to use in the condition.
[$sel:key:TagValuePair'] :: TagValuePair -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TagValuePair</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:TagValuePair'</a>, <a>tagValuePair_value</a> - The tag
--   value, associated with the specified tag key (key), to use in the
--   condition. To specify only a tag key for a condition, specify the tag
--   key for the key property and set this value to an empty string.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:TagValuePair'</a>, <a>tagValuePair_key</a> - The value for
--   the tag key to use in the condition.
newTagValuePair :: TagValuePair

-- | The tag value, associated with the specified tag key (key), to use in
--   the condition. To specify only a tag key for a condition, specify the
--   tag key for the key property and set this value to an empty string.
tagValuePair_value :: Lens' TagValuePair (Maybe Text)

-- | The value for the tag key to use in the condition.
tagValuePair_key :: Lens' TagValuePair (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagValuePair.TagValuePair
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagValuePair.TagValuePair
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagValuePair.TagValuePair
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagValuePair.TagValuePair
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagValuePair.TagValuePair
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagValuePair.TagValuePair
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagValuePair.TagValuePair
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagValuePair.TagValuePair


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagScopeTerm

-- | Specifies a tag-based condition that determines whether an S3 object
--   is included or excluded from a classification job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTagScopeTerm</a> smart constructor.
data TagScopeTerm
TagScopeTerm' :: Maybe [TagValuePair] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe JobComparator -> Maybe TagTarget -> TagScopeTerm

-- | The tag keys or tag key and value pairs to use in the condition. To
--   specify only tag keys in a condition, specify the keys in this array
--   and set the value for each associated tag value to an empty string.
[$sel:tagValues:TagScopeTerm'] :: TagScopeTerm -> Maybe [TagValuePair]

-- | The object property to use in the condition. The only valid value is
--   TAG.
[$sel:key:TagScopeTerm'] :: TagScopeTerm -> Maybe Text

-- | The operator to use in the condition. Valid values are EQ (equals) or
--   NE (not equals).
[$sel:comparator:TagScopeTerm'] :: TagScopeTerm -> Maybe JobComparator

-- | The type of object to apply the condition to.
[$sel:target:TagScopeTerm'] :: TagScopeTerm -> Maybe TagTarget

-- | Create a value of <a>TagScopeTerm</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagValues:TagScopeTerm'</a>, <a>tagScopeTerm_tagValues</a> -
--   The tag keys or tag key and value pairs to use in the condition. To
--   specify only tag keys in a condition, specify the keys in this array
--   and set the value for each associated tag value to an empty string.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:TagScopeTerm'</a>, <a>tagScopeTerm_key</a> - The object
--   property to use in the condition. The only valid value is TAG.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comparator:TagScopeTerm'</a>, <a>tagScopeTerm_comparator</a> -
--   The operator to use in the condition. Valid values are EQ (equals) or
--   NE (not equals).
--   
--   <a>$sel:target:TagScopeTerm'</a>, <a>tagScopeTerm_target</a> - The
--   type of object to apply the condition to.
newTagScopeTerm :: TagScopeTerm

-- | The tag keys or tag key and value pairs to use in the condition. To
--   specify only tag keys in a condition, specify the keys in this array
--   and set the value for each associated tag value to an empty string.
tagScopeTerm_tagValues :: Lens' TagScopeTerm (Maybe [TagValuePair])

-- | The object property to use in the condition. The only valid value is
--   TAG.
tagScopeTerm_key :: Lens' TagScopeTerm (Maybe Text)

-- | The operator to use in the condition. Valid values are EQ (equals) or
--   NE (not equals).
tagScopeTerm_comparator :: Lens' TagScopeTerm (Maybe JobComparator)

-- | The type of object to apply the condition to.
tagScopeTerm_target :: Lens' TagScopeTerm (Maybe TagTarget)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagScopeTerm.TagScopeTerm
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagScopeTerm.TagScopeTerm
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagScopeTerm.TagScopeTerm
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagScopeTerm.TagScopeTerm
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagScopeTerm.TagScopeTerm
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagScopeTerm.TagScopeTerm
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagScopeTerm.TagScopeTerm
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TagScopeTerm.TagScopeTerm


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobScopeTerm

-- | Specifies a property- or tag-based condition that defines criteria for
--   including or excluding S3 objects from a classification job. A
--   JobScopeTerm object can contain only one simpleScopeTerm object or one
--   tagScopeTerm object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobScopeTerm</a> smart constructor.
data JobScopeTerm
JobScopeTerm' :: Maybe SimpleScopeTerm -> Maybe TagScopeTerm -> JobScopeTerm

-- | A property-based condition that defines a property, operator, and one
--   or more values for including or excluding objects from the job.
[$sel:simpleScopeTerm:JobScopeTerm'] :: JobScopeTerm -> Maybe SimpleScopeTerm

-- | A tag-based condition that defines the operator and tag keys or tag
--   key and value pairs for including or excluding objects from the job.
[$sel:tagScopeTerm:JobScopeTerm'] :: JobScopeTerm -> Maybe TagScopeTerm

-- | Create a value of <a>JobScopeTerm</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:simpleScopeTerm:JobScopeTerm'</a>,
--   <a>jobScopeTerm_simpleScopeTerm</a> - A property-based condition that
--   defines a property, operator, and one or more values for including or
--   excluding objects from the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagScopeTerm:JobScopeTerm'</a>,
--   <a>jobScopeTerm_tagScopeTerm</a> - A tag-based condition that defines
--   the operator and tag keys or tag key and value pairs for including or
--   excluding objects from the job.
newJobScopeTerm :: JobScopeTerm

-- | A property-based condition that defines a property, operator, and one
--   or more values for including or excluding objects from the job.
jobScopeTerm_simpleScopeTerm :: Lens' JobScopeTerm (Maybe SimpleScopeTerm)

-- | A tag-based condition that defines the operator and tag keys or tag
--   key and value pairs for including or excluding objects from the job.
jobScopeTerm_tagScopeTerm :: Lens' JobScopeTerm (Maybe TagScopeTerm)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobScopeTerm.JobScopeTerm
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobScopeTerm.JobScopeTerm
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobScopeTerm.JobScopeTerm
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobScopeTerm.JobScopeTerm
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobScopeTerm.JobScopeTerm
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobScopeTerm.JobScopeTerm
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobScopeTerm.JobScopeTerm
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobScopeTerm.JobScopeTerm


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobScopingBlock

-- | Specifies one or more property- and tag-based conditions that define
--   criteria for including or excluding S3 objects from a classification
--   job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobScopingBlock</a> smart constructor.
data JobScopingBlock
JobScopingBlock' :: Maybe [JobScopeTerm] -> JobScopingBlock

-- | An array of conditions, one for each property- or tag-based condition
--   that determines which objects to include or exclude from the job. If
--   you specify more than one condition, Amazon Macie uses AND logic to
--   join the conditions.
[$sel:and:JobScopingBlock'] :: JobScopingBlock -> Maybe [JobScopeTerm]

-- | Create a value of <a>JobScopingBlock</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:and:JobScopingBlock'</a>, <a>jobScopingBlock_and</a> - An
--   array of conditions, one for each property- or tag-based condition
--   that determines which objects to include or exclude from the job. If
--   you specify more than one condition, Amazon Macie uses AND logic to
--   join the conditions.
newJobScopingBlock :: JobScopingBlock

-- | An array of conditions, one for each property- or tag-based condition
--   that determines which objects to include or exclude from the job. If
--   you specify more than one condition, Amazon Macie uses AND logic to
--   join the conditions.
jobScopingBlock_and :: Lens' JobScopingBlock (Maybe [JobScopeTerm])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobScopingBlock.JobScopingBlock
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobScopingBlock.JobScopingBlock
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobScopingBlock.JobScopingBlock
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobScopingBlock.JobScopingBlock
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobScopingBlock.JobScopingBlock
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobScopingBlock.JobScopingBlock
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobScopingBlock.JobScopingBlock
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobScopingBlock.JobScopingBlock


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Scoping

-- | Specifies one or more property- and tag-based conditions that define
--   criteria for including or excluding S3 objects from a classification
--   job. Exclude conditions take precedence over include conditions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScoping</a> smart constructor.
data Scoping
Scoping' :: Maybe JobScopingBlock -> Maybe JobScopingBlock -> Scoping

-- | The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which objects to
--   include in the analysis.
[$sel:includes:Scoping'] :: Scoping -> Maybe JobScopingBlock

-- | The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which objects to
--   exclude from the analysis.
[$sel:excludes:Scoping'] :: Scoping -> Maybe JobScopingBlock

-- | Create a value of <a>Scoping</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:includes:Scoping'</a>, <a>scoping_includes</a> - The property-
--   and tag-based conditions that determine which objects to include in
--   the analysis.
--   
--   <a>$sel:excludes:Scoping'</a>, <a>scoping_excludes</a> - The property-
--   and tag-based conditions that determine which objects to exclude from
--   the analysis.
newScoping :: Scoping

-- | The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which objects to
--   include in the analysis.
scoping_includes :: Lens' Scoping (Maybe JobScopingBlock)

-- | The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which objects to
--   exclude from the analysis.
scoping_excludes :: Lens' Scoping (Maybe JobScopingBlock)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Scoping.Scoping
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Scoping.Scoping
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Scoping.Scoping
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Scoping.Scoping
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Scoping.Scoping
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Scoping.Scoping
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Scoping.Scoping
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Scoping.Scoping


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3JobDefinition

-- | Specifies which S3 buckets contain the objects that a classification
--   job analyzes, and the scope of that analysis. The bucket specification
--   can be static (bucketDefinitions) or dynamic (bucketCriteria). If it's
--   static, the job analyzes objects in the same predefined set of buckets
--   each time the job runs. If it's dynamic, the job analyzes objects in
--   any buckets that match the specified criteria each time the job starts
--   to run.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3JobDefinition</a> smart constructor.
data S3JobDefinition
S3JobDefinition' :: Maybe Scoping -> Maybe S3BucketCriteriaForJob -> Maybe [S3BucketDefinitionForJob] -> S3JobDefinition

-- | The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which S3 objects
--   to include or exclude from the analysis. Each time the job runs, the
--   job uses these criteria to determine which objects to analyze.
[$sel:scoping:S3JobDefinition'] :: S3JobDefinition -> Maybe Scoping

-- | The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which S3 buckets
--   to include or exclude from the analysis. Each time the job runs, the
--   job uses these criteria to determine which buckets contain objects to
--   analyze. A job's definition can contain a bucketCriteria object or a
--   bucketDefinitions array, not both.
[$sel:bucketCriteria:S3JobDefinition'] :: S3JobDefinition -> Maybe S3BucketCriteriaForJob

-- | An array of objects, one for each Amazon Web Services account that
--   owns specific S3 buckets to analyze. Each object specifies the account
--   ID for an account and one or more buckets to analyze for that account.
--   A job's definition can contain a bucketDefinitions array or a
--   bucketCriteria object, not both.
[$sel:bucketDefinitions:S3JobDefinition'] :: S3JobDefinition -> Maybe [S3BucketDefinitionForJob]

-- | Create a value of <a>S3JobDefinition</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:scoping:S3JobDefinition'</a>, <a>s3JobDefinition_scoping</a> -
--   The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which S3 objects
--   to include or exclude from the analysis. Each time the job runs, the
--   job uses these criteria to determine which objects to analyze.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketCriteria:S3JobDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>s3JobDefinition_bucketCriteria</a> - The property- and tag-based
--   conditions that determine which S3 buckets to include or exclude from
--   the analysis. Each time the job runs, the job uses these criteria to
--   determine which buckets contain objects to analyze. A job's definition
--   can contain a bucketCriteria object or a bucketDefinitions array, not
--   both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketDefinitions:S3JobDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>s3JobDefinition_bucketDefinitions</a> - An array of objects, one
--   for each Amazon Web Services account that owns specific S3 buckets to
--   analyze. Each object specifies the account ID for an account and one
--   or more buckets to analyze for that account. A job's definition can
--   contain a bucketDefinitions array or a bucketCriteria object, not
--   both.
newS3JobDefinition :: S3JobDefinition

-- | The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which S3 objects
--   to include or exclude from the analysis. Each time the job runs, the
--   job uses these criteria to determine which objects to analyze.
s3JobDefinition_scoping :: Lens' S3JobDefinition (Maybe Scoping)

-- | The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which S3 buckets
--   to include or exclude from the analysis. Each time the job runs, the
--   job uses these criteria to determine which buckets contain objects to
--   analyze. A job's definition can contain a bucketCriteria object or a
--   bucketDefinitions array, not both.
s3JobDefinition_bucketCriteria :: Lens' S3JobDefinition (Maybe S3BucketCriteriaForJob)

-- | An array of objects, one for each Amazon Web Services account that
--   owns specific S3 buckets to analyze. Each object specifies the account
--   ID for an account and one or more buckets to analyze for that account.
--   A job's definition can contain a bucketDefinitions array or a
--   bucketCriteria object, not both.
s3JobDefinition_bucketDefinitions :: Lens' S3JobDefinition (Maybe [S3BucketDefinitionForJob])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3JobDefinition.S3JobDefinition
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3JobDefinition.S3JobDefinition
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3JobDefinition.S3JobDefinition
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3JobDefinition.S3JobDefinition
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3JobDefinition.S3JobDefinition
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3JobDefinition.S3JobDefinition
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3JobDefinition.S3JobDefinition
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.S3JobDefinition.S3JobDefinition


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TimeRange

-- | An inclusive time period that Amazon Macie usage data applies to.
--   Possible values are:
newtype TimeRange
TimeRange' :: Text -> TimeRange
[fromTimeRange] :: TimeRange -> Text
pattern TimeRange_MONTH_TO_DATE :: TimeRange
pattern TimeRange_PAST_30_DAYS :: TimeRange
instance Amazonka.Data.XML.ToXML Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance Amazonka.Data.XML.FromXML Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance Amazonka.Data.Query.ToQuery Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance Amazonka.Data.Headers.ToHeader Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance Amazonka.Data.Log.ToLog Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance Amazonka.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance Amazonka.Data.Text.ToText Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance Amazonka.Data.Text.FromText Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Type

Type' :: Text -> Type
[fromType] :: Type -> Text
pattern Type_AES256 :: Type
pattern Type_Aws_kms :: Type
pattern Type_NONE :: Type

instance Amazonka.Data.XML.FromXML Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Type.Type

instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Type.Type


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketServerSideEncryption

-- | Provides information about the default server-side encryption settings
--   for an S3 bucket. For detailed information about these settings, see
--   <a>Setting default server-side encryption behavior for Amazon S3
--   buckets</a> in the <i>Amazon Simple Storage Service User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucketServerSideEncryption</a> smart constructor.
data BucketServerSideEncryption
BucketServerSideEncryption' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Type -> BucketServerSideEncryption

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or unique identifier (key ID) for the
--   KMS key that's used by default to encrypt objects that are added to
--   the bucket. This value is null if the bucket uses an Amazon S3 managed
--   key to encrypt new objects or the bucket doesn't encrypt new objects
--   by default.
[$sel:kmsMasterKeyId:BucketServerSideEncryption'] :: BucketServerSideEncryption -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of server-side encryption that's used by default when storing
--   new objects in the bucket. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AES256 - New objects are encrypted with an Amazon S3 managed key.
--   They use SSE-S3 encryption.</li>
--   <li>aws:kms - New objects are encrypted with an KMS key
--   (kmsMasterKeyId), either an Amazon Web Services managed key or a
--   customer managed key. They use SSE-KMS encryption.</li>
--   <li>NONE - New objects aren't encrypted by default. Default encryption
--   is disabled for the bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:type':BucketServerSideEncryption'] :: BucketServerSideEncryption -> Maybe Type

-- | Create a value of <a>BucketServerSideEncryption</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsMasterKeyId:BucketServerSideEncryption'</a>,
--   <a>bucketServerSideEncryption_kmsMasterKeyId</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) or unique identifier (key ID) for the KMS key that's used
--   by default to encrypt objects that are added to the bucket. This value
--   is null if the bucket uses an Amazon S3 managed key to encrypt new
--   objects or the bucket doesn't encrypt new objects by default.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':BucketServerSideEncryption'</a>,
--   <a>bucketServerSideEncryption_type</a> - The type of server-side
--   encryption that's used by default when storing new objects in the
--   bucket. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AES256 - New objects are encrypted with an Amazon S3 managed key.
--   They use SSE-S3 encryption.</li>
--   <li>aws:kms - New objects are encrypted with an KMS key
--   (kmsMasterKeyId), either an Amazon Web Services managed key or a
--   customer managed key. They use SSE-KMS encryption.</li>
--   <li>NONE - New objects aren't encrypted by default. Default encryption
--   is disabled for the bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
newBucketServerSideEncryption :: BucketServerSideEncryption

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or unique identifier (key ID) for the
--   KMS key that's used by default to encrypt objects that are added to
--   the bucket. This value is null if the bucket uses an Amazon S3 managed
--   key to encrypt new objects or the bucket doesn't encrypt new objects
--   by default.
bucketServerSideEncryption_kmsMasterKeyId :: Lens' BucketServerSideEncryption (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of server-side encryption that's used by default when storing
--   new objects in the bucket. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AES256 - New objects are encrypted with an Amazon S3 managed key.
--   They use SSE-S3 encryption.</li>
--   <li>aws:kms - New objects are encrypted with an KMS key
--   (kmsMasterKeyId), either an Amazon Web Services managed key or a
--   customer managed key. They use SSE-KMS encryption.</li>
--   <li>NONE - New objects aren't encrypted by default. Default encryption
--   is disabled for the bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
bucketServerSideEncryption_type :: Lens' BucketServerSideEncryption (Maybe Type)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketServerSideEncryption.BucketServerSideEncryption
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketServerSideEncryption.BucketServerSideEncryption
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketServerSideEncryption.BucketServerSideEncryption
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketServerSideEncryption.BucketServerSideEncryption
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketServerSideEncryption.BucketServerSideEncryption
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketServerSideEncryption.BucketServerSideEncryption
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketServerSideEncryption.BucketServerSideEncryption


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketMetadata

-- | Provides statistical data and other information about an S3 bucket
--   that Amazon Macie monitors and analyzes for your account. If an error
--   occurs when Macie attempts to retrieve and process information about
--   the bucket or the bucket's objects, the value for most of these
--   properties is null. Exceptions are accountId, bucketArn,
--   bucketCreatedAt, bucketName, lastUpdated, and region. To identify the
--   cause of the error, refer to the errorCode and errorMessage values.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucketMetadata</a> smart constructor.
data BucketMetadata
BucketMetadata' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ObjectCountByEncryptionType -> Maybe SharedAccess -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ObjectLevelStatistics -> Maybe ObjectLevelStatistics -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe AllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads -> Maybe BucketPublicAccess -> Maybe BucketMetadataErrorCode -> Maybe JobDetails -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe ReplicationDetails -> Maybe BucketServerSideEncryption -> Maybe [KeyValuePair] -> Maybe Integer -> BucketMetadata

-- | The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that are compressed
--   (.gz, .gzip, .zip) files in the bucket.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Amazon Macie calculates this
--   value based on the size of the latest version of each applicable
--   object in the bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of
--   all versions of each applicable object in the bucket.
[$sel:sizeInBytesCompressed:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe Integer

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when Amazon
--   Macie most recently retrieved both bucket and object metadata from
--   Amazon S3 for the bucket.
[$sel:lastUpdated:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The total number of objects that are in the bucket, grouped by
--   server-side encryption type. This includes a grouping that reports the
--   total number of objects that aren't encrypted or use client-side
--   encryption.
[$sel:objectCountByEncryptionType:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe ObjectCountByEncryptionType

-- | Specifies whether the bucket is shared with another Amazon Web
--   Services account. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>EXTERNAL - The bucket is shared with an Amazon Web Services
--   account that isn't part of the same Amazon Macie organization.</li>
--   <li>INTERNAL - The bucket is shared with an Amazon Web Services
--   account that's part of the same Amazon Macie organization.</li>
--   <li>NOT_SHARED - The bucket isn't shared with other Amazon Web
--   Services accounts.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie wasn't able to evaluate the shared access
--   settings for the bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:sharedAccess:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe SharedAccess

-- | The total storage size, in bytes, of the bucket.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Amazon Macie calculates this
--   value based on the size of the latest version of each object in the
--   bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all versions of
--   each object in the bucket.
[$sel:sizeInBytes:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe Integer

-- | The name of the bucket.
[$sel:bucketName:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of objects that Amazon Macie can analyze in the
--   bucket. These objects use a supported storage class and have a file
--   name extension for a supported file or storage format.
[$sel:classifiableObjectCount:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe Integer

-- | The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns
--   the bucket.
[$sel:accountId:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that Amazon Macie
--   can't analyze in the bucket. These objects don't use a supported
--   storage class or don't have a file name extension for a supported file
--   or storage format.
[$sel:unclassifiableObjectSizeInBytes:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe ObjectLevelStatistics

-- | The total number of objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze in the
--   bucket. These objects don't use a supported storage class or don't
--   have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.
[$sel:unclassifiableObjectCount:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe ObjectLevelStatistics

-- | Specifies whether versioning is enabled for the bucket.
[$sel:versioning:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether the bucket policy for the bucket requires
--   server-side encryption of objects when objects are uploaded to the
--   bucket. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>FALSE - The bucket policy requires server-side encryption of new
--   objects. PutObject requests must include the
--   x-amz-server-side-encryption header and the value for that header must
--   be AES256 or aws:kms.</li>
--   <li>TRUE - The bucket doesn't have a bucket policy or it has a bucket
--   policy that doesn't require server-side encryption of new objects. If
--   a bucket policy exists, it doesn't require PutObject requests to
--   include the x-amz-server-side-encryption header and it doesn't require
--   the value for that header to be AES256 or aws:kms.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie can't determine whether the bucket policy
--   requires server-side encryption of new objects.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:allowsUnencryptedObjectUploads:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe AllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads

-- | Specifies whether the bucket is publicly accessible due to the
--   combination of permissions settings that apply to the bucket, and
--   provides information about those settings.
[$sel:publicAccess:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe BucketPublicAccess

-- | Specifies the error code for an error that prevented Amazon Macie from
--   retrieving and processing information about the bucket and the
--   bucket's objects. If this value is ACCESS_DENIED, Macie doesn't have
--   permission to retrieve the information. For example, the bucket has a
--   restrictive bucket policy and Amazon S3 denied the request. If this
--   value is null, Macie was able to retrieve and process the information.
[$sel:errorCode:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe BucketMetadataErrorCode

-- | Specifies whether any one-time or recurring classification jobs are
--   configured to analyze data in the bucket, and, if so, the details of
--   the job that ran most recently.
[$sel:jobDetails:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe JobDetails

-- | The Amazon Web Services Region that hosts the bucket.
[$sel:region:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the
--   bucket was created.
[$sel:bucketCreatedAt:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A brief description of the error (errorCode) that prevented Amazon
--   Macie from retrieving and processing information about the bucket and
--   the bucket's objects. This value is null if Macie was able to retrieve
--   and process the information.
[$sel:errorMessage:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket.
[$sel:bucketArn:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of objects in the bucket.
[$sel:objectCount:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe Integer

-- | Specifies whether the bucket is configured to replicate one or more
--   objects to buckets for other Amazon Web Services accounts and, if so,
--   which accounts.
[$sel:replicationDetails:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe ReplicationDetails

-- | Specifies whether the bucket encrypts new objects by default and, if
--   so, the type of server-side encryption that's used.
[$sel:serverSideEncryption:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe BucketServerSideEncryption

-- | An array that specifies the tags (keys and values) that are associated
--   with the bucket.
[$sel:tags:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe [KeyValuePair]

-- | The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that Amazon Macie can
--   analyze in the bucket. These objects use a supported storage class and
--   have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Macie calculates this value
--   based on the size of the latest version of each applicable object in
--   the bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all
--   versions of each applicable object in the bucket.
[$sel:classifiableSizeInBytes:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>BucketMetadata</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInBytesCompressed:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_sizeInBytesCompressed</a> - The total storage size,
--   in bytes, of the objects that are compressed (.gz, .gzip, .zip) files
--   in the bucket.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Amazon Macie calculates this
--   value based on the size of the latest version of each applicable
--   object in the bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of
--   all versions of each applicable object in the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdated:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_lastUpdated</a> - The date and time, in UTC and
--   extended ISO 8601 format, when Amazon Macie most recently retrieved
--   both bucket and object metadata from Amazon S3 for the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectCountByEncryptionType:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_objectCountByEncryptionType</a> - The total number
--   of objects that are in the bucket, grouped by server-side encryption
--   type. This includes a grouping that reports the total number of
--   objects that aren't encrypted or use client-side encryption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sharedAccess:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_sharedAccess</a> - Specifies whether the bucket is
--   shared with another Amazon Web Services account. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>EXTERNAL - The bucket is shared with an Amazon Web Services
--   account that isn't part of the same Amazon Macie organization.</li>
--   <li>INTERNAL - The bucket is shared with an Amazon Web Services
--   account that's part of the same Amazon Macie organization.</li>
--   <li>NOT_SHARED - The bucket isn't shared with other Amazon Web
--   Services accounts.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie wasn't able to evaluate the shared access
--   settings for the bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInBytes:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_sizeInBytes</a> - The total storage size, in bytes,
--   of the bucket.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Amazon Macie calculates this
--   value based on the size of the latest version of each object in the
--   bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all versions of
--   each object in the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_bucketName</a> - The name of the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:classifiableObjectCount:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_classifiableObjectCount</a> - The total number of
--   objects that Amazon Macie can analyze in the bucket. These objects use
--   a supported storage class and have a file name extension for a
--   supported file or storage format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:BucketMetadata'</a>, <a>bucketMetadata_accountId</a>
--   - The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns
--   the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unclassifiableObjectSizeInBytes:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_unclassifiableObjectSizeInBytes</a> - The total
--   storage size, in bytes, of the objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze
--   in the bucket. These objects don't use a supported storage class or
--   don't have a file name extension for a supported file or storage
--   format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unclassifiableObjectCount:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_unclassifiableObjectCount</a> - The total number of
--   objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze in the bucket. These objects
--   don't use a supported storage class or don't have a file name
--   extension for a supported file or storage format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:versioning:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_versioning</a> - Specifies whether versioning is
--   enabled for the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowsUnencryptedObjectUploads:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_allowsUnencryptedObjectUploads</a> - Specifies
--   whether the bucket policy for the bucket requires server-side
--   encryption of objects when objects are uploaded to the bucket.
--   Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>FALSE - The bucket policy requires server-side encryption of new
--   objects. PutObject requests must include the
--   x-amz-server-side-encryption header and the value for that header must
--   be AES256 or aws:kms.</li>
--   <li>TRUE - The bucket doesn't have a bucket policy or it has a bucket
--   policy that doesn't require server-side encryption of new objects. If
--   a bucket policy exists, it doesn't require PutObject requests to
--   include the x-amz-server-side-encryption header and it doesn't require
--   the value for that header to be AES256 or aws:kms.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie can't determine whether the bucket policy
--   requires server-side encryption of new objects.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicAccess:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_publicAccess</a> - Specifies whether the bucket is
--   publicly accessible due to the combination of permissions settings
--   that apply to the bucket, and provides information about those
--   settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorCode:BucketMetadata'</a>, <a>bucketMetadata_errorCode</a>
--   - Specifies the error code for an error that prevented Amazon Macie
--   from retrieving and processing information about the bucket and the
--   bucket's objects. If this value is ACCESS_DENIED, Macie doesn't have
--   permission to retrieve the information. For example, the bucket has a
--   restrictive bucket policy and Amazon S3 denied the request. If this
--   value is null, Macie was able to retrieve and process the information.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobDetails:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_jobDetails</a> - Specifies whether any one-time or
--   recurring classification jobs are configured to analyze data in the
--   bucket, and, if so, the details of the job that ran most recently.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:BucketMetadata'</a>, <a>bucketMetadata_region</a> - The
--   Amazon Web Services Region that hosts the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketCreatedAt:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_bucketCreatedAt</a> - The date and time, in UTC and
--   extended ISO 8601 format, when the bucket was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorMessage:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_errorMessage</a> - A brief description of the error
--   (errorCode) that prevented Amazon Macie from retrieving and processing
--   information about the bucket and the bucket's objects. This value is
--   null if Macie was able to retrieve and process the information.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketArn:BucketMetadata'</a>, <a>bucketMetadata_bucketArn</a>
--   - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectCount:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_objectCount</a> - The total number of objects in the
--   bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationDetails:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_replicationDetails</a> - Specifies whether the
--   bucket is configured to replicate one or more objects to buckets for
--   other Amazon Web Services accounts and, if so, which accounts.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverSideEncryption:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_serverSideEncryption</a> - Specifies whether the
--   bucket encrypts new objects by default and, if so, the type of
--   server-side encryption that's used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:BucketMetadata'</a>, <a>bucketMetadata_tags</a> - An
--   array that specifies the tags (keys and values) that are associated
--   with the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:classifiableSizeInBytes:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_classifiableSizeInBytes</a> - The total storage
--   size, in bytes, of the objects that Amazon Macie can analyze in the
--   bucket. These objects use a supported storage class and have a file
--   name extension for a supported file or storage format.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Macie calculates this value
--   based on the size of the latest version of each applicable object in
--   the bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all
--   versions of each applicable object in the bucket.
newBucketMetadata :: BucketMetadata

-- | The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that are compressed
--   (.gz, .gzip, .zip) files in the bucket.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Amazon Macie calculates this
--   value based on the size of the latest version of each applicable
--   object in the bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of
--   all versions of each applicable object in the bucket.
bucketMetadata_sizeInBytesCompressed :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe Integer)

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when Amazon
--   Macie most recently retrieved both bucket and object metadata from
--   Amazon S3 for the bucket.
bucketMetadata_lastUpdated :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The total number of objects that are in the bucket, grouped by
--   server-side encryption type. This includes a grouping that reports the
--   total number of objects that aren't encrypted or use client-side
--   encryption.
bucketMetadata_objectCountByEncryptionType :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe ObjectCountByEncryptionType)

-- | Specifies whether the bucket is shared with another Amazon Web
--   Services account. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>EXTERNAL - The bucket is shared with an Amazon Web Services
--   account that isn't part of the same Amazon Macie organization.</li>
--   <li>INTERNAL - The bucket is shared with an Amazon Web Services
--   account that's part of the same Amazon Macie organization.</li>
--   <li>NOT_SHARED - The bucket isn't shared with other Amazon Web
--   Services accounts.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie wasn't able to evaluate the shared access
--   settings for the bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
bucketMetadata_sharedAccess :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe SharedAccess)

-- | The total storage size, in bytes, of the bucket.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Amazon Macie calculates this
--   value based on the size of the latest version of each object in the
--   bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all versions of
--   each object in the bucket.
bucketMetadata_sizeInBytes :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe Integer)

-- | The name of the bucket.
bucketMetadata_bucketName :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of objects that Amazon Macie can analyze in the
--   bucket. These objects use a supported storage class and have a file
--   name extension for a supported file or storage format.
bucketMetadata_classifiableObjectCount :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe Integer)

-- | The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns
--   the bucket.
bucketMetadata_accountId :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that Amazon Macie
--   can't analyze in the bucket. These objects don't use a supported
--   storage class or don't have a file name extension for a supported file
--   or storage format.
bucketMetadata_unclassifiableObjectSizeInBytes :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe ObjectLevelStatistics)

-- | The total number of objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze in the
--   bucket. These objects don't use a supported storage class or don't
--   have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.
bucketMetadata_unclassifiableObjectCount :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe ObjectLevelStatistics)

-- | Specifies whether versioning is enabled for the bucket.
bucketMetadata_versioning :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether the bucket policy for the bucket requires
--   server-side encryption of objects when objects are uploaded to the
--   bucket. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>FALSE - The bucket policy requires server-side encryption of new
--   objects. PutObject requests must include the
--   x-amz-server-side-encryption header and the value for that header must
--   be AES256 or aws:kms.</li>
--   <li>TRUE - The bucket doesn't have a bucket policy or it has a bucket
--   policy that doesn't require server-side encryption of new objects. If
--   a bucket policy exists, it doesn't require PutObject requests to
--   include the x-amz-server-side-encryption header and it doesn't require
--   the value for that header to be AES256 or aws:kms.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie can't determine whether the bucket policy
--   requires server-side encryption of new objects.</li>
--   </ul>
bucketMetadata_allowsUnencryptedObjectUploads :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe AllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads)

-- | Specifies whether the bucket is publicly accessible due to the
--   combination of permissions settings that apply to the bucket, and
--   provides information about those settings.
bucketMetadata_publicAccess :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe BucketPublicAccess)

-- | Specifies the error code for an error that prevented Amazon Macie from
--   retrieving and processing information about the bucket and the
--   bucket's objects. If this value is ACCESS_DENIED, Macie doesn't have
--   permission to retrieve the information. For example, the bucket has a
--   restrictive bucket policy and Amazon S3 denied the request. If this
--   value is null, Macie was able to retrieve and process the information.
bucketMetadata_errorCode :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe BucketMetadataErrorCode)

-- | Specifies whether any one-time or recurring classification jobs are
--   configured to analyze data in the bucket, and, if so, the details of
--   the job that ran most recently.
bucketMetadata_jobDetails :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe JobDetails)

-- | The Amazon Web Services Region that hosts the bucket.
bucketMetadata_region :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the
--   bucket was created.
bucketMetadata_bucketCreatedAt :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A brief description of the error (errorCode) that prevented Amazon
--   Macie from retrieving and processing information about the bucket and
--   the bucket's objects. This value is null if Macie was able to retrieve
--   and process the information.
bucketMetadata_errorMessage :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket.
bucketMetadata_bucketArn :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of objects in the bucket.
bucketMetadata_objectCount :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe Integer)

-- | Specifies whether the bucket is configured to replicate one or more
--   objects to buckets for other Amazon Web Services accounts and, if so,
--   which accounts.
bucketMetadata_replicationDetails :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe ReplicationDetails)

-- | Specifies whether the bucket encrypts new objects by default and, if
--   so, the type of server-side encryption that's used.
bucketMetadata_serverSideEncryption :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe BucketServerSideEncryption)

-- | An array that specifies the tags (keys and values) that are associated
--   with the bucket.
bucketMetadata_tags :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe [KeyValuePair])

-- | The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that Amazon Macie can
--   analyze in the bucket. These objects use a supported storage class and
--   have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Macie calculates this value
--   based on the size of the latest version of each applicable object in
--   the bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all
--   versions of each applicable object in the bucket.
bucketMetadata_classifiableSizeInBytes :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe Integer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketMetadata.BucketMetadata
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketMetadata.BucketMetadata
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketMetadata.BucketMetadata
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketMetadata.BucketMetadata
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketMetadata.BucketMetadata
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketMetadata.BucketMetadata
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.BucketMetadata.BucketMetadata

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UsageStatisticsFilter

-- | Specifies a condition for filtering the results of a query for quota
--   and usage data for one or more Amazon Macie accounts.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUsageStatisticsFilter</a> smart constructor.
data UsageStatisticsFilter
UsageStatisticsFilter' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe UsageStatisticsFilterKey -> Maybe UsageStatisticsFilterComparator -> UsageStatisticsFilter

-- | An array that lists values to use in the condition, based on the value
--   for the field specified by the key property. If the value for the key
--   property is accountId, this array can specify multiple values.
--   Otherwise, this array can specify only one value.
--   
--   Valid values for each supported field are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>accountId - The unique identifier for an Amazon Web Services
--   account.</li>
--   <li>freeTrialStartDate - The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO
--   8601 format, when the free trial started for an account.</li>
--   <li>serviceLimit - A Boolean (true or false) value that indicates
--   whether an account has reached its monthly quota.</li>
--   <li>total - A string that represents the current estimated cost for an
--   account.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:values:UsageStatisticsFilter'] :: UsageStatisticsFilter -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The field to use in the condition.
[$sel:key:UsageStatisticsFilter'] :: UsageStatisticsFilter -> Maybe UsageStatisticsFilterKey

-- | The operator to use in the condition. If the value for the key
--   property is accountId, this value must be CONTAINS. If the value for
--   the key property is any other supported field, this value can be EQ,
--   GT, GTE, LT, LTE, or NE.
[$sel:comparator:UsageStatisticsFilter'] :: UsageStatisticsFilter -> Maybe UsageStatisticsFilterComparator

-- | Create a value of <a>UsageStatisticsFilter</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:UsageStatisticsFilter'</a>,
--   <a>usageStatisticsFilter_values</a> - An array that lists values to
--   use in the condition, based on the value for the field specified by
--   the key property. If the value for the key property is accountId, this
--   array can specify multiple values. Otherwise, this array can specify
--   only one value.
--   
--   Valid values for each supported field are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>accountId - The unique identifier for an Amazon Web Services
--   account.</li>
--   <li>freeTrialStartDate - The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO
--   8601 format, when the free trial started for an account.</li>
--   <li>serviceLimit - A Boolean (true or false) value that indicates
--   whether an account has reached its monthly quota.</li>
--   <li>total - A string that represents the current estimated cost for an
--   account.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:UsageStatisticsFilter'</a>,
--   <a>usageStatisticsFilter_key</a> - The field to use in the condition.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comparator:UsageStatisticsFilter'</a>,
--   <a>usageStatisticsFilter_comparator</a> - The operator to use in the
--   condition. If the value for the key property is accountId, this value
--   must be CONTAINS. If the value for the key property is any other
--   supported field, this value can be EQ, GT, GTE, LT, LTE, or NE.
newUsageStatisticsFilter :: UsageStatisticsFilter

-- | An array that lists values to use in the condition, based on the value
--   for the field specified by the key property. If the value for the key

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UsageTotal

-- | Provides aggregated data for an Amazon Macie usage metric. The value
--   for the metric reports estimated usage data for an account for the
--   preceding 30 days or the current calendar month to date, depending on
--   the time period (timeRange) specified in the request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUsageTotal</a> smart constructor.
data UsageTotal
UsageTotal' :: Maybe Currency -> Maybe UsageType -> Maybe Text -> UsageTotal

-- | The type of currency that the value for the metric (estimatedCost) is
--   reported in.
[$sel:currency:UsageTotal'] :: UsageTotal -> Maybe Currency

-- | The name of the metric. Possible values are:
--   DATA_INVENTORY_EVALUATION, for monitoring S3 buckets; and,
--   SENSITIVE_DATA_DISCOVERY, for analyzing S3 objects to detect sensitive
--   data.
[$sel:type':UsageTotal'] :: UsageTotal -> Maybe UsageType

-- | The estimated value for the metric.
[$sel:estimatedCost:UsageTotal'] :: UsageTotal -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UsageTotal</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:currency:UsageTotal'</a>, <a>usageTotal_currency</a> - The
--   type of currency that the value for the metric (estimatedCost) is
--   reported in.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':UsageTotal'</a>, <a>usageTotal_type</a> - The name of
--   the metric. Possible values are: DATA_INVENTORY_EVALUATION, for
--   monitoring S3 buckets; and, SENSITIVE_DATA_DISCOVERY, for analyzing S3
--   objects to detect sensitive data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:estimatedCost:UsageTotal'</a>, <a>usageTotal_estimatedCost</a>
--   - The estimated value for the metric.
newUsageTotal :: UsageTotal

-- | The type of currency that the value for the metric (estimatedCost) is
--   reported in.
usageTotal_currency :: Lens' UsageTotal (Maybe Currency)

-- | The name of the metric. Possible values are:
--   DATA_INVENTORY_EVALUATION, for monitoring S3 buckets; and,
--   SENSITIVE_DATA_DISCOVERY, for analyzing S3 objects to detect sensitive
--   data.
usageTotal_type :: Lens' UsageTotal (Maybe UsageType)

-- | The estimated value for the metric.
usageTotal_estimatedCost :: Lens' UsageTotal (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UsageTotal.UsageTotal
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UsageTotal.UsageTotal
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UsageTotal.UsageTotal
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UsageTotal.UsageTotal
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UsageTotal.UsageTotal
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UsageTotal.UsageTotal
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UsageTotal.UsageTotal


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UsageByAccount

-- | Provides data for a specific usage metric and the corresponding quota
--   for an Amazon Macie account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUsageByAccount</a> smart constructor.
data UsageByAccount
UsageByAccount' :: Maybe ServiceLimit -> Maybe Currency -> Maybe UsageType -> Maybe Text -> UsageByAccount

-- | The current value for the quota that corresponds to the metric
--   specified by the type field.
[$sel:serviceLimit:UsageByAccount'] :: UsageByAccount -> Maybe ServiceLimit

-- | The type of currency that the value for the metric (estimatedCost) is
--   reported in.
[$sel:currency:UsageByAccount'] :: UsageByAccount -> Maybe Currency

-- | The name of the metric. Possible values are:
--   DATA_INVENTORY_EVALUATION, for monitoring S3 buckets; and,
--   SENSITIVE_DATA_DISCOVERY, for analyzing S3 objects to detect sensitive
--   data.
[$sel:type':UsageByAccount'] :: UsageByAccount -> Maybe UsageType

-- | The estimated value for the metric.
[$sel:estimatedCost:UsageByAccount'] :: UsageByAccount -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UsageByAccount</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceLimit:UsageByAccount'</a>,
--   <a>usageByAccount_serviceLimit</a> - The current value for the quota
--   that corresponds to the metric specified by the type field.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currency:UsageByAccount'</a>, <a>usageByAccount_currency</a> -
--   The type of currency that the value for the metric (estimatedCost) is
--   reported in.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':UsageByAccount'</a>, <a>usageByAccount_type</a> - The
--   name of the metric. Possible values are: DATA_INVENTORY_EVALUATION,
--   for monitoring S3 buckets; and, SENSITIVE_DATA_DISCOVERY, for
--   analyzing S3 objects to detect sensitive data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:estimatedCost:UsageByAccount'</a>,
--   <a>usageByAccount_estimatedCost</a> - The estimated value for the
--   metric.
newUsageByAccount :: UsageByAccount

-- | The current value for the quota that corresponds to the metric
--   specified by the type field.
usageByAccount_serviceLimit :: Lens' UsageByAccount (Maybe ServiceLimit)

-- | The type of currency that the value for the metric (estimatedCost) is
--   reported in.
usageByAccount_currency :: Lens' UsageByAccount (Maybe Currency)

-- | The name of the metric. Possible values are:
--   DATA_INVENTORY_EVALUATION, for monitoring S3 buckets; and,
--   SENSITIVE_DATA_DISCOVERY, for analyzing S3 objects to detect sensitive
--   data.
usageByAccount_type :: Lens' UsageByAccount (Maybe UsageType)

-- | The estimated value for the metric.
usageByAccount_estimatedCost :: Lens' UsageByAccount (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UsageByAccount.UsageByAccount
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UsageByAccount.UsageByAccount
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UsageByAccount.UsageByAccount
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UsageByAccount.UsageByAccount

instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UsageByAccount.UsageByAccount
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UsageByAccount.UsageByAccount


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UsageRecord

-- | Provides quota and aggregated usage data for an Amazon Macie account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUsageRecord</a> smart constructor.
data UsageRecord
UsageRecord' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe [UsageByAccount] -> UsageRecord

-- | The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that the
--   data applies to.
[$sel:accountId:UsageRecord'] :: UsageRecord -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the free
--   trial started for the account.
[$sel:freeTrialStartDate:UsageRecord'] :: UsageRecord -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An array of objects that contains usage data and quotas for the
--   account. Each object contains the data for a specific usage metric and
--   the corresponding quota.
[$sel:usage:UsageRecord'] :: UsageRecord -> Maybe [UsageByAccount]

-- | Create a value of <a>UsageRecord</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:UsageRecord'</a>, <a>usageRecord_accountId</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that the data
--   applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:freeTrialStartDate:UsageRecord'</a>,
--   <a>usageRecord_freeTrialStartDate</a> - The date and time, in UTC and
--   extended ISO 8601 format, when the free trial started for the account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:usage:UsageRecord'</a>, <a>usageRecord_usage</a> - An array of
--   objects that contains usage data and quotas for the account. Each
--   object contains the data for a specific usage metric and the
--   corresponding quota.
newUsageRecord :: UsageRecord

-- | The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that the
--   data applies to.
usageRecord_accountId :: Lens' UsageRecord (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the free
--   trial started for the account.
usageRecord_freeTrialStartDate :: Lens' UsageRecord (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An array of objects that contains usage data and quotas for the
--   account. Each object contains the data for a specific usage metric and
--   the corresponding quota.
usageRecord_usage :: Lens' UsageRecord (Maybe [UsageByAccount])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UsageRecord.UsageRecord
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UsageRecord.UsageRecord
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UsageRecord.UsageRecord
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UsageRecord.UsageRecord
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UsageRecord.UsageRecord
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UsageRecord.UsageRecord
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UsageRecord.UsageRecord


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UserIdentityRoot

-- | Provides information about an Amazon Web Services account and entity
--   that performed an action on an affected resource. The action was
--   performed using the credentials for your Amazon Web Services account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUserIdentityRoot</a> smart constructor.
data UserIdentityRoot
UserIdentityRoot' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> UserIdentityRoot

-- | The unique identifier for the entity that performed the action.
[$sel:principalId:UserIdentityRoot'] :: UserIdentityRoot -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the principal that performed the
--   action. The last section of the ARN contains the name of the user or
--   role that performed the action.
[$sel:arn:UserIdentityRoot'] :: UserIdentityRoot -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account.
[$sel:accountId:UserIdentityRoot'] :: UserIdentityRoot -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UserIdentityRoot</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:principalId:UserIdentityRoot'</a>,
--   <a>userIdentityRoot_principalId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   entity that performed the action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:UserIdentityRoot'</a>, <a>userIdentityRoot_arn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the principal that performed the action.
--   The last section of the ARN contains the name of the user or role that
--   performed the action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:UserIdentityRoot'</a>,
--   <a>userIdentityRoot_accountId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   Amazon Web Services account.
newUserIdentityRoot :: UserIdentityRoot

-- | The unique identifier for the entity that performed the action.
userIdentityRoot_principalId :: Lens' UserIdentityRoot (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the principal that performed the
--   action. The last section of the ARN contains the name of the user or
--   role that performed the action.
userIdentityRoot_arn :: Lens' UserIdentityRoot (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account.
userIdentityRoot_accountId :: Lens' UserIdentityRoot (Maybe Text)
