module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UserIdentity

-- | Provides information about the type and other characteristics of an
--   entity that performed an action on an affected resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUserIdentity</a> smart constructor.
data UserIdentity
UserIdentity' :: Maybe IamUser -> Maybe UserIdentityRoot -> Maybe AwsAccount -> Maybe AssumedRole -> Maybe FederatedUser -> Maybe AwsService -> Maybe UserIdentityType -> UserIdentity

-- | If the action was performed using the credentials for an Identity and
--   Access Management (IAM) user, the name and other details about the
--   user.
[$sel:iamUser:UserIdentity'] :: UserIdentity -> Maybe IamUser

-- | If the action was performed using the credentials for your Amazon Web
--   Services account, the details of your account.
[$sel:root:UserIdentity'] :: UserIdentity -> Maybe UserIdentityRoot

-- | If the action was performed using the credentials for another Amazon
--   Web Services account, the details of that account.
[$sel:awsAccount:UserIdentity'] :: UserIdentity -> Maybe AwsAccount

-- | If the action was performed with temporary security credentials that
--   were obtained using the AssumeRole operation of the Security Token
--   Service (STS) API, the identifiers, session context, and other details
--   about the identity.
[$sel:assumedRole:UserIdentity'] :: UserIdentity -> Maybe AssumedRole

-- | If the action was performed with temporary security credentials that
--   were obtained using the GetFederationToken operation of the Security
--   Token Service (STS) API, the identifiers, session context, and other
--   details about the identity.
[$sel:federatedUser:UserIdentity'] :: UserIdentity -> Maybe FederatedUser

-- | If the action was performed by an Amazon Web Services account that
--   belongs to an Amazon Web Service, the name of the service.
[$sel:awsService:UserIdentity'] :: UserIdentity -> Maybe AwsService

-- | The type of entity that performed the action.
[$sel:type':UserIdentity'] :: UserIdentity -> Maybe UserIdentityType

-- | Create a value of <a>UserIdentity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamUser:UserIdentity'</a>, <a>userIdentity_iamUser</a> - If
--   the action was performed using the credentials for an Identity and
--   Access Management (IAM) user, the name and other details about the
--   user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:root:UserIdentity'</a>, <a>userIdentity_root</a> - If the
--   action was performed using the credentials for your Amazon Web
--   Services account, the details of your account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsAccount:UserIdentity'</a>, <a>userIdentity_awsAccount</a> -
--   If the action was performed using the credentials for another Amazon
--   Web Services account, the details of that account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assumedRole:UserIdentity'</a>, <a>userIdentity_assumedRole</a>
--   - If the action was performed with temporary security credentials that
--   were obtained using the AssumeRole operation of the Security Token
--   Service (STS) API, the identifiers, session context, and other details
--   about the identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:federatedUser:UserIdentity'</a>,
--   <a>userIdentity_federatedUser</a> - If the action was performed with
--   temporary security credentials that were obtained using the
--   GetFederationToken operation of the Security Token Service (STS) API,
--   the identifiers, session context, and other details about the
--   identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsService:UserIdentity'</a>, <a>userIdentity_awsService</a> -
--   If the action was performed by an Amazon Web Services account that
--   belongs to an Amazon Web Service, the name of the service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':UserIdentity'</a>, <a>userIdentity_type</a> - The type
--   of entity that performed the action.
newUserIdentity :: UserIdentity

-- | If the action was performed using the credentials for an Identity and
--   Access Management (IAM) user, the name and other details about the
--   user.
userIdentity_iamUser :: Lens' UserIdentity (Maybe IamUser)

-- | If the action was performed using the credentials for your Amazon Web
--   Services account, the details of your account.
userIdentity_root :: Lens' UserIdentity (Maybe UserIdentityRoot)

-- | If the action was performed using the credentials for another Amazon
--   Web Services account, the details of that account.
userIdentity_awsAccount :: Lens' UserIdentity (Maybe AwsAccount)

-- | If the action was performed with temporary security credentials that
--   were obtained using the AssumeRole operation of the Security Token
--   Service (STS) API, the identifiers, session context, and other details
--   about the identity.
userIdentity_assumedRole :: Lens' UserIdentity (Maybe AssumedRole)

-- | If the action was performed with temporary security credentials that
--   were obtained using the GetFederationToken operation of the Security
--   Token Service (STS) API, the identifiers, session context, and other
--   details about the identity.
userIdentity_federatedUser :: Lens' UserIdentity (Maybe FederatedUser)

-- | If the action was performed by an Amazon Web Services account that
--   belongs to an Amazon Web Service, the name of the service.
userIdentity_awsService :: Lens' UserIdentity (Maybe AwsService)

-- | The type of entity that performed the action.
userIdentity_type :: Lens' UserIdentity (Maybe UserIdentityType)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UserIdentity.UserIdentity
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UserIdentity.UserIdentity
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UserIdentity.UserIdentity
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UserIdentity.UserIdentity
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UserIdentity.UserIdentity
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UserIdentity.UserIdentity
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UserIdentity.UserIdentity


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FindingActor

-- | Provides information about an entity that performed an action that
--   produced a policy finding for a resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFindingActor</a> smart constructor.
data FindingActor
FindingActor' :: Maybe UserIdentity -> Maybe IpAddressDetails -> Maybe DomainDetails -> FindingActor

-- | The type and other characteristics of the entity that performed the
--   action on the affected resource.
[$sel:userIdentity:FindingActor'] :: FindingActor -> Maybe UserIdentity

-- | The IP address of the device that the entity used to perform the
--   action on the affected resource. This object also provides information
--   such as the owner and geographic location for the IP address.
[$sel:ipAddressDetails:FindingActor'] :: FindingActor -> Maybe IpAddressDetails

-- | The domain name of the device that the entity used to perform the
--   action on the affected resource.
[$sel:domainDetails:FindingActor'] :: FindingActor -> Maybe DomainDetails

-- | Create a value of <a>FindingActor</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:userIdentity:FindingActor'</a>,
--   <a>findingActor_userIdentity</a> - The type and other characteristics
--   of the entity that performed the action on the affected resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipAddressDetails:FindingActor'</a>,
--   <a>findingActor_ipAddressDetails</a> - The IP address of the device
--   that the entity used to perform the action on the affected resource.
--   This object also provides information such as the owner and geographic
--   location for the IP address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainDetails:FindingActor'</a>,
--   <a>findingActor_domainDetails</a> - The domain name of the device that
--   the entity used to perform the action on the affected resource.
newFindingActor :: FindingActor

-- | The type and other characteristics of the entity that performed the
--   action on the affected resource.
findingActor_userIdentity :: Lens' FindingActor (Maybe UserIdentity)

-- | The IP address of the device that the entity used to perform the
--   action on the affected resource. This object also provides information
--   such as the owner and geographic location for the IP address.
findingActor_ipAddressDetails :: Lens' FindingActor (Maybe IpAddressDetails)

-- | The domain name of the device that the entity used to perform the
--   action on the affected resource.
findingActor_domainDetails :: Lens' FindingActor (Maybe DomainDetails)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FindingActor.FindingActor
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FindingActor.FindingActor
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FindingActor.FindingActor
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FindingActor.FindingActor
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FindingActor.FindingActor
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FindingActor.FindingActor
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.FindingActor.FindingActor


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.PolicyDetails

-- | Provides the details of a policy finding.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicyDetails</a> smart constructor.
data PolicyDetails
PolicyDetails' :: Maybe FindingActor -> Maybe FindingAction -> PolicyDetails

-- | The entity that performed the action that produced the finding.
[$sel:actor:PolicyDetails'] :: PolicyDetails -> Maybe FindingActor

-- | The action that produced the finding.
[$sel:action:PolicyDetails'] :: PolicyDetails -> Maybe FindingAction

-- | Create a value of <a>PolicyDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:actor:PolicyDetails'</a>, <a>policyDetails_actor</a> - The
--   entity that performed the action that produced the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:PolicyDetails'</a>, <a>policyDetails_action</a> - The
--   action that produced the finding.
newPolicyDetails :: PolicyDetails

-- | The entity that performed the action that produced the finding.
policyDetails_actor :: Lens' PolicyDetails (Maybe FindingActor)

-- | The action that produced the finding.
policyDetails_action :: Lens' PolicyDetails (Maybe FindingAction)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.PolicyDetails.PolicyDetails
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.PolicyDetails.PolicyDetails
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.PolicyDetails.PolicyDetails
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.PolicyDetails.PolicyDetails
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.PolicyDetails.PolicyDetails
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.PolicyDetails.PolicyDetails
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.PolicyDetails.PolicyDetails


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.Finding

-- | Provides the details of a finding.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFinding</a> smart constructor.
data Finding
Finding' :: Maybe ClassificationDetails -> Maybe PolicyDetails -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe FindingCategory -> Maybe Severity -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ResourcesAffected -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe FindingType -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Finding

-- | The details of a sensitive data finding. This value is null for a
--   policy finding.
[$sel:classificationDetails:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe ClassificationDetails

-- | The details of a policy finding. This value is null for a sensitive
--   data finding.
[$sel:policyDetails:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe PolicyDetails

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the
--   finding was created.
[$sel:createdAt:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The category of the finding. Possible values are: CLASSIFICATION, for
--   a sensitive data finding; and, POLICY, for a policy finding.
[$sel:category:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe FindingCategory

-- | The severity level and score for the finding.
[$sel:severity:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Severity

-- | The total number of occurrences of the finding. For sensitive data
--   findings, this value is always 1. All sensitive data findings are
--   considered new (unique) because they derive from individual
--   classification jobs.
[$sel:count:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Integer

-- | The version of the schema that was used to define the data structures
--   in the finding.
[$sel:schemaVersion:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Text

-- | The resources that the finding applies to.
[$sel:resourcesAffected:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe ResourcesAffected

-- | The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that the
--   finding applies to. This is typically the account that owns the
--   affected resource.
[$sel:accountId:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services partition that Amazon Macie created the
--   finding in.
[$sel:partition:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the finding. This is a random string that
--   Amazon Macie generates and assigns to a finding when it creates the
--   finding.
[$sel:id:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services Region that Amazon Macie created the finding
--   in.
[$sel:region:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the
--   finding was last updated. For sensitive data findings, this value is
--   the same as the value for the createdAt property. All sensitive data
--   findings are considered new (unique) because they derive from
--   individual classification jobs.
[$sel:updatedAt:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The brief description of the finding.
[$sel:title:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of the finding.
[$sel:type':Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe FindingType

-- | Specifies whether the finding is archived (suppressed).
[$sel:archived:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Bool

-- | The description of the finding.
[$sel:description:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the finding is a sample finding. A <i>sample
--   finding</i> is a finding that uses example data to demonstrate what a
--   finding might contain.
[$sel:sample:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>Finding</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:classificationDetails:Finding'</a>,
--   <a>finding_classificationDetails</a> - The details of a sensitive data
--   finding. This value is null for a policy finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyDetails:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_policyDetails</a> - The
--   details of a policy finding. This value is null for a sensitive data
--   finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_createdAt</a> - The date
--   and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the finding was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:category:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_category</a> - The category
--   of the finding. Possible values are: CLASSIFICATION, for a sensitive
--   data finding; and, POLICY, for a policy finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:severity:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_severity</a> - The severity
--   level and score for the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:count:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_count</a> - The total number of
--   occurrences of the finding. For sensitive data findings, this value is
--   always 1. All sensitive data findings are considered new (unique)
--   because they derive from individual classification jobs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schemaVersion:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_schemaVersion</a> - The
--   version of the schema that was used to define the data structures in
--   the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourcesAffected:Finding'</a>,
--   <a>finding_resourcesAffected</a> - The resources that the finding
--   applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_accountId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that the finding
--   applies to. This is typically the account that owns the affected
--   resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:partition:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_partition</a> - The Amazon
--   Web Services partition that Amazon Macie created the finding in.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_id</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the finding. This is a random string that Amazon Macie generates and
--   assigns to a finding when it creates the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_region</a> - The Amazon Web
--   Services Region that Amazon Macie created the finding in.
--   
--   <a>$sel:updatedAt:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_updatedAt</a> - The date
--   and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the finding was
--   last updated. For sensitive data findings, this value is the same as
--   the value for the createdAt property. All sensitive data findings are
--   considered new (unique) because they derive from individual
--   classification jobs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_title</a> - The brief
--   description of the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Finding'</a>, <a>finding_type</a> - The type of the
--   finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:archived:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_archived</a> - Specifies
--   whether the finding is archived (suppressed).
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_description</a> - The
--   description of the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sample:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_sample</a> - Specifies whether
--   the finding is a sample finding. A <i>sample finding</i> is a finding
--   that uses example data to demonstrate what a finding might contain.
newFinding :: Finding

-- | The details of a sensitive data finding. This value is null for a
--   policy finding.
finding_classificationDetails :: Lens' Finding (Maybe ClassificationDetails)

-- | The details of a policy finding. This value is null for a sensitive
--   data finding.
finding_policyDetails :: Lens' Finding (Maybe PolicyDetails)

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the
--   finding was created.
finding_createdAt :: Lens' Finding (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The category of the finding. Possible values are: CLASSIFICATION, for
--   a sensitive data finding; and, POLICY, for a policy finding.
finding_category :: Lens' Finding (Maybe FindingCategory)

-- | The severity level and score for the finding.
finding_severity :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Severity)

-- | The total number of occurrences of the finding. For sensitive data
--   findings, this value is always 1. All sensitive data findings are
--   considered new (unique) because they derive from individual
--   classification jobs.
finding_count :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Integer)

-- | The version of the schema that was used to define the data structures
--   in the finding.
finding_schemaVersion :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Text)

-- | The resources that the finding applies to.
finding_resourcesAffected :: Lens' Finding (Maybe ResourcesAffected)

-- | The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that the
--   finding applies to. This is typically the account that owns the
--   affected resource.
finding_accountId :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services partition that Amazon Macie created the
--   finding in.
finding_partition :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the finding. This is a random string that
--   Amazon Macie generates and assigns to a finding when it creates the
--   finding.
finding_id :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services Region that Amazon Macie created the finding
--   in.
finding_region :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the
--   finding was last updated. For sensitive data findings, this value is
--   the same as the value for the createdAt property. All sensitive data
--   findings are considered new (unique) because they derive from
--   individual classification jobs.
finding_updatedAt :: Lens' Finding (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The brief description of the finding.
finding_title :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of the finding.
finding_type :: Lens' Finding (Maybe FindingType)

-- | Specifies whether the finding is archived (suppressed).
finding_archived :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Bool)

-- | The description of the finding.
finding_description :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the finding is a sample finding. A <i>sample
--   finding</i> is a finding that uses example data to demonstrate what a
--   finding might contain.
finding_sample :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Bool)

module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UserPausedDetails

-- | Provides information about when a classification job was paused. For a
--   one-time job, this object also specifies when the job will expire and
--   be cancelled if it isn't resumed. For a recurring job, this object
--   also specifies when the paused job run will expire and be cancelled if
--   it isn't resumed. This object is present only if a job's current
--   status (jobStatus) is USER_PAUSED. The information in this object
--   applies only to a job that was paused while it had a status of
--   RUNNING.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUserPausedDetails</a> smart constructor.
data UserPausedDetails
UserPausedDetails' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> UserPausedDetails

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the job
--   or job run will expire and be cancelled if you don't resume it first.
[$sel:jobExpiresAt:UserPausedDetails'] :: UserPausedDetails -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Health event that Amazon Macie
--   sent to notify you of the job or job run's pending expiration and
--   cancellation. This value is null if a job has been paused for less
--   than 23 days.
[$sel:jobImminentExpirationHealthEventArn:UserPausedDetails'] :: UserPausedDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when you
--   paused the job.
[$sel:jobPausedAt:UserPausedDetails'] :: UserPausedDetails -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>UserPausedDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobExpiresAt:UserPausedDetails'</a>,
--   <a>userPausedDetails_jobExpiresAt</a> - The date and time, in UTC and
--   extended ISO 8601 format, when the job or job run will expire and be
--   cancelled if you don't resume it first.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobImminentExpirationHealthEventArn:UserPausedDetails'</a>,
--   <a>userPausedDetails_jobImminentExpirationHealthEventArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Health event that Amazon Macie sent
--   to notify you of the job or job run's pending expiration and
--   cancellation. This value is null if a job has been paused for less
--   than 23 days.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobPausedAt:UserPausedDetails'</a>,
--   <a>userPausedDetails_jobPausedAt</a> - The date and time, in UTC and
--   extended ISO 8601 format, when you paused the job.
newUserPausedDetails :: UserPausedDetails

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the job
--   or job run will expire and be cancelled if you don't resume it first.
userPausedDetails_jobExpiresAt :: Lens' UserPausedDetails (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Health event that Amazon Macie
--   sent to notify you of the job or job run's pending expiration and
--   cancellation. This value is null if a job has been paused for less
--   than 23 days.
userPausedDetails_jobImminentExpirationHealthEventArn :: Lens' UserPausedDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when you
--   paused the job.
userPausedDetails_jobPausedAt :: Lens' UserPausedDetails (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UserPausedDetails.UserPausedDetails
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UserPausedDetails.UserPausedDetails
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UserPausedDetails.UserPausedDetails
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UserPausedDetails.UserPausedDetails
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UserPausedDetails.UserPausedDetails
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UserPausedDetails.UserPausedDetails
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.UserPausedDetails.UserPausedDetails


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobSummary

-- | Provides information about a classification job, including the current
--   status of the job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobSummary</a> smart constructor.
data JobSummary
JobSummary' :: Maybe LastRunErrorStatus -> Maybe JobType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe UserPausedDetails -> Maybe S3BucketCriteriaForJob -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [S3BucketDefinitionForJob] -> Maybe JobStatus -> JobSummary

-- | Specifies whether any account- or bucket-level access errors occurred
--   when the job ran. For a recurring job, this value indicates the error
--   status of the job's most recent run.
[$sel:lastRunErrorStatus:JobSummary'] :: JobSummary -> Maybe LastRunErrorStatus

-- | The schedule for running the job. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ONE_TIME - The job runs only once.</li>
--   <li>SCHEDULED - The job runs on a daily, weekly, or monthly
--   basis.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:jobType:JobSummary'] :: JobSummary -> Maybe JobType

-- | The unique identifier for the job.
[$sel:jobId:JobSummary'] :: JobSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the job
--   was created.
[$sel:createdAt:JobSummary'] :: JobSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | If the current status of the job is USER_PAUSED, specifies when the
--   job was paused and when the job or job run will expire and be
--   cancelled if it isn't resumed. This value is present only if the value
--   for jobStatus is USER_PAUSED.
[$sel:userPausedDetails:JobSummary'] :: JobSummary -> Maybe UserPausedDetails

-- | The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which S3 buckets
--   are included or excluded from the job's analysis. Each time the job
--   runs, the job uses these criteria to determine which buckets to
--   analyze. A job's definition can contain a bucketCriteria object or a
--   bucketDefinitions array, not both.
[$sel:bucketCriteria:JobSummary'] :: JobSummary -> Maybe S3BucketCriteriaForJob

-- | The custom name of the job.
[$sel:name:JobSummary'] :: JobSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of objects, one for each Amazon Web Services account that
--   owns specific S3 buckets for the job to analyze. Each object specifies
--   the account ID for an account and one or more buckets to analyze for
--   that account. A job's definition can contain a bucketDefinitions array
--   or a bucketCriteria object, not both.
[$sel:bucketDefinitions:JobSummary'] :: JobSummary -> Maybe [S3BucketDefinitionForJob]

-- | The current status of the job. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>CANCELLED - You cancelled the job or, if it's a one-time job, you
--   paused the job and didn't resume it within 30 days.</li>
--   <li>COMPLETE - For a one-time job, Amazon Macie finished processing
--   the data specified for the job. This value doesn't apply to recurring
--   jobs.</li>
--   <li>IDLE - For a recurring job, the previous scheduled run is complete
--   and the next scheduled run is pending. This value doesn't apply to
--   one-time jobs.</li>
--   <li>PAUSED - Macie started running the job but additional processing
--   would exceed the monthly sensitive data discovery quota for your
--   account or one or more member accounts that the job analyzes data
--   for.</li>
--   <li>RUNNING - For a one-time job, the job is in progress. For a
--   recurring job, a scheduled run is in progress.</li>
--   <li>USER_PAUSED - You paused the job. If you paused the job while it
--   had a status of RUNNING and you don't resume it within 30 days of
--   pausing it, the job or job run will expire and be cancelled, depending
--   on the job's type. To check the expiration date, refer to the
--   UserPausedDetails.jobExpiresAt property.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:jobStatus:JobSummary'] :: JobSummary -> Maybe JobStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>JobSummary</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastRunErrorStatus:JobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobSummary_lastRunErrorStatus</a> - Specifies whether any account-
--   or bucket-level access errors occurred when the job ran. For a
--   recurring job, this value indicates the error status of the job's most
--   recent run.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobType:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_jobType</a> - The
--   schedule for running the job. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ONE_TIME - The job runs only once.</li>
--   <li>SCHEDULED - The job runs on a daily, weekly, or monthly
--   basis.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_jobId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_createdAt</a> - The
--   date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the job was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userPausedDetails:JobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobSummary_userPausedDetails</a> - If the current status of the job
--   is USER_PAUSED, specifies when the job was paused and when the job or
--   job run will expire and be cancelled if it isn't resumed. This value
--   is present only if the value for jobStatus is USER_PAUSED.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketCriteria:JobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobSummary_bucketCriteria</a> - The property- and tag-based
--   conditions that determine which S3 buckets are included or excluded
--   from the job's analysis. Each time the job runs, the job uses these
--   criteria to determine which buckets to analyze. A job's definition can
--   contain a bucketCriteria object or a bucketDefinitions array, not
--   both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_name</a> - The custom name
--   of the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketDefinitions:JobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobSummary_bucketDefinitions</a> - An array of objects, one for
--   each Amazon Web Services account that owns specific S3 buckets for the
--   job to analyze. Each object specifies the account ID for an account
--   and one or more buckets to analyze for that account. A job's
--   definition can contain a bucketDefinitions array or a bucketCriteria
--   object, not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobStatus:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_jobStatus</a> - The
--   current status of the job. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>CANCELLED - You cancelled the job or, if it's a one-time job, you
--   paused the job and didn't resume it within 30 days.</li>
--   <li>COMPLETE - For a one-time job, Amazon Macie finished processing
--   the data specified for the job. This value doesn't apply to recurring
--   jobs.</li>
--   <li>IDLE - For a recurring job, the previous scheduled run is complete
--   and the next scheduled run is pending. This value doesn't apply to
--   one-time jobs.</li>
--   <li>PAUSED - Macie started running the job but additional processing
--   would exceed the monthly sensitive data discovery quota for your
--   account or one or more member accounts that the job analyzes data
--   for.</li>
--   <li>RUNNING - For a one-time job, the job is in progress. For a
--   recurring job, a scheduled run is in progress.</li>
--   <li>USER_PAUSED - You paused the job. If you paused the job while it
--   had a status of RUNNING and you don't resume it within 30 days of
--   pausing it, the job or job run will expire and be cancelled, depending
--   on the job's type. To check the expiration date, refer to the
--   UserPausedDetails.jobExpiresAt property.</li>
--   </ul>
newJobSummary :: JobSummary

-- | Specifies whether any account- or bucket-level access errors occurred
--   when the job ran. For a recurring job, this value indicates the error
--   status of the job's most recent run.
jobSummary_lastRunErrorStatus :: Lens' JobSummary (Maybe LastRunErrorStatus)

-- | The schedule for running the job. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ONE_TIME - The job runs only once.</li>
--   <li>SCHEDULED - The job runs on a daily, weekly, or monthly
--   basis.</li>
--   </ul>
jobSummary_jobType :: Lens' JobSummary (Maybe JobType)

-- | The unique identifier for the job.
jobSummary_jobId :: Lens' JobSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the job
--   was created.
jobSummary_createdAt :: Lens' JobSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | If the current status of the job is USER_PAUSED, specifies when the
--   job was paused and when the job or job run will expire and be
--   cancelled if it isn't resumed. This value is present only if the value
--   for jobStatus is USER_PAUSED.
jobSummary_userPausedDetails :: Lens' JobSummary (Maybe UserPausedDetails)

-- | The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which S3 buckets
--   are included or excluded from the job's analysis. Each time the job
--   runs, the job uses these criteria to determine which buckets to
--   analyze. A job's definition can contain a bucketCriteria object or a
--   bucketDefinitions array, not both.
jobSummary_bucketCriteria :: Lens' JobSummary (Maybe S3BucketCriteriaForJob)

-- | The custom name of the job.
jobSummary_name :: Lens' JobSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of objects, one for each Amazon Web Services account that
--   owns specific S3 buckets for the job to analyze. Each object specifies
--   the account ID for an account and one or more buckets to analyze for
--   that account. A job's definition can contain a bucketDefinitions array
--   or a bucketCriteria object, not both.
jobSummary_bucketDefinitions :: Lens' JobSummary (Maybe [S3BucketDefinitionForJob])

-- | The current status of the job. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>CANCELLED - You cancelled the job or, if it's a one-time job, you
--   paused the job and didn't resume it within 30 days.</li>
--   <li>COMPLETE - For a one-time job, Amazon Macie finished processing
--   the data specified for the job. This value doesn't apply to recurring
--   jobs.</li>
--   <li>IDLE - For a recurring job, the previous scheduled run is complete
--   and the next scheduled run is pending. This value doesn't apply to
--   one-time jobs.</li>
--   <li>PAUSED - Macie started running the job but additional processing
--   would exceed the monthly sensitive data discovery quota for your
--   account or one or more member accounts that the job analyzes data
--   for.</li>
--   <li>RUNNING - For a one-time job, the job is in progress. For a
--   recurring job, a scheduled run is in progress.</li>
--   <li>USER_PAUSED - You paused the job. If you paused the job while it
--   had a status of RUNNING and you don't resume it within 30 days of
--   pausing it, the job or job run will expire and be cancelled, depending
--   on the job's type. To check the expiration date, refer to the
--   UserPausedDetails.jobExpiresAt property.</li>
--   </ul>
jobSummary_jobStatus :: Lens' JobSummary (Maybe JobStatus)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobSummary.JobSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobSummary.JobSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobSummary.JobSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobSummary.JobSummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobSummary.JobSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobSummary.JobSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobSummary.JobSummary


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.WeeklySchedule

-- | Specifies a weekly recurrence pattern for running a classification
--   job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWeeklySchedule</a> smart constructor.
data WeeklySchedule
WeeklySchedule' :: Maybe DayOfWeek -> WeeklySchedule

-- | The day of the week when Amazon Macie runs the job.
[$sel:dayOfWeek:WeeklySchedule'] :: WeeklySchedule -> Maybe DayOfWeek

-- | Create a value of <a>WeeklySchedule</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dayOfWeek:WeeklySchedule'</a>, <a>weeklySchedule_dayOfWeek</a>
--   - The day of the week when Amazon Macie runs the job.
newWeeklySchedule :: WeeklySchedule

-- | The day of the week when Amazon Macie runs the job.
weeklySchedule_dayOfWeek :: Lens' WeeklySchedule (Maybe DayOfWeek)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.WeeklySchedule.WeeklySchedule
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.WeeklySchedule.WeeklySchedule
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.WeeklySchedule.WeeklySchedule
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.WeeklySchedule.WeeklySchedule
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.WeeklySchedule.WeeklySchedule
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.WeeklySchedule.WeeklySchedule
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.WeeklySchedule.WeeklySchedule
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.WeeklySchedule.WeeklySchedule


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobScheduleFrequency

-- | Specifies the recurrence pattern for running a classification job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobScheduleFrequency</a> smart constructor.
data JobScheduleFrequency
JobScheduleFrequency' :: Maybe DailySchedule -> Maybe MonthlySchedule -> Maybe WeeklySchedule -> JobScheduleFrequency

-- | Specifies a daily recurrence pattern for running the job.
[$sel:dailySchedule:JobScheduleFrequency'] :: JobScheduleFrequency -> Maybe DailySchedule

-- | Specifies a monthly recurrence pattern for running the job.
[$sel:monthlySchedule:JobScheduleFrequency'] :: JobScheduleFrequency -> Maybe MonthlySchedule

-- | Specifies a weekly recurrence pattern for running the job.
[$sel:weeklySchedule:JobScheduleFrequency'] :: JobScheduleFrequency -> Maybe WeeklySchedule

-- | Create a value of <a>JobScheduleFrequency</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dailySchedule:JobScheduleFrequency'</a>,
--   <a>jobScheduleFrequency_dailySchedule</a> - Specifies a daily
--   recurrence pattern for running the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:monthlySchedule:JobScheduleFrequency'</a>,
--   <a>jobScheduleFrequency_monthlySchedule</a> - Specifies a monthly
--   recurrence pattern for running the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:weeklySchedule:JobScheduleFrequency'</a>,
--   <a>jobScheduleFrequency_weeklySchedule</a> - Specifies a weekly
--   recurrence pattern for running the job.
newJobScheduleFrequency :: JobScheduleFrequency

-- | Specifies a daily recurrence pattern for running the job.
jobScheduleFrequency_dailySchedule :: Lens' JobScheduleFrequency (Maybe DailySchedule)

-- | Specifies a monthly recurrence pattern for running the job.
jobScheduleFrequency_monthlySchedule :: Lens' JobScheduleFrequency (Maybe MonthlySchedule)

-- | Specifies a weekly recurrence pattern for running the job.
jobScheduleFrequency_weeklySchedule :: Lens' JobScheduleFrequency (Maybe WeeklySchedule)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobScheduleFrequency.JobScheduleFrequency
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobScheduleFrequency.JobScheduleFrequency
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobScheduleFrequency.JobScheduleFrequency
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobScheduleFrequency.JobScheduleFrequency
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobScheduleFrequency.JobScheduleFrequency
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobScheduleFrequency.JobScheduleFrequency
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobScheduleFrequency.JobScheduleFrequency
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.MacieV2.Types.JobScheduleFrequency.JobScheduleFrequency


module Amazonka.MacieV2.Types

-- | API version <tt>2020-01-01</tt> of the Amazon Macie 2 SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | Provides information about an error that occurred due to a syntax
--   error in a request.
_ValidationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Provides information about an error that occurred due to insufficient
--   access to a specified resource.
_AccessDeniedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Provides information about an error that occurred due to a versioning
--   conflict for a specified resource.
_ConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Provides information about an error that occurred due to one or more
--   service quotas for an account.
_ServiceQuotaExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Provides information about an error that occurred because too many
--   requests were sent during a certain amount of time.
_ThrottlingException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Provides information about an error that occurred due to an unknown
--   internal server error, exception, or failure.
_InternalServerException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Provides information about an error that occurred because a specified
--   resource wasn't found.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The current status of an account as the delegated Amazon Macie
--   administrator account for an Amazon Web Services organization.
--   Possible values are:
newtype AdminStatus

[fromAdminStatus] :: AdminStatus -> Text
pattern AdminStatus_DISABLING_IN_PROGRESS :: AdminStatus
pattern AdminStatus_ENABLED :: AdminStatus

-- | Provides information about the permissions settings of the
--   bucket-level access control list (ACL) for an S3 bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccessControlList</a> smart constructor.
data AccessControlList
AccessControlList' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> AccessControlList

-- | Specifies whether the ACL grants the general public with write access
--   permissions for the bucket.
[$sel:allowsPublicWriteAccess:AccessControlList'] :: AccessControlList -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether the ACL grants the general public with read access
--   permissions for the bucket.
[$sel:allowsPublicReadAccess:AccessControlList'] :: AccessControlList -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>AccessControlList</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowsPublicWriteAccess:AccessControlList'</a>,
--   <a>accessControlList_allowsPublicWriteAccess</a> - Specifies whether
--   the ACL grants the general public with write access permissions for
--   the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowsPublicReadAccess:AccessControlList'</a>,
--   <a>accessControlList_allowsPublicReadAccess</a> - Specifies whether
--   the ACL grants the general public with read access permissions for the
--   bucket.
newAccessControlList :: AccessControlList

-- | Specifies whether the ACL grants the general public with write access
--   permissions for the bucket.
accessControlList_allowsPublicWriteAccess :: Lens' AccessControlList (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether the ACL grants the general public with read access
--   permissions for the bucket.
accessControlList_allowsPublicReadAccess :: Lens' AccessControlList (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies the details of an account to associate with an Amazon Macie
--   administrator account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccountDetail</a> smart constructor.
data AccountDetail
AccountDetail' :: Text -> Text -> AccountDetail

-- | The email address for the account.
[$sel:email:AccountDetail'] :: AccountDetail -> Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID for the account.
[$sel:accountId:AccountDetail'] :: AccountDetail -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AccountDetail</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:email:AccountDetail'</a>, <a>accountDetail_email</a> - The
--   email address for the account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:AccountDetail'</a>, <a>accountDetail_accountId</a> -
--   The Amazon Web Services account ID for the account.
newAccountDetail :: Text -> Text -> AccountDetail

-- | The email address for the account.
accountDetail_email :: Lens' AccountDetail Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID for the account.
accountDetail_accountId :: Lens' AccountDetail Text

-- | Provides information about the account-level permissions settings that
--   apply to an S3 bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccountLevelPermissions</a> smart constructor.
data AccountLevelPermissions

--   that owns the bucket.

-- | Create a value of <a>AccountLevelPermissions</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockPublicAccess:AccountLevelPermissions'</a>,

--   access settings for the Amazon Web Services account that owns the
--   bucket.
newAccountLevelPermissions :: AccountLevelPermissions

-- | The block public access settings for the Amazon Web Services account
--   that owns the bucket.

-- | Provides information about the delegated Amazon Macie administrator

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAdminAccount</a> smart constructor.

--   Amazon Macie for the organization.

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID for the account.

-- | Create a value of <a>AdminAccount</a> with all optional fields

--   shared access settings for. Macie can't determine whether these
--   buckets are shared with other Amazon Web Services accounts.
bucketCountBySharedAccessType_unknown :: Lens' BucketCountBySharedAccessType (Maybe Integer)

-- | Provides information about the number of S3 buckets whose bucket
--   policies do or don't require server-side encryption of objects when
--   objects are uploaded to the buckets.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads</a>
--   smart constructor.
data BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads
BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads

-- | The total number of buckets whose bucket policies require server-side
--   encryption of new objects. PutObject requests for these buckets must
--   include the x-amz-server-side-encryption header and the value for that
--   header must be AES256 or aws:kms.
[$sel:deniesUnencryptedObjectUploads:BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads'] :: BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total number of buckets that Amazon Macie wasn't able to evaluate
--   server-side encryption requirements for. Macie can't determine whether
--   the bucket policies for these buckets require server-side encryption
--   of new objects.
[$sel:unknown:BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads'] :: BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total number of buckets that don't have a bucket policy or have a
--   bucket policy that doesn't require server-side encryption of new
--   objects. If a bucket policy exists, the policy doesn't require
--   PutObject requests to include the x-amz-server-side-encryption header
--   and it doesn't require the value for that header to be AES256 or
--   aws:kms.
[$sel:allowsUnencryptedObjectUploads:BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads'] :: BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads -> Maybe Integer

newBucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads :: BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads

-- | Provides information about the bucket-level permissions settings for
--   an S3 bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucketLevelPermissions</a> smart constructor.
data BucketLevelPermissions
BucketLevelPermissions' :: Maybe AccessControlList -> Maybe BlockPublicAccess -> Maybe BucketPolicy -> BucketLevelPermissions

-- | The permissions settings of the access control list (ACL) for the
--   bucket. This value is null if an ACL hasn't been defined for the
--   bucket.
[$sel:accessControlList:BucketLevelPermissions'] :: BucketLevelPermissions -> Maybe AccessControlList

-- | The block public access settings for the bucket.
[$sel:blockPublicAccess:BucketLevelPermissions'] :: BucketLevelPermissions -> Maybe BlockPublicAccess

-- | The permissions settings of the bucket policy for the bucket. This
--   value is null if a bucket policy hasn't been defined for the bucket.
[$sel:bucketPolicy:BucketLevelPermissions'] :: BucketLevelPermissions -> Maybe BucketPolicy

-- | Create a value of <a>BucketLevelPermissions</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessControlList:BucketLevelPermissions'</a>,
--   <a>bucketLevelPermissions_accessControlList</a> - The permissions
--   settings of the access control list (ACL) for the bucket. This value
--   is null if an ACL hasn't been defined for the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockPublicAccess:BucketLevelPermissions'</a>,
--   <a>bucketLevelPermissions_blockPublicAccess</a> - The block public
--   access settings for the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketPolicy:BucketLevelPermissions'</a>,
--   <a>bucketLevelPermissions_bucketPolicy</a> - The permissions settings
--   of the bucket policy for the bucket. This value is null if a bucket
--   policy hasn't been defined for the bucket.
newBucketLevelPermissions :: BucketLevelPermissions

-- | The permissions settings of the access control list (ACL) for the
--   bucket. This value is null if an ACL hasn't been defined for the
--   bucket.
bucketLevelPermissions_accessControlList :: Lens' BucketLevelPermissions (Maybe AccessControlList)

-- | The block public access settings for the bucket.
bucketLevelPermissions_blockPublicAccess :: Lens' BucketLevelPermissions (Maybe BlockPublicAccess)

-- | The permissions settings of the bucket policy for the bucket. This
--   value is null if a bucket policy hasn't been defined for the bucket.
bucketLevelPermissions_bucketPolicy :: Lens' BucketLevelPermissions (Maybe BucketPolicy)

-- | Provides statistical data and other information about an S3 bucket
--   that Amazon Macie monitors and analyzes for your account. If an error
--   occurs when Macie attempts to retrieve and process information about
--   the bucket or the bucket's objects, the value for most of these
--   properties is null. Exceptions are accountId, bucketArn,
--   bucketCreatedAt, bucketName, lastUpdated, and region. To identify the
--   cause of the error, refer to the errorCode and errorMessage values.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucketMetadata</a> smart constructor.
data BucketMetadata
BucketMetadata' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ObjectCountByEncryptionType -> Maybe SharedAccess -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ObjectLevelStatistics -> Maybe ObjectLevelStatistics -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe AllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads -> Maybe BucketPublicAccess -> Maybe BucketMetadataErrorCode -> Maybe JobDetails -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe ReplicationDetails -> Maybe BucketServerSideEncryption -> Maybe [KeyValuePair] -> Maybe Integer -> BucketMetadata

-- | The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that are compressed
--   (.gz, .gzip, .zip) files in the bucket.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Amazon Macie calculates this
--   value based on the size of the latest version of each applicable
--   object in the bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of
--   all versions of each applicable object in the bucket.
[$sel:sizeInBytesCompressed:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe Integer

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when Amazon
--   Macie most recently retrieved both bucket and object metadata from
--   Amazon S3 for the bucket.
[$sel:lastUpdated:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The total number of objects that are in the bucket, grouped by
--   server-side encryption type. This includes a grouping that reports the
--   total number of objects that aren't encrypted or use client-side
--   encryption.
[$sel:objectCountByEncryptionType:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe ObjectCountByEncryptionType

-- | Specifies whether the bucket is shared with another Amazon Web
--   Services account. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>EXTERNAL - The bucket is shared with an Amazon Web Services
--   account that isn't part of the same Amazon Macie organization.</li>
--   <li>INTERNAL - The bucket is shared with an Amazon Web Services
--   account that's part of the same Amazon Macie organization.</li>
--   <li>NOT_SHARED - The bucket isn't shared with other Amazon Web
--   Services accounts.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie wasn't able to evaluate the shared access
--   settings for the bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:sharedAccess:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe SharedAccess

-- | The total storage size, in bytes, of the bucket.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Amazon Macie calculates this
--   value based on the size of the latest version of each object in the
--   bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all versions of
--   each object in the bucket.
[$sel:sizeInBytes:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe Integer

-- | The name of the bucket.
[$sel:bucketName:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of objects that Amazon Macie can analyze in the
--   bucket. These objects use a supported storage class and have a file
--   name extension for a supported file or storage format.
[$sel:classifiableObjectCount:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe Integer

-- | The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns
--   the bucket.
[$sel:accountId:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that Amazon Macie
--   can't analyze in the bucket. These objects don't use a supported
--   storage class or don't have a file name extension for a supported file
--   or storage format.
[$sel:unclassifiableObjectSizeInBytes:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe ObjectLevelStatistics

-- | The total number of objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze in the
--   bucket. These objects don't use a supported storage class or don't
--   have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.
[$sel:unclassifiableObjectCount:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe ObjectLevelStatistics

-- | Specifies whether versioning is enabled for the bucket.
[$sel:versioning:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether the bucket policy for the bucket requires
--   server-side encryption of objects when objects are uploaded to the
--   bucket. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>FALSE - The bucket policy requires server-side encryption of new
--   objects. PutObject requests must include the
--   x-amz-server-side-encryption header and the value for that header must
--   be AES256 or aws:kms.</li>
--   <li>TRUE - The bucket doesn't have a bucket policy or it has a bucket
--   policy that doesn't require server-side encryption of new objects. If
--   a bucket policy exists, it doesn't require PutObject requests to
--   include the x-amz-server-side-encryption header and it doesn't require
--   the value for that header to be AES256 or aws:kms.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie can't determine whether the bucket policy
--   requires server-side encryption of new objects.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:allowsUnencryptedObjectUploads:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe AllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads

-- | Specifies whether the bucket is publicly accessible due to the
--   combination of permissions settings that apply to the bucket, and
--   provides information about those settings.
[$sel:publicAccess:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe BucketPublicAccess

-- | Specifies the error code for an error that prevented Amazon Macie from
--   retrieving and processing information about the bucket and the
--   bucket's objects. If this value is ACCESS_DENIED, Macie doesn't have
--   permission to retrieve the information. For example, the bucket has a
--   restrictive bucket policy and Amazon S3 denied the request. If this
--   value is null, Macie was able to retrieve and process the information.
[$sel:errorCode:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe BucketMetadataErrorCode

-- | Specifies whether any one-time or recurring classification jobs are
--   configured to analyze data in the bucket, and, if so, the details of
--   the job that ran most recently.
[$sel:jobDetails:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe JobDetails

-- | The Amazon Web Services Region that hosts the bucket.
[$sel:region:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the
--   bucket was created.
[$sel:bucketCreatedAt:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A brief description of the error (errorCode) that prevented Amazon
--   Macie from retrieving and processing information about the bucket and
--   the bucket's objects. This value is null if Macie was able to retrieve
--   and process the information.
[$sel:errorMessage:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket.
[$sel:bucketArn:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of objects in the bucket.
[$sel:objectCount:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe Integer

-- | Specifies whether the bucket is configured to replicate one or more
--   objects to buckets for other Amazon Web Services accounts and, if so,
--   which accounts.
[$sel:replicationDetails:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe ReplicationDetails

-- | Specifies whether the bucket encrypts new objects by default and, if
--   so, the type of server-side encryption that's used.
[$sel:serverSideEncryption:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe BucketServerSideEncryption

-- | An array that specifies the tags (keys and values) that are associated
--   with the bucket.
[$sel:tags:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe [KeyValuePair]

-- | The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that Amazon Macie can
--   analyze in the bucket. These objects use a supported storage class and
--   have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Macie calculates this value
--   based on the size of the latest version of each applicable object in
--   the bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all
--   versions of each applicable object in the bucket.
[$sel:classifiableSizeInBytes:BucketMetadata'] :: BucketMetadata -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>BucketMetadata</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   <a>bucketMetadata_bucketCreatedAt</a> - The date and time, in UTC and

--   <a>$sel:errorMessage:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_errorMessage</a> - A brief description of the error
--   (errorCode) that prevented Amazon Macie from retrieving and processing

--   <a>$sel:objectCount:BucketMetadata'</a>,

--   bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationDetails:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_replicationDetails</a> - Specifies whether the
--   bucket is configured to replicate one or more objects to buckets for
--   other Amazon Web Services accounts and, if so, which accounts.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverSideEncryption:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_serverSideEncryption</a> - Specifies whether the
--   bucket encrypts new objects by default and, if so, the type of
--   server-side encryption that's used.
