--   array that specifies the tags (keys and values) that are associated
--   with the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:classifiableSizeInBytes:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_classifiableSizeInBytes</a> - The total storage
--   size, in bytes, of the objects that Amazon Macie can analyze in the
--   bucket. These objects use a supported storage class and have a file
--   name extension for a supported file or storage format.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Macie calculates this value
--   based on the size of the latest version of each applicable object in
--   the bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all
--   versions of each applicable object in the bucket.
newBucketMetadata :: BucketMetadata

-- | The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that are compressed
--   (.gz, .gzip, .zip) files in the bucket.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Amazon Macie calculates this
--   value based on the size of the latest version of each applicable
--   object in the bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of
--   all versions of each applicable object in the bucket.
bucketMetadata_sizeInBytesCompressed :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe Integer)

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when Amazon
--   Macie most recently retrieved both bucket and object metadata from
--   Amazon S3 for the bucket.
bucketMetadata_lastUpdated :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The total number of objects that are in the bucket, grouped by
--   server-side encryption type. This includes a grouping that reports the
--   total number of objects that aren't encrypted or use client-side
--   encryption.
bucketMetadata_objectCountByEncryptionType :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe ObjectCountByEncryptionType)

-- | Specifies whether the bucket is shared with another Amazon Web
--   Services account. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>EXTERNAL - The bucket is shared with an Amazon Web Services
--   account that isn't part of the same Amazon Macie organization.</li>
--   <li>INTERNAL - The bucket is shared with an Amazon Web Services
--   account that's part of the same Amazon Macie organization.</li>
--   <li>NOT_SHARED - The bucket isn't shared with other Amazon Web
--   Services accounts.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie wasn't able to evaluate the shared access
--   settings for the bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
bucketMetadata_sharedAccess :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe SharedAccess)

-- | The total storage size, in bytes, of the bucket.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Amazon Macie calculates this
--   value based on the size of the latest version of each object in the
--   bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all versions of
--   each object in the bucket.
bucketMetadata_sizeInBytes :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe Integer)

-- | The name of the bucket.
bucketMetadata_bucketName :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of objects that Amazon Macie can analyze in the
--   bucket. These objects use a supported storage class and have a file
--   name extension for a supported file or storage format.
bucketMetadata_classifiableObjectCount :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe Integer)

-- | The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns
--   the bucket.
bucketMetadata_accountId :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that Amazon Macie
--   can't analyze in the bucket. These objects don't use a supported
--   storage class or don't have a file name extension for a supported file
--   or storage format.
bucketMetadata_unclassifiableObjectSizeInBytes :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe ObjectLevelStatistics)

-- | The total number of objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze in the
--   bucket. These objects don't use a supported storage class or don't
--   have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.
bucketMetadata_unclassifiableObjectCount :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe ObjectLevelStatistics)

-- | Specifies whether versioning is enabled for the bucket.
bucketMetadata_versioning :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether the bucket policy for the bucket requires
--   server-side encryption of objects when objects are uploaded to the
--   bucket. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>FALSE - The bucket policy requires server-side encryption of new
--   objects. PutObject requests must include the
--   x-amz-server-side-encryption header and the value for that header must
--   be AES256 or aws:kms.</li>
--   <li>TRUE - The bucket doesn't have a bucket policy or it has a bucket
--   policy that doesn't require server-side encryption of new objects. If
--   a bucket policy exists, it doesn't require PutObject requests to
--   include the x-amz-server-side-encryption header and it doesn't require
--   the value for that header to be AES256 or aws:kms.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie can't determine whether the bucket policy
--   requires server-side encryption of new objects.</li>
--   </ul>
bucketMetadata_allowsUnencryptedObjectUploads :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe AllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads)

-- | Specifies whether the bucket is publicly accessible due to the
--   combination of permissions settings that apply to the bucket, and
--   provides information about those settings.
bucketMetadata_publicAccess :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe BucketPublicAccess)

-- | Specifies the error code for an error that prevented Amazon Macie from
--   retrieving and processing information about the bucket and the
--   bucket's objects. If this value is ACCESS_DENIED, Macie doesn't have
--   permission to retrieve the information. For example, the bucket has a
--   restrictive bucket policy and Amazon S3 denied the request. If this
--   value is null, Macie was able to retrieve and process the information.
bucketMetadata_errorCode :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe BucketMetadataErrorCode)

-- | Specifies whether any one-time or recurring classification jobs are
--   configured to analyze data in the bucket, and, if so, the details of
--   the job that ran most recently.
bucketMetadata_jobDetails :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe JobDetails)

-- | The Amazon Web Services Region that hosts the bucket.
bucketMetadata_region :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the
--   bucket was created.
bucketMetadata_bucketCreatedAt :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A brief description of the error (errorCode) that prevented Amazon
--   Macie from retrieving and processing information about the bucket and
--   the bucket's objects. This value is null if Macie was able to retrieve
--   and process the information.
bucketMetadata_errorMessage :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket.
bucketMetadata_bucketArn :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of objects in the bucket.
bucketMetadata_objectCount :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe Integer)

-- | Specifies whether the bucket is configured to replicate one or more
--   objects to buckets for other Amazon Web Services accounts and, if so,
--   which accounts.
bucketMetadata_replicationDetails :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe ReplicationDetails)

-- | Specifies whether the bucket encrypts new objects by default and, if
--   so, the type of server-side encryption that's used.
bucketMetadata_serverSideEncryption :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe BucketServerSideEncryption)

-- | An array that specifies the tags (keys and values) that are associated
--   with the bucket.
bucketMetadata_tags :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe [KeyValuePair])

-- | The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that Amazon Macie can
--   analyze in the bucket. These objects use a supported storage class and
--   have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Macie calculates this value
--   based on the size of the latest version of each applicable object in
--   the bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all
--   versions of each applicable object in the bucket.
bucketMetadata_classifiableSizeInBytes :: Lens' BucketMetadata (Maybe Integer)

-- | Provides information about the account-level and bucket-level
--   permissions settings for an S3 bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucketPermissionConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data BucketPermissionConfiguration
BucketPermissionConfiguration' :: Maybe BucketLevelPermissions -> Maybe AccountLevelPermissions -> BucketPermissionConfiguration

-- | The bucket-level permissions settings for the bucket.
[$sel:bucketLevelPermissions:BucketPermissionConfiguration'] :: BucketPermissionConfiguration -> Maybe BucketLevelPermissions

-- | The account-level permissions settings that apply to the bucket.
[$sel:accountLevelPermissions:BucketPermissionConfiguration'] :: BucketPermissionConfiguration -> Maybe AccountLevelPermissions

-- | Create a value of <a>BucketPermissionConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketLevelPermissions:BucketPermissionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>bucketPermissionConfiguration_bucketLevelPermissions</a> - The
--   bucket-level permissions settings for the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountLevelPermissions:BucketPermissionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>bucketPermissionConfiguration_accountLevelPermissions</a> - The
--   account-level permissions settings that apply to the bucket.
newBucketPermissionConfiguration :: BucketPermissionConfiguration

-- | The bucket-level permissions settings for the bucket.
bucketPermissionConfiguration_bucketLevelPermissions :: Lens' BucketPermissionConfiguration (Maybe BucketLevelPermissions)

-- | The account-level permissions settings that apply to the bucket.
bucketPermissionConfiguration_accountLevelPermissions :: Lens' BucketPermissionConfiguration (Maybe AccountLevelPermissions)

-- | Provides information about the permissions settings of the bucket
--   policy for an S3 bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucketPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data BucketPolicy
BucketPolicy' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> BucketPolicy

-- | Specifies whether the bucket policy allows the general public to have
--   write access to the bucket.
[$sel:allowsPublicWriteAccess:BucketPolicy'] :: BucketPolicy -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether the bucket policy allows the general public to have
--   read access to the bucket.
[$sel:allowsPublicReadAccess:BucketPolicy'] :: BucketPolicy -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>BucketPolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowsPublicWriteAccess:BucketPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>bucketPolicy_allowsPublicWriteAccess</a> - Specifies whether the
--   bucket policy allows the general public to have write access to the
--   bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowsPublicReadAccess:BucketPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>bucketPolicy_allowsPublicReadAccess</a> - Specifies whether the
--   bucket policy allows the general public to have read access to the
--   bucket.
newBucketPolicy :: BucketPolicy

-- | Specifies whether the bucket policy allows the general public to have
--   write access to the bucket.
bucketPolicy_allowsPublicWriteAccess :: Lens' BucketPolicy (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether the bucket policy allows the general public to have
--   read access to the bucket.
bucketPolicy_allowsPublicReadAccess :: Lens' BucketPolicy (Maybe Bool)

-- | Provides information about the permissions settings that determine
--   whether an S3 bucket is publicly accessible.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucketPublicAccess</a> smart constructor.
data BucketPublicAccess
BucketPublicAccess' :: Maybe BucketPermissionConfiguration -> Maybe EffectivePermission -> BucketPublicAccess

-- | The account-level and bucket-level permissions settings for the
--   bucket.
[$sel:permissionConfiguration:BucketPublicAccess'] :: BucketPublicAccess -> Maybe BucketPermissionConfiguration

-- | Specifies whether the bucket is publicly accessible due to the
--   combination of permissions settings that apply to the bucket. Possible
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>NOT_PUBLIC - The bucket isn't publicly accessible.</li>
--   <li>PUBLIC - The bucket is publicly accessible.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie can't determine whether the bucket is
--   publicly accessible.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:effectivePermission:BucketPublicAccess'] :: BucketPublicAccess -> Maybe EffectivePermission

-- | Create a value of <a>BucketPublicAccess</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionConfiguration:BucketPublicAccess'</a>,
--   <a>bucketPublicAccess_permissionConfiguration</a> - The account-level
--   and bucket-level permissions settings for the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:effectivePermission:BucketPublicAccess'</a>,
--   <a>bucketPublicAccess_effectivePermission</a> - Specifies whether the
--   bucket is publicly accessible due to the combination of permissions
--   settings that apply to the bucket. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>NOT_PUBLIC - The bucket isn't publicly accessible.</li>
--   <li>PUBLIC - The bucket is publicly accessible.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie can't determine whether the bucket is
--   publicly accessible.</li>
--   </ul>
newBucketPublicAccess :: BucketPublicAccess

-- | The account-level and bucket-level permissions settings for the
--   bucket.
bucketPublicAccess_permissionConfiguration :: Lens' BucketPublicAccess (Maybe BucketPermissionConfiguration)

-- | Specifies whether the bucket is publicly accessible due to the
--   combination of permissions settings that apply to the bucket. Possible
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>NOT_PUBLIC - The bucket isn't publicly accessible.</li>
--   <li>PUBLIC - The bucket is publicly accessible.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie can't determine whether the bucket is
--   publicly accessible.</li>
--   </ul>
bucketPublicAccess_effectivePermission :: Lens' BucketPublicAccess (Maybe EffectivePermission)

-- | Provides information about the default server-side encryption settings
--   for an S3 bucket. For detailed information about these settings, see
--   <a>Setting default server-side encryption behavior for Amazon S3
--   buckets</a> in the <i>Amazon Simple Storage Service User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucketServerSideEncryption</a> smart constructor.
data BucketServerSideEncryption
BucketServerSideEncryption' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Type -> BucketServerSideEncryption

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or unique identifier (key ID) for the
--   KMS key that's used by default to encrypt objects that are added to
--   the bucket. This value is null if the bucket uses an Amazon S3 managed
--   key to encrypt new objects or the bucket doesn't encrypt new objects
--   by default.
[$sel:kmsMasterKeyId:BucketServerSideEncryption'] :: BucketServerSideEncryption -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of server-side encryption that's used by default when storing
--   new objects in the bucket. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AES256 - New objects are encrypted with an Amazon S3 managed key.
--   They use SSE-S3 encryption.</li>
--   <li>aws:kms - New objects are encrypted with an KMS key
--   (kmsMasterKeyId), either an Amazon Web Services managed key or a
--   customer managed key. They use SSE-KMS encryption.</li>
--   <li>NONE - New objects aren't encrypted by default. Default encryption
--   is disabled for the bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:type':BucketServerSideEncryption'] :: BucketServerSideEncryption -> Maybe Type

-- | Create a value of <a>BucketServerSideEncryption</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsMasterKeyId:BucketServerSideEncryption'</a>,
--   <a>bucketServerSideEncryption_kmsMasterKeyId</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) or unique identifier (key ID) for the KMS key that's used
--   by default to encrypt objects that are added to the bucket. This value
--   is null if the bucket uses an Amazon S3 managed key to encrypt new
--   objects or the bucket doesn't encrypt new objects by default.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':BucketServerSideEncryption'</a>,
--   <a>bucketServerSideEncryption_type</a> - The type of server-side
--   encryption that's used by default when storing new objects in the
--   bucket. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AES256 - New objects are encrypted with an Amazon S3 managed key.
--   They use SSE-S3 encryption.</li>
--   <li>aws:kms - New objects are encrypted with an KMS key
--   (kmsMasterKeyId), either an Amazon Web Services managed key or a
--   customer managed key. They use SSE-KMS encryption.</li>
--   <li>NONE - New objects aren't encrypted by default. Default encryption
--   is disabled for the bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
newBucketServerSideEncryption :: BucketServerSideEncryption

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or unique identifier (key ID) for the
--   KMS key that's used by default to encrypt objects that are added to
--   the bucket. This value is null if the bucket uses an Amazon S3 managed
--   key to encrypt new objects or the bucket doesn't encrypt new objects
--   by default.
bucketServerSideEncryption_kmsMasterKeyId :: Lens' BucketServerSideEncryption (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of server-side encryption that's used by default when storing
--   new objects in the bucket. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AES256 - New objects are encrypted with an Amazon S3 managed key.
--   They use SSE-S3 encryption.</li>
--   <li>aws:kms - New objects are encrypted with an KMS key
--   (kmsMasterKeyId), either an Amazon Web Services managed key or a
--   customer managed key. They use SSE-KMS encryption.</li>
--   <li>NONE - New objects aren't encrypted by default. Default encryption
--   is disabled for the bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
bucketServerSideEncryption_type :: Lens' BucketServerSideEncryption (Maybe Type)

-- | Specifies criteria for sorting the results of a query for information
--   about S3 buckets.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucketSortCriteria</a> smart constructor.
data BucketSortCriteria
BucketSortCriteria' :: Maybe OrderBy -> Maybe Text -> BucketSortCriteria

-- | The sort order to apply to the results, based on the value specified
--   by the attributeName property. Valid values are: ASC, sort the results
--   in ascending order; and, DESC, sort the results in descending order.
[$sel:orderBy:BucketSortCriteria'] :: BucketSortCriteria -> Maybe OrderBy

-- | The name of the bucket property to sort the results by. This value can
--   be one of the following properties that Amazon Macie defines as bucket
--   metadata: accountId, bucketName, classifiableObjectCount,
--   classifiableSizeInBytes, objectCount, or sizeInBytes.
[$sel:attributeName:BucketSortCriteria'] :: BucketSortCriteria -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>BucketSortCriteria</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:orderBy:BucketSortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>bucketSortCriteria_orderBy</a> - The sort order to apply to the
--   results, based on the value specified by the attributeName property.
--   Valid values are: ASC, sort the results in ascending order; and, DESC,
--   sort the results in descending order.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeName:BucketSortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>bucketSortCriteria_attributeName</a> - The name of the bucket
--   property to sort the results by. This value can be one of the
--   following properties that Amazon Macie defines as bucket metadata:
--   accountId, bucketName, classifiableObjectCount,
--   classifiableSizeInBytes, objectCount, or sizeInBytes.
newBucketSortCriteria :: BucketSortCriteria

-- | The sort order to apply to the results, based on the value specified
--   by the attributeName property. Valid values are: ASC, sort the results
--   in ascending order; and, DESC, sort the results in descending order.
bucketSortCriteria_orderBy :: Lens' BucketSortCriteria (Maybe OrderBy)

-- | The name of the bucket property to sort the results by. This value can
--   be one of the following properties that Amazon Macie defines as bucket
--   metadata: accountId, bucketName, classifiableObjectCount,
--   classifiableSizeInBytes, objectCount, or sizeInBytes.
bucketSortCriteria_attributeName :: Lens' BucketSortCriteria (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the location of an occurrence of sensitive data in a
--   Microsoft Excel workbook, CSV file, or TSV file.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCell</a> smart constructor.
data Cell
Cell' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Cell

-- | The row number of the row that contains the sensitive data.
[$sel:row:Cell'] :: Cell -> Maybe Integer

-- | The location of the cell, as an absolute cell reference, that contains
--   the sensitive data, for example Sheet2!C5 for cell C5 on Sheet2 in a
--   Microsoft Excel workbook. This value is null for CSV and TSV files.
[$sel:cellReference:Cell'] :: Cell -> Maybe Text

-- | The column number of the column that contains the sensitive data. For
--   a Microsoft Excel workbook, this value correlates to the alphabetical
--   character(s) for a column identifier, for example: 1 for column A, 2
--   for column B, and so on.
[$sel:column:Cell'] :: Cell -> Maybe Integer

-- | The name of the column that contains the sensitive data, if available.
[$sel:columnName:Cell'] :: Cell -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Cell</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:row:Cell'</a>, <a>cell_row</a> - The row number of the row
--   that contains the sensitive data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cellReference:Cell'</a>, <a>cell_cellReference</a> - The
--   location of the cell, as an absolute cell reference, that contains the
--   sensitive data, for example Sheet2!C5 for cell C5 on Sheet2 in a
--   Microsoft Excel workbook. This value is null for CSV and TSV files.
--   
--   <a>$sel:column:Cell'</a>, <a>cell_column</a> - The column number of
--   the column that contains the sensitive data. For a Microsoft Excel
--   workbook, this value correlates to the alphabetical character(s) for a
--   column identifier, for example: 1 for column A, 2 for column B, and so
--   on.
--   
--   <a>$sel:columnName:Cell'</a>, <a>cell_columnName</a> - The name of the
--   column that contains the sensitive data, if available.
newCell :: Cell

-- | The row number of the row that contains the sensitive data.
cell_row :: Lens' Cell (Maybe Integer)

-- | The location of the cell, as an absolute cell reference, that contains
--   the sensitive data, for example Sheet2!C5 for cell C5 on Sheet2 in a
--   Microsoft Excel workbook. This value is null for CSV and TSV files.
cell_cellReference :: Lens' Cell (Maybe Text)

-- | The column number of the column that contains the sensitive data. For
--   a Microsoft Excel workbook, this value correlates to the alphabetical
--   character(s) for a column identifier, for example: 1 for column A, 2
--   for column B, and so on.
cell_column :: Lens' Cell (Maybe Integer)

-- | The name of the column that contains the sensitive data, if available.
cell_columnName :: Lens' Cell (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides information about a sensitive data finding, including the
--   classification job that produced the finding.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClassificationDetails</a> smart constructor.
data ClassificationDetails
ClassificationDetails' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ClassificationResult -> ClassificationDetails

-- | The path to the folder or file (in Amazon S3) that contains the
--   corresponding sensitive data discovery result for the finding. If a
--   finding applies to a large archive or compressed file, this value is
--   the path to a folder. Otherwise, this value is the path to a file.
[$sel:detailedResultsLocation:ClassificationDetails'] :: ClassificationDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the classification job that produced the
--   finding.
[$sel:jobId:ClassificationDetails'] :: ClassificationDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the classification job that produced
--   the finding.
[$sel:jobArn:ClassificationDetails'] :: ClassificationDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The status and other details of the finding.
[$sel:result:ClassificationDetails'] :: ClassificationDetails -> Maybe ClassificationResult

-- | Create a value of <a>ClassificationDetails</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:detailedResultsLocation:ClassificationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>classificationDetails_detailedResultsLocation</a> - The path to the
--   folder or file (in Amazon S3) that contains the corresponding
--   sensitive data discovery result for the finding. If a finding applies
--   to a large archive or compressed file, this value is the path to a
--   folder. Otherwise, this value is the path to a file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:ClassificationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>classificationDetails_jobId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   classification job that produced the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobArn:ClassificationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>classificationDetails_jobArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the classification job that produced the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:result:ClassificationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>classificationDetails_result</a> - The status and other details of
--   the finding.
newClassificationDetails :: ClassificationDetails

-- | The path to the folder or file (in Amazon S3) that contains the
--   corresponding sensitive data discovery result for the finding. If a
--   finding applies to a large archive or compressed file, this value is
--   the path to a folder. Otherwise, this value is the path to a file.
classificationDetails_detailedResultsLocation :: Lens' ClassificationDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the classification job that produced the
--   finding.
classificationDetails_jobId :: Lens' ClassificationDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the classification job that produced
--   the finding.
classificationDetails_jobArn :: Lens' ClassificationDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The status and other details of the finding.
classificationDetails_result :: Lens' ClassificationDetails (Maybe ClassificationResult)

-- | Specifies where to store data classification results, and the
--   encryption settings to use when storing results in that location.
--   Currently, you can store classification results only in an S3 bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClassificationExportConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ClassificationExportConfiguration
ClassificationExportConfiguration' :: Maybe S3Destination -> ClassificationExportConfiguration

-- | The S3 bucket to store data classification results in, and the
--   encryption settings to use when storing results in that bucket.
[$sel:s3Destination:ClassificationExportConfiguration'] :: ClassificationExportConfiguration -> Maybe S3Destination

-- | Create a value of <a>ClassificationExportConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Destination:ClassificationExportConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>classificationExportConfiguration_s3Destination</a> - The S3 bucket
--   to store data classification results in, and the encryption settings
--   to use when storing results in that bucket.
newClassificationExportConfiguration :: ClassificationExportConfiguration

-- | The S3 bucket to store data classification results in, and the
--   encryption settings to use when storing results in that bucket.
classificationExportConfiguration_s3Destination :: Lens' ClassificationExportConfiguration (Maybe S3Destination)

-- | Provides the details of a sensitive data finding, including the types,
--   number of occurrences, and locations of the sensitive data that was
--   detected.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClassificationResult</a> smart constructor.
data ClassificationResult
ClassificationResult' :: Maybe [SensitiveDataItem] -> Maybe ClassificationResultStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe CustomDataIdentifiers -> ClassificationResult

-- | The category, types, and number of occurrences of the sensitive data
--   that produced the finding.
[$sel:sensitiveData:ClassificationResult'] :: ClassificationResult -> Maybe [SensitiveDataItem]

-- | The status of the finding.
[$sel:status:ClassificationResult'] :: ClassificationResult -> Maybe ClassificationResultStatus

-- | The type of content, as a MIME type, that the finding applies to. For
--   example, application/gzip, for a GNU Gzip compressed archive file, or
--   application/pdf, for an Adobe Portable Document Format file.
[$sel:mimeType:ClassificationResult'] :: ClassificationResult -> Maybe Text

-- | The total size, in bytes, of the data that the finding applies to.
[$sel:sizeClassified:ClassificationResult'] :: ClassificationResult -> Maybe Integer

-- | Specifies whether Amazon Macie detected additional occurrences of
--   sensitive data in the S3 object. A finding includes location data for
--   a maximum of 15 occurrences of sensitive data.
--   
--   This value can help you determine whether to investigate additional
--   occurrences of sensitive data in an object. You can do this by
--   referring to the corresponding sensitive data discovery result for the
--   finding (ClassificationDetails.detailedResultsLocation).
[$sel:additionalOccurrences:ClassificationResult'] :: ClassificationResult -> Maybe Bool

-- | The custom data identifiers that detected the sensitive data and the
--   number of occurrences of the data that they detected.
[$sel:customDataIdentifiers:ClassificationResult'] :: ClassificationResult -> Maybe CustomDataIdentifiers

-- | Provides information about the status of a sensitive data finding.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClassificationResultStatus</a> smart constructor.
data ClassificationResultStatus
ClassificationResultStatus' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ClassificationResultStatus

-- | A brief description of the status of the finding. Amazon Macie uses
--   this value to notify you of any errors, warnings, or considerations
--   that might impact your analysis of the finding.
[$sel:reason:ClassificationResultStatus'] :: ClassificationResultStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The status of the finding. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>COMPLETE - Amazon Macie successfully completed its analysis of the
--   S3 object that the finding applies to.</li>
--   <li>PARTIAL - Macie analyzed only a subset of the data in the S3
--   object that the finding applies to. For example, the object is an
--   archive file that contains files in an unsupported format.</li>
--   <li>SKIPPED - Macie wasn't able to analyze the S3 object that the
--   finding applies to. For example, the object is a file in an
--   unsupported format.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:code:ClassificationResultStatus'] :: ClassificationResultStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ClassificationResultStatus</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   status of the finding. Amazon Macie uses this value to notify you of
--   any errors, warnings, or considerations that might impact your
--   analysis of the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:code:ClassificationResultStatus'</a>,
--   <a>classificationResultStatus_code</a> - The status of the finding.
--   Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>

--   S3 object that the finding applies to.</li>
--   <li>PARTIAL - Macie analyzed only a subset of the data in the S3
--   object that the finding applies to. For example, the object is an
--   archive file that contains files in an unsupported format.</li>
--   <li>SKIPPED - Macie wasn't able to analyze the S3 object that the

--   unsupported format.</li>
--   </ul>

--   AWS_CREDENTIALS, PHONE_NUMBER, or ADDRESS.
newDefaultDetection :: DefaultDetection

-- | The location of 1-15 occurrences of the sensitive data that was
--   detected. A finding includes location data for a maximum of 15
--   occurrences of sensitive data.
defaultDetection_occurrences :: Lens' DefaultDetection (Maybe Occurrences)

-- | The total number of occurrences of the type of sensitive data that was
--   detected.
defaultDetection_count :: Lens' DefaultDetection (Maybe Integer)

-- | The type of sensitive data that was detected. For example,
--   AWS_CREDENTIALS, PHONE_NUMBER, or ADDRESS.
defaultDetection_type :: Lens' DefaultDetection (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides information about the domain name of the device that an
--   entity used to perform an action on an affected resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDomainDetails</a> smart constructor.
data DomainDetails
DomainDetails' :: Maybe Text -> DomainDetails

-- | The name of the domain.
[$sel:domainName:DomainDetails'] :: DomainDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DomainDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainName:DomainDetails'</a>, <a>domainDetails_domainName</a>
--   - The name of the domain.
newDomainDetails :: DomainDetails

-- | The name of the domain.
domainDetails_domainName :: Lens' DomainDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides information about an identity that performed an action on an
--   affected resource by using temporary security credentials. The
--   credentials were obtained using the GetFederationToken operation of
--   the Security Token Service (STS) API.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFederatedUser</a> smart constructor.
data FederatedUser
FederatedUser' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SessionContext -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> FederatedUser

-- | The unique identifier for the entity that was used to get the
--   credentials.
[$sel:principalId:FederatedUser'] :: FederatedUser -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the entity that was used to get the
--   credentials.
[$sel:arn:FederatedUser'] :: FederatedUser -> Maybe Text

-- | The details of the session that was created for the credentials,
--   including the entity that issued the session.
[$sel:sessionContext:FederatedUser'] :: FederatedUser -> Maybe SessionContext

-- | The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns
--   the entity that was used to get the credentials.
[$sel:accountId:FederatedUser'] :: FederatedUser -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services access key ID that identifies the credentials.
[$sel:accessKeyId:FederatedUser'] :: FederatedUser -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>FederatedUser</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:principalId:FederatedUser'</a>,
--   <a>federatedUser_principalId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   entity that was used to get the credentials.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:FederatedUser'</a>, <a>federatedUser_arn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the entity that was used to get the
--   credentials.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sessionContext:FederatedUser'</a>,
--   <a>federatedUser_sessionContext</a> - The details of the session that
--   was created for the credentials, including the entity that issued the
--   session.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:FederatedUser'</a>, <a>federatedUser_accountId</a> -
--   The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns
--   the entity that was used to get the credentials.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessKeyId:FederatedUser'</a>,
--   <a>federatedUser_accessKeyId</a> - The Amazon Web Services access key
--   ID that identifies the credentials.
newFederatedUser :: FederatedUser

-- | The unique identifier for the entity that was used to get the
--   credentials.
federatedUser_principalId :: Lens' FederatedUser (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the entity that was used to get the
--   credentials.
federatedUser_arn :: Lens' FederatedUser (Maybe Text)

-- | The details of the session that was created for the credentials,
--   including the entity that issued the session.
federatedUser_sessionContext :: Lens' FederatedUser (Maybe SessionContext)

-- | The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns
--   the entity that was used to get the credentials.
federatedUser_accountId :: Lens' FederatedUser (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services access key ID that identifies the credentials.
federatedUser_accessKeyId :: Lens' FederatedUser (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides the details of a finding.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFinding</a> smart constructor.
data Finding
Finding' :: Maybe ClassificationDetails -> Maybe PolicyDetails -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe FindingCategory -> Maybe Severity -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ResourcesAffected -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe FindingType -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Finding

-- | The details of a sensitive data finding. This value is null for a
--   policy finding.
[$sel:classificationDetails:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe ClassificationDetails

-- | The details of a policy finding. This value is null for a sensitive
--   data finding.
[$sel:policyDetails:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe PolicyDetails

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the
--   finding was created.
[$sel:createdAt:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The category of the finding. Possible values are: CLASSIFICATION, for
--   a sensitive data finding; and, POLICY, for a policy finding.
[$sel:category:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe FindingCategory

-- | The severity level and score for the finding.
[$sel:severity:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Severity

-- | The total number of occurrences of the finding. For sensitive data
--   findings, this value is always 1. All sensitive data findings are
--   considered new (unique) because they derive from individual
--   classification jobs.
[$sel:count:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Integer

-- | The version of the schema that was used to define the data structures
--   in the finding.
[$sel:schemaVersion:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Text

-- | The resources that the finding applies to.
[$sel:resourcesAffected:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe ResourcesAffected

-- | The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that the
--   finding applies to. This is typically the account that owns the
--   affected resource.
[$sel:accountId:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services partition that Amazon Macie created the
--   finding in.
[$sel:partition:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the finding. This is a random string that
--   Amazon Macie generates and assigns to a finding when it creates the
--   finding.
[$sel:id:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services Region that Amazon Macie created the finding
--   in.
[$sel:region:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the
--   finding was last updated. For sensitive data findings, this value is
--   the same as the value for the createdAt property. All sensitive data
--   findings are considered new (unique) because they derive from
--   individual classification jobs.
[$sel:updatedAt:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The brief description of the finding.
[$sel:title:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of the finding.
[$sel:type':Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe FindingType

-- | Specifies whether the finding is archived (suppressed).
[$sel:archived:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Bool

-- | The description of the finding.
[$sel:description:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the finding is a sample finding. A <i>sample
--   finding</i> is a finding that uses example data to demonstrate what a
--   finding might contain.
[$sel:sample:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>Finding</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:classificationDetails:Finding'</a>,
--   <a>finding_classificationDetails</a> - The details of a sensitive data
--   finding. This value is null for a policy finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyDetails:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_policyDetails</a> - The
--   details of a policy finding. This value is null for a sensitive data
--   finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_createdAt</a> - The date
--   and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the finding was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:category:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_category</a> - The category
--   of the finding. Possible values are: CLASSIFICATION, for a sensitive
--   data finding; and, POLICY, for a policy finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:severity:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_severity</a> - The severity
--   level and score for the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:count:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_count</a> - The total number of
--   occurrences of the finding. For sensitive data findings, this value is
--   always 1. All sensitive data findings are considered new (unique)
--   because they derive from individual classification jobs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schemaVersion:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_schemaVersion</a> - The
--   version of the schema that was used to define the data structures in
--   the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourcesAffected:Finding'</a>,
--   <a>finding_resourcesAffected</a> - The resources that the finding
--   applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_accountId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that the finding
--   applies to. This is typically the account that owns the affected
--   resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:partition:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_partition</a> - The Amazon
--   Web Services partition that Amazon Macie created the finding in.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_id</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the finding. This is a random string that Amazon Macie generates and
--   assigns to a finding when it creates the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_region</a> - The Amazon Web
--   Services Region that Amazon Macie created the finding in.
--   
--   <a>$sel:updatedAt:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_updatedAt</a> - The date
--   and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the finding was
--   last updated. For sensitive data findings, this value is the same as
--   the value for the createdAt property. All sensitive data findings are
--   considered new (unique) because they derive from individual
--   classification jobs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_title</a> - The brief
--   description of the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Finding'</a>, <a>finding_type</a> - The type of the
--   finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:archived:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_archived</a> - Specifies
--   whether the finding is archived (suppressed).
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_description</a> - The
--   description of the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sample:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_sample</a> - Specifies whether
--   the finding is a sample finding. A <i>sample finding</i> is a finding
--   that uses example data to demonstrate what a finding might contain.
newFinding :: Finding

-- | The details of a sensitive data finding. This value is null for a
--   policy finding.
finding_classificationDetails :: Lens' Finding (Maybe ClassificationDetails)

-- | The details of a policy finding. This value is null for a sensitive
--   data finding.
finding_policyDetails :: Lens' Finding (Maybe PolicyDetails)

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the
--   finding was created.
finding_createdAt :: Lens' Finding (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The category of the finding. Possible values are: CLASSIFICATION, for
--   a sensitive data finding; and, POLICY, for a policy finding.
finding_category :: Lens' Finding (Maybe FindingCategory)

-- | The severity level and score for the finding.
finding_severity :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Severity)

-- | The total number of occurrences of the finding. For sensitive data
--   findings, this value is always 1. All sensitive data findings are
--   considered new (unique) because they derive from individual
--   classification jobs.
finding_count :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Integer)

-- | The version of the schema that was used to define the data structures
--   in the finding.
finding_schemaVersion :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Text)

-- | The resources that the finding applies to.
finding_resourcesAffected :: Lens' Finding (Maybe ResourcesAffected)

-- | The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that the
--   finding applies to. This is typically the account that owns the
--   affected resource.
finding_accountId :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services partition that Amazon Macie created the
--   finding in.
finding_partition :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the finding. This is a random string that
--   Amazon Macie generates and assigns to a finding when it creates the
--   finding.
finding_id :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services Region that Amazon Macie created the finding
--   in.
finding_region :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the
--   finding was last updated. For sensitive data findings, this value is
--   the same as the value for the createdAt property. All sensitive data
--   findings are considered new (unique) because they derive from
--   individual classification jobs.
finding_updatedAt :: Lens' Finding (Maybe UTCTime)

finding_title :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of the finding.
finding_type :: Lens' Finding (Maybe FindingType)

finding_archived :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Bool)

finding_description :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Text)

--   finding</i> is a finding that uses example data to demonstrate what a
--   finding might contain.
finding_sample :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Bool)

-- | Provides information about an action that occurred for a resource and
--   produced a policy finding.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFindingAction</a> smart constructor.
data FindingAction
FindingAction' :: Maybe ApiCallDetails -> Maybe FindingActionType -> FindingAction

-- | The invocation details of the API operation that an entity invoked for
--   the affected resource, if the value for the actionType property is
--   AWS_API_CALL.
[$sel:apiCallDetails:FindingAction'] :: FindingAction -> Maybe ApiCallDetails

-- | The type of action that occurred for the affected resource. This value
--   is typically AWS_API_CALL, which indicates that an entity invoked an
--   API operation for the resource.
[$sel:actionType:FindingAction'] :: FindingAction -> Maybe FindingActionType

-- | Create a value of <a>FindingAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   value for the actionType property is AWS_API_CALL.
--

--   value is typically AWS_API_CALL, which indicates that an entity
--   invoked an API operation for the resource.

--   API operation for the resource.

-- | Specifies criteria for sorting the results of a query that retrieves
--   aggregated statistical data about findings.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFindingStatisticsSortCriteria</a> smart constructor.
data FindingStatisticsSortCriteria
FindingStatisticsSortCriteria' :: Maybe OrderBy -> Maybe FindingStatisticsSortAttributeName -> FindingStatisticsSortCriteria

-- | The sort order to apply to the results, based on the value for the
--   property specified by the attributeName property. Valid values are:
--   ASC, sort the results in ascending order; and, DESC, sort the results
--   in descending order.
[$sel:orderBy:FindingStatisticsSortCriteria'] :: FindingStatisticsSortCriteria -> Maybe OrderBy

-- | The grouping to sort the results by. Valid values are: count, sort the
--   results by the number of findings in each group of results; and,
--   groupKey, sort the results by the name of each group of results.
[$sel:attributeName:FindingStatisticsSortCriteria'] :: FindingStatisticsSortCriteria -> Maybe FindingStatisticsSortAttributeName

-- | Create a value of <a>FindingStatisticsSortCriteria</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:orderBy:FindingStatisticsSortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>findingStatisticsSortCriteria_orderBy</a> - The sort order to apply
--   to the results, based on the value for the property specified by the
--   attributeName property. Valid values are: ASC, sort the results in
--   ascending order; and, DESC, sort the results in descending order.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeName:FindingStatisticsSortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>findingStatisticsSortCriteria_attributeName</a> - The grouping to
--   sort the results by. Valid values are: count, sort the results by the
--   number of findings in each group of results; and, groupKey, sort the
--   results by the name of each group of results.
newFindingStatisticsSortCriteria :: FindingStatisticsSortCriteria

-- | The sort order to apply to the results, based on the value for the
--   property specified by the attributeName property. Valid values are:
--   ASC, sort the results in ascending order; and, DESC, sort the results
--   in descending order.
findingStatisticsSortCriteria_orderBy :: Lens' FindingStatisticsSortCriteria (Maybe OrderBy)

--   results by the number of findings in each group of results; and,
--   groupKey, sort the results by the name of each group of results.
findingStatisticsSortCriteria_attributeName :: Lens' FindingStatisticsSortCriteria (Maybe FindingStatisticsSortAttributeName)

-- | Provides information about a findings filter.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFindingsFilterListItem</a> smart constructor.
data FindingsFilterListItem
FindingsFilterListItem' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe FindingsFilterAction -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> FindingsFilterListItem

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the filter.
[$sel:arn:FindingsFilterListItem'] :: FindingsFilterListItem -> Maybe Text

-- | The action that's performed on findings that meet the filter criteria.
--   Possible values are: ARCHIVE, suppress (automatically archive) the
--   findings; and, NOOP, don't perform any action on the findings.
[$sel:action:FindingsFilterListItem'] :: FindingsFilterListItem -> Maybe FindingsFilterAction

-- | The custom name of the filter.
[$sel:name:FindingsFilterListItem'] :: FindingsFilterListItem -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the filter.
[$sel:id:FindingsFilterListItem'] :: FindingsFilterListItem -> Maybe Text

-- | A map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags (keys and values)
--   that are associated with the filter.
[$sel:tags:FindingsFilterListItem'] :: FindingsFilterListItem -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>FindingsFilterListItem</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:FindingsFilterListItem'</a>,
--   <a>findingsFilterListItem_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:FindingsFilterListItem'</a>,
--   <a>findingsFilterListItem_action</a> - The action that's performed on
--   findings that meet the filter criteria. Possible values are: ARCHIVE,
--   suppress (automatically archive) the findings; and, NOOP, don't
--   perform any action on the findings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:FindingsFilterListItem'</a>,
--   <a>findingsFilterListItem_name</a> - The custom name of the filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:FindingsFilterListItem'</a>,
--   <a>findingsFilterListItem_id</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:FindingsFilterListItem'</a>,
--   <a>findingsFilterListItem_tags</a> - A map of key-value pairs that
--   identifies the tags (keys and values) that are associated with the
--   filter.
newFindingsFilterListItem :: FindingsFilterListItem

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the filter.
findingsFilterListItem_arn :: Lens' FindingsFilterListItem (Maybe Text)

-- | The action that's performed on findings that meet the filter criteria.
--   Possible values are: ARCHIVE, suppress (automatically archive) the
--   findings; and, NOOP, don't perform any action on the findings.
findingsFilterListItem_action :: Lens' FindingsFilterListItem (Maybe FindingsFilterAction)

-- | The custom name of the filter.
findingsFilterListItem_name :: Lens' FindingsFilterListItem (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the filter.
findingsFilterListItem_id :: Lens' FindingsFilterListItem (Maybe Text)

--   that are associated with the filter.
findingsFilterListItem_tags :: Lens' FindingsFilterListItem (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | Provides a group of results for a query that retrieved aggregated
--   statistical data about findings.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGroupCount</a> smart constructor.
data GroupCount

--   as specified by the groupBy property in the query request.

-- | The total number of findings in the group of query results.

--   specified by the groupBy property in the query request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:count:GroupCount'</a>, <a>groupCount_count</a> - The total
--   number of findings in the group of query results.

--   as specified by the groupBy property in the query request.

-- | Provides information about an Identity and Access Management (IAM)
--   user who performed an action on an affected resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIamUser</a> smart constructor.
data IamUser
IamUser' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> IamUser

-- | The unique identifier for the IAM user who performed the action.
[$sel:principalId:IamUser'] :: IamUser -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the principal that performed the
--   action. The last section of the ARN contains the name of the user who
--   performed the action.
[$sel:arn:IamUser'] :: IamUser -> Maybe Text

-- | The user name of the IAM user who performed the action.
[$sel:userName:IamUser'] :: IamUser -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that's
--   associated with the IAM user who performed the action.
[$sel:accountId:IamUser'] :: IamUser -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>IamUser</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:principalId:IamUser'</a>, <a>iamUser_principalId</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the IAM user who performed the action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:IamUser'</a>, <a>iamUser_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the principal that performed the action. The last
--   section of the ARN contains the name of the user who performed the
--   action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userName:IamUser'</a>, <a>iamUser_userName</a> - The user name
--   of the IAM user who performed the action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:IamUser'</a>, <a>iamUser_accountId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that's associated with
--   the IAM user who performed the action.
newIamUser :: IamUser

-- | The unique identifier for the IAM user who performed the action.
iamUser_principalId :: Lens' IamUser (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the principal that performed the
--   action. The last section of the ARN contains the name of the user who
--   performed the action.
iamUser_arn :: Lens' IamUser (Maybe Text)

-- | The user name of the IAM user who performed the action.
iamUser_userName :: Lens' IamUser (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that's
--   associated with the IAM user who performed the action.
iamUser_accountId :: Lens' IamUser (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides information about an Amazon Macie membership invitation that
--   was received by an account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInvitation</a> smart constructor.
data Invitation
Invitation' :: Maybe RelationshipStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Invitation

-- | The status of the relationship between the account that sent the
--   invitation (<i>inviter account</i>) and the account that received the
--   invitation (<i>invitee account</i>).
[$sel:relationshipStatus:Invitation'] :: Invitation -> Maybe RelationshipStatus

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the
--   invitation was sent.
[$sel:invitedAt:Invitation'] :: Invitation -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The unique identifier for the invitation. Amazon Macie uses this
--   identifier to validate the inviter account with the invitee account.
[$sel:invitationId:Invitation'] :: Invitation -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID for the account that sent the
--   invitation.
[$sel:accountId:Invitation'] :: Invitation -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Invitation</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:relationshipStatus:Invitation'</a>,
--   <a>invitation_relationshipStatus</a> - The status of the relationship
--   between the account that sent the invitation (<i>inviter account</i>)
--   and the account that received the invitation (<i>invitee account</i>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:invitedAt:Invitation'</a>, <a>invitation_invitedAt</a> - The
--   date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the
--   invitation was sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:invitationId:Invitation'</a>, <a>invitation_invitationId</a> -
--   The unique identifier for the invitation. Amazon Macie uses this
--   identifier to validate the inviter account with the invitee account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:Invitation'</a>, <a>invitation_accountId</a> - The
--   Amazon Web Services account ID for the account that sent the
--   invitation.
newInvitation :: Invitation

-- | The status of the relationship between the account that sent the
--   invitation (<i>inviter account</i>) and the account that received the
--   invitation (<i>invitee account</i>).
invitation_relationshipStatus :: Lens' Invitation (Maybe RelationshipStatus)

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the
--   invitation was sent.
invitation_invitedAt :: Lens' Invitation (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The unique identifier for the invitation. Amazon Macie uses this
--   identifier to validate the inviter account with the invitee account.
invitation_invitationId :: Lens' Invitation (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID for the account that sent the
--   invitation.
invitation_accountId :: Lens' Invitation (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides information about the IP address of the device that an entity
--   used to perform an action on an affected resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIpAddressDetails</a> smart constructor.
data IpAddressDetails
IpAddressDetails' :: Maybe IpCity -> Maybe IpGeoLocation -> Maybe Text -> Maybe IpOwner -> Maybe IpCountry -> IpAddressDetails

-- | The city that the IP address originated from.
[$sel:ipCity:IpAddressDetails'] :: IpAddressDetails -> Maybe IpCity

-- | The geographic coordinates of the location that the IP address
--   originated from.
[$sel:ipGeoLocation:IpAddressDetails'] :: IpAddressDetails -> Maybe IpGeoLocation

-- | The Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) address of the device.
[$sel:ipAddressV4:IpAddressDetails'] :: IpAddressDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The registered owner of the IP address.
[$sel:ipOwner:IpAddressDetails'] :: IpAddressDetails -> Maybe IpOwner

-- | The country that the IP address originated from.
[$sel:ipCountry:IpAddressDetails'] :: IpAddressDetails -> Maybe IpCountry

-- | Create a value of <a>IpAddressDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   The city that the IP address originated from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipGeoLocation:IpAddressDetails'</a>,
--   <a>ipAddressDetails_ipGeoLocation</a> - The geographic coordinates of
--   the location that the IP address originated from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipAddressV4:IpAddressDetails'</a>,
--   <a>ipAddressDetails_ipAddressV4</a> - The Internet Protocol version 4
--   (IPv4) address of the device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipOwner:IpAddressDetails'</a>, <a>ipAddressDetails_ipOwner</a>
--   - The registered owner of the IP address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipCountry:IpAddressDetails'</a>,
--   <a>ipAddressDetails_ipCountry</a> - The country that the IP address
--   originated from.
newIpAddressDetails :: IpAddressDetails

--   originated from.

ipAddressDetails_ipOwner :: Lens' IpAddressDetails (Maybe IpOwner)

-- | The country that the IP address originated from.
ipAddressDetails_ipCountry :: Lens' IpAddressDetails (Maybe IpCountry)

data IpOwner

--   address.

--   
--   <a>$sel:isp:IpOwner'</a>, <a>ipOwner_isp</a> - The name of the

newIpOwner :: IpOwner
