--   that Amazon Macie monitors and analyzes.
newMatchingResource :: MatchingResource

-- | The details of an S3 bucket that Amazon Macie monitors and analyzes.
matchingResource_matchingBucket :: Lens' MatchingResource (Maybe MatchingBucket)

-- | Provides information about an account that's associated with an Amazon
--   Macie administrator account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMember</a> smart constructor.
data Member
Member' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RelationshipStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Member

-- | The email address for the account.
[$sel:email:Member'] :: Member -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID for the administrator account.
[$sel:administratorAccountId:Member'] :: Member -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the account.
[$sel:arn:Member'] :: Member -> Maybe Text

-- | The current status of the relationship between the account and the
--   administrator account.
[$sel:relationshipStatus:Member'] :: Member -> Maybe RelationshipStatus

-- | (Deprecated) The Amazon Web Services account ID for the administrator
--   account. This property has been replaced by the administratorAccountId
--   property and is retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:masterAccountId:Member'] :: Member -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when an Amazon
--   Macie membership invitation was last sent to the account. This value
--   is null if a Macie invitation hasn't been sent to the account.
[$sel:invitedAt:Member'] :: Member -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID for the account.
[$sel:accountId:Member'] :: Member -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, of the most
--   recent change to the status of the relationship between the account
--   and the administrator account.
[$sel:updatedAt:Member'] :: Member -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags (keys and values)
--   that are associated with the account in Amazon Macie.
[$sel:tags:Member'] :: Member -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>Member</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:email:Member'</a>, <a>member_email</a> - The email address for
--   the account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:administratorAccountId:Member'</a>,
--   <a>member_administratorAccountId</a> - The Amazon Web Services account
--   ID for the administrator account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Member'</a>, <a>member_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:relationshipStatus:Member'</a>,
--   <a>member_relationshipStatus</a> - The current status of the
--   relationship between the account and the administrator account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:masterAccountId:Member'</a>, <a>member_masterAccountId</a> -
--   (Deprecated) The Amazon Web Services account ID for the administrator
--   account. This property has been replaced by the administratorAccountId
--   property and is retained only for backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:invitedAt:Member'</a>, <a>member_invitedAt</a> - The date and
--   time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when an Amazon Macie
--   membership invitation was last sent to the account. This value is null
--   if a Macie invitation hasn't been sent to the account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:Member'</a>, <a>member_accountId</a> - The Amazon
--   Web Services account ID for the account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:updatedAt:Member'</a>, <a>member_updatedAt</a> - The date and
--   time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, of the most recent change
--   to the status of the relationship between the account and the
--   administrator account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Member'</a>, <a>member_tags</a> - A map of key-value
--   pairs that identifies the tags (keys and values) that are associated
--   with the account in Amazon Macie.
newMember :: Member

-- | The email address for the account.
member_email :: Lens' Member (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID for the administrator account.
member_administratorAccountId :: Lens' Member (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the account.
member_arn :: Lens' Member (Maybe Text)

-- | The current status of the relationship between the account and the
--   administrator account.
member_relationshipStatus :: Lens' Member (Maybe RelationshipStatus)

-- | (Deprecated) The Amazon Web Services account ID for the administrator
--   account. This property has been replaced by the administratorAccountId
--   property and is retained only for backward compatibility.
member_masterAccountId :: Lens' Member (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when an Amazon
--   Macie membership invitation was last sent to the account. This value
--   is null if a Macie invitation hasn't been sent to the account.
member_invitedAt :: Lens' Member (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID for the account.
member_accountId :: Lens' Member (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, of the most
--   recent change to the status of the relationship between the account
--   and the administrator account.
member_updatedAt :: Lens' Member (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags (keys and values)
--   that are associated with the account in Amazon Macie.
member_tags :: Lens' Member (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | Specifies a monthly recurrence pattern for running a classification
--   job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMonthlySchedule</a> smart constructor.
data MonthlySchedule
MonthlySchedule' :: Maybe Int -> MonthlySchedule

-- | The numeric day of the month when Amazon Macie runs the job. This
--   value can be an integer from 1 through 31.
--   
--   If this value exceeds the number of days in a certain month, Macie
--   doesn't run the job that month. Macie runs the job only during months
--   that have the specified day. For example, if this value is 31 and a
--   month has only 30 days, Macie doesn't run the job that month. To run
--   the job every month, specify a value that's less than 29.
[$sel:dayOfMonth:MonthlySchedule'] :: MonthlySchedule -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>MonthlySchedule</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dayOfMonth:MonthlySchedule'</a>,
--   <a>monthlySchedule_dayOfMonth</a> - The numeric day of the month when
--   Amazon Macie runs the job. This value can be an integer from 1 through
--   31.
--   
--   If this value exceeds the number of days in a certain month, Macie
--   doesn't run the job that month. Macie runs the job only during months
--   that have the specified day. For example, if this value is 31 and a
--   month has only 30 days, Macie doesn't run the job that month. To run
--   the job every month, specify a value that's less than 29.
newMonthlySchedule :: MonthlySchedule

-- | The numeric day of the month when Amazon Macie runs the job. This
--   value can be an integer from 1 through 31.
--   
--   If this value exceeds the number of days in a certain month, Macie
--   doesn't run the job that month. Macie runs the job only during months
--   that have the specified day. For example, if this value is 31 and a
--   month has only 30 days, Macie doesn't run the job that month. To run
--   the job every month, specify a value that's less than 29.
monthlySchedule_dayOfMonth :: Lens' MonthlySchedule (Maybe Int)

-- | Provides information about the number of objects that are in an S3
--   bucket and use certain types of server-side encryption, use
--   client-side encryption, or aren't encrypted.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newObjectCountByEncryptionType</a> smart constructor.
data ObjectCountByEncryptionType
ObjectCountByEncryptionType' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> ObjectCountByEncryptionType

-- | The total number of objects that Amazon Macie doesn't have current
--   encryption metadata for. Macie can't provide current data about the
--   encryption settings for these objects.
[$sel:unknown:ObjectCountByEncryptionType'] :: ObjectCountByEncryptionType -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total number of objects that are encrypted with an Amazon S3
--   managed key. The objects use Amazon S3 managed encryption (SSE-S3).
[$sel:s3Managed:ObjectCountByEncryptionType'] :: ObjectCountByEncryptionType -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total number of objects that aren't encrypted or use client-side
--   encryption.
[$sel:unencrypted:ObjectCountByEncryptionType'] :: ObjectCountByEncryptionType -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total number of objects that are encrypted with an KMS key, either
--   an Amazon Web Services managed key or a customer managed key. The
--   objects use KMS encryption (SSE-KMS).
[$sel:kmsManaged:ObjectCountByEncryptionType'] :: ObjectCountByEncryptionType -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total number of objects that are encrypted with a
--   customer-provided key. The objects use customer-provided server-side
--   encryption (SSE-C).
[$sel:customerManaged:ObjectCountByEncryptionType'] :: ObjectCountByEncryptionType -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>ObjectCountByEncryptionType</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:unknown:ObjectCountByEncryptionType'</a>,
--   <a>objectCountByEncryptionType_unknown</a> - The total number of
--   objects that Amazon Macie doesn't have current encryption metadata
--   for. Macie can't provide current data about the encryption settings
--   for these objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Managed:ObjectCountByEncryptionType'</a>,
--   <a>objectCountByEncryptionType_s3Managed</a> - The total number of
--   objects that are encrypted with an Amazon S3 managed key. The objects
--   use Amazon S3 managed encryption (SSE-S3).
--   
--   <a>$sel:unencrypted:ObjectCountByEncryptionType'</a>,
--   <a>objectCountByEncryptionType_unencrypted</a> - The total number of
--   objects that aren't encrypted or use client-side encryption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsManaged:ObjectCountByEncryptionType'</a>,
--   <a>objectCountByEncryptionType_kmsManaged</a> - The total number of
--   objects that are encrypted with an KMS key, either an Amazon Web
--   Services managed key or a customer managed key. The objects use KMS
--   encryption (SSE-KMS).
--   
--   <a>$sel:customerManaged:ObjectCountByEncryptionType'</a>,
--   <a>objectCountByEncryptionType_customerManaged</a> - The total number
--   of objects that are encrypted with a customer-provided key. The
--   objects use customer-provided server-side encryption (SSE-C).
newObjectCountByEncryptionType :: ObjectCountByEncryptionType

-- | The total number of objects that Amazon Macie doesn't have current
--   encryption metadata for. Macie can't provide current data about the
--   encryption settings for these objects.
objectCountByEncryptionType_unknown :: Lens' ObjectCountByEncryptionType (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total number of objects that are encrypted with an Amazon S3
--   managed key. The objects use Amazon S3 managed encryption (SSE-S3).
objectCountByEncryptionType_s3Managed :: Lens' ObjectCountByEncryptionType (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total number of objects that aren't encrypted or use client-side
--   encryption.
objectCountByEncryptionType_unencrypted :: Lens' ObjectCountByEncryptionType (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total number of objects that are encrypted with an KMS key, either
--   an Amazon Web Services managed key or a customer managed key. The
--   objects use KMS encryption (SSE-KMS).
objectCountByEncryptionType_kmsManaged :: Lens' ObjectCountByEncryptionType (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total number of objects that are encrypted with a
--   customer-provided key. The objects use customer-provided server-side
--   encryption (SSE-C).
objectCountByEncryptionType_customerManaged :: Lens' ObjectCountByEncryptionType (Maybe Integer)

-- | Provides information about the total storage size (in bytes) or number
--   of objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze in one or more S3 buckets.
--   In a BucketMetadata or MatchingBucket object, this data is for a
--   specific bucket. In a GetBucketStatisticsResponse object, this data is
--   aggregated for the buckets in the query results. If versioning is
--   enabled for a bucket, total storage size values are based on the size
--   of the latest version of each applicable object in the bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newObjectLevelStatistics</a> smart constructor.
data ObjectLevelStatistics
ObjectLevelStatistics' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> ObjectLevelStatistics

-- | The total storage size (in bytes) or number of objects that Amazon
--   Macie can't analyze because the objects don't have a file name
--   extension for a supported file or storage format.
[$sel:fileType:ObjectLevelStatistics'] :: ObjectLevelStatistics -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total storage size (in bytes) or number of objects that Amazon
--   Macie can't analyze because the objects use an unsupported storage
--   class.
[$sel:storageClass:ObjectLevelStatistics'] :: ObjectLevelStatistics -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total storage size (in bytes) or number of objects that Amazon
--   Macie can't analyze because the objects use an unsupported storage
--   class or don't have a file name extension for a supported file or
--   storage format.
[$sel:total:ObjectLevelStatistics'] :: ObjectLevelStatistics -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>ObjectLevelStatistics</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileType:ObjectLevelStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>objectLevelStatistics_fileType</a> - The total storage size (in
--   bytes) or number of objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze because
--   the objects don't have a file name extension for a supported file or
--   storage format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageClass:ObjectLevelStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>objectLevelStatistics_storageClass</a> - The total storage size (in
--   bytes) or number of objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze because
--   the objects use an unsupported storage class.
--   
--   <a>$sel:total:ObjectLevelStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>objectLevelStatistics_total</a> - The total storage size (in bytes)
--   or number of objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze because the
--   objects use an unsupported storage class or don't have a file name
--   extension for a supported file or storage format.
newObjectLevelStatistics :: ObjectLevelStatistics

-- | The total storage size (in bytes) or number of objects that Amazon
--   Macie can't analyze because the objects don't have a file name
--   extension for a supported file or storage format.
objectLevelStatistics_fileType :: Lens' ObjectLevelStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total storage size (in bytes) or number of objects that Amazon
--   Macie can't analyze because the objects use an unsupported storage
--   class.
objectLevelStatistics_storageClass :: Lens' ObjectLevelStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total storage size (in bytes) or number of objects that Amazon
--   Macie can't analyze because the objects use an unsupported storage
--   class or don't have a file name extension for a supported file or
--   storage format.
objectLevelStatistics_total :: Lens' ObjectLevelStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | Specifies the location of 1-15 occurrences of sensitive data that was
--   detected by a managed data identifier or a custom data identifier and
--   produced a sensitive data finding.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOccurrences</a> smart constructor.
data Occurrences
Occurrences' :: Maybe [Range] -> Maybe [Cell] -> Maybe [Page] -> Maybe [Record] -> Maybe [Range] -> Occurrences

-- | An array of objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in a
--   non-binary text file, such as an HTML, TXT, or XML file. Each Range
--   object specifies a line or inclusive range of lines that contains the
--   sensitive data, and the position of the data on the specified line or
--   lines.
--   
--   This value is often null for file types that are supported by Cell,
--   Page, or Record objects. Exceptions are the location of sensitive data
--   in: unstructured sections of an otherwise structured file, such as a
--   comment in a file; a malformed file that Amazon Macie analyzes as
--   plain text; and, a CSV or TSV file that has any column names that
--   contain sensitive data.
[$sel:lineRanges:Occurrences'] :: Occurrences -> Maybe [Range]

-- | An array of objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in a
--   Microsoft Excel workbook, CSV file, or TSV file. This value is null
--   for all other types of files.
--   
--   Each Cell object specifies a cell or field that contains the sensitive
--   data.
[$sel:cells:Occurrences'] :: Occurrences -> Maybe [Cell]

-- | An array of objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in an
--   Adobe Portable Document Format file. This value is null for all other
--   types of files.
--   
--   Each Page object specifies a page that contains the sensitive data.
[$sel:pages:Occurrences'] :: Occurrences -> Maybe [Page]

-- | An array of objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in an
--   Apache Avro object container, Apache Parquet file, JSON file, or JSON
--   Lines file. This value is null for all other types of files.
--   
--   For an Avro object container or Parquet file, each Record object
--   specifies a record index and the path to a field in a record that
--   contains the sensitive data. For a JSON or JSON Lines file, each
--   Record object specifies the path to a field or array that contains the
--   sensitive data. For a JSON Lines file, it also specifies the index of
--   the line that contains the data.
[$sel:records:Occurrences'] :: Occurrences -> Maybe [Record]

-- | Reserved for future use.
[$sel:offsetRanges:Occurrences'] :: Occurrences -> Maybe [Range]

-- | Create a value of <a>Occurrences</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lineRanges:Occurrences'</a>, <a>occurrences_lineRanges</a> -
--   An array of objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in a
--   non-binary text file, such as an HTML, TXT, or XML file. Each Range
--   object specifies a line or inclusive range of lines that contains the
--   sensitive data, and the position of the data on the specified line or
--   lines.
--   
--   This value is often null for file types that are supported by Cell,
--   Page, or Record objects. Exceptions are the location of sensitive data
--   in: unstructured sections of an otherwise structured file, such as a
--   comment in a file; a malformed file that Amazon Macie analyzes as
--   plain text; and, a CSV or TSV file that has any column names that
--   contain sensitive data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cells:Occurrences'</a>, <a>occurrences_cells</a> - An array of
--   objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in a Microsoft
--   Excel workbook, CSV file, or TSV file. This value is null for all
--   other types of files.
--   
--   Each Cell object specifies a cell or field that contains the sensitive
--   data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pages:Occurrences'</a>, <a>occurrences_pages</a> - An array of
--   objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in an Adobe
--   Portable Document Format file. This value is null for all other types
--   of files.
--   
--   Each Page object specifies a page that contains the sensitive data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:records:Occurrences'</a>, <a>occurrences_records</a> - An
--   array of objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in an
--   Apache Avro object container, Apache Parquet file, JSON file, or JSON
--   Lines file. This value is null for all other types of files.
--   
--   For an Avro object container or Parquet file, each Record object
--   specifies a record index and the path to a field in a record that
--   contains the sensitive data. For a JSON or JSON Lines file, each
--   Record object specifies the path to a field or array that contains the
--   sensitive data. For a JSON Lines file, it also specifies the index of
--   the line that contains the data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:offsetRanges:Occurrences'</a>, <a>occurrences_offsetRanges</a>
--   - Reserved for future use.
newOccurrences :: Occurrences

-- | An array of objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in a
--   non-binary text file, such as an HTML, TXT, or XML file. Each Range
--   object specifies a line or inclusive range of lines that contains the
--   sensitive data, and the position of the data on the specified line or
--   lines.
--   
--   This value is often null for file types that are supported by Cell,
--   Page, or Record objects. Exceptions are the location of sensitive data
--   in: unstructured sections of an otherwise structured file, such as a
--   comment in a file; a malformed file that Amazon Macie analyzes as
--   plain text; and, a CSV or TSV file that has any column names that
--   contain sensitive data.
occurrences_lineRanges :: Lens' Occurrences (Maybe [Range])

-- | An array of objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in a
--   Microsoft Excel workbook, CSV file, or TSV file. This value is null
--   for all other types of files.
--   
--   Each Cell object specifies a cell or field that contains the sensitive
--   data.
occurrences_cells :: Lens' Occurrences (Maybe [Cell])

-- | An array of objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in an
--   Adobe Portable Document Format file. This value is null for all other
--   types of files.
--   
--   Each Page object specifies a page that contains the sensitive data.
occurrences_pages :: Lens' Occurrences (Maybe [Page])

-- | An array of objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in an
--   Apache Avro object container, Apache Parquet file, JSON file, or JSON
--   Lines file. This value is null for all other types of files.
--   
--   For an Avro object container or Parquet file, each Record object
--   specifies a record index and the path to a field in a record that
--   contains the sensitive data. For a JSON or JSON Lines file, each
--   Record object specifies the path to a field or array that contains the
--   sensitive data. For a JSON Lines file, it also specifies the index of
--   the line that contains the data.
occurrences_records :: Lens' Occurrences (Maybe [Record])

-- | Reserved for future use.
occurrences_offsetRanges :: Lens' Occurrences (Maybe [Range])

-- | Specifies the location of an occurrence of sensitive data in an Adobe
--   Portable Document Format file.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPage</a> smart constructor.
data Page
Page' :: Maybe Range -> Maybe Range -> Maybe Integer -> Page

-- | Reserved for future use.
[$sel:offsetRange:Page'] :: Page -> Maybe Range

-- | Reserved for future use.
[$sel:lineRange:Page'] :: Page -> Maybe Range

-- | The page number of the page that contains the sensitive data.
[$sel:pageNumber:Page'] :: Page -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>Page</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:offsetRange:Page'</a>, <a>page_offsetRange</a> - Reserved for
--   future use.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lineRange:Page'</a>, <a>page_lineRange</a> - Reserved for
--   future use.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageNumber:Page'</a>, <a>page_pageNumber</a> - The page number
--   of the page that contains the sensitive data.
newPage :: Page

-- | Reserved for future use.
page_offsetRange :: Lens' Page (Maybe Range)

-- | Reserved for future use.
page_lineRange :: Lens' Page (Maybe Range)

-- | The page number of the page that contains the sensitive data.
page_pageNumber :: Lens' Page (Maybe Integer)

-- | Provides the details of a policy finding.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicyDetails</a> smart constructor.
data PolicyDetails
PolicyDetails' :: Maybe FindingActor -> Maybe FindingAction -> PolicyDetails

-- | The entity that performed the action that produced the finding.
[$sel:actor:PolicyDetails'] :: PolicyDetails -> Maybe FindingActor

-- | The action that produced the finding.
[$sel:action:PolicyDetails'] :: PolicyDetails -> Maybe FindingAction

-- | Create a value of <a>PolicyDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:actor:PolicyDetails'</a>, <a>policyDetails_actor</a> - The
--   entity that performed the action that produced the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:PolicyDetails'</a>, <a>policyDetails_action</a> - The
--   action that produced the finding.
newPolicyDetails :: PolicyDetails

-- | The entity that performed the action that produced the finding.
policyDetails_actor :: Lens' PolicyDetails (Maybe FindingActor)

-- | The action that produced the finding.
policyDetails_action :: Lens' PolicyDetails (Maybe FindingAction)

-- | Specifies the location of an occurrence of sensitive data in a
--   non-binary text file, such as an HTML, TXT, or XML file.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRange</a> smart constructor.
data Range
Range' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Range

-- | The number of lines from the beginning of the file to the beginning of
--   the sensitive data.
[$sel:start:Range'] :: Range -> Maybe Integer

-- | The number of lines from the beginning of the file to the end of the
--   sensitive data.
[$sel:end:Range'] :: Range -> Maybe Integer

-- | The number of characters, with spaces and starting from 1, from the
--   beginning of the first line that contains the sensitive data (start)
--   to the beginning of the sensitive data.
[$sel:startColumn:Range'] :: Range -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>Range</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:start:Range'</a>, <a>range_start</a> - The number of lines
--   from the beginning of the file to the beginning of the sensitive data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:end:Range'</a>, <a>range_end</a> - The number of lines from
--   the beginning of the file to the end of the sensitive data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startColumn:Range'</a>, <a>range_startColumn</a> - The number
--   of characters, with spaces and starting from 1, from the beginning of
--   the first line that contains the sensitive data (start) to the
--   beginning of the sensitive data.
newRange :: Range

-- | The number of lines from the beginning of the file to the beginning of
--   the sensitive data.
range_start :: Lens' Range (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of lines from the beginning of the file to the end of the
--   sensitive data.
range_end :: Lens' Range (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of characters, with spaces and starting from 1, from the
--   beginning of the first line that contains the sensitive data (start)
--   to the beginning of the sensitive data.
range_startColumn :: Lens' Range (Maybe Integer)

-- | Specifies the location of an occurrence of sensitive data in an Apache
--   Avro object container, Apache Parquet file, JSON file, or JSON Lines
--   file.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecord</a> smart constructor.
data Record
Record' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Record

-- | The path, as a JSONPath expression, to the sensitive data. For an Avro
--   object container or Parquet file, this is the path to the field in the
--   record (recordIndex) that contains the data. For a JSON or JSON Lines
--   file, this is the path to the field or array that contains the data.
--   If the data is a value in an array, the path also indicates which
--   value contains the data.
--   
--   If Amazon Macie detects sensitive data in the name of any element in
--   the path, Macie omits this field. If the name of an element exceeds 20
--   characters, Macie truncates the name by removing characters from the
--   beginning of the name. If the resulting full path exceeds 250
--   characters, Macie also truncates the path, starting with the first
--   element in the path, until the path contains 250 or fewer characters.
[$sel:jsonPath:Record'] :: Record -> Maybe Text

-- | For an Avro object container or Parquet file, the record index,
--   starting from 0, for the record that contains the sensitive data. For
--   a JSON Lines file, the line index, starting from 0, for the line that
--   contains the sensitive data. This value is always 0 for JSON files.
[$sel:recordIndex:Record'] :: Record -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>Record</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:jsonPath:Record'</a>, <a>record_jsonPath</a> - The path, as a
--   JSONPath expression, to the sensitive data. For an Avro object
--   container or Parquet file, this is the path to the field in the record
--   (recordIndex) that contains the data. For a JSON or JSON Lines file,
--   this is the path to the field or array that contains the data. If the
--   data is a value in an array, the path also indicates which value
--   contains the data.
--   
--   If Amazon Macie detects sensitive data in the name of any element in
--   the path, Macie omits this field. If the name of an element exceeds 20
--   characters, Macie truncates the name by removing characters from the
--   beginning of the name. If the resulting full path exceeds 250
--   characters, Macie also truncates the path, starting with the first
--   element in the path, until the path contains 250 or fewer characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recordIndex:Record'</a>, <a>record_recordIndex</a> - For an
--   Avro object container or Parquet file, the record index, starting from
--   0, for the record that contains the sensitive data. For a JSON Lines
--   file, the line index, starting from 0, for the line that contains the
--   sensitive data. This value is always 0 for JSON files.
newRecord :: Record

-- | The path, as a JSONPath expression, to the sensitive data. For an Avro
--   object container or Parquet file, this is the path to the field in the
--   record (recordIndex) that contains the data. For a JSON or JSON Lines
--   file, this is the path to the field or array that contains the data.
--   If the data is a value in an array, the path also indicates which
--   value contains the data.
--   
--   If Amazon Macie detects sensitive data in the name of any element in
--   the path, Macie omits this field. If the name of an element exceeds 20
--   characters, Macie truncates the name by removing characters from the
--   beginning of the name. If the resulting full path exceeds 250
--   characters, Macie also truncates the path, starting with the first
--   element in the path, until the path contains 250 or fewer characters.
record_jsonPath :: Lens' Record (Maybe Text)

-- | For an Avro object container or Parquet file, the record index,
--   starting from 0, for the record that contains the sensitive data. For
--   a JSON Lines file, the line index, starting from 0, for the line that
--   contains the sensitive data. This value is always 0 for JSON files.
record_recordIndex :: Lens' Record (Maybe Integer)

-- | Provides information about settings that define whether one or more
--   objects in an S3 bucket are replicated to S3 buckets for other Amazon
--   Web Services accounts and, if so, which accounts.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReplicationDetails</a> smart constructor.
data ReplicationDetails
ReplicationDetails' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Bool -> ReplicationDetails

-- | Specifies whether the bucket is configured to replicate one or more
--   objects to any destination.
[$sel:replicated:ReplicationDetails'] :: ReplicationDetails -> Maybe Bool

-- | An array of Amazon Web Services account IDs, one for each Amazon Web
--   Services account that the bucket is configured to replicate one or
--   more objects to.
[$sel:replicationAccounts:ReplicationDetails'] :: ReplicationDetails -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Specifies whether the bucket is configured to replicate one or more
--   objects to an Amazon Web Services account that isn't part of the same
--   Amazon Macie organization.
[$sel:replicatedExternally:ReplicationDetails'] :: ReplicationDetails -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>ReplicationDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicated:ReplicationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>replicationDetails_replicated</a> - Specifies whether the bucket is
--   configured to replicate one or more objects to any destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationAccounts:ReplicationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>replicationDetails_replicationAccounts</a> - An array of Amazon Web
--   Services account IDs, one for each Amazon Web Services account that
--   the bucket is configured to replicate one or more objects to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicatedExternally:ReplicationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>replicationDetails_replicatedExternally</a> - Specifies whether the
--   bucket is configured to replicate one or more objects to an Amazon Web
--   Services account that isn't part of the same Amazon Macie
--   organization.
newReplicationDetails :: ReplicationDetails

-- | Specifies whether the bucket is configured to replicate one or more
--   objects to any destination.
replicationDetails_replicated :: Lens' ReplicationDetails (Maybe Bool)

-- | An array of Amazon Web Services account IDs, one for each Amazon Web
--   Services account that the bucket is configured to replicate one or
--   more objects to.
replicationDetails_replicationAccounts :: Lens' ReplicationDetails (Maybe [Text])

-- | Specifies whether the bucket is configured to replicate one or more
--   objects to an Amazon Web Services account that isn't part of the same
--   Amazon Macie organization.
replicationDetails_replicatedExternally :: Lens' ReplicationDetails (Maybe Bool)

-- | Provides information about the resources that a finding applies to.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResourcesAffected</a> smart constructor.
data ResourcesAffected
ResourcesAffected' :: Maybe S3Object -> Maybe S3Bucket -> ResourcesAffected

-- | The details of the S3 object that the finding applies to.
[$sel:s3Object:ResourcesAffected'] :: ResourcesAffected -> Maybe S3Object

-- | The details of the S3 bucket that the finding applies to.
[$sel:s3Bucket:ResourcesAffected'] :: ResourcesAffected -> Maybe S3Bucket

-- | Create a value of <a>ResourcesAffected</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Object:ResourcesAffected'</a>,
--   <a>resourcesAffected_s3Object</a> - The details of the S3 object that
--   the finding applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Bucket:ResourcesAffected'</a>,
--   <a>resourcesAffected_s3Bucket</a> - The details of the S3 bucket that
--   the finding applies to.
newResourcesAffected :: ResourcesAffected

-- | The details of the S3 object that the finding applies to.
resourcesAffected_s3Object :: Lens' ResourcesAffected (Maybe S3Object)

-- | The details of the S3 bucket that the finding applies to.
resourcesAffected_s3Bucket :: Lens' ResourcesAffected (Maybe S3Bucket)

-- | Provides information about the S3 bucket that a finding applies to.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3Bucket</a> smart constructor.
data S3Bucket
S3Bucket' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe S3BucketOwner -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ServerSideEncryption -> Maybe AllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads -> Maybe BucketPublicAccess -> Maybe [KeyValuePair] -> S3Bucket

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket.
[$sel:arn:S3Bucket'] :: S3Bucket -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the
--   bucket was created.
[$sel:createdAt:S3Bucket'] :: S3Bucket -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The display name and canonical user ID for the Amazon Web Services
--   account that owns the bucket.
[$sel:owner:S3Bucket'] :: S3Bucket -> Maybe S3BucketOwner

-- | The name of the bucket.
[$sel:name:S3Bucket'] :: S3Bucket -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of server-side encryption that's used by default to encrypt
--   objects in the bucket.
[$sel:defaultServerSideEncryption:S3Bucket'] :: S3Bucket -> Maybe ServerSideEncryption

-- | Specifies whether the bucket policy for the bucket requires
--   server-side encryption of objects when objects are uploaded to the
--   bucket. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>FALSE - The bucket policy requires server-side encryption of new
--   objects. PutObject requests must include the
--   x-amz-server-side-encryption header and the value for that header must
--   be AES256 or aws:kms.</li>
--   <li>TRUE - The bucket doesn't have a bucket policy or it has a bucket
--   policy that doesn't require server-side encryption of new objects. If
--   a bucket policy exists, it doesn't require PutObject requests to
--   include the x-amz-server-side-encryption header and it doesn't require
--   the value for that header to be AES256 or aws:kms.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie can't determine whether the bucket policy
--   requires server-side encryption of objects.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:allowsUnencryptedObjectUploads:S3Bucket'] :: S3Bucket -> Maybe AllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads

-- | The permissions settings that determine whether the bucket is publicly
--   accessible.
[$sel:publicAccess:S3Bucket'] :: S3Bucket -> Maybe BucketPublicAccess

-- | The tags that are associated with the bucket.
[$sel:tags:S3Bucket'] :: S3Bucket -> Maybe [KeyValuePair]

-- | Create a value of <a>S3Bucket</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:S3Bucket'</a>, <a>s3Bucket_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:S3Bucket'</a>, <a>s3Bucket_createdAt</a> - The date
--   and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the bucket was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:owner:S3Bucket'</a>, <a>s3Bucket_owner</a> - The display name
--   and canonical user ID for the Amazon Web Services account that owns
--   the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:S3Bucket'</a>, <a>s3Bucket_name</a> - The name of the
--   bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultServerSideEncryption:S3Bucket'</a>,
--   <a>s3Bucket_defaultServerSideEncryption</a> - The type of server-side
--   encryption that's used by default to encrypt objects in the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowsUnencryptedObjectUploads:S3Bucket'</a>,
--   <a>s3Bucket_allowsUnencryptedObjectUploads</a> - Specifies whether the
--   bucket policy for the bucket requires server-side encryption of
--   objects when objects are uploaded to the bucket. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>FALSE - The bucket policy requires server-side encryption of new
--   objects. PutObject requests must include the
--   x-amz-server-side-encryption header and the value for that header must
--   be AES256 or aws:kms.</li>
--   <li>TRUE - The bucket doesn't have a bucket policy or it has a bucket
--   policy that doesn't require server-side encryption of new objects. If
--   a bucket policy exists, it doesn't require PutObject requests to
--   include the x-amz-server-side-encryption header and it doesn't require
--   the value for that header to be AES256 or aws:kms.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie can't determine whether the bucket policy
--   requires server-side encryption of objects.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicAccess:S3Bucket'</a>, <a>s3Bucket_publicAccess</a> - The
--   permissions settings that determine whether the bucket is publicly
--   accessible.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:S3Bucket'</a>, <a>s3Bucket_tags</a> - The tags that are
--   associated with the bucket.
newS3Bucket :: S3Bucket

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket.
s3Bucket_arn :: Lens' S3Bucket (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the
--   bucket was created.
s3Bucket_createdAt :: Lens' S3Bucket (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The display name and canonical user ID for the Amazon Web Services
--   account that owns the bucket.
s3Bucket_owner :: Lens' S3Bucket (Maybe S3BucketOwner)

-- | The name of the bucket.
s3Bucket_name :: Lens' S3Bucket (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of server-side encryption that's used by default to encrypt
--   objects in the bucket.
s3Bucket_defaultServerSideEncryption :: Lens' S3Bucket (Maybe ServerSideEncryption)

-- | Specifies whether the bucket policy for the bucket requires
--   server-side encryption of objects when objects are uploaded to the
--   bucket. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>FALSE - The bucket policy requires server-side encryption of new
--   objects. PutObject requests must include the
--   x-amz-server-side-encryption header and the value for that header must
--   be AES256 or aws:kms.</li>
--   <li>TRUE - The bucket doesn't have a bucket policy or it has a bucket
--   policy that doesn't require server-side encryption of new objects. If
--   a bucket policy exists, it doesn't require PutObject requests to
--   include the x-amz-server-side-encryption header and it doesn't require
--   the value for that header to be AES256 or aws:kms.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie can't determine whether the bucket policy
--   requires server-side encryption of objects.</li>
--   </ul>
s3Bucket_allowsUnencryptedObjectUploads :: Lens' S3Bucket (Maybe AllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads)

-- | The permissions settings that determine whether the bucket is publicly
--   accessible.
s3Bucket_publicAccess :: Lens' S3Bucket (Maybe BucketPublicAccess)

-- | The tags that are associated with the bucket.
s3Bucket_tags :: Lens' S3Bucket (Maybe [KeyValuePair])

-- | Specifies property- and tag-based conditions that define criteria for
--   including or excluding S3 buckets from a classification job. Exclude
--   conditions take precedence over include conditions.

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3BucketCriteriaForJob</a> smart constructor.

-- | Specifies an S3 bucket to store data classification results in, and
--   the encryption settings to use when storing results in that bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3Destination</a> smart constructor.
data S3Destination
S3Destination' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> S3Destination

-- | The path prefix to use in the path to the location in the bucket. This
--   prefix specifies where to store classification results in the bucket.
[$sel:keyPrefix:S3Destination'] :: S3Destination -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the bucket.
[$sel:bucketName:S3Destination'] :: S3Destination -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the KMS key to use for encryption of
--   the results. This must be the ARN of an existing, symmetric, customer
--   managed KMS key that's in the same Amazon Web Services Region as the
--   bucket.
[$sel:kmsKeyArn:S3Destination'] :: S3Destination -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>S3Destination</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   fields.

--   <a>$sel:bucketName:S3Destination'</a>, <a>s3Destination_bucketName</a>
--   - The name of the bucket.

--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyArn:S3Destination'</a>, <a>s3Destination_kmsKeyArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the KMS key to use for encryption of
--   the results. This must be the ARN of an existing, symmetric, customer
--   managed KMS key that's in the same Amazon Web Services Region as the
--   bucket.

s3Destination_bucketName :: Lens' S3Destination Text

-- | Specifies which S3 buckets contain the objects that a classification
--   job analyzes, and the scope of that analysis. The bucket specification
--   can be static (bucketDefinitions) or dynamic (bucketCriteria). If it's
--   static, the job analyzes objects in the same predefined set of buckets
--   each time the job runs. If it's dynamic, the job analyzes objects in
--   any buckets that match the specified criteria each time the job starts
--   to run.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3JobDefinition</a> smart constructor.
data S3JobDefinition
S3JobDefinition' :: Maybe Scoping -> Maybe S3BucketCriteriaForJob -> Maybe [S3BucketDefinitionForJob] -> S3JobDefinition

-- | The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which S3 objects
--   to include or exclude from the analysis. Each time the job runs, the
--   job uses these criteria to determine which objects to analyze.
[$sel:scoping:S3JobDefinition'] :: S3JobDefinition -> Maybe Scoping

-- | The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which S3 buckets
--   to include or exclude from the analysis. Each time the job runs, the
--   job uses these criteria to determine which buckets contain objects to
--   analyze. A job's definition can contain a bucketCriteria object or a
--   bucketDefinitions array, not both.
[$sel:bucketCriteria:S3JobDefinition'] :: S3JobDefinition -> Maybe S3BucketCriteriaForJob

-- | An array of objects, one for each Amazon Web Services account that
--   owns specific S3 buckets to analyze. Each object specifies the account
--   ID for an account and one or more buckets to analyze for that account.
--   A job's definition can contain a bucketDefinitions array or a
--   bucketCriteria object, not both.
[$sel:bucketDefinitions:S3JobDefinition'] :: S3JobDefinition -> Maybe [S3BucketDefinitionForJob]

-- | Create a value of <a>S3JobDefinition</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:scoping:S3JobDefinition'</a>, <a>s3JobDefinition_scoping</a> -
--   The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which S3 objects
--   to include or exclude from the analysis. Each time the job runs, the
--   job uses these criteria to determine which objects to analyze.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketCriteria:S3JobDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>s3JobDefinition_bucketCriteria</a> - The property- and tag-based
--   conditions that determine which S3 buckets to include or exclude from
--   the analysis. Each time the job runs, the job uses these criteria to
--   determine which buckets contain objects to analyze. A job's definition
--   can contain a bucketCriteria object or a bucketDefinitions array, not
--   both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketDefinitions:S3JobDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>s3JobDefinition_bucketDefinitions</a> - An array of objects, one
--   for each Amazon Web Services account that owns specific S3 buckets to
--   analyze. Each object specifies the account ID for an account and one
--   or more buckets to analyze for that account. A job's definition can
--   contain a bucketDefinitions array or a bucketCriteria object, not
--   both.
newS3JobDefinition :: S3JobDefinition

-- | The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which S3 objects
--   to include or exclude from the analysis. Each time the job runs, the
--   job uses these criteria to determine which objects to analyze.
s3JobDefinition_scoping :: Lens' S3JobDefinition (Maybe Scoping)

-- | The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which S3 buckets
--   to include or exclude from the analysis. Each time the job runs, the
--   job uses these criteria to determine which buckets contain objects to
--   analyze. A job's definition can contain a bucketCriteria object or a
--   bucketDefinitions array, not both.
s3JobDefinition_bucketCriteria :: Lens' S3JobDefinition (Maybe S3BucketCriteriaForJob)

-- | An array of objects, one for each Amazon Web Services account that
--   owns specific S3 buckets to analyze. Each object specifies the account
--   ID for an account and one or more buckets to analyze for that account.
--   A job's definition can contain a bucketDefinitions array or a
--   bucketCriteria object, not both.
s3JobDefinition_bucketDefinitions :: Lens' S3JobDefinition (Maybe [S3BucketDefinitionForJob])

-- | Provides information about the S3 object that a finding applies to.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3Object</a> smart constructor.
data S3Object
S3Object' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StorageClass -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ServerSideEncryption -> Maybe [KeyValuePair] -> S3Object

-- | The entity tag (ETag) that identifies the affected version of the
--   object. If the object was overwritten or changed after Amazon Macie
--   produced the finding, this value might be different from the current
--   ETag for the object.
[$sel:eTag:S3Object'] :: S3Object -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier for the affected version of the object.
[$sel:versionId:S3Object'] :: S3Object -> Maybe Text

-- | The path to the object, including the full key (name).
[$sel:path:S3Object'] :: S3Object -> Maybe Text

-- | The total storage size, in bytes, of the object.
[$sel:size:S3Object'] :: S3Object -> Maybe Integer

-- | The file name extension of the object. If the object doesn't have a
--   file name extension, this value is "".
[$sel:extension:S3Object'] :: S3Object -> Maybe Text

-- | The full key (name) that's assigned to the object.
[$sel:key:S3Object'] :: S3Object -> Maybe Text

-- | The storage class of the object.
[$sel:storageClass:S3Object'] :: S3Object -> Maybe StorageClass

-- | Specifies whether the object is publicly accessible due to the
--   combination of permissions settings that apply to the object.
[$sel:publicAccess:S3Object'] :: S3Object -> Maybe Bool

-- | The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the
--   object was last modified.
[$sel:lastModified:S3Object'] :: S3Object -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket that contains the object.
[$sel:bucketArn:S3Object'] :: S3Object -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of server-side encryption that's used to encrypt the object.
[$sel:serverSideEncryption:S3Object'] :: S3Object -> Maybe ServerSideEncryption

-- | The tags that are associated with the object.
[$sel:tags:S3Object'] :: S3Object -> Maybe [KeyValuePair]

-- | Create a value of <a>S3Object</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

-- | Specifies one or more property- and tag-based conditions that define

data Scoping

-- | The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which objects to
--   exclude from the analysis.

--   <a>$sel:excludes:Scoping'</a>, <a>scoping_excludes</a> - The property-
--   and tag-based conditions that determine which objects to exclude from
--   the analysis.
newScoping :: Scoping

--   exclude from the analysis.

-- | Specifies property- and tag-based conditions that define filter

-- | Specifies a property- or tag-based filter condition for including or
--   excluding Amazon Web Services resources from the query results.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSearchResourcesCriteria</a> smart constructor.
data SearchResourcesCriteria
SearchResourcesCriteria' :: Maybe SearchResourcesTagCriterion -> Maybe SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion -> SearchResourcesCriteria

-- | A tag-based condition that defines an operator and tag keys, tag
--   values, or tag key and value pairs for including or excluding
--   resources from the results.
[$sel:tagCriterion:SearchResourcesCriteria'] :: SearchResourcesCriteria -> Maybe SearchResourcesTagCriterion

-- | A property-based condition that defines a property, operator, and one
--   or more values for including or excluding resources from the results.
[$sel:simpleCriterion:SearchResourcesCriteria'] :: SearchResourcesCriteria -> Maybe SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion

--   value pairs for including or excluding resources from the results.
--

--   for including or excluding resources from the results.

--   resources from the results.

-- | Specifies property- and tag-based conditions that define filter
--   criteria for including or excluding Amazon Web Services resources from
--   the query results.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSearchResourcesCriteriaBlock</a> smart constructor.
data SearchResourcesCriteriaBlock
SearchResourcesCriteriaBlock' :: Maybe [SearchResourcesCriteria] -> SearchResourcesCriteriaBlock

-- | An array of objects, one for each property- or tag-based condition
--   that includes or excludes resources from the query results. If you
--   specify more than one condition, Amazon Macie uses AND logic to join
--   the conditions.
[$sel:and:SearchResourcesCriteriaBlock'] :: SearchResourcesCriteriaBlock -> Maybe [SearchResourcesCriteria]

-- | Create a value of <a>SearchResourcesCriteriaBlock</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:and:SearchResourcesCriteriaBlock'</a>,
--   <a>searchResourcesCriteriaBlock_and</a> - An array of objects, one for
--   each property- or tag-based condition that includes or excludes
--   resources from the query results. If you specify more than one
--   condition, Amazon Macie uses AND logic to join the conditions.
newSearchResourcesCriteriaBlock :: SearchResourcesCriteriaBlock

-- | An array of objects, one for each property- or tag-based condition
--   that includes or excludes resources from the query results. If you
--   specify more than one condition, Amazon Macie uses AND logic to join
--   the conditions.
searchResourcesCriteriaBlock_and :: Lens' SearchResourcesCriteriaBlock (Maybe [SearchResourcesCriteria])

-- | Specifies a property-based filter condition that determines which
--   Amazon Web Services resources are included or excluded from the query
--   results.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSearchResourcesSimpleCriterion</a> smart
--   constructor.
data SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion
SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe SearchResourcesSimpleCriterionKey -> Maybe SearchResourcesComparator -> SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion

-- | An array that lists one or more values to use in the condition. If you
--   specify multiple values, Amazon Macie uses OR logic to join the
--   values. Valid values for each supported property (key) are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_ID - A string that represents the unique identifier for
--   the Amazon Web Services account that owns the resource.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_EFFECTIVE_PERMISSION - A string that represents an
--   enumerated value that Macie defines for the
--   <a>BucketPublicAccess.effectivePermission</a> property of an S3
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_NAME - A string that represents the name of an S3
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_SHARED_ACCESS - A string that represents an enumerated
--   value that Macie defines for the <a>BucketMetadata.sharedAccess</a>
--   property of an S3 bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
--

-- | Specifies configuration settings that determine which findings are
--   published to Security Hub automatically. For information about how
--   Macie publishes findings to Security Hub, see <a>Amazon Macie
--   integration with Security Hub</a> in the <i>Amazon Macie User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSecurityHubConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data SecurityHubConfiguration
SecurityHubConfiguration' :: Bool -> Bool -> SecurityHubConfiguration

-- | Specifies whether to publish policy findings to Security Hub. If you
--   set this value to true, Amazon Macie automatically publishes all new
--   and updated policy findings that weren't suppressed by a findings
--   filter. The default value is true.
[$sel:publishPolicyFindings:SecurityHubConfiguration'] :: SecurityHubConfiguration -> Bool

-- | Specifies whether to publish sensitive data findings to Security Hub.
--   If you set this value to true, Amazon Macie automatically publishes
--   all sensitive data findings that weren't suppressed by a findings
--   filter. The default value is false.
[$sel:publishClassificationFindings:SecurityHubConfiguration'] :: SecurityHubConfiguration -> Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>SecurityHubConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.

--   whether to publish policy findings to Security Hub. If you set this
--   value to true, Amazon Macie automatically publishes all new and
--   updated policy findings that weren't suppressed by a findings filter.
--   The default value is true.

--   <a>securityHubConfiguration_publishClassificationFindings</a> -

--   If you set this value to true, Amazon Macie automatically publishes
--   all sensitive data findings that weren't suppressed by a findings
--   filter. The default value is false.

-- | Provides information about the category, types, and occurrences of
--   sensitive data that produced a sensitive data finding.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSensitiveDataItem</a> smart constructor.
data SensitiveDataItem
SensitiveDataItem' :: Maybe [DefaultDetection] -> Maybe SensitiveDataItemCategory -> Maybe Integer -> SensitiveDataItem

-- | An array of objects, one for each type of sensitive data that was
--   detected. Each object reports the number of occurrences of a specific
--   type of sensitive data that was detected, and the location of up to 15
--   of those occurrences.
[$sel:detections:SensitiveDataItem'] :: SensitiveDataItem -> Maybe [DefaultDetection]

-- | The category of sensitive data that was detected. For example:
--   CREDENTIALS, for credentials data such as private keys or Amazon Web
--   Services secret keys; FINANCIAL_INFORMATION, for financial data such
--   as credit card numbers; or, PERSONAL_INFORMATION, for personal health
--   information, such as health insurance identification numbers, or
--   personally identifiable information, such as passport numbers.
[$sel:category:SensitiveDataItem'] :: SensitiveDataItem -> Maybe SensitiveDataItemCategory

-- | The total number of occurrences of the sensitive data that was
--   detected.
[$sel:totalCount:SensitiveDataItem'] :: SensitiveDataItem -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>SensitiveDataItem</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:detections:SensitiveDataItem'</a>,
--   <a>sensitiveDataItem_detections</a> - An array of objects, one for
--   each type of sensitive data that was detected. Each object reports the
--   number of occurrences of a specific type of sensitive data that was
--   detected, and the location of up to 15 of those occurrences.
--   
--   <a>$sel:category:SensitiveDataItem'</a>,
--   <a>sensitiveDataItem_category</a> - The category of sensitive data
--   that was detected. For example: CREDENTIALS, for credentials data such
--   as private keys or Amazon Web Services secret keys;
--   FINANCIAL_INFORMATION, for financial data such as credit card numbers;
--   or, PERSONAL_INFORMATION, for personal health information, such as
--   health insurance identification numbers, or personally identifiable
--   information, such as passport numbers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalCount:SensitiveDataItem'</a>,
--   <a>sensitiveDataItem_totalCount</a> - The total number of occurrences
--   of the sensitive data that was detected.
newSensitiveDataItem :: SensitiveDataItem

-- | An array of objects, one for each type of sensitive data that was
--   detected. Each object reports the number of occurrences of a specific
--   type of sensitive data that was detected, and the location of up to 15
--   of those occurrences.
sensitiveDataItem_detections :: Lens' SensitiveDataItem (Maybe [DefaultDetection])

-- | The category of sensitive data that was detected. For example:
--   CREDENTIALS, for credentials data such as private keys or Amazon Web
--   Services secret keys; FINANCIAL_INFORMATION, for financial data such
--   as credit card numbers; or, PERSONAL_INFORMATION, for personal health
--   information, such as health insurance identification numbers, or
--   personally identifiable information, such as passport numbers.
sensitiveDataItem_category :: Lens' SensitiveDataItem (Maybe SensitiveDataItemCategory)

-- | The total number of occurrences of the sensitive data that was
--   detected.
sensitiveDataItem_totalCount :: Lens' SensitiveDataItem (Maybe Integer)

data ServerSideEncryption
ServerSideEncryption' :: Maybe EncryptionType -> Maybe Text -> ServerSideEncryption

-- | The server-side encryption algorithm that's used when storing data in
--   the bucket or object. If default encryption is disabled for the bucket
--   or the object isn't encrypted using server-side encryption, this value
--   is NONE.
[$sel:encryptionType:ServerSideEncryption'] :: ServerSideEncryption -> Maybe EncryptionType

--   KMS key that's used to encrypt data in the bucket or the object. This
--   value is null if an KMS key isn't used to encrypt the data.

--   isn't encrypted using server-side encryption, this value is NONE.

--   <a>$sel:kmsMasterKeyId:ServerSideEncryption'</a>,
--   <a>serverSideEncryption_kmsMasterKeyId</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) or unique identifier (key ID) for the KMS key that's used to
--   encrypt data in the bucket or the object. This value is null if an KMS
--   key isn't used to encrypt the data.
newServerSideEncryption :: ServerSideEncryption

-- | Provides information about the source and type of temporary security
--   credentials that were issued to an entity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSessionIssuer</a> smart constructor.
data SessionIssuer
SessionIssuer' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> SessionIssuer

-- | The unique identifier for the entity that was used to get the
--   credentials.
[$sel:principalId:SessionIssuer'] :: SessionIssuer -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source account, IAM user, or
--   role that was used to get the credentials.
[$sel:arn:SessionIssuer'] :: SessionIssuer -> Maybe Text

-- | The name or alias of the user or role that issued the session. This
--   value is null if the credentials were obtained from a root account
--   that doesn't have an alias.
[$sel:userName:SessionIssuer'] :: SessionIssuer -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns
--   the entity that was used to get the credentials.
[$sel:accountId:SessionIssuer'] :: SessionIssuer -> Maybe Text

-- | The source of the temporary security credentials, such as Root,
--   IAMUser, or Role.
[$sel:type':SessionIssuer'] :: SessionIssuer -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SessionIssuer</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:principalId:SessionIssuer'</a>,
--   <a>sessionIssuer_principalId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   entity that was used to get the credentials.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:SessionIssuer'</a>, <a>sessionIssuer_arn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the source account, IAM user, or role that was
--   used to get the credentials.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userName:SessionIssuer'</a>, <a>sessionIssuer_userName</a> -
--   The name or alias of the user or role that issued the session. This
--   value is null if the credentials were obtained from a root account
--   that doesn't have an alias.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:SessionIssuer'</a>, <a>sessionIssuer_accountId</a> -
--   The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns
--   the entity that was used to get the credentials.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':SessionIssuer'</a>, <a>sessionIssuer_type</a> - The
--   source of the temporary security credentials, such as Root, IAMUser,
--   or Role.
newSessionIssuer :: SessionIssuer

-- | The unique identifier for the entity that was used to get the
--   credentials.
sessionIssuer_principalId :: Lens' SessionIssuer (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source account, IAM user, or
--   role that was used to get the credentials.
sessionIssuer_arn :: Lens' SessionIssuer (Maybe Text)

-- | The name or alias of the user or role that issued the session. This
--   value is null if the credentials were obtained from a root account
--   that doesn't have an alias.
sessionIssuer_userName :: Lens' SessionIssuer (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns
--   the entity that was used to get the credentials.
sessionIssuer_accountId :: Lens' SessionIssuer (Maybe Text)

-- | The source of the temporary security credentials, such as Root,
--   IAMUser, or Role.
sessionIssuer_type :: Lens' SessionIssuer (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides the numerical and qualitative representations of a finding's
--   severity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSeverity</a> smart constructor.
data Severity
Severity' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe SeverityDescription -> Severity

-- | The numerical representation of the finding's severity, ranging from 1
--   (least severe) to 3 (most severe).
[$sel:score:Severity'] :: Severity -> Maybe Integer

-- | The qualitative representation of the finding's severity, ranging from
--   Low (least severe) to High (most severe).
[$sel:description:Severity'] :: Severity -> Maybe SeverityDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>Severity</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:score:Severity'</a>, <a>severity_score</a> - The numerical
--   representation of the finding's severity, ranging from 1 (least
--   severe) to 3 (most severe).
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Severity'</a>, <a>severity_description</a> - The
--   qualitative representation of the finding's severity, ranging from Low
--   (least severe) to High (most severe).
newSeverity :: Severity

-- | The numerical representation of the finding's severity, ranging from 1
--   (least severe) to 3 (most severe).
severity_score :: Lens' Severity (Maybe Integer)

-- | The qualitative representation of the finding's severity, ranging from
--   Low (least severe) to High (most severe).
severity_description :: Lens' Severity (Maybe SeverityDescription)

-- | Specifies a property-based condition that determines whether an S3
--   bucket is included or excluded from a classification job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSimpleCriterionForJob</a> smart constructor.
data SimpleCriterionForJob
SimpleCriterionForJob' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe SimpleCriterionKeyForJob -> Maybe JobComparator -> SimpleCriterionForJob

-- | An array that lists one or more values to use in the condition. If you
--   specify multiple values, Amazon Macie uses OR logic to join the
--   values. Valid values for each supported property (key) are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_ID - A string that represents the unique identifier for
--   the Amazon Web Services account that owns the bucket.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_EFFECTIVE_PERMISSION - A string that represents an
--   enumerated value that Macie defines for the
--   <a>BucketPublicAccess.effectivePermission</a> property of a
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_NAME - A string that represents the name of a
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_SHARED_ACCESS - A string that represents an enumerated
--   value that Macie defines for the <a>BucketMetadata.sharedAccess</a>
--   property of a bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Values are case sensitive. Also, Macie doesn't support use of partial
--   values or wildcard characters in these values.
[$sel:values:SimpleCriterionForJob'] :: SimpleCriterionForJob -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The property to use in the condition.
[$sel:key:SimpleCriterionForJob'] :: SimpleCriterionForJob -> Maybe SimpleCriterionKeyForJob

-- | The operator to use in the condition. Valid values are EQ (equals) and
--   NE (not equals).
[$sel:comparator:SimpleCriterionForJob'] :: SimpleCriterionForJob -> Maybe JobComparator

-- | Create a value of <a>SimpleCriterionForJob</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>simpleCriterionForJob_values</a> - An array that lists one or more
--   values to use in the condition. If you specify multiple values, Amazon
--   Macie uses OR logic to join the values. Valid values for each
--   supported property (key) are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_ID - A string that represents the unique identifier for
--   the Amazon Web Services account that owns the bucket.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_EFFECTIVE_PERMISSION - A string that represents an
--   enumerated value that Macie defines for the
--   <a>BucketPublicAccess.effectivePermission</a> property of a
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_NAME - A string that represents the name of a
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_SHARED_ACCESS - A string that represents an enumerated
--   value that Macie defines for the <a>BucketMetadata.sharedAccess</a>
--   property of a bucket.</li>
--   </ul>

--   values or wildcard characters in these values.

--   condition.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comparator:SimpleCriterionForJob'</a>,
--   <a>simpleCriterionForJob_comparator</a> - The operator to use in the
--   condition. Valid values are EQ (equals) and NE (not equals).
newSimpleCriterionForJob :: SimpleCriterionForJob

--   value that Macie defines for the <a>BucketMetadata.sharedAccess</a>
--   property of a bucket.</li>
--   </ul>

--   Values are case sensitive. Also, Macie doesn't support use of partial
--   values or wildcard characters in these values.

-- | Specifies a property-based condition that determines whether an S3
--   object is included or excluded from a classification job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSimpleScopeTerm</a> smart constructor.
data SimpleScopeTerm
SimpleScopeTerm' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe ScopeFilterKey -> Maybe JobComparator -> SimpleScopeTerm

-- | An array that lists the values to use in the condition. If the value
--   for the key property is OBJECT_EXTENSION or OBJECT_KEY, this array can
--   specify multiple values and Amazon Macie uses OR logic to join the
--   values. Otherwise, this array can specify only one value.
--   
--   Valid values for each supported property (key) are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OBJECT_EXTENSION - A string that represents the file name
--   extension of an object. For example: docx or pdf</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_KEY - A string that represents the key prefix (folder name
--   or path) of an object. For example: logs or awslogs/eventlogs. This
--   value applies a condition to objects whose keys (names) begin with the
--   specified value.</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_LAST_MODIFIED_DATE - The date and time (in UTC and extended
--   ISO 8601 format) when an object was created or last changed, whichever
--   is latest. For example: 2020-09-28T14:31:13Z</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_SIZE - An integer that represents the storage size (in
--   bytes) of an object.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Macie doesn't support use of wildcard characters in these values.
--   Also, string values are case sensitive.
[$sel:values:SimpleScopeTerm'] :: SimpleScopeTerm -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The object property to use in the condition.
[$sel:key:SimpleScopeTerm'] :: SimpleScopeTerm -> Maybe ScopeFilterKey

-- | The operator to use in the condition. Valid values for each supported
--   property (key) are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OBJECT_EXTENSION - EQ (equals) or NE (not equals)</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_KEY - STARTS_WITH</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_LAST_MODIFIED_DATE - Any operator except CONTAINS</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_SIZE - Any operator except CONTAINS</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:comparator:SimpleScopeTerm'] :: SimpleScopeTerm -> Maybe JobComparator

-- | Create a value of <a>SimpleScopeTerm</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   for the key property is OBJECT_EXTENSION or OBJECT_KEY, this array can
--   specify multiple values and Amazon Macie uses OR logic to join the
--   values. Otherwise, this array can specify only one value.
--   
--   Valid values for each supported property (key) are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OBJECT_EXTENSION - A string that represents the file name
--   extension of an object. For example: docx or pdf</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_KEY - A string that represents the key prefix (folder name
--   or path) of an object. For example: logs or awslogs/eventlogs. This

--   object property to use in the condition.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comparator:SimpleScopeTerm'</a>,

--   condition. Valid values for each supported property (key) are:

--   <li>OBJECT_LAST_MODIFIED_DATE - Any operator except CONTAINS</li>

-- | Specifies criteria for sorting the results of a request for findings.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSortCriteria</a> smart constructor.
data SortCriteria
SortCriteria' :: Maybe OrderBy -> Maybe Text -> SortCriteria

-- | The sort order to apply to the results, based on the value for the
--   property specified by the attributeName property. Valid values are:
--   ASC, sort the results in ascending order; and, DESC, sort the results
--   in descending order.
[$sel:orderBy:SortCriteria'] :: SortCriteria -> Maybe OrderBy

-- | The name of the property to sort the results by. This value can be the
--   name of any property that Amazon Macie defines for a finding.
[$sel:attributeName:SortCriteria'] :: SortCriteria -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SortCriteria</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   sort order to apply to the results, based on the value for the
--   property specified by the attributeName property. Valid values are:
--   ASC, sort the results in ascending order; and, DESC, sort the results
--   in descending order.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeName:SortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>sortCriteria_attributeName</a> - The name of the property to sort
--   the results by. This value can be the name of any property that Amazon
--   Macie defines for a finding.
newSortCriteria :: SortCriteria

--   property specified by the attributeName property. Valid values are:
--   ASC, sort the results in ascending order; and, DESC, sort the results
--   in descending order.

--   name of any property that Amazon Macie defines for a finding.
sortCriteria_attributeName :: Lens' SortCriteria (Maybe Text)

--   NE (not equals).

-- | Provides information about an account-related request that hasn't been
--   processed.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUnprocessedAccount</a> smart constructor.
data UnprocessedAccount

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID for the account that the request
--   applies to.
[$sel:accountId:UnprocessedAccount'] :: UnprocessedAccount -> Maybe Text

-- | The source of the issue or delay in processing the request.
[$sel:errorCode:UnprocessedAccount'] :: UnprocessedAccount -> Maybe ErrorCode

-- | The reason why the request hasn't been processed.
[$sel:errorMessage:UnprocessedAccount'] :: UnprocessedAccount -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UnprocessedAccount</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:UnprocessedAccount'</a>,
--   <a>unprocessedAccount_accountId</a> - The Amazon Web Services account
--   ID for the account that the request applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorCode:UnprocessedAccount'</a>,
--   <a>unprocessedAccount_errorCode</a> - The source of the issue or delay
--   in processing the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorMessage:UnprocessedAccount'</a>,
--   <a>unprocessedAccount_errorMessage</a> - The reason why the request
--   hasn't been processed.
newUnprocessedAccount :: UnprocessedAccount

--   applies to.
unprocessedAccount_accountId :: Lens' UnprocessedAccount (Maybe Text)

-- | The source of the issue or delay in processing the request.
unprocessedAccount_errorCode :: Lens' UnprocessedAccount (Maybe ErrorCode)

-- | The reason why the request hasn't been processed.
unprocessedAccount_errorMessage :: Lens' UnprocessedAccount (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides data for a specific usage metric and the corresponding quota
--   for an Amazon Macie account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUsageByAccount</a> smart constructor.
data UsageByAccount
UsageByAccount' :: Maybe ServiceLimit -> Maybe Currency -> Maybe UsageType -> Maybe Text -> UsageByAccount

--   specified by the type field.
