--   specifies whether to analyze all existing, eligible objects
--   immediately after the job is created (true). To analyze only those
--   objects that are created or changed after you create the job and
--   before the job's first scheduled run, set this value to false.
--   
--   If you configure the job to run only once, don't specify a value for
--   this property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:samplingPercentage:CreateClassificationJob'</a>,
--   <a>createClassificationJob_samplingPercentage</a> - The sampling
--   depth, as a percentage, for the job to apply when processing objects.
--   This value determines the percentage of eligible objects that the job
--   analyzes. If this value is less than 100, Amazon Macie selects the
--   objects to analyze at random, up to the specified percentage, and
--   analyzes all the data in those objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:managedDataIdentifierSelector:CreateClassificationJob'</a>,
--   <a>createClassificationJob_managedDataIdentifierSelector</a> - The
--   selection type to apply when determining which managed data
--   identifiers the job uses to analyze data. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ALL - Use all the managed data identifiers that Amazon Macie
--   provides. If you specify this value, don't specify any values for the
--   managedDataIdentifierIds property.</li>
--   <li>EXCLUDE - Use all the managed data identifiers that Macie provides
--   except the managed data identifiers specified by the
--   managedDataIdentifierIds property.</li>
--   <li>INCLUDE - Use only the managed data identifiers specified by the
--   managedDataIdentifierIds property.</li>
--   <li>NONE - Don't use any managed data identifiers. If you specify this
--   value, specify at least one custom data identifier for the job
--   (customDataIdentifierIds) and don't specify any values for the
--   managedDataIdentifierIds property.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, the job uses all
--   managed data identifiers. If you don't specify a value for this
--   property or you specify ALL or EXCLUDE for a recurring job, the job
--   also uses new managed data identifiers as they are released.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customDataIdentifierIds:CreateClassificationJob'</a>,

--   unique identifiers, one for each custom data identifier for the job to
--   use when it analyzes data. To use only managed data identifiers, don't
--   specify a value for this property and specify a value other than NONE
--   for the managedDataIdentifierSelector property.

--   to include (use) or exclude (not use) when it analyzes data. Inclusion
--   or exclusion depends on the managed data identifier selection type
--   that you specify for the job (managedDataIdentifierSelector).

--   ListManagedDataIdentifiers operation.

--

--   and an associated tag value. The maximum length of a tag key is 128

--   filter the query results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sortCriteria:GetFindingStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>getFindingStatistics_sortCriteria</a> - The criteria to use to sort
--   the query results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupBy:GetFindingStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>getFindingStatistics_groupBy</a> - The finding property to use to
--   group the query results. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>classificationDetails.jobId - The unique identifier for the
--   classification job that produced the finding.</li>
--   <li>resourcesAffected.s3Bucket.name - The name of the S3 bucket that
--   the finding applies to.</li>
--   <li>severity.description - The severity level of the finding, such as
--   High or Medium.</li>
--   <li>type - The type of finding, such as Policy:IAMUser/S3BucketPublic
--   and SensitiveData:S3Object/Personal.</li>
--   </ul>
newGetFindingStatistics :: GroupBy -> GetFindingStatistics

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetFindingStatisticsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetFindingStatisticsResponse
GetFindingStatisticsResponse' :: Maybe [GroupCount] -> Int -> GetFindingStatisticsResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>GetFindingStatisticsResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:countsByGroup:GetFindingStatisticsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getFindingStatisticsResponse_countsByGroup</a> - An array of
--   objects, one for each group of findings that meet the filter criteria
--   specified in the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetFindingStatisticsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getFindingStatisticsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newGetFindingStatisticsResponse :: Int -> GetFindingStatisticsResponse

--   policies do or don't require server-side encryption of objects when
--   objects are uploaded to the buckets.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads</a>
--   smart constructor.
data BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads
BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads

-- | Create a value of
--   <a>BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:deniesUnencryptedObjectUploads:BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads'</a>,
--   <a>bucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads_deniesUnencryptedObjectUploads</a>
--   - The total number of buckets whose bucket policies require
--   server-side encryption of new objects. PutObject requests for these
--   buckets must include the x-amz-server-side-encryption header and the
--   value for that header must be AES256 or aws:kms.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unknown:BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads'</a>,
--   <a>bucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads_unknown</a> - The
--   total number of buckets that Amazon Macie wasn't able to evaluate
--   server-side encryption requirements for. Macie can't determine whether
--   the bucket policies for these buckets require server-side encryption
--   of new objects.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowsUnencryptedObjectUploads:BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads'</a>,
--   <a>bucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads_allowsUnencryptedObjectUploads</a>
--   - The total number of buckets that don't have a bucket policy or have
--   a bucket policy that doesn't require server-side encryption of new
--   objects. If a bucket policy exists, the policy doesn't require
--   PutObject requests to include the x-amz-server-side-encryption header
--   and it doesn't require the value for that header to be AES256 or
--   aws:kms.
newBucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads :: BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads

-- | Provides statistical data and other information about an S3 bucket
--   that Amazon Macie monitors and analyzes for your account. If an error
--   occurs when Macie attempts to retrieve and process information about
--   the bucket or the bucket's objects, the value for most of these
--   properties is null. Exceptions are accountId, bucketArn,
--   bucketCreatedAt, bucketName, lastUpdated, and region. To identify the
--   cause of the error, refer to the errorCode and errorMessage values.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucketMetadata</a> smart constructor.
data BucketMetadata
BucketMetadata' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ObjectCountByEncryptionType -> Maybe SharedAccess -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ObjectLevelStatistics -> Maybe ObjectLevelStatistics -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe AllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads -> Maybe BucketPublicAccess -> Maybe BucketMetadataErrorCode -> Maybe JobDetails -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe ReplicationDetails -> Maybe BucketServerSideEncryption -> Maybe [KeyValuePair] -> Maybe Integer -> BucketMetadata

-- | Create a value of <a>BucketMetadata</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInBytesCompressed:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_sizeInBytesCompressed</a> - The total storage size,
--   in bytes, of the objects that are compressed (.gz, .gzip, .zip) files
--   in the bucket.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Amazon Macie calculates this
--   value based on the size of the latest version of each applicable
--   object in the bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of
--   all versions of each applicable object in the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdated:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_lastUpdated</a> - The date and time, in UTC and
--   extended ISO 8601 format, when Amazon Macie most recently retrieved
--   both bucket and object metadata from Amazon S3 for the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectCountByEncryptionType:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_objectCountByEncryptionType</a> - The total number
--   of objects that are in the bucket, grouped by server-side encryption
--   type. This includes a grouping that reports the total number of
--   objects that aren't encrypted or use client-side encryption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sharedAccess:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_sharedAccess</a> - Specifies whether the bucket is
--   shared with another Amazon Web Services account. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>EXTERNAL - The bucket is shared with an Amazon Web Services
--   account that isn't part of the same Amazon Macie organization.</li>
--   <li>INTERNAL - The bucket is shared with an Amazon Web Services
--   account that's part of the same Amazon Macie organization.</li>
--   <li>NOT_SHARED - The bucket isn't shared with other Amazon Web
--   Services accounts.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie wasn't able to evaluate the shared access
--   settings for the bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInBytes:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_sizeInBytes</a> - The total storage size, in bytes,
--   of the bucket.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Amazon Macie calculates this
--   value based on the size of the latest version of each object in the
--   bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all versions of
--   each object in the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_bucketName</a> - The name of the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:classifiableObjectCount:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_classifiableObjectCount</a> - The total number of
--   objects that Amazon Macie can analyze in the bucket. These objects use
--   a supported storage class and have a file name extension for a
--   supported file or storage format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:BucketMetadata'</a>, <a>bucketMetadata_accountId</a>
--   - The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns
--   the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unclassifiableObjectSizeInBytes:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_unclassifiableObjectSizeInBytes</a> - The total
--   storage size, in bytes, of the objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze
--   in the bucket. These objects don't use a supported storage class or
--   don't have a file name extension for a supported file or storage
--   format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unclassifiableObjectCount:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_unclassifiableObjectCount</a> - The total number of
--   objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze in the bucket. These objects
--   don't use a supported storage class or don't have a file name
--   extension for a supported file or storage format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:versioning:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_versioning</a> - Specifies whether versioning is
--   enabled for the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowsUnencryptedObjectUploads:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_allowsUnencryptedObjectUploads</a> - Specifies
--   whether the bucket policy for the bucket requires server-side
--   encryption of objects when objects are uploaded to the bucket.
--   Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>FALSE - The bucket policy requires server-side encryption of new
--   objects. PutObject requests must include the
--   x-amz-server-side-encryption header and the value for that header must
--   be AES256 or aws:kms.</li>
--   <li>TRUE - The bucket doesn't have a bucket policy or it has a bucket
--   policy that doesn't require server-side encryption of new objects. If
--   a bucket policy exists, it doesn't require PutObject requests to
--   include the x-amz-server-side-encryption header and it doesn't require
--   the value for that header to be AES256 or aws:kms.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie can't determine whether the bucket policy
--   requires server-side encryption of new objects.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicAccess:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_publicAccess</a> - Specifies whether the bucket is
--   publicly accessible due to the combination of permissions settings
--   that apply to the bucket, and provides information about those
--   settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorCode:BucketMetadata'</a>, <a>bucketMetadata_errorCode</a>
--   - Specifies the error code for an error that prevented Amazon Macie
--   from retrieving and processing information about the bucket and the
--   bucket's objects. If this value is ACCESS_DENIED, Macie doesn't have
--   permission to retrieve the information. For example, the bucket has a
--   restrictive bucket policy and Amazon S3 denied the request. If this
--   value is null, Macie was able to retrieve and process the information.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobDetails:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_jobDetails</a> - Specifies whether any one-time or
--   recurring classification jobs are configured to analyze data in the
--   bucket, and, if so, the details of the job that ran most recently.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:BucketMetadata'</a>, <a>bucketMetadata_region</a> - The
--   Amazon Web Services Region that hosts the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketCreatedAt:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_bucketCreatedAt</a> - The date and time, in UTC and
--   extended ISO 8601 format, when the bucket was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorMessage:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_errorMessage</a> - A brief description of the error
--   (errorCode) that prevented Amazon Macie from retrieving and processing
--   information about the bucket and the bucket's objects. This value is
--   null if Macie was able to retrieve and process the information.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketArn:BucketMetadata'</a>, <a>bucketMetadata_bucketArn</a>
--   - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectCount:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_objectCount</a> - The total number of objects in the
--   bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationDetails:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_replicationDetails</a> - Specifies whether the
--   bucket is configured to replicate one or more objects to buckets for
--   other Amazon Web Services accounts and, if so, which accounts.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverSideEncryption:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_serverSideEncryption</a> - Specifies whether the
--   bucket encrypts new objects by default and, if so, the type of
--   server-side encryption that's used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:BucketMetadata'</a>, <a>bucketMetadata_tags</a> - An
--   array that specifies the tags (keys and values) that are associated
--   with the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:classifiableSizeInBytes:BucketMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>bucketMetadata_classifiableSizeInBytes</a> - The total storage
--   size, in bytes, of the objects that Amazon Macie can analyze in the
--   bucket. These objects use a supported storage class and have a file
--   name extension for a supported file or storage format.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Macie calculates this value
--   based on the size of the latest version of each applicable object in
--   the bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all
--   versions of each applicable object in the bucket.
newBucketMetadata :: BucketMetadata

-- | Provides information about the default server-side encryption settings

--   fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>bucketServerSideEncryption_kmsMasterKeyId</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) or unique identifier (key ID) for the KMS key that's used
--   by default to encrypt objects that are added to the bucket. This value
--   is null if the bucket uses an Amazon S3 managed key to encrypt new
--   objects or the bucket doesn't encrypt new objects by default.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':BucketServerSideEncryption'</a>,
--   <a>bucketServerSideEncryption_type</a> - The type of server-side
--   encryption that's used by default when storing new objects in the
--   bucket. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AES256 - New objects are encrypted with an Amazon S3 managed key.
--   They use SSE-S3 encryption.</li>
--   <li>aws:kms - New objects are encrypted with an KMS key
--   (kmsMasterKeyId), either an Amazon Web Services managed key or a
--   customer managed key. They use SSE-KMS encryption.</li>
--   <li>NONE - New objects aren't encrypted by default. Default encryption
--   is disabled for the bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
newBucketServerSideEncryption :: BucketServerSideEncryption

--   Microsoft Excel workbook, CSV file, or TSV file.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCell</a> smart constructor.
data Cell

-- | Create a value of <a>Cell</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:row:Cell'</a>, <a>cell_row</a> - The row number of the row
--   that contains the sensitive data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cellReference:Cell'</a>, <a>cell_cellReference</a> - The
--   location of the cell, as an absolute cell reference, that contains the
--   sensitive data, for example Sheet2!C5 for cell C5 on Sheet2 in a
--   Microsoft Excel workbook. This value is null for CSV and TSV files.
--   
--   <a>$sel:column:Cell'</a>, <a>cell_column</a> - The column number of
--   the column that contains the sensitive data. For a Microsoft Excel
--   workbook, this value correlates to the alphabetical character(s) for a
--   column identifier, for example: 1 for column A, 2 for column B, and so
--   on.
--   
--   <a>$sel:columnName:Cell'</a>, <a>cell_columnName</a> - The name of the
--   column that contains the sensitive data, if available.
newCell :: Cell

--   sensitive data discovery result for the finding. If a finding applies
--   to a large archive or compressed file, this value is the path to a
--   folder. Otherwise, this value is the path to a file.

newClassificationDetails :: ClassificationDetails

-- | Provides the details of a sensitive data finding, including the types,
--   number of occurrences, and locations of the sensitive data that was
--   detected.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClassificationResult</a> smart constructor.
data ClassificationResult
ClassificationResult' :: Maybe [SensitiveDataItem] -> Maybe ClassificationResultStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe CustomDataIdentifiers -> ClassificationResult

-- | Create a value of <a>ClassificationResult</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sensitiveData:ClassificationResult'</a>,
--   <a>classificationResult_sensitiveData</a> - The category, types, and
--   number of occurrences of the sensitive data that produced the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ClassificationResult'</a>,
--   <a>classificationResult_status</a> - The status of the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mimeType:ClassificationResult'</a>,
--   <a>classificationResult_mimeType</a> - The type of content, as a MIME
--   type, that the finding applies to. For example, application/gzip, for
--   a GNU Gzip compressed archive file, or application/pdf, for an Adobe
--   Portable Document Format file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeClassified:ClassificationResult'</a>,
--   <a>classificationResult_sizeClassified</a> - The total size, in bytes,
--   of the data that the finding applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalOccurrences:ClassificationResult'</a>,
--   <a>classificationResult_additionalOccurrences</a> - Specifies whether
--   Amazon Macie detected additional occurrences of sensitive data in the
--   S3 object. A finding includes location data for a maximum of 15
--   occurrences of sensitive data.
--   
--   This value can help you determine whether to investigate additional
--   occurrences of sensitive data in an object. You can do this by
--   referring to the corresponding sensitive data discovery result for the
--   finding (ClassificationDetails.detailedResultsLocation).
--   
--   <a>$sel:customDataIdentifiers:ClassificationResult'</a>,
--   <a>classificationResult_customDataIdentifiers</a> - The custom data
--   identifiers that detected the sensitive data and the number of
--   occurrences of the data that they detected.
newClassificationResult :: ClassificationResult

-- | Provides information about the status of a sensitive data finding.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClassificationResultStatus</a> smart constructor.
data ClassificationResultStatus
ClassificationResultStatus' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ClassificationResultStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>ClassificationResultStatus</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:reason:ClassificationResultStatus'</a>,
--   <a>classificationResultStatus_reason</a> - A brief description of the
--   status of the finding. Amazon Macie uses this value to notify you of
--   any errors, warnings, or considerations that might impact your
--   analysis of the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:code:ClassificationResultStatus'</a>,
--   <a>classificationResultStatus_code</a> - The status of the finding.
--   Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>COMPLETE - Amazon Macie successfully completed its analysis of the
--   S3 object that the finding applies to.</li>
--   <li>PARTIAL - Macie analyzed only a subset of the data in the S3
--   object that the finding applies to. For example, the object is an
--   archive file that contains files in an unsupported format.</li>
--   <li>SKIPPED - Macie wasn't able to analyze the S3 object that the
--   finding applies to. For example, the object is a file in an
--   unsupported format.</li>
--   </ul>
newClassificationResultStatus :: ClassificationResultStatus

-- | Specifies the operator to use in a property-based condition that
--   filters the results of a query for findings. For detailed information
--   and examples of each operator, see <a>Fundamentals of filtering
--   findings</a> in the <i>Amazon Macie User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCriterionAdditionalProperties</a> smart constructor.
data CriterionAdditionalProperties
CriterionAdditionalProperties' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> CriterionAdditionalProperties

-- | Create a value of <a>CriterionAdditionalProperties</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:eq:CriterionAdditionalProperties'</a>,
--   <a>criterionAdditionalProperties_eq</a> - The value for the property
--   matches (equals) the specified value. If you specify multiple values,
--   Macie uses OR logic to join the values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lte:CriterionAdditionalProperties'</a>,
--   <a>criterionAdditionalProperties_lte</a> - The value for the property
--   is less than or equal to the specified value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gt:CriterionAdditionalProperties'</a>,
--   <a>criterionAdditionalProperties_gt</a> - The value for the property
--   is greater than the specified value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eqExactMatch:CriterionAdditionalProperties'</a>,
--   <a>criterionAdditionalProperties_eqExactMatch</a> - The value for the
--   property exclusively matches (equals an exact match for) all the
--   specified values. If you specify multiple values, Amazon Macie uses
--   AND logic to join the values.
--   
--   You can use this operator with the following properties:
--   customDataIdentifiers.detections.arn,
--   customDataIdentifiers.detections.name,
--   resourcesAffected.s3Bucket.tags.key,
--   resourcesAffected.s3Bucket.tags.value,
--   resourcesAffected.s3Object.tags.key,
--   resourcesAffected.s3Object.tags.value, sensitiveData.category, and
--   sensitiveData.detections.type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:neq:CriterionAdditionalProperties'</a>,
--   <a>criterionAdditionalProperties_neq</a> - The value for the property
--   doesn't match (doesn't equal) the specified value. If you specify
--   multiple values, Macie uses OR logic to join the values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lt:CriterionAdditionalProperties'</a>,
--   <a>criterionAdditionalProperties_lt</a> - The value for the property
--   is less than the specified value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gte:CriterionAdditionalProperties'</a>,
--   <a>criterionAdditionalProperties_gte</a> - The value for the property
--   is greater than or equal to the specified value.
newCriterionAdditionalProperties :: CriterionAdditionalProperties

-- | Provides the details of a finding.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFinding</a> smart constructor.
data Finding
Finding' :: Maybe ClassificationDetails -> Maybe PolicyDetails -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe FindingCategory -> Maybe Severity -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ResourcesAffected -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe FindingType -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Finding

-- | Create a value of <a>Finding</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:classificationDetails:Finding'</a>,
--   <a>finding_classificationDetails</a> - The details of a sensitive data
--   finding. This value is null for a policy finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyDetails:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_policyDetails</a> - The
--   details of a policy finding. This value is null for a sensitive data
--   finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_createdAt</a> - The date
--   and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the finding was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:category:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_category</a> - The category
--   of the finding. Possible values are: CLASSIFICATION, for a sensitive
--   data finding; and, POLICY, for a policy finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:severity:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_severity</a> - The severity
--   level and score for the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:count:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_count</a> - The total number of
--   occurrences of the finding. For sensitive data findings, this value is
--   always 1. All sensitive data findings are considered new (unique)
--   because they derive from individual classification jobs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schemaVersion:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_schemaVersion</a> - The
--   version of the schema that was used to define the data structures in
--   the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourcesAffected:Finding'</a>,
--   <a>finding_resourcesAffected</a> - The resources that the finding
--   applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_accountId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that the finding
--   applies to. This is typically the account that owns the affected
--   resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:partition:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_partition</a> - The Amazon
--   Web Services partition that Amazon Macie created the finding in.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_id</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the finding. This is a random string that Amazon Macie generates and
--   assigns to a finding when it creates the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_region</a> - The Amazon Web
--   Services Region that Amazon Macie created the finding in.
--   
--   <a>$sel:updatedAt:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_updatedAt</a> - The date
--   and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the finding was
--   last updated. For sensitive data findings, this value is the same as
--   the value for the createdAt property. All sensitive data findings are
--   considered new (unique) because they derive from individual
--   classification jobs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_title</a> - The brief
--   description of the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Finding'</a>, <a>finding_type</a> - The type of the
--   finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:archived:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_archived</a> - Specifies
--   whether the finding is archived (suppressed).
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_description</a> - The
--   description of the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sample:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_sample</a> - Specifies whether
--   the finding is a sample finding. A <i>sample finding</i> is a finding
--   that uses example data to demonstrate what a finding might contain.
newFinding :: Finding

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:IpCountry'</a>, <a>ipCountry_name</a> - The name of the
--   country that the IP address originated from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:code:IpCountry'</a>, <a>ipCountry_code</a> - The two-character
--   code, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, for the country that the IP
--   address originated from. For example, US for the United States.
newIpCountry :: IpCountry

data IpGeoLocation

--   longitude coordinate of the location, rounded to four decimal places.
newIpGeoLocation :: IpGeoLocation

data IpOwner

--   internet service provider (ISP) that owned the IP address.
newIpOwner :: IpOwner

-- | Specifies whether any one-time or recurring classification jobs are
--   configured to analyze data in an S3 bucket, and, if so, the details of
--   the job that ran most recently.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobDetails</a> smart constructor.
data JobDetails
JobDetails' :: Maybe IsMonitoredByJob -> Maybe IsDefinedInJob -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> JobDetails

-- | Create a value of <a>JobDetails</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:isMonitoredByJob:JobDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobDetails_isMonitoredByJob</a> - Specifies whether any recurring
--   jobs are configured to analyze data in the bucket. Possible values
--   are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>TRUE - The bucket is explicitly included in the bucket definition
--   (S3BucketDefinitionForJob) for one or more recurring jobs or the
--   bucket matches the bucket criteria (S3BucketCriteriaForJob) for one or
--   more recurring jobs. At least one of those jobs has a status other
--   than CANCELLED.</li>
--   <li>FALSE - The bucket isn't explicitly included in the bucket
--   definition (S3BucketDefinitionForJob) for any recurring jobs, the
--   bucket doesn't match the bucket criteria (S3BucketCriteriaForJob) for
--   any recurring jobs, or all the recurring jobs that are configured to
--   analyze data in the bucket have a status of CANCELLED.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - An exception occurred when Amazon Macie attempted to
--   retrieve job data for the bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:isDefinedInJob:JobDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobDetails_isDefinedInJob</a> - Specifies whether any one-time or
--   recurring jobs are configured to analyze data in the bucket. Possible
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>TRUE - The bucket is explicitly included in the bucket definition
--   (S3BucketDefinitionForJob) for one or more jobs and at least one of
--   those jobs has a status other than CANCELLED. Or the bucket matched
--   the bucket criteria (S3BucketCriteriaForJob) for at least one job that
--   previously ran.</li>
--   <li>FALSE - The bucket isn't explicitly included in the bucket
--   definition (S3BucketDefinitionForJob) for any jobs, all the jobs that
--   explicitly include the bucket in their bucket definitions have a
--   status of CANCELLED, or the bucket didn't match the bucket criteria
--   (S3BucketCriteriaForJob) for any jobs that previously ran.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - An exception occurred when Amazon Macie attempted to
--   retrieve job data for the bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastJobId:JobDetails'</a>, <a>jobDetails_lastJobId</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the job that ran most recently and is configured
--   to analyze data in the bucket, either the latest run of a recurring
--   job or the only run of a one-time job.
--   
--   This value is typically null if the value for the isDefinedInJob
--   property is FALSE or UNKNOWN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastJobRunTime:JobDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobDetails_lastJobRunTime</a> - The date and time, in UTC and
--   extended ISO 8601 format, when the job (lastJobId) started. If the job
--   is a recurring job, this value indicates when the most recent run
--   started.
--   
--   This value is typically null if the value for the isDefinedInJob
--   property is FALSE or UNKNOWN.
newJobDetails :: JobDetails

-- | Provides information about a classification job, including the current
--   status of the job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobSummary</a> smart constructor.
data JobSummary
JobSummary' :: Maybe LastRunErrorStatus -> Maybe JobType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe UserPausedDetails -> Maybe S3BucketCriteriaForJob -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [S3BucketDefinitionForJob] -> Maybe JobStatus -> JobSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>JobSummary</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastRunErrorStatus:JobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobSummary_lastRunErrorStatus</a> - Specifies whether any account-
--   or bucket-level access errors occurred when the job ran. For a
--   recurring job, this value indicates the error status of the job's most
--   recent run.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobType:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_jobType</a> - The
--   schedule for running the job. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ONE_TIME - The job runs only once.</li>
--   <li>SCHEDULED - The job runs on a daily, weekly, or monthly
--   basis.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_jobId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_createdAt</a> - The
--   date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the job was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userPausedDetails:JobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobSummary_userPausedDetails</a> - If the current status of the job
--   is USER_PAUSED, specifies when the job was paused and when the job or
--   job run will expire and be cancelled if it isn't resumed. This value
--   is present only if the value for jobStatus is USER_PAUSED.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketCriteria:JobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobSummary_bucketCriteria</a> - The property- and tag-based
--   conditions that determine which S3 buckets are included or excluded
--   from the job's analysis. Each time the job runs, the job uses these
--   criteria to determine which buckets to analyze. A job's definition can
--   contain a bucketCriteria object or a bucketDefinitions array, not
--   both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_name</a> - The custom name
--   of the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketDefinitions:JobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobSummary_bucketDefinitions</a> - An array of objects, one for
--   each Amazon Web Services account that owns specific S3 buckets for the
--   job to analyze. Each object specifies the account ID for an account
--   and one or more buckets to analyze for that account. A job's
--   definition can contain a bucketDefinitions array or a bucketCriteria
--   object, not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobStatus:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_jobStatus</a> - The
--   current status of the job. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>CANCELLED - You cancelled the job or, if it's a one-time job, you
--   paused the job and didn't resume it within 30 days.</li>
--   <li>COMPLETE - For a one-time job, Amazon Macie finished processing
--   the data specified for the job. This value doesn't apply to recurring
--   jobs.</li>
--   <li>IDLE - For a recurring job, the previous scheduled run is complete
--   and the next scheduled run is pending. This value doesn't apply to
--   one-time jobs.</li>
--   <li>PAUSED - Macie started running the job but additional processing
--   would exceed the monthly sensitive data discovery quota for your
--   account or one or more member accounts that the job analyzes data
--   for.</li>
--   <li>RUNNING - For a one-time job, the job is in progress. For a
--   recurring job, a scheduled run is in progress.</li>
--   <li>USER_PAUSED - You paused the job. If you paused the job while it
--   had a status of RUNNING and you don't resume it within 30 days of
--   pausing it, the job or job run will expire and be cancelled, depending
--   on the job's type. To check the expiration date, refer to the
--   UserPausedDetails.jobExpiresAt property.</li>
--   </ul>
newJobSummary :: JobSummary

-- | Provides information about a managed data identifier. For additional

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   for credentials data such as private keys or Amazon Web Services
--   secret keys; FINANCIAL_INFORMATION, for financial data such as credit
--   card numbers; or, PERSONAL_INFORMATION, for personal health

--   credit card numbers, or USA_PASSPORT_NUMBER for US passport numbers.
newManagedDataIdentifierSummary :: ManagedDataIdentifierSummary

-- | Provides statistical data and other information about an S3 bucket
--   that Amazon Macie monitors and analyzes for your account. If an error
--   occurs when Macie attempts to retrieve and process information about
--   the bucket or the bucket's objects, the value for most of these
--   properties is null. Exceptions are accountId and bucketName. To
--   identify the cause of the error, refer to the errorCode and
--   errorMessage values.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMatchingBucket</a> smart constructor.
data MatchingBucket
MatchingBucket' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe ObjectCountByEncryptionType -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ObjectLevelStatistics -> Maybe ObjectLevelStatistics -> Maybe BucketMetadataErrorCode -> Maybe JobDetails -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> MatchingBucket

-- | Create a value of <a>MatchingBucket</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInBytesCompressed:MatchingBucket'</a>,
--   <a>matchingBucket_sizeInBytesCompressed</a> - The total storage size,
--   in bytes, of the objects that are compressed (.gz, .gzip, .zip) files
--   in the bucket.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Amazon Macie calculates this
--   value based on the size of the latest version of each applicable
--   object in the bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of
--   all versions of each applicable object in the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectCountByEncryptionType:MatchingBucket'</a>,
--   <a>matchingBucket_objectCountByEncryptionType</a> - The total number
--   of objects that are in the bucket, grouped by server-side encryption
--   type. This includes a grouping that reports the total number of
--   objects that aren't encrypted or use client-side encryption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInBytes:MatchingBucket'</a>,
--   <a>matchingBucket_sizeInBytes</a> - The total storage size, in bytes,
--   of the bucket.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Amazon Macie calculates this
--   value based on the size of the latest version of each object in the
--   bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all versions of
--   each object in the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:MatchingBucket'</a>,
--   <a>matchingBucket_bucketName</a> - The name of the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:classifiableObjectCount:MatchingBucket'</a>,
--   <a>matchingBucket_classifiableObjectCount</a> - The total number of
--   objects that Amazon Macie can analyze in the bucket. These objects use
--   a supported storage class and have a file name extension for a
--   supported file or storage format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:MatchingBucket'</a>, <a>matchingBucket_accountId</a>
--   - The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns
--   the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unclassifiableObjectSizeInBytes:MatchingBucket'</a>,
--   <a>matchingBucket_unclassifiableObjectSizeInBytes</a> - The total
--   storage size, in bytes, of the objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze
--   in the bucket. These objects don't use a supported storage class or
--   don't have a file name extension for a supported file or storage
--   format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unclassifiableObjectCount:MatchingBucket'</a>,
--   <a>matchingBucket_unclassifiableObjectCount</a> - The total number of
--   objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze in the bucket. These objects
--   don't use a supported storage class or don't have a file name
--   extension for a supported file or storage format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorCode:MatchingBucket'</a>, <a>matchingBucket_errorCode</a>
--   - Specifies the error code for an error that prevented Amazon Macie
--   from retrieving and processing information about the bucket and the
--   bucket's objects. If this value is ACCESS_DENIED, Macie doesn't have
--   permission to retrieve the information. For example, the bucket has a
--   restrictive bucket policy and Amazon S3 denied the request. If this
--   value is null, Macie was able to retrieve and process the information.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobDetails:MatchingBucket'</a>,
--   <a>matchingBucket_jobDetails</a> - Specifies whether any one-time or
--   recurring classification jobs are configured to analyze objects in the
--   bucket, and, if so, the details of the job that ran most recently.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorMessage:MatchingBucket'</a>,
--   <a>matchingBucket_errorMessage</a> - A brief description of the error
--   (errorCode) that prevented Amazon Macie from retrieving and processing
--   information about the bucket and the bucket's objects. This value is
--   null if Macie was able to retrieve and process the information.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectCount:MatchingBucket'</a>,
--   <a>matchingBucket_objectCount</a> - The total number of objects in the
--   bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:classifiableSizeInBytes:MatchingBucket'</a>,
--   <a>matchingBucket_classifiableSizeInBytes</a> - The total storage
--   size, in bytes, of the objects that Amazon Macie can analyze in the
--   bucket. These objects use a supported storage class and have a file
--   name extension for a supported file or storage format.
--   
--   If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Macie calculates this value
--   based on the size of the latest version of each applicable object in
--   the bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all
--   versions of each applicable object in the bucket.
newMatchingBucket :: MatchingBucket

-- | Provides statistical data and other information about an Amazon Web
--   Services resource that Amazon Macie monitors and analyzes for your
--   account.

data MatchingResource

newMatchingResource :: MatchingResource

-- | Provides information about an account that's associated with an Amazon

data Member

-- | Create a value of <a>Member</a> with all optional fields omitted.

--   (ARN) of the account.

--   Web Services account ID for the account.

--   time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, of the most recent change
--   to the status of the relationship between the account and the
--   administrator account.

--   pairs that identifies the tags (keys and values) that are associated
--   with the account in Amazon Macie.
newMember :: Member

-- | Specifies a monthly recurrence pattern for running a classification
--   job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMonthlySchedule</a> smart constructor.
data MonthlySchedule
MonthlySchedule' :: Maybe Int -> MonthlySchedule

-- | Create a value of <a>MonthlySchedule</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dayOfMonth:MonthlySchedule'</a>,
--   <a>monthlySchedule_dayOfMonth</a> - The numeric day of the month when
--   Amazon Macie runs the job. This value can be an integer from 1 through
--   31.
--   
--   If this value exceeds the number of days in a certain month, Macie
--   doesn't run the job that month. Macie runs the job only during months
--   that have the specified day. For example, if this value is 31 and a
--   month has only 30 days, Macie doesn't run the job that month. To run
--   the job every month, specify a value that's less than 29.
newMonthlySchedule :: MonthlySchedule

-- | Provides information about the number of objects that are in an S3
--   bucket and use certain types of server-side encryption, use
--   client-side encryption, or aren't encrypted.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newObjectCountByEncryptionType</a> smart constructor.
data ObjectCountByEncryptionType
ObjectCountByEncryptionType' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> ObjectCountByEncryptionType

-- | Create a value of <a>ObjectCountByEncryptionType</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   objects that Amazon Macie doesn't have current encryption metadata
--   for. Macie can't provide current data about the encryption settings
--   for these objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Managed:ObjectCountByEncryptionType'</a>,
--   <a>objectCountByEncryptionType_s3Managed</a> - The total number of
--   objects that are encrypted with an Amazon S3 managed key. The objects
--   use Amazon S3 managed encryption (SSE-S3).
--   
--   <a>$sel:unencrypted:ObjectCountByEncryptionType'</a>,
--   <a>objectCountByEncryptionType_unencrypted</a> - The total number of
--   objects that aren't encrypted or use client-side encryption.

--   objects that are encrypted with an KMS key, either an Amazon Web
--   Services managed key or a customer managed key. The objects use KMS
--   encryption (SSE-KMS).
--   
--   <a>$sel:customerManaged:ObjectCountByEncryptionType'</a>,
--   <a>objectCountByEncryptionType_customerManaged</a> - The total number
--   of objects that are encrypted with a customer-provided key. The
--   objects use customer-provided server-side encryption (SSE-C).
newObjectCountByEncryptionType :: ObjectCountByEncryptionType

-- | Provides information about the total storage size (in bytes) or number
--   of objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze in one or more S3 buckets.
--   In a BucketMetadata or MatchingBucket object, this data is for a
--   specific bucket. In a GetBucketStatisticsResponse object, this data is
--   aggregated for the buckets in the query results. If versioning is
--   enabled for a bucket, total storage size values are based on the size
--   of the latest version of each applicable object in the bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newObjectLevelStatistics</a> smart constructor.
data ObjectLevelStatistics

-- | Create a value of <a>ObjectLevelStatistics</a> with all optional

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileType:ObjectLevelStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>objectLevelStatistics_fileType</a> - The total storage size (in
--   bytes) or number of objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze because
--   the objects don't have a file name extension for a supported file or
--   storage format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageClass:ObjectLevelStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>objectLevelStatistics_storageClass</a> - The total storage size (in
--   bytes) or number of objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze because
--   the objects use an unsupported storage class.
--   
--   <a>$sel:total:ObjectLevelStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>objectLevelStatistics_total</a> - The total storage size (in bytes)

--   objects use an unsupported storage class or don't have a file name
--   extension for a supported file or storage format.
newObjectLevelStatistics :: ObjectLevelStatistics

-- | Specifies the location of 1-15 occurrences of sensitive data that was
--   detected by a managed data identifier or a custom data identifier and
--   produced a sensitive data finding.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOccurrences</a> smart constructor.
data Occurrences
Occurrences' :: Maybe [Range] -> Maybe [Cell] -> Maybe [Page] -> Maybe [Record] -> Maybe [Range] -> Occurrences

-- | Create a value of <a>Occurrences</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lineRanges:Occurrences'</a>, <a>occurrences_lineRanges</a> -
--   An array of objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in a
--   non-binary text file, such as an HTML, TXT, or XML file. Each Range
--   object specifies a line or inclusive range of lines that contains the
--   sensitive data, and the position of the data on the specified line or
--   lines.
--   
--   This value is often null for file types that are supported by Cell,
--   Page, or Record objects. Exceptions are the location of sensitive data
--   in: unstructured sections of an otherwise structured file, such as a
--   comment in a file; a malformed file that Amazon Macie analyzes as
--   plain text; and, a CSV or TSV file that has any column names that
--   contain sensitive data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cells:Occurrences'</a>, <a>occurrences_cells</a> - An array of
--   objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in a Microsoft
--   Excel workbook, CSV file, or TSV file. This value is null for all
--   other types of files.
--   
--   Each Cell object specifies a cell or field that contains the sensitive
--   data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pages:Occurrences'</a>, <a>occurrences_pages</a> - An array of
--   objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in an Adobe
--   Portable Document Format file. This value is null for all other types
--   of files.
--   
--   Each Page object specifies a page that contains the sensitive data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:records:Occurrences'</a>, <a>occurrences_records</a> - An
--   array of objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in an
--   Apache Avro object container, Apache Parquet file, JSON file, or JSON
--   Lines file. This value is null for all other types of files.
--   
--   For an Avro object container or Parquet file, each Record object
--   specifies a record index and the path to a field in a record that
--   contains the sensitive data. For a JSON or JSON Lines file, each
--   Record object specifies the path to a field or array that contains the
--   sensitive data. For a JSON Lines file, it also specifies the index of
--   the line that contains the data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:offsetRanges:Occurrences'</a>, <a>occurrences_offsetRanges</a>
--   - Reserved for future use.
newOccurrences :: Occurrences

-- | Specifies the location of an occurrence of sensitive data in an Adobe
--   Portable Document Format file.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPage</a> smart constructor.
data Page

-- | Create a value of <a>Page</a> with all optional fields omitted.

--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:offsetRange:Page'</a>, <a>page_offsetRange</a> - Reserved for
--   future use.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lineRange:Page'</a>, <a>page_lineRange</a> - Reserved for
--   future use.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageNumber:Page'</a>, <a>page_pageNumber</a> - The page number
--   of the page that contains the sensitive data.
newPage :: Page

-- | Specifies the location of an occurrence of sensitive data in a
--   non-binary text file, such as an HTML, TXT, or XML file.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRange</a> smart constructor.
data Range
Range' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Range

-- | Create a value of <a>Range</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:start:Range'</a>, <a>range_start</a> - The number of lines
--   from the beginning of the file to the beginning of the sensitive data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:end:Range'</a>, <a>range_end</a> - The number of lines from
--   the beginning of the file to the end of the sensitive data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startColumn:Range'</a>, <a>range_startColumn</a> - The number
--   of characters, with spaces and starting from 1, from the beginning of
--   the first line that contains the sensitive data (start) to the
--   beginning of the sensitive data.
newRange :: Range

-- | Specifies the location of an occurrence of sensitive data in an Apache
--   Avro object container, Apache Parquet file, JSON file, or JSON Lines
--   file.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecord</a> smart constructor.
data Record
Record' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Record

-- | Create a value of <a>Record</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:jsonPath:Record'</a>, <a>record_jsonPath</a> - The path, as a
--   JSONPath expression, to the sensitive data. For an Avro object
--   container or Parquet file, this is the path to the field in the record
--   (recordIndex) that contains the data. For a JSON or JSON Lines file,
--   this is the path to the field or array that contains the data. If the
--   data is a value in an array, the path also indicates which value
--   contains the data.
--   
--   If Amazon Macie detects sensitive data in the name of any element in
--   the path, Macie omits this field. If the name of an element exceeds 20
--   characters, Macie truncates the name by removing characters from the
--   beginning of the name. If the resulting full path exceeds 250
--   characters, Macie also truncates the path, starting with the first
--   element in the path, until the path contains 250 or fewer characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recordIndex:Record'</a>, <a>record_recordIndex</a> - For an
--   Avro object container or Parquet file, the record index, starting from
--   0, for the record that contains the sensitive data. For a JSON Lines
--   file, the line index, starting from 0, for the line that contains the
--   sensitive data. This value is always 0 for JSON files.
newRecord :: Record

-- | Provides information about the S3 bucket that a finding applies to.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3Bucket</a> smart constructor.
data S3Bucket
S3Bucket' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe S3BucketOwner -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ServerSideEncryption -> Maybe AllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads -> Maybe BucketPublicAccess -> Maybe [KeyValuePair] -> S3Bucket

-- | Create a value of <a>S3Bucket</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:S3Bucket'</a>, <a>s3Bucket_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:S3Bucket'</a>, <a>s3Bucket_createdAt</a> - The date
--   and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the bucket was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:owner:S3Bucket'</a>, <a>s3Bucket_owner</a> - The display name
--   and canonical user ID for the Amazon Web Services account that owns
--   the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:S3Bucket'</a>, <a>s3Bucket_name</a> - The name of the
--   bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultServerSideEncryption:S3Bucket'</a>,
--   <a>s3Bucket_defaultServerSideEncryption</a> - The type of server-side
--   encryption that's used by default to encrypt objects in the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowsUnencryptedObjectUploads:S3Bucket'</a>,
--   <a>s3Bucket_allowsUnencryptedObjectUploads</a> - Specifies whether the
--   bucket policy for the bucket requires server-side encryption of
--   objects when objects are uploaded to the bucket. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>FALSE - The bucket policy requires server-side encryption of new
--   objects. PutObject requests must include the
--   x-amz-server-side-encryption header and the value for that header must
--   be AES256 or aws:kms.</li>
--   <li>TRUE - The bucket doesn't have a bucket policy or it has a bucket
--   policy that doesn't require server-side encryption of new objects. If
--   a bucket policy exists, it doesn't require PutObject requests to
--   include the x-amz-server-side-encryption header and it doesn't require
--   the value for that header to be AES256 or aws:kms.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie can't determine whether the bucket policy
--   requires server-side encryption of objects.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicAccess:S3Bucket'</a>, <a>s3Bucket_publicAccess</a> - The
--   permissions settings that determine whether the bucket is publicly
--   accessible.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:S3Bucket'</a>, <a>s3Bucket_tags</a> - The tags that are
--   associated with the bucket.
newS3Bucket :: S3Bucket

-- | Specifies an S3 bucket to store data classification results in, and
--   the encryption settings to use when storing results in that bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3Destination</a> smart constructor.
data S3Destination
S3Destination' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> S3Destination

-- | Create a value of <a>S3Destination</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyPrefix:S3Destination'</a>, <a>s3Destination_keyPrefix</a> -
--   The path prefix to use in the path to the location in the bucket. This
--   prefix specifies where to store classification results in the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:S3Destination'</a>, <a>s3Destination_bucketName</a>
--   - The name of the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyArn:S3Destination'</a>, <a>s3Destination_kmsKeyArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the KMS key to use for encryption of
--   the results. This must be the ARN of an existing, symmetric, customer
--   managed KMS key that's in the same Amazon Web Services Region as the
--   bucket.
newS3Destination :: Text -> Text -> S3Destination

-- | Specifies which S3 buckets contain the objects that a classification
--   job analyzes, and the scope of that analysis. The bucket specification
--   can be static (bucketDefinitions) or dynamic (bucketCriteria). If it's
--   static, the job analyzes objects in the same predefined set of buckets
--   each time the job runs. If it's dynamic, the job analyzes objects in
--   any buckets that match the specified criteria each time the job starts
--   to run.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3JobDefinition</a> smart constructor.
data S3JobDefinition

--   omitted.

--   job uses these criteria to determine which objects to analyze.

--   conditions that determine which S3 buckets to include or exclude from
--   the analysis. Each time the job runs, the job uses these criteria to
--   determine which buckets contain objects to analyze. A job's definition
--   can contain a bucketCriteria object or a bucketDefinitions array, not
--   both.

--   for each Amazon Web Services account that owns specific S3 buckets to
--   analyze. Each object specifies the account ID for an account and one
--   or more buckets to analyze for that account. A job's definition can
--   contain a bucketDefinitions array or a bucketCriteria object, not
--   both.
newS3JobDefinition :: S3JobDefinition

-- | Specifies a property-based condition that determines whether an S3
--   bucket is included or excluded from a classification job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSimpleCriterionForJob</a> smart constructor.
data SimpleCriterionForJob
SimpleCriterionForJob' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe SimpleCriterionKeyForJob -> Maybe JobComparator -> SimpleCriterionForJob

-- | Create a value of <a>SimpleCriterionForJob</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:SimpleCriterionForJob'</a>,
--   <a>simpleCriterionForJob_values</a> - An array that lists one or more
--   values to use in the condition. If you specify multiple values, Amazon
--   Macie uses OR logic to join the values. Valid values for each
--   supported property (key) are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_ID - A string that represents the unique identifier for
--   the Amazon Web Services account that owns the bucket.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_EFFECTIVE_PERMISSION - A string that represents an
--   enumerated value that Macie defines for the
--   <a>BucketPublicAccess.effectivePermission</a> property of a
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_NAME - A string that represents the name of a
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li>S3_BUCKET_SHARED_ACCESS - A string that represents an enumerated
--   value that Macie defines for the <a>BucketMetadata.sharedAccess</a>
--   property of a bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Values are case sensitive. Also, Macie doesn't support use of partial
--   values or wildcard characters in these values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:SimpleCriterionForJob'</a>,
--   <a>simpleCriterionForJob_key</a> - The property to use in the
--   condition.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comparator:SimpleCriterionForJob'</a>,
--   <a>simpleCriterionForJob_comparator</a> - The operator to use in the
--   condition. Valid values are EQ (equals) and NE (not equals).
newSimpleCriterionForJob :: SimpleCriterionForJob

data SimpleScopeTerm
SimpleScopeTerm' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe ScopeFilterKey -> Maybe JobComparator -> SimpleScopeTerm

-- | Create a value of <a>SimpleScopeTerm</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:SimpleScopeTerm'</a>, <a>simpleScopeTerm_values</a> -
--   An array that lists the values to use in the condition. If the value
--   for the key property is OBJECT_EXTENSION or OBJECT_KEY, this array can
--   specify multiple values and Amazon Macie uses OR logic to join the
--   values. Otherwise, this array can specify only one value.
--   
--   Valid values for each supported property (key) are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OBJECT_EXTENSION - A string that represents the file name
--   extension of an object. For example: docx or pdf</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_KEY - A string that represents the key prefix (folder name
--   or path) of an object. For example: logs or awslogs/eventlogs. This
--   value applies a condition to objects whose keys (names) begin with the
--   specified value.</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_LAST_MODIFIED_DATE - The date and time (in UTC and extended
--   ISO 8601 format) when an object was created or last changed, whichever
--   is latest. For example: 2020-09-28T14:31:13Z</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_SIZE - An integer that represents the storage size (in
--   bytes) of an object.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Macie doesn't support use of wildcard characters in these values.
--   Also, string values are case sensitive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:SimpleScopeTerm'</a>, <a>simpleScopeTerm_key</a> - The
--   object property to use in the condition.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comparator:SimpleScopeTerm'</a>,
--   <a>simpleScopeTerm_comparator</a> - The operator to use in the
--   condition. Valid values for each supported property (key) are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OBJECT_EXTENSION - EQ (equals) or NE (not equals)</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_KEY - STARTS_WITH</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_LAST_MODIFIED_DATE - Any operator except CONTAINS</li>
--   <li>OBJECT_SIZE - Any operator except CONTAINS</li>
--   </ul>
newSimpleScopeTerm :: SimpleScopeTerm

-- | Provides information about when a classification job was paused. For a
--   one-time job, this object also specifies when the job will expire and
--   be cancelled if it isn't resumed. For a recurring job, this object
--   also specifies when the paused job run will expire and be cancelled if
--   it isn't resumed. This object is present only if a job's current
--   status (jobStatus) is USER_PAUSED. The information in this object
--   applies only to a job that was paused while it had a status of
--   RUNNING.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUserPausedDetails</a> smart constructor.
data UserPausedDetails

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobExpiresAt:UserPausedDetails'</a>,
--   <a>userPausedDetails_jobExpiresAt</a> - The date and time, in UTC and
--   extended ISO 8601 format, when the job or job run will expire and be
--   cancelled if you don't resume it first.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobImminentExpirationHealthEventArn:UserPausedDetails'</a>,
--   <a>userPausedDetails_jobImminentExpirationHealthEventArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Health event that Amazon Macie sent
--   to notify you of the job or job run's pending expiration and
--   cancellation. This value is null if a job has been paused for less
--   than 23 days.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobPausedAt:UserPausedDetails'</a>,
--   <a>userPausedDetails_jobPausedAt</a> - The date and time, in UTC and
--   extended ISO 8601 format, when you paused the job.
newUserPausedDetails :: UserPausedDetails
